name: Amazon Basics USB Wired Computer Keyboard and Wired Mouse Bundle Pack
description:
• Low-profile keys provide a quiet, comfortable typing experience
  • Hotkeys enable easy access for Media, My Computer, mute, volume down, volume Up, and calculator; 4 function keys control previous track, Stop, Play/Pause, Next track on your media player
  • Simple wired USB connection; works with Windows 2000, XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 and later
  • Smooth, precise and affordable USB-connected 3-button optical mouse for the desktop PC
  • High-definition (1000 dpi) optical tracking enables responsive cursor control for precise tracking and easy text selection

reviews.review: If you are into basics, I don't think you can get a better deal than this. Just nothing wrong with this keyboard and the mouse, as they work no different from any other stuff I've ever used, whether at work, or at home.
I have had this key board for a good year or so and have no complaints about it.
What's to dislike simple keyboard mouse that work great and arrived quick
Je l'avais acheté pour démarrer un ordinateur fonctionne très bien !!

Keyboard:
I've come to like the chicklet style keys and it's good to see them turning up as full sized keyboards. This keyboard is very nice to type on... the keys are spaced so that my hands just naturally land on home row and the board is fairly slender from front to back which means no wild reaching for keys. Another nice part of this board is that it's fairly close to the table top; you won't need a stepladder to reach the keys. Overall this leads to a comfortable and fast typing scenario that is surprisingly good for an inexpensive membrane keyboard.

On the down side this board is rather noisy. The centre front of the keyboard is a bit flexible, with a hard plastic "leg" that's a bit too short and it will bounce off the table when typing. I put mine on a rubber pad and it's now acceptably quiet.

The casing of this keyboard is easy to flex and bend. On one hand this lets us flex it a little to get it sitting flat on the table, on the other it's not very rigid while typing. I don't think this is a strength issue so it's unlikely you'll break it but you should expect it to flex a bit when picking it up or moving it.

Mouse:
The mouse from this package is pretty nice. It's fast and agile. Repeated back and forth movements land in about the same place every time so you aren't constantly picking it up to reset the cursor position. The buttons have a positive click to them so there's no doubt when they've been pressed, which should reduce button down errors. The wheel is quiet and smooth to use with a third button underneath.

On the down side this mouse is very light. It's almost impossible to roll the wheel without moving the mouse, unless you are holding it in place. The cord is a bit on the short side as well. It should have been the same length as the keyboard cord.

Overall:
A good deal for the price.
Both pieces are well made and operate as expected.

I recently purchased this Amazon Basics Keyboard and Mouse combo, and I will say that I am thoroughly impressed with its performance. Great combination, works really well.
The setup process was simple and straightforward just had to plugin to the USB ports.
The sleek design and comfortable feel of both the keyboard and mouse make them easy to use for extended periods of time without any discomfort or fatigue.

Overall, I would highly recommend the Amazon Basics Keyboard and Mouse combo to anyone in need of a reliable and efficient input device for their computer. It's stylish, comfortable, and easy to use, making it a great value for its price point."
Works well, but the keyboard can be pretty loud.

I recently purchased the Amazon Basics Keyboard and Monitor Riser and I'm very pleased with the product. It has helped to free up additional desk space in my home office and allow for better ergonomics. The device is easy to assemble and it has two adjustable heights, allowing me to customize it to whatever my workspace needs are. It has a non-skid surface so my laptop doesn't slide off and the legs have a wide enough base to fit my bigger laptop. The price was very reasonable and I am happy to recommend this product.

I like the durable, one piece flange on the back that angles the keyboard. I also like the bright blue led indicators for caps and number lock. Lots of extra keyboard function buttons too that replace Ctrl and Alr commands.
Wish the function buttons were divided into groups of four to make finding them visually easier.

The AmazonBasics Wired Keyboard and Wired Mouse Bundle Pack is a commendable offering for those seeking a straightforward and budget-friendly solution to their input needs. While not groundbreaking, this bundle serves as a reliable and practical addition to any workstation.

The keyboard, with its familiar layout and tactile keys, offers a comfortable typing experience. Its simplicity is its strength, making it ideal for both casual users and professionals seeking a no-nonsense input device. The keys are responsive and provide a satisfying click, enhancing typing speed and accuracy. However, don't expect advanced features like customizable macros or RGB lighting - this bundle aims to provide the essentials.

Paired with the keyboard, the wired mouse maintains the same philosophy of functionality over frills. Its ergonomic design fits comfortably in hand, making extended usage less strenuous. The tracking is smooth and accurate, suitable for everyday tasks and casual gaming. Once again, it's worth noting that this mouse isn't meant for heavy gamers or those looking for extensive customization options.

What truly sets this bundle apart is its unbeatable value. The combination of a reliable keyboard and a serviceable mouse at this price point is hard to beat. It's an excellent choice for students, home offices, or anyone who doesn't require extravagant features. Plus, the wired connection ensures minimal latency, a boon for users who prioritize responsiveness.

In summary, the AmazonBasics Wired Keyboard and Wired Mouse Bundle Pack is a testament to the adage "simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." It's not aiming to redefine the market, but rather to provide a dependable, cost-effective solution for those seeking basic input devices. If you're in need of an unpretentious yet reliable keyboard and mouse combo, this bundle is well worth considering.

Amazon Basics USB Wired Computer Keyboard (QWERTY) and Mouse Bundle Pack works great for my work from home job. My previous keyboard had a stuck "a" and I could not get the "a" to work on the previous keyboard I had.
Posiblemente el teclado y mouse más útil en su categoría para el trabajo.
nada

name: Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo,J JOYACCESS 2.4G Ergonomic Whisper-Quiet Compact Wireless Computer Keyboard Mouse Designed for Windows, Mac,PC, Laptop,Tablet - Black Grey
description:
• ?Ergonomic Wireless Keyboard and Mouse? JOYACCESS wireless keyboard and mouse combo designed ergonomic. The slim keyboard has a tilt angle for the great typing position.Sweat-resistant, skin-friendly finish wireless mouse in contoured shape would provide hours of work comfortably.
  • ?Plug&Play and Sleek Design?The keyboard and mouse set commonly use one nano receiver only for saving USB port of your computer or laptop.*The nano receiver is snapped in the storage of mouse near battery compartment. JOYACCESS wireless keyboard has all keys in scissor-cross low profile structure;which maks it ulra-slim(keystroke travel 2mm),resposive,quiet and soft.
  • ?HIGH PRECITION DPI 2400 in 5 levels?You can easily change the cursor sensitivity of this cordless mouse depending on your activities;usually 1600 DPI for office, DPI 2000-2400 for 4K resolution monitor or entertainment like gaming at home. 2 polling rate: 125Hz and 250Hz; adjusted by pressing the right key and the wheel simultaneously at 3s for change.
  • ?Stable 2.4G Wireless Connection& Long Standby?2.4GHz wireless signal delivers up to 10 meters connection. The optical mouse working currency is only 0.11mA and will automaticly enter power saving mode if inactivity in 20s; easily wake it up by moving.The compact keyboard also come into sleep in 8 minutes if no typing. *Battery not included in package.
  • ?Wide Compatibility? Compatible with Windows 2000 / ME / XP / Vista / 7 / 8 / 10. Work well with Macbook, desktops, Chrome-book, PC, Laptop, Computer Smart TV and more. Both keyboard and mouse give a world of silence and a morden desktop; great for conference, board presentation, library, coffee shop, night work, travel, etc.

reviews.review: Super clavier! J’adore les touches, la couleur et le design minimaliste qui fait dupe du clavier Apple. Par contre la batterie ne dure pas longtemps après 1 mois et demi d’utilisation j’ai du les changer. Je travaille presque chaque jour avec à titre de référence!
Mouse started acting up pretty early on but the keyboard is great and so slick

Keyboard Pros:
- All aluminum construction. It's got a little bit of bow but not enough that even the heaviest typer will notice. Overall build quality is borderline excellent.
- Included dongle range is good. I don't have direct line of site and where it sits it's blocked on 3 sides with a cold rolled steel 15u server. The only escape is tempered glass on the front and 10 feet away it doesn't miss a keystroke.
- Keys, although chicklet style, are very usable. This wont help you play fortnite better, but it's good for typing. There not a lot of horizontal shift in the keys and they don't feel at all mushy. They bounce up good enough that you don't need to slow down your typing.
- Battery life seems good. The fact you can recharge the battery is a great bonus at this price point.
- On/Off switch which conserves battery life and makes it so my year and a half old wont mash the keys when I'm getting him cheerios.

Keyboard Cons:
- Could have used a backlight. Not something too much to complain about at this price point, but would be nice.
- It's a little thin on the bottom. Another inch or so of material would give lap typers somewhere to put their hands when they are typing. I can see they were going for small and minimalist but anyone who's got a PC hooked up to a tv will tell you, a little extra palm and wrist support goes a long way.

Mouse Pros:
- Still rechargeable
- Works I guess?
- On/Off button

Mouse Cons:
- Not at all ergonomic. Long term use for a heavy computer user would easily cause finger injuries from the shape of the mouse.
- Unlike the keyboard the mouse feels like an afterthought. It's great it's included and doesn't require an extra dongle to use, but it feels cheap. Clicks sound weird and the scroll mouse doesn't allow for fluid scrolling and instead only allows step scrolling.
- no extra buttons to speak of. Usually even a cheap $10 mouse these days has a forward and back button.
- Giant hole where the dongle used to be on the bottom. Very easy to get crud buildup in. Not a great design.
- SO lightweight. Where the keyboard is a fairly heavy slab by keyboard standards, the mouse weights practically nothing at all.

In conclusion, the keyboard is a great buy on its own. Its attractive looking, and easy to type on. The solid build quality is great at this price point and should stand up to minor abuse without issue. The stuff is very easily plug and play on most systems and range is good and accurate. The mouse is a mess. It's good to have included just in case your real mouse dies and the fact it uses the same dongle is great for people who tend to lose small pieces. I switched it out with my favorite wireless mouse (Logitech MX Master 3) which is an unfair comparison at almost $130. But pretty well anything short of an Amazon Basics mouse would probably be a step up on this one.

I really like the keyboard. And for the sub-$50 category, this is an excellent value. The mouse would be nothing more than an emergency mouse but again, it's nice that something is included in the box. This may be the first sub-$50 keyboard that I would give a buy to as long as you're not looking mechanical feel or cherry mx. It's a no-frills clean design that I'm sure I'll use for a while.

Having bought and returned 3 other brands of keyboard (including name brand Logi) this 4th attempt didn't really fill me with promise. But of all the keyboards I tried, this is the best one. It has good weight and the included mouse is low profile, comfortable, and absolutely silent. I was used to my Dell compact keyboard and wanted one like that -- a solid feeling but quiet keystroke, with a good layout and a quiet comfortable mouse to go along with it. This combo ticked almost all the boxes. The one thing I don't care for is that they arranged the Del/Home/PgUp/PgDn/End keys vertically between the main key panel and the numeric pad. Which would have been fine, but it's done at the expense of making the Backspace, Enter, and Shift keys less wide than normal. I make a lot of mistakes so I use the Backspace key quite a bit and this is somewhat annoying, but the rest of the keyboard makes up for it. All in all, the best one I've tried in this price range and I think it's a keeper. One other note: it has dedicated function keys but doesn't have the custom function keys of some others so I can't quickly put the computer to sleep or pop up the web browser with a single key.
It met and exceeded my expectations
Paired simply by plugging in the USB to be laptop. Works nicely, looks sleek. Mouse is extremely quiet. So far so good.
I have been very happy with this product works great & I’ve been using since 2020. Wondering how I can get replacement USB dongle, I’ve just lost mine.
easy to set up - works fine - great price

I teach online and have worked in IT my whole adult life. I get Apple keyboards and trackpads for the Macs, and usually Logitech for the PCs. To keep this short, this JOYACCESS set replaced a Logitech set that is only a few months old. The mouse was constantly lagging from about day 2, and to be honest, I am so used to scissor-switch keyboards, I was thinking about getting a replacement. After I left the Logitech mouse at another house, I needed a quick replacement and ordered this JOYACCESS set, not expecting much except for next-day delivery. At a fraction of the cost of an equivalent Logitech set, it turned out to be far superior. The keyboard is perfect, scissor-switch joy, and I really like that the keys are also textured (as opposed to smooth like an Apple keyboard). It is built just like an Apple keyboard, so it earns points for aesthetics, too. I don't particularly like the END key to the right of the right arrow, only because I use that arrow often, and end up hitting the END key instead. The compact Apple keyboard does not have an END key (whereas the full-sized Apple and the Logitech do), and I think that it could be safely eliminated (just a suggestion).

Finally, the mouse is my absolute favorite, EVER! It hasn't lagged, which was my biggest complaint with the Logitech mouse, but beyond stellar connectivity, it is the most responsive mouse I've used, and I do mean "ever." The DPI switch/button was new to me, and the only thing I would recommend would be for JOYACCESS to include some information about that feature in the literature included with the set. Being able to adjust the sensitivity was a bonus I had not expected, and finally I have the perfect setup. The monitor and even the computer shown were also purchased on Amazon, but I'm leaving a review for the lowest cost purchase because this mouse and keyboard are outstanding. After all these years, I've got a new go-to keyboard/mouse brand, and after all that, I suppose I should get back to work.

I finally decided to DO something about my messy and chaotic desk with so many cords everywhere I could barely move. When I spilled coffee all over my laptop and ruined it, I knew something had to change. I’ve only had this set for a couple of days and it already feels like the a breath of fresh air.

The keyboard and mouse are both very responsive. They are also both comfortable to use. It’s nice not to have to sacrifice comfort for beauty. Needless to say, I think the green looks stunning on my desk. It’s even better looking in person.

It comes as it appears and it is a nice keyboard and mouse overall. My only issue with it is that sometimes while I use to the mouse lags and the keyboard is not responsive. I noticed it is when my mouse bad keyboard are not pointing directly at the USB drive which can be annoying if you use a second monitor or have a dock (anything where im not pointed directly at the receiver). Overall, pretty good value for the price and it gets the job done!

I was looking for a colorful small keyboard and I found this. I use this for my work keyboard. The charge lasts awhile. It is just the right size. I would not use this for gaming. I like that the keys are somewhat silent so there is no clicking and clacking of the keys (that annoys me). It is very slim and a very nice elegant pink. it is made of metal and not plastic like I thought. But i admit i did not read the description.

I bought this mouse and keyboard to use with my work laptop. It was working fine. A little cheap feeling for my comfort, but I kept it with high hopes. Sure enough, the mouse completely stopped working less than 60 days after purchase even after trying to change the batteries twice. The keyboard still works, but the usb is for both, so it renders it useless as well unless I want to take up yet another usb space. Seller was easy to work with, though, and gave me a full refund.

reviews.review: Very impressive PC - we don't use for gaming - but fun to have with all the lights - speed excellent - easy set up - if you are looking for a basic computer for a good price - get this one. PC, keyboard and mouse and accessories - as advertised.

The back panel on the computer is warped so much that a normal speaker jack cannot be used as they cannot be pushed in all the way. This makes using external speakers impossible. Also many large scratches. This does not work or look like new as described.
Mon neveu est très content

Unfortunately, it never worked well for gaming, more importantly completely stopped working in less than a month. The seller referred us to Amazon knowing we can not return it to Amazon and did not provide further support.

I really like everything about this computer that comes with some Microsoft 365 and like it has all the all the really neat things like words in it so all kinds and eat things PowerPoint you will love it you’ve got to get one

I'll start by saying I'm not a computer person and I'm not too knowledgeable about what's inside.

Pros

That aside, the computer runs great. Fast start up, fast shutdown. The RGB lights and remote are a cool cosmetic touch. Entry inside the computer is also easy for when you install a graphics card or whatever you're adding. It's quiet, doesn't make a lot of heat. Even without a graphics card it still runs some pretty big games like Albion, World of War craft, Dungeons and Dragons Neverwinter. Mouse and keyboard while simple also have RGB components work and look nice together.

Cons

I was under the impression that I was purchasing a gaming computer...and I'm not too exactly sure what makes this pc a gaming pc other than the RGB lights...it doesn't come with a graphics card, have to buy a low profile graphics card separately and unless you know about graphics cards that may be confusing, however they DO claim that it didn't have one. Quite honestly aside from not having a graphics card to play more demanding games, I can't think of any other complaints to review about.

At the end of the day I bought this pc because it was low price and and claimed to have gaming components. It can certainly runs like a breeze and can be upgraded to handle higher end games, can still play basic low requirement games, even some bigger games at its base form.
Does not perform as a gaming computer. Poor graphics performance. I play through Steam and the GPU can't handle it. Kind of feel like I've been ripped off.

I bought it specifically so I could play World of Warcraft with my wife and kids. It runs it perfectly even with Pandora playing in a browser window. I'm absolutely loving this PC. It runs Overwatch and other high demand games just fine. I have now owned it for over a year and it still works perfectly. It still runs World of Warcraft and World of Tanks as well as other games.

If you just want to print documents or use it for email it's fine. Unfortunately it is listed as a PC for gaming which it is not. If you do want to use it for gaming you will have to drop about another $50 -$75 for 8gb of RAM to run minimum requirements for almost all current games. Then you can expect to spend another $350- $900 on a video card for it to even open any game besides solitaire. I wasted time and money. I should have just purchased a gaming PC directly from TigerDirect, etc. I'm going to end up spending more to get non-gaming gaming PC to any type of specs where it could be used for games than just purchasing one that is set up for it to begin with. I wish I could give zero stars.
This should have been advertised as a regular PC as it is not for gaming at all. You will have to put a couple hundred dollars more into it just to get it to play a game. Absolute waste of money!

name: ASUS ROG Strix Scope TKL Electro Punk Mechanical Gaming Keyboard | Cherry MX Red Switches | 2X Wider Ctrl Key for Greater FPS Precision | Gaming Keyboard for PC | Aura Sync RGB Lighting, Quick-Toggle
description:
• ASUS ROG Strix Scope TKL Electro Punk Edition Mechanical Gaming Keyboard comes in a stunning black-and-pink cyberpunk theme. It features German-made Cherry MX red switches for precision input with responsive keystrokes for an enhanced gaming performance
  • PRECISION SHOOTING – Enjoy fewer missed clicks & better precision with especially designed 2X broader, ergonomic Left CTRL key. This TKL or tenkeyless gaming keyboard gives more room for gamers and is a perfect choice for FPS games
  • ANTI-GHOSTING - 100% anti-ghosting with super-fast response, onboard memory, on-the fly macro keyboard recordings, Windows lock key for uninterrupted video games sessions – it’s got it all!
  • PORTABLE & MINIMALISTIC DESIGN - This compact and frameless wired keyboard fits easily into backpacks and comes with a Type-C detachable cord that doubles as a charging cord for mobiles while on the go
  • DURABLE KEYBOARD – Resilient Aluminum top plate in striking slash aesthetics looks classy. A STEALTH KEY (F12) hides all apps & mutes audio, and QUICK-TOGGLE BETWEEN FN AND MEDIA CONTROLS let you switch between work & play instantly

reviews.review: Love this keyboard! Seamless for gaming and compact as well.

Quite a tall keyboard, it would very much benefit from a wrist rest.

If you are typing with your wrists on yours desk it's pretty much impossible to reach all around the keyboard. I would love to buy a wrist rest for this keyboard then it would be perfect.

The switches sound great, slightly airy but that's typical for cherry's. Very smooth actuation, and also not a loud keyboard at all. My Corsair K70 with brown switches blows this out of the water when it comes to sound. That is not a bad thing though. Just be aware it's quite a bit quieter than other mechanical keyboards.

Not to mention this keyboard is damn attractive. Once you get some lighting going with aura sync it's even better.

The Asus software is hard to install. Every time it says error when I started to install. So I think it is not a good thing to keep and try something else. Regardless of lag I am completely satisfied with this. Thank you......

Overall its a solid board if its the only one you're ever going to use. Switches are cherry so you can expect a pretty solid quality, not the best but you could for sure do worse. Theme is a nice color scheme, works well. Keycaps and board are also of expected quality, however you cannot use any aftermarket keycaps unless you can find a set that supports a 2.25u left control. There are better boards for the price however it is not bad.
colorful . for gift
Lo que esperaba
Honestly, i bought my computer just to buy this keyboard. I got the hot pink one and beautiful
Muy buen teclado, tiene buena pinta, buena iluminación y comodidad con las teclas.

I generally like this keyboard, but the only thing that bugs me is sometimes the keycaps pop off while I am in the middle of writing and it breaks my flow. For example, I would get really in the zone about writing a report and then BAM, the "J" keycap pops off and now I have to push it back onto the switch.

I'm not sure if maybe the keycap itself is a little loose or the switch is not quite correct, but it hasn't quite bothered me enough to make me want to switch out the key/switch, yet.
This is awesome for the punk/cyberpunk theme and is a great build quality keyboard with nicely sized keys 10/10

name: HiLetgo 2pcs Gamepad Joystick Shield for Arduino Expansion Board Analog Keyboard and Mouse Function
description:
• The "NRF24L01" interace has been added
  • The "Nokia 5110 LCD" interface has been added
  • The bluetooth module interface has been added, Convenient Bluetooth wireless serial communication.
  • The "I2C" communication interface has been added Compatible with Arduino UNO
  • Operating voltage :3.5v or 5v

reviews.review:
I didn't expect much out of this... look at the price.
The buttons were easy enough to figure out and if your new to writing Arduino google for Arduino code + the product name someone put some very basic button testing code out there to test the ABCD buttons EF and Joystick XY. Oddly the sample code I found didn't include the button on the Joystick down press button, see my list below. I didn't care I was just looking for confirmation of the PINs because it's actually Pin 2-8 and A0, A1. I'm really happy they didn't leave anything on D0/1 for the serial port.. The joystick will show you difficultly to read a value other than mid-point (spring return value) to full or minimum range. If you move it a little into mid-span value if you creep into the movement. Full scale readings are present after about 1/2 through the full range of motion. I ended up just integrating my value and it was fine. A person could de-solder and replace this joystick but in my experience these types of joysticks are kid of low quality anyways.

There are no other peripherals on this board outside of the joystick with pushdown button and the six buttons. There are three breakout headers and then the pin headers for prototyping.

Here is the inputs:
#define BUTTON_UP 2
#define BUTTON_RIGHT 3
#define BUTTON_DOWN 4
#define BUTTON_LEFT 5
#define BUTTON_1 6
#define BUTTON_2 7
#define BUTTON_XY 8
#define PIN_ANALOG_X 0
#define PIN_ANALOG_Y 1

I like that it feels solid and pretty well made. I would like a pin out for it. Not sure if they have one somewhere. Mine had the connectors for Nrf24L01 and also the bluetooth. I connected these to my mega 2560 Arduino and checked out all the buttons and joystick on the serial monitor and these worked seamlessly. I hope my project turns out good.

Item shiped is not what was displayed. There seems to be confusion on the refrance to interface. I2c for example or bluetooth these are not what one would expect for a interface but rather more of a pass through. They bring the sda and sdl lines to a header and call it a i2c interface but in reality they are just pins connected to the i2c interface on the arduino.

The blue tooth is just the serial tx and rc lines on the arduino.

The power switch just selects the 3.3 or 5 volt line on the arduino and places it on the different pass through headers..

I actually removed all the headers but the yellow dual header and am using a esp32 to read the switch states and the x and y analog inputs

I really wanted to like this especially since it (was supposed to have) had breakouts for bluetooth and the NRF24L01.

First off, there is no documentation that I could find - what you get in the description here on Amazon is all that there is and that is inaccurate. In addition to Jon's review I wrote a simple sketch to test all the pins. This is what I found:

I tried both boards--everything I found was true for both thus all bugs are actually features.

1. The four coloured buttons come up on pins D2 - D5
2. The two small momentary buttons are on pins D6, D7
3. The joystick Y-axis does indeed come up on A0 but is highly susceptible to noise and pressure from pushing the buttons. This results in large voltage fluctuations when not it use and inconsistent min-max values when in use. Push the Y-axis to max or min and the voltage will slowly creep back toward the centre value.
4. The joystick X-axis does not come up on A1. Rather A1 is a V+ (i.e. more sensitive with clipping) version of the Y-axis. I found no X-axis output on the board.
5. As there is no documentation (and the product is not mentioned at all on the HiLetgo website leading me to believe that this is not actually made by that company,) there is no way to know how to interface with the NRF24L01 or the Nokia LCD or know which pins they interface with. I could have done some continuity testing but, since the joystick was unusable, I decided to forgo any further waste of my time.
6. As mentioned by Jon, the bluetooth and I2C headers are non-existent.
7. The board mounted voltage toggle switch is finicky at best and had to be held in the 3.3v position in order to maintain connection. The 5v position worked fine.

Returned; I guess I'll make my own.
Solder work needs reworking. One bad LED, it’s a 603 oh boy! I’ll fix that too. I want these boards, at least I know what’s wrong with these ones. Your a Tech, go for it.

name: StarTech.com Under Desk-Mount Keyboard Tray - 26.4” Wide - Adjustable - Ergonomic Slide-Out Keyboard Shelf with Tilt and Swivel (KBTRAYADJ)
description:
• SPACIOUS AND STABLE: This under desk keyboard tray measures 26.4” (670 mm) by 10” (255 mm), providing ample room for your keyboard and mouse, supports up to 4.4lb (2kg), and doesn’t shake when typing
  • PREVENT INJURY: Installing an under-desk mount keyboard stand helps keep your shoulders, arms, and wrists in a neutral position, preventing strain and injury

reviews.review: This worked great in the beginning. But after less than a year, the screws came out and it detached from the desk.

At first, the product seemed solid. No issues installing and worked great. However, as time progressed, it slowly became unable to stay upright when in use. The little knob that allows you to adjust the height/level becomes unable to stay up and it slants down to a useless angle, dropping your mouse and keyboard.

In the beginning it was only occasionally when I was using it, and I always tried not to push too hard when using my mouse and keyboard. Despite my efforts, over time, this got worse and worse. The last few weeks it will only hold at an inward angle, and now, it won't hold at all, and the little knob is basically useless. It broke a part of my expensive ergonomic keyboard, when it decided to randomly drop while I was in another room, dropping my mouse and keyboard.

I always undid the knob when readjusting, and tried my best to take care of the product when using it. It lacks durability, and is not ideal for work from home when being used for long periods.

I contacted the seller before writing this review, and they replied by only citing the 30 day return policy and saying they cannot help me as it has passed. Completely unhelpful. I would rather a replacement part be sent out, but that option was not even offered.

Please see the photos, and be warned, this is not a high quality, durable keyboard tray.

Bought this as a replacement for our office. The adjustable knob fell out for one of our Ergotron underdesk keyboard units and the manufacturer did not provide a replacement knob (or bolt), so we started looking for options. I came across this unit, which is essentially identical to the Ergotron unit it replaced. The Ergotron unit was easier to adjust, but this unit swivels left and right, and also has a nice rubber wrist support on the keyboard tray. Only other downside would be the roller mechanism. It sits closer to the front of the desk and is slightly longer than the Ergotron variant.
Easy enough to mount and adjust for comfortable position. Saves room on the desk for paperwork. Glad I bought, in fact bought second for a friend... they are happy with theirs.

J'ai un produit similaire au bureau qui s'ajuste tout seul simplement en pivotant la base du plateau. J'ai acheté celui-ci pour mon bureau à la maison, et je suis déçu. On doit désserrer et resserer une vis à chaque fois pour le sortir et le rentrer sous le bureau, la vis se lousse un peu et il n'est pas rare qu'on doive le resserrer en travaillant.
This is great. Nice and sturdy. Its a little stiff to move but that is expected. So far I am very happy with it!

I love my under mount because I can have my mouse on the same level as my key board and that you can set the angle of the platform.
What could be a dislike is it is a little bouncy but that is to be expected
J'adore! J'avais peur que ca slaque tout seul mais après 2 mois, c'est vraiment du solide! comme au bureau!

On the expensive side I felt, and the other reviews were not particularly compelling. So was hesitant to purchase. However, got lucky and came into to some money off vouchers for amazon and took the opportunity to have a punt on this.

Thanks to prime it arrived next day so speedy delivery.

Build quality is good (which is what you want when paying £60+ I guess).
Setup took about 10 minutes. You can pretty much guess how to setup so no real need of course to waste time reading instructions :D

Having read the review about the keyboard sliding, I am guessing that person’s keyboard doesn't have silicon or rubber stands on it. As my Logitech keyboard is not moving anywhere.
As you can see from the pictures there is plenty of room for mouse and keyboard, even got my wrist support on it.

My MX2s mouse glides across the top which is great.

Board slides in and out nicely and stays in place as well. Board doesn't bounce much either when in use and I am quite a heavy typist and its barely moving.

Haven’t used for gaming yet so will see how that goes with a bigger keyboard and gaming mouse.

Let me say that this IS a very well-made, heavy-duty piece of kit, the construction and action are solid, assembly is very nice and, as a mechanical fitter, I can appreciate that it is an exceptionally sturdy piece of kit. But I do have a tiny problem, my desk isn't deep enough to take it, yeah, I know measure twice cut once! Well, I didn't, so make sure that you check before buying it is a large unit, I do have another computer desk that is gradually being turned into a server/drive store in the attic so i will be fitting this to it when I get around to it. On a standard office curved desk, it should fit no problem. very impressed with the quality of the item, less so with my measuring skills.

As a keyboard shelf its great. Although it said its 70cm. Yes. It is. But the clamps are much further apart. Fortunately the desk i was attaching it to was around a cm narrower than the wing to wing measurements so the clamps go right on the edge.

It seems sturdy although plastic. My only frustration is on placing a keyboard on it slides around like ice. The mouse you dont mind slip because you move it. But it would be nice if the keyboard did not. I contemplated getting some fake leather and gluing it on the shelf but at £70 if that wrecks it that would be disappointing.

Slightly unsure right now how to address the moving keyboard issue. As the slightest hand movement moves the keyboard
Dommage je m attendais a mieux trop cher pour la qualité il tien mal et il et lourd point positif l espace qui permet d avoir la souris et le clavier
それなりの期待しかしていなかったが、１年使ってみて特に壊れもせず、難点もない。満足している。

reviews.review: The computer works great! Only thing was that the WIFI adapter was broken when it was received and it took another week and a half for delivery so it delayed an eager pre-teen from enjoying it right away. Even then we ended up getting another one as it didn’t work well. But overall a good purchase so far and the customer service was quick.
Très bonne qualité, idéale pour mon jeune garçon.
Returning due to wrong plug in not even a Canadian plug. Huge disappointment and will be returning for a refund

If you look at the specs in the description and the title of the desktop you will see that they don't mention the graphics card because the graphics card is not at all for gaming if your reading this Don't buy the desktop may run games but the graphics card is terrible so pls don't buy this for your sake.
L’ordinateur boguais souvent
It my first pc so I can’t judge that well but pretty good in my opinion
This is my first pc but I think it's pretty good performance, and it's cheap! But when I connect wired headphones it doesn't work. But overall it's a pretty good pc and it's easy to setup!

This gaming computer is awesome! Easy to assemble. Fits on my existing desk easily. It runs fast and graphics are immaculate. Only issue I've had is its ability to maintain Wi-Fi connection with my existing VPN.
Mine didn't come with the remote control, the cover where u open it was poorly put on too, when I tried to open it the got detached

Let me preface this with, this product is not bad for the price point. It works as a functioning computer for low end gaming (Roblox, Among Us etc) and everyday use. As someone who likes to run high graphics action packed games(CoD, GTA, other newer games with high graphics requirements or FPS)-this does not do it for me. I’ve also been having some minor issues with the colors inverting when a game is in full screen, it’s a simple fix by opting to not use windows optimization. My biggest issue with this is windows 11 is not supported on this desktop. It is not up to Microsoft’s standards and this cannot be upgraded to windows 11. That’s not a big deal right now as most things will run on windows 10 I’m just concerned for the longevity of this product. I knew this was a refurbished piece however I was not expecting the pc to be 5 years old, according to the pc specs from the PC Heath app. This pc also does not have an HDMI port thankfully there are 2 DP ports so I can plug both my GTek monitors into. Like I said this pc will do what is needed with some pretty decent low volume gaming but if you want to stream/use dual monitors/play high end or action games I do not recommend this… For some context of my comparison: my Lenovo laptop with AMD processing can run more of these higher quality games with fewer issues, and I find myself questioning if I will continue to use this desktop or just plug my laptop in with my 2 monitors.

**UPDATE**
So I gave this a fair shot for about 2months… I gave up after trying to make this work and even upgraded some of the internal parts! I ultimately went and purchased a much better gaming PC. With this pc, not only did the Wi-Fi stop working all together and require an Ethernet cable, I could no longer turn it on… the saying “you get what you pay for” is clearly expressed here. BUYER BEWARE: save your money, this is not worth the price….

reviews.review: I was initially excited about this keyboard because it was quiet and the keys seemed soft. Once I started using it, I realized that most of the keys would stick, especially the backspace key. This gets very frustrating when you need to type anything past a few sentences. The mouse, on the other hand, is very comfortable and responsive. No issues with it. Overall, do not recommend.
It works !

I'm very hard on keyboards, so it was yet again time for another replacement. I purchased this set because I've been getting a lot of connection drops with my usb mouse due to a loose internal wire. This Amazon Basics set is nice. I like the tilt level of the keyboard. It is indeed nice and quiet. I am taking a star away due to 2 factors. I find that the keyboard does drop letters if you aren't being very firm on your letter presses and I do not like the fact that the mouse wheel has zero "click" on the scroll wheel. The scroll wheel is entirely smooth in both the action and the feel. There is no texture on the wheel to allow your finger any traction and there is no click feel when you scroll to allow for precision.

I think it's been a year since I bought them. The mouse is only just starting to go, the scroll wheel stopped working. So I'm very impressed considering I used to go through mice quickly.
Batteries last forever too in both the keyboard and mouse.

The only complaint I have is that shape of the mouse. I wish it were longer and a pinch more flat. I have little lady hands yet I still feel like my hand are all hunched up or something.

Also if you get a USB adapter for your android phone and plug in the Bluetooth adapter but this mouse and keyboard set, it works flawlessly! Neat little trick to annoy my iPhone using best friend.

This is a great mouse and keyboard set. I wanted a "silent" set for some time, but they are so expensive in store. This pair comes at a very reasonable price!

I'll begin with the mouse: it is just the right size for me. I have smaller hands but the mouse sits very comfortably and the "compact" part of its name suits it well. It is not huge or bulky, and it is very lightweight. The wheel is smooth and sensitive and the clicking has stayed very quiet despite months of use - something I was worried about. It glides on my mousepad nicely and I have never had any lagging issues. It is actually quite responsive.

Onto the keyboard: I particularly like the layout. Everything is very straightforward aside from the fact that you have to use the function key along with the F# keys to change volume, but that is not an issue for me. Keys have also been super quiet since day one despite daily use and I have never had an issue with stickiness or the keys not registering.

Connection on its own has remained perfect, and the battery life is fantastic. Have not had to change batteries since purchasing this set in October. I am very happy with their performance thus far.

Keyboard has soft silent keys and it's great to use. Very responsive as well. The edge of the keyboard is a little bit sharp though.
Mouse is sluggish to respond and too small. My hand gets tired using the mouse so I had to rest/stretch in between.
But it's relatively inexpensive so value for money is good.

Yes, I know this product is literally titled 'quiet and compact'... but with 30 million other choices on amazon for a wireless keyboard/mouse combo, my eyes quickly glaze over.

I regret this purchase. As a heavy computer user for work, I wanted to get off my laptop and go back to a keyboard and mouse. I hastily purchased this one, thinking, one keyboard is as good as any, and the price was right. Well NO.

Typing on this feels like typing in playdough. The plastic it's made from has a shiny textured gloss to it, which doesn't help, and yeah, the keypresses is like trying to use a zx spectrum chiclet kb. Lots of missed keypresses. Would not recommend for anything but the most casual of typers.

The mouse is also very tiny. Not comfortable at all to hold and use constantly for people over 6 yrs old.

That said, it works, was exactly as described (I should have read better), and my only real complaint here is my own impatience.

I was going to give this 5 stars, and was in the process of writing a review for this at 5-stars, though as i am writing i find it very annoying that certain keys will not register (perhaps due to bluetooth/wireless - this is a problem i have encountered with every single wireless keyboard/mouse i have ever used, hence why i personally use only wired peripherals).
This keyboard was for my father, who does not have quiet the level of demand from computer items as myself, and he hasnt complained about it. A bonus would be the very quiet action of the keys and mouse, making it nearly silent/inaudible when someone is typing on the keyboard - massively appreciate this vs. the old boxy dell keyboards that sound like someone's punching the keys.

TLDR; 3-stars because i hate wireless keyboards (they are junk). This is a good price and does its job though.

I am a "power user" . . on my computer 14-hours per day ... for work and play
1 - after two years, several letters have "come off" ... so there is no letter on the key tile
2 - I've had it for three years and have not yet had to replace the batteries -- VERY power efficient!
3 - the keys and presses feel great . . nice tactile feel and very easy to type on

I broke the spacebar on my keyboard and needed a new one ASAP. This one has a nice typing feel and I use it with a wireless Kensington trackball, so I keep the mouse as a backup. Good price, fast Prime delivery. Would buy this one again. Haven't had it long enough to rate the battery and I don't need fast gaming.

Bought to use for Computer Networking class. I use Pop!_OS full time. Works and functions for the most part. Issues that I have:
-Noticeable lag. Used with Pop!_OS, tested on Fedora 38 and Kali, same issue.
-Smaller keys, you have to make sure your fingers are lined up correctly and make small transitions from key to key. Luckily this keyboard is only used part time.
-No power switch on keyboard, it's "auto" power off, guessing it's based on if the mouse is turned on or off.
-I'm left handed, mouse feels fine in my hand for the most part, I don't heavily depend on the mouse anyways due to using the tab key and shortcut keys.

Overall not a terrible keyboard, may work perfectly with a Windows OS, but if you are using a Linux distro, keep in mind this will lag.

Love the quiet of the keys, however, the delay is a little behind. Sometimes the space bar needs to be pushed multiple times to work. Otherwise, great for the price and to use as my mobile keyboard/mouse set.

Very good keyboard with a great classic layout. The keys have the slightest lag but it's not a big deal. The mouse size is slightly disappointing but it works quite well.
Overall it's a great product. 4.5/5

reviews.review: Quick delivery and exactly what I needed

Not a lover. There is a rattle noise happening when the left side of the keyboard is in use. The space bar is a little louder than the rest of the keys as well, and the mouse is not very ergonomic (nor is the keyboard, I prefer a bit of a steeper slant myself, this is very minimally raised). I do like that the mouse has a very quiet click.
I think I will be returning this set.

Love how quiet the keys are but they still make a satisfying noise 😂🫶🏽💜 no connection problems, came with an extra usb thing but I’m not sure why, it’s not needed, as one connects both the mouse and the keyboard. 10/10 for me !

I love this keyboard. It is sleek, and the cover really makes typing even more silent. It is comfortable to type, and has light indicators for the number lock/caps lock. My only wish is the mouse to be more ergonomic, but it's not horrible. Overall I would recommend it. Don't forget, it doesn't come with batteries ( 2x AAA for keyboard and 1x AA for mouse).
This set makes me happy to write my notes and do admin throughout the day. The keys are comfortable and it is nice a slim!
I'm probably returning it. Really disappointed with the colour.
I was shipped the keyboard and mouse set with the receiver. I find it odd because the back of the mouse was sealed with a sticker and everything. It makes no sense why it should be missing.
Nice and works well so far. Mouse need to be turn off and on, if the laptop went to sleep. Its a bit annoying but not a deal breaker

i love this keyboard, im a cad tech so i need a good keyboard and mouse to get a lot of use out of. ive gotten multiple compliments on it and its a super cute color. It comes with a silicone cover to put over the buttons for everyday use and i love it. im actually wearing it down and would love to buy just another silicone matt to replace this one. keeps me from getting my keys stuck with dirt and dust and still get the full color and cuteness of the keyboard. O! the mouse is perfect too, i have smaller hands and cant with the bulky mouses so this one is perfect! will update with pictures later!
Nice color, nice quality as in the website..
Quiet keys, mouse is very responsive

I used the keyboard all day and it was actually pretty sturdy. It sits a little lower than I would like but my wrist weren't uncomfortable at all.

I love the soft buttery feel of the mouse. I will write another review with updates in 6 mths. To see if I still feel the same way.

name: VGA Controller Board, PS/2 Control Module for Mouse Keyboard, Control Module with Micro32 Chipset, Graphics Library Game Engine ANSI/VT Terminal for ESP32
description:
• Modular interface: UART, SPI SDIO, I2C LED PWM, TV, PWM, I2S, IRGPIO, Capacitor, Touch, Sensor, ADC, DACLNA, Preamplifier.
  • WiFi supports FCC/CE-RED/IC/TELEC/KCC/SRRC/NCC.
  • The WiFi distance is up to 300 meters and the transmission power is 22dBm.
  • Compliant with V4.2BR / EDR and BLE standards, sensitivity is -97dBm.
  • NZIF Receiver Class-1, Class-2 and Class-3 Transmitter AFH.

reviews.review:
Yeah this thing totally rocks! I bought it just for the heck of it, I was looking at ESP32 boards and this came up and I figured why not.

It actually works really well with the fabGL Arduino library :-) there's a small wiring diagram printed on the board, and it seems to match the wiring schema for PS2 and VGA from fabgl.

I set it up as a generic ESP32 dev board in the Arduino IDE, and try downloading the sample space invaders program, and amazingly it actually worked first try!

So seems like a pretty cool useful little board, and if the schematic I have from the fabGL git page is right (and it seems right for VGA and PS2 connections at least) then there's a way to get you a few more GPIOs, plus the audio port, and so on.

By the way, the picture of the board didn't show an audio port or a micro SD port, but the board I got seems to have both, which is a nice bonus :-)
Fantastic little board, does what it is advertised and the VGA output is solid. Only complaint: little documentation.
item static package was opened prior to receipt. Item not working.

reviews.review: Unfortunately, the handle on the top of the harness did not reach to the other side of my case so I had to goto a special sewing store to increase the length of the handle to make it fit my case. I see now that this is the smaller harness. On Amazon.com, there are 2 options, a small harness and large harness. I recommend people buy the large harness. Amazon.ca or the seller should add the option to select the large harness. But I was able to successfully alter the harness for $20 extra and now it's perfect :)

Bought to transport an NZXT 510i case on the plane. Bit of a snug fit but I felt more secure knowing it's tight. With nothing else but the mouse pads and a few cables, it fit comfortably in the overhead compartment in an airplane.

Would recommend for anyone thinking of transporting their desktop as a carry-on but be sure to check desktop dimensions beforehand.
Doesn't for my lian Li mini (although it's bigger than most minis)

I really like it. My desktop is quite expensive...and I used to carry it around without this contraption, up and down 2 flights of stairs. Whenever I strap this brace on the PC, I ALWAYS feel anxious because it seems like it's not strong enough to carry 25, or so, pounds. Still, every time I use it, it works just fine and the handle always stays intact!

I don't know if I would travel with this brace outside of my house, though. I could easily see myself walking through a crowd of people, at the airport, and somebody bumping into it and causing something to break or be damaged. After all, the case is totally exposed. Dents and scratches are to be expected, if you're not careful.
One thing that I do feel is disappointing, about the strap, are the carrying pockets. They're just not big enough for me to carry valuable items, alongside the PC, and feel comfortable that those items won't fall out - and some have. Luckily, no damage has ever come to a mouse or game controller that fell out.
The pockets could easily be made larger and more secure. An average-sized keyboard looks sketchy on the side of the brace because its form-factor is so tall that it will tilt a little bit. It'll probably never fall over, but it's just another concern that I have.
It's not worth it to carry important things inside those little pockets unless those things are small enough to be inconveniences (like a usb drive or a mouse pad).

Regardless, the brace does its job VERY well and it enables me to travel with my desktop, more often than I should. As long as you clip it right and strap the velcro properly, your desktop will be safe in your hands.
Ease to use. Stable

I bought this to fit on a Dell Inspiron 3650. I am very well pleased with the product quality, but I was a bit misled regard whether it would fit my computer. The description says it fits cases "2 to 9 inches wide" and "11.5 to 18 inches tall".

My Dell 3650 is about 14" tall and 5" wide, so it should've fit nicely. However, it did not. The velcro (or magic, as the description states) straps are too long to wrap around my computer and still fasten.

The product is great quality and appears durable, but the description was very misleading for me, and now, I have a product that is not going to work as well as it should have.

Use this for a mobile gaming lab with custom built PCs. The pockets make the entire computer be self contained and can hold power cables, headsets, mice, keyboards, and mice pads. Straps adjust to fit device. Handles make transporting two a doable endurance workout or can get a monitor case to transport the whole setup in one go.

Ordered 3 pcs, one had faulty buckle which opened immediately under slight pressure, sadly this made it unusable. Other two were fine. Suggest you pay attention to the size, as it is way too small for larger cases.

reviews.review:
This PCI Express to Dual Port PS/2 Expansion Card did not function in an Intel® Desktop Board DH55HC. I was hoping to replace the onboard PS/2 on the motherboard with this card; the DH55HC is equipped with only one PS/2 port, which is a combo port (purple/green). The BIOS on the DH55HC allows me to disable the onboard PS/2 combo port, which i did. But unfortunately, my functionning PS/2 keyboard did not work on this PS/2 Expansion Card. And yes, the SATA power cable was plugged-in the expansion card.

The adapter did not contain any instruction nor driver; Windows 7 x64 recognized the peripheral but prompted me for a driver. Did not try any other operating system because this card needed to go in this particular offline computer.

The seller offer an RMA but shipping back the card would cost me $20,00 canadian so the card went into the "junk" pile of useless, unstable or barely functionning computer parts.

reviews.review: I am writing a positive review for two reasons: 1st is because I got a deal on this kit (About 36$ instead of 60$), second is because the keyboard is better than I hoped for. I think the keyboard alone would be worth the price I paid. It's only downside is the battery cover fits loosely. I would rate the mouse 2 stars as it's VERY small (uncomfortable for most people I guess), it feels cheap ( It weights close to nothing) and I noticed that the left click works about 70% of the time.

I've had this keyboard for about 18 months. Now I have the dreaded stuck key issue. I'll be moving to a Logitech.

The keyboard and mouse are fine. I've been using it daily for 18 months. No issues. I switch (KVM) between two machines and this works flawlessly.

My only complaint would be that the escape key is in line with the function keys, so I continually hit F1 instead of F2. Pretty minor, I'd say.

This is a solid keyboard - no cheap plastic here. No bend, no flex. For the price, I'm amazed at the quality. It's better than keyboards I've bought in the past at two or three times the price. So I bought a second one for work. I don't play any fast twitch games, so for gaming - don't know. I has a system shutdown key in the upper right which I've bumped accidentally a couple of times. Very annoying. I haven't found a way to disable it.

The keyboard is OK. The mouse is quite small compared to what I am used to, But it is also fine.
A good value.

The keyboard is very functional although in truth I am not the most experienced person to evaluate it. Just to say that it works as well as the Microsoft keyboard that it replaced. The mouse is a little less impressive than the Microsoft one it replaced. In fact, my first impression was that it was quite cheap. On the positive side it fits nicely in the hand. My recommendation is that they upgrade the quality of the mouse.

Nous avons acheté ce clavier et souris au début de la pandémie et sommes très satisfaits. Les touches sont agréables au touché et le bruit est feutré. Plusieurs semaines ont passé depuis et aucun signe de fatigue des batteries.
Mouse is ok for day to day use. Keyboard has alot of functionality, but keystroke is spongy and sometimes keyboard doesn't respond when you press on keys.

Nice quality combo, I had to add some grip to the mouse to help hold it due to all plastic design and being that it is quite small for larger hands. Once I added some grip to the mouse it is fine. Happy with purchase.

This is the first day with this keyboard for my at home use. I am initially very impressed with the quality for the price. I wish it was USB charging for both rather than battery operated. I also didn't find enough operating instructions to know if turning the keyboard and mouse off when I am not using the keyboard is recommended. Guess this is good cross-selling of products for Amazon to sell rechargable batterys. Back on topic, the keyboard feels heavy duty and hopefully we have a long relationship.

Plug and play out of the box, batteries in first of course and four batteries were included. Disconnect the old key board and insert the little dongle, you only need one for both items. And your away as long as you turn the mouse on, switch in on the underside.
Well built keyboard the keyboard has a good feel when typing, there a number of keys to operate things like email, sleep mode, calculator and more it’s a great feature. The ergonomic feel is great no hand or wrist strain. I love it if I had ten computers they would all have this keyboard. I’m excepting any free gaming computers to test this out lol. No fancy lights all over the thing, they drive me madder than I am now. Worth the money you won’t be disappointed. And from other reports if it does not work correctly, Amazon are great at sorting out an issues.

The keyboard isn't bad at all. The keys have a good feel, some decent resistance before a quick release. This is much better than most inexpensive keyboards. The extra keys mostly work with my Ubuntu 18.04 laptop. A few don't do anything and a few do things other than what they're supposed to do, but they're mostly useful. I imagine they all work correctly on a Windows computer. The keyboard is lightweight but doesn't feel flimsy.

The mouse precision is good even on my plain white desk at work and the buttons and wheel work fine, but the mouse is barely bigger than a travel mouse and its shape is peculiar. It's almost hourglass-shaped if you look at it from the front, and the small amount of outward curve toward the top has the "next/previous web page" buttons right where my thumb sat when I tried to hold on to the mouse. Probably my preteen daughter could have used it better but it was barely usable for me. As mentioned, the buttons have a solid feel to them.

The instructions don't have much useful information, but this is a keyboard and mouse. I'd hope that the instructions are mostly not needed.

There are a few minuses aside from the size and shape of the mouse.

- The keys make a squish-release noise which drove me up a wall until I put on my headphones. Probably I'm just being an oversensitive baby, but still.

- The top-right corner of the keyboard has buttons which are supposed to lock the computer and to ask if you want to power down, but on my Linux machine they suspended the computer and turned it off immediately without prompting. This wouldn't be a problem except for their location where they'd get tapped by mistake when I moved the keyboard on my desk.

- The keyboard is lopsided, with the arrow keys and the numeric keypad to the right. This is fine if you're using the keyboard on a desk but not if you put your legs up and use it on your lap. I don't know how many people would want to do this but I'm not sure why you'd have a wireless keyboard and not do it.

Overall I think these are a good value if you aren't bothered by the shortcomings I mentioned.
Well-constructed. I returned it because the keyboard is not lighted.
good replacement and not expensive

name: Redragon K628 PRO 75% 3-Mode Wireless RGB Gaming Keyboard, 78 Keys Hot-Swappable Compact Mechanical Keyboard w/Hot-Swap Free-Mod PCB Socket, Dedicated Arrow Keys & Numpad, Red Switch
description:
• YES! TRUE HOT-SWAP - The transformative innovation with 99.8%+ switches compatible free-mod hot swappable Redragon keyboard is available now. The unique exclusive structure design of the socket makes the switch mounting easier and less wobbling.
  • Practical Smart 78 Keys - Redragon 75% layout K628 pro in 3-modes meets the user's need for separate arrow keys and number keys. The 78-key layout provides the ultimate balance of compactness and 104-key functionality, allowing for the smoothest habit curve.
  • 3-Mode Connection - Geared with Redragon innovative tri-mode connection technology, USB-C wired, BT 3.0/5.0 & 2.4Ghz wireless modes which make the user experience upgraded to another level in all fields.
  • Hot-Swappable Red Switches - Hot-swappable with almost all switch types in the market no matter 3-pin or 5-pin. Quiet basic linear mechanical switches, soft key travel makes every click easy to register. Easy to mod or update it with your wishing preference, no forum researching required.
  • Vibrant Groovy RGB - Up to 20 presets backlighting modes are free to choose by the keyboard itself. Brightness and flowing speed is also adjustable on board. New marvelous music sync mode will light up your desktop discotheque vibe, quite a light show to get immersed.
  • Pro Software Supported - Expand your options using the available software to design your own new modes and effects found on redragonshop. Macros with different keybindings or shortcuts for more efficient work and gaming.

reviews.review: I like the quality of my K628RGB-PRO but there were several issues. First I got the wrong software because the names are similar or they have the wrong software on one of their links. Second when the bluetooth is on the software says there's a firmware update that breaks the keyboard. I had to uninstall software and bluetooth, reset, unplug. Luckily that fixed it. Third the keyboard goes into sleep mode even when plugged in. I turned off all the usb save power options in device manager but didn't stop it. Now I just live with it waking up and beeping like a usb device has connected or disconnected. There's also no ` which I just to key up for discord. And no enter key on number pad and the zero is not long like a normal pad. There's also no easy to use delete key near the backspace to delete from the right. Of course I knew I'd have to adapt to a few difference but those are the worst ones for me. I was able to map the ` to the escape key, the ESC to the - key on the top right and the delete key to the + to the right of the backspace key. It's clicky but that was expected. I wish there was good easy fast on/off button. I guess if using bluetooth when I would need it, I could use the switch under it but it's small. A push button would of been nice. Maybe there's a macro or key combo from windows I can use. I hope this helps everyone. I usually don't spend over $35 for a keyboard this was $65 on sale so maybe $75 cnd with tax. Not bad but dam that first issue was a big one. And the light options are cool. I was going to give it a 3 but with software working it should be a 4. Note get the Redragon_K628RGB-PRO_Setup_V1.6.7_20221.exe version.

TLDR: Great price to get a board if you want to switch out the keycaps and switches for some custom ones, which is what I did. The wireless is not usable for online gaming, but connecting it with a wire is totally fine. The layout is impractical.

1. The wireless is not suitable for suitable for gaming, unless you're casually playing a single player game from the couch and REALLY don't care about input lag. (Note: you can plug this keyboard in using the wire and it is completely fine). But even on the 2.4 Ghz with wireless dongle, the keyboard will sometimes stop sending keystrokes for a full second and then just send a bunch of them at the same time in a batch. Some key presses simply get missed. Not playable for any online games. It's actually annoying to type this review with! The wire is not long enough for my standing desk, so I cannot play games with this while standing.

2. The keyboard layout is really bad. I bought this keyboard primarily for the keyboard layout, but after using it, I realized the position of the arrow keys is unnatural, since I expect the arrow keys to be at the far right side of the keyboard. I can't get used to it. And the num pad is too close to my regular keys, so typos happen far too often with the sensitive switches I use. It's just not a practical layout unfortunately.

I've been using Redragon keyboard since last year. I got their low profile keyboard before and gave it to my sister. Now I need a new one and found this amazing keyboard with 3 mode of connection which I prefer.
Great keyboard.
Fantastic. No complaints
it works, its not loud, it looks good

So far it's an excellent keyboard. Only potential issue is that it will often disconnect from bluetooth at random times. I have yet to determine if this is due to the keyboard or my laptop. My last bluetooth keyboard had the same issue, which is making me think it might be more of an issue with my laptop.

So far so good! Love the sound! Keys a little more sensitive than I thought but once you’ve adapted, it’s fine!
We’ll see in a few months if the quality holds.

I have been using this keyboard daily for over a year now.. And while I still miss having dedicated F keys, this keyboard otherwise has been the best one I have ever owned, and costs less than half the price of my previous corsair and Logitech keyboards. I put extra money into pre lubed gateron milky reds, foam and tape mods, and o-rings.. Modded this keyboard is very quiet with a deep clacky sound. It feels fantastic and comparable to keyboards more than double the price. Not metal, but feels sturdy and has a little heft to it so you still get a premium feel (once modded). 100% worth it if you like full size features in a tiny package.

After downsizing to a TKL a few years ago there were more than a few times where I missed having the numpad so when I saw the layout on the Redragon Pollux, and the fact that it had standard hot swap sockets, I was sold. The functionality of any missing keys are accessible by holding the function key and pressing the key they've mapped that function to. The placement of these remapped functions is intuitive and easy to remember, but if you need to use the F row keys without taking your other hand off of the mouse then this probably isn't the keyboard for you. They've also conveniently mapped media key functions like volume and pause/play to the Z-M keys. The only thing that's outright missing from a full size keyboard is the second enter key.

It comes with Redragon branded red linear switches which felt way better than I expected. I liked the switches from my old keyboard so I just swapped them in but the stock switches felt good too. Unlike most Redragon keyboards, this one has north facing standard 5 pin hot swappable sockets which means you can install switches from other switch manufacturers like Cherry, Gateron and Kailh. The RGB LEDs stick up a bit from the PCB so they recommend using switches with the little cutout for the LED on the bottom, but even V2 Zealios (which don't have that cutout) snapped in without a problem.

The plate mounted stabilizers are pretty loose and will need some level of modification to fully eliminate the rattle. Honestly, I've heard worse from more expensive keyboards but there is definitely a lot of room for improvement. Since the board is hot swappable, you could also install enthusiast grade plate mounted stabilizers if you wanted.

The keycaps are the standard double shot ABS shine through caps that come with most gaming keyboards. The mapped functions are printed in white on the top of the keys, which isn't the cleanest look, but isn't a deal breaker. If you want to put different keycaps on it then you'll need to find a set that includes the smaller right shift and right modifier keys as well as the small 0 and + for the numpad.

The RGB backlighting is vibrant and animates smoothly. There are about 20 modes to choose from including the expected ones like the color wave and spinning color wheel. You can cycle through them by holding FN and pressing the right alt key. Holding FN and pressing the arrow keys controls the brightness and speed. Holding FN and pressing the space bar will allow you to cycle through single colors for modes that allow it. Pressing FN and backspace will toggle the backlighting on or off.

There are tiny red LED indicators for caps lock and num lock on either side of the 2 key on the top row. They're recessed enough that they're visible but don't interfere with the rest of the RGB lighting. I've included a picture with my review so you can see what it looks like. You can lock the windows key by pressing FN+Win and the Win key will light up white (more of a purple tinged white because RGB keyboards struggle with pure white backlighting) to indicate that it is locked.

There is downloadable software you can get from the website on the box but I never bothered with it because you can do everything except program macros directly from the keyboard itself.

The only real annoyance I have is that the detachable USB C port is on the left side of the keyboard and the included USB C cable isn't a right angle plug so it sticks out further than I would like. Since it's detachable I can buy a right angle cord if it still bothers me later on.

For around $60 you're getting a unique layout that actually balances form and function in addition to a path to further customization if you choose to take advantage of it.

I have bought this keyboard recently and it very sleek and nice feeling but they keycaps seem to be a little rushed and not so nice but that is understandable for a lower end keyboard over all i am happy with the keyborard and it is very responsive as i am typing with it now. :D
Comfortable layout and keys are nice are quiet for a mechanical type. Recommended.

Tras 2 meses de prueba trabajando con él 8 horas diarias, puede decir que funciona perfectamente, espectacular, justo tiene lo que buscaba. Teclado numérico y sobre todo atajos para cualquier tecla de un teclado convencional.
Lo único que no me gusta, es que la serigrafía de las teclas que se usa con FN casi ni se ven, ni con la iluminación activada.

reviews.review: The keyboard is very sturdy. Types really well. I actually like typing again. Looks good too. The mouse is accurate and glides smoothly. Highly recommended. 👍
I love my key board and I get so many comments on it lol

I love this thing. It's ADORABLE, comfortable, and to use. Every coworker has gone bananas when they see it. The keys are soft and easy to type with, and all the normal keyboard functions are there (when using w/Windows). The mouse looks/feels a bit cheap, but works perfectly fine. I have been using the set for a week now and haven't experienced any issues (no connection issues or lags, battery life ok, etc). My only complaint is that the mouse falls asleep very quickly, and I'm having to train myself to click it to turn it back on (as opposed to simply moving it around). All in all, would buy again 100%.

I bought this and have really wanted to love it but the keyboard supports at the top back broke within a month out of nowhere and the signal to the laptop always lags. Almost every other sentence has multiple errors where keys just weren't registered or get sticky. Often the keys go Capital out of nowhere and its not that cap locks is on, I use shift to capitalise and its like it gets stuck so even when I let go, letters still type in cap. It has seriously reduced my wpm because of how many errors it makes, I spend way too much time correcting signal errors when typing. Have been unable to contact seller since.
Three months of use and two keys have already faded - I know I didn't pay a bunch for it but I expected better quality or for it to at least last longer.
I like that the keys can pop off and I'm able to clean the keys once it gets dirty. I use this product in my craft room for my computer and it matches my decor. Compliments my space very well.
So loved it! Recommend it
The most cutest keyboard and mouse! I love the style and the sound it makes. It’s what I’ve been looking for !!!

Worth every penny! Super cool and cute keyboard. Does the job well 👌🏼
Might be confusing at first since they’re round compared to the usual keyboard keys, but it works fine! I ordered another one to use at work.
The colour and quality is same as described!

I love love love this product. I wasn't expecting the wireless USB to connect to both the mouse and the keyboard, and I love that it does! Additionally, it came with a little brush that can clean in between the keys!
It's very convenient. The size isn't too small and not too big, so it's just right (for me, personally at least). The color is just as shown, which I love! It's such a pretty pastel color. The keys can be a little loud if you're typing a lot, but I personally like the clicky sound. I will say that it does require two AA batteries (one for the keyboard and the other for the mouse), so make sure you have those!
I will say that the mouse had a weird little (very little, as shown in the 2nd picture) stain just slightly under the left button. To be honest though, I don't mind it since you can't really see it anyways because of how small it is and since its under the button lol. That was the only little thing I could nitpick at, but otherwise, everything else is just lovely! I definitely recommend.

Bought this keyboard for my home office. I had an issue where the mouse wasn’t working aware from the keyboard and when I emailed the company’s help through Amazon, the person on the other end was responsive and helpful.
