I love gaming mode - switching 'WASD' movement to the arrow keys, sadly in this day some games do no allow you to rebind controls!

I would have loved a small quick start guide or something though, there are a few different colour settings but I do not know the key combinations and have only found the different settings accidently. Basically it is rainbow and you can't change what colour the keys glow but you can dim or turn it off, that's an easily seen setting, but there is 'breathing' modes, basically you can have the glow solid, or have the keys dim in and out and at varying speeds but as I mentioned I have NO IDEA how to change the 'breathing' modes :( I also found gaming mode by accident but very glad I did!!

The mouse as far as I know there is no way to change the colour settings, and there are two buttons on the left side that I wish I could change what they did when clicked because I am constantly hitting the rear one by accident, and that acts like the 'back' button in your browser and that has led to a lot of swearing especially as it usually happens after I've tyyped something and go to grab the mouse to submit it - it hits back and my page goes back, losing my work! The extra buttons are great when games allow binding but the buttons are millimeters off from being out of my way.

Overall a happy purchase.
Je l’aime beaucoup!!! De bonne qualité et très lumineux!
Nice and clean
It’s very good for the price
Bought for my son who said it is similar to a mechanical keyboard. The cooured lights are not too bright
My son absolutely loves this combination. He’s a gamer and really enjoyed playing his games with these!!

The BAKTH LED Keyboard is actually quite a wonderful keyboard. While not being able to say it is a mechanical keyboard it has the feel of one. I was disappointed when I found out that the backlights are only rainbow, I first thought they could fade into different colors like the mouse. And don't bother trying to find a program that can somehow program the backlights, I've looked into that and could not find any programs. So if you're looking for a backlight keyboard that can be programmed I'd suggest Corsair keyboards or Red Dragon keyboards. However if you're fine with just the rainbow color on the keyboard then this is the one for you. The other nice thing about this keyboard is that it has the "FN" shortcuts, these shortcuts are most convenient to use without having to touch the mouse so many times, which can be a nuisance.
Here is a list of what they do:
FN F1 - Opens an outdated music media player, not worth the time to use.
FN F2 - Reduces Sound
FN F3 - Increases Sound
FN F4 - Mutes Sound totally.
FN F5 - Stops Video
FN F6 - Clicks on Search bar to search for whatever you need (not sure why it looks like it rewinds)
FN F7 - Doesn't Work
FN F8 - Doesn't Work
FN F9 - Opens Default Browser
FN F10 - Opens Default Browser (Yes I didn't make a mistake they both open the browser)
FN F11 - Locks Keyboard so no one can type anything, unless they know the shortcut (to unlock it just press FN F11 Again)
FN F12 - Haven't figured it out yet the symbol looks like a calculator or numpad shortcut but when I clicked it, it did nothing.

While the mouse is a pleasing gesture for the buyer it really is quite a bad mouse. The mouse has a cpi button (cpi is mouse sensitivity) which ranges from slow medium and fast. The cpi button can be nice depending on the width of your screen (Bigger monitor would require faster cpi, while smaller monitor would require slower cpi, etc.) The forward and backward buttons are extremely sensitive and I've accidentally clicked them multiple times. While the cpi button and the forward-backward side buttons are nice for office work they aren't so much for gaming. The infa-red hole on the bottom that tracks movement to move the arrow is a bit high up allowing harder movement, and not as smooth for the customer. So I wouldn't use the mouse for gaming so as for office work (careful depending on what office work you do).

All in all I'd say the keyboard is really nice for a simple gamer (or serious gamer). It has the mechanical feeling (at least for me, and most likely you.), the gaming backlights most gamers would use. The simple shortcuts, and the legs on the bottom to stand the keyboard higher up. So if you're looking for a cheap gaming keyboard I'd recommend this one, however I would keep looking for a new mouse because the mouse isn't the best.

`Cheers!

My feedback is based on heavy weekday usage in my home office 8+ hrs daily.

1. Lighting - This is a rainbox lighted keyboard, I like to work without an overhead light near a window. This keyboard gives off a really fun light & it is quite bright. I enjoy that feature of the keyboard, but it's not a vital requirement. Please note that you can not change this keyboard to a single color, so don't expect that feature. The description is clear but sometimes consumers get confused & think that all lighted keyboards are the same.
2. Key-Spacing - Key spacing is critical for speed while typing. There's nothing worse that continuously hitting the wrong keys or your fingers slipping from the keys. I like the feel of these keys, the slight indention for your fingertips & the larger size of the letters on the keys. I can type just as quick as I normally do with no delays & this keyboard has no issues keeping up and is very responsive
3. Angle - keyboard has a good rise, I extend the little feet so that it is at an angle and this one is a good one. I can't use a keyboard without this feature as it makes my wrists ache (carpal tunnel), and this keyboard does not disappoint.
4. Price -- When I purchased this keyboard I thought it was a good buy, when I received it & opened the box it came with a mouse! That was like a bonus as I wasn't expecting it.

If you are hesitating about buying this keyboard, don't! You'll enjoy it, it makes the work day a little more fun & the light is pretty. What are you waiting for, click the "add to cart" button now & try this one out!

reviews.review: I purchased this computer with 16gb ram but only got 8gb. It has 2 sticks of 4gb of ram in the 2 slots. When I contacted the seller they offered to send me replacements quickly. Even with 8gb ram this computer is still very fast and it’s quiet. It had a couple small blemishes on the case but overall looked to be clean and in good condition. I wish I had known it only had the i5 2400. I would have rather had a newer version at this price. I also wish the DVD was a writer. I didn’t realize it was a reader only. Seller was quick to respond and fix the ram issue. I love my new computer. I’ll update my review after I get the new ram in.

reviews.review:
First of all This is the title of the computer advertised on Amazon
Dell OptiPlex 5040 Business PC Desktop Computer - Intel Quad Core i5-6500 3.2GHz, 16GB DDR3 Memory, New 1TB Solid State Drive, Windows 10 Pro, HDMI, USB 3.0, DVD, Keyboard, Mouse, WiFi (Renewed)

What I got was NOT what was in the title.... 8 GIGS of RAM and only a 256 gig SSD Drive. After I got the computer and checked the specs I noticed that the description of the product in the page showed the correct specs. THIS MAKES SHOPPING Very confusing because the user does not truly know what they are getting. I am Not really happy about this. But this is not even the real issue it turns out.

The REAL ISSUE
The computers HARD DRIVE died on me after a few hours of setting it up. After a few hours of using the computer and setting it up I then started getting the Blue screen and Windows was telling me that windows files were corrupted and I then had to restore the computer.

Luckily I know what I am doing and I restored the computer to a factory state. And got the computer running again. THE NEXT DAY I started encountering Blue screens again with a similar error. Windows files got corrupted and started the problem again. Something is SERIOUSLY WRONG with the hard drive you put into this computer.

To test my theory I then installed windows on a separate external drive. To make sure that the problems I am facing was in fact hard drive related. My Hard drive is performing well so far without any issues.

I contacted the company so far with a promising result that they will send me at least the 1 terabyte SSD with windows installed on it. I will update this review once I get the new drive installed and Tested.

At a minimum the title of the product should match the specs. But with what hopes to be a good customer service I will give a couple more stars. We will see.

I bought Dell because I am still using a similar one I bought new 5 years ago. I wanted a backup computer with wireless that I could install on my living room TV system as a monitor-- to have the comcast xfinity streaming app on my Samsung 50" alexa TV as monitor for the Dell. Everything worked great except the cheap USB wireless, which I could not get t to work, even though It found my Xfinity wireless signal, it could not stream any data. I replaced it with a better USB wireless from Amazon and everything worked great. That is why the 4 star rating.
So far, so good. I have been using this daily since it arrived. It meets the specs advertised. It looks and runs well. I think I got what I needed for less.

reviews.review: I wanted a new desktop to replace an old, burnt out Desktop Clone with Windows XP I've had since 2003. Yes, it still worked until last year. I didn't want to spend a great deal of money, especially with Windows 10, ad OS I strongly dislike. This package was very appealing: what it contained and the price. I've only had it a couple of days, but so far, so good. Everything in it works as should. Everything arrived as described and promptly. Packaged was well packaged, though, why it isn't marked fragile, I don't know. No assembly instructions were included, but it was very easy to install. I don't know about the quality of keyboard and mouse because I'm using my older one. Very easy to connect to WiFI. No issues have arisen yet. I hope this one lasts half as long as its predecessor. It's fast, too, though I don't know about gaming. It comes pre-installed with licensed Windows 10 Pro, which in comparison only has one feature not in Windows 10 home, so not worth much at all. I did some research online about this model. It's from 2011 and went for $1599.00 at that time with an overall score of 4.25 out of 5 stars in satisfaction. Of course, with full refurbishment here, it has been built up and upgraded. The package comes with a major brand monitor, but you don't know which one until you receive it. I received a Lenovo Thinkpad with mine. Overall, I think it is a good purchase at a great price.

This is a renewed HP desktop computer with monitor, a new keyboard, mouse and a usb wifi adapter. All cables were included.
The first computer developed a hard drive failure after about a week use. After returning the tower component, Blair Tech send me a second unit but that one had a high squeal whenever I used the audio for music or videos. The third shipment was the charm and since receiving it have experienced no problems to date.
You may ask why would I accept a third unit after experiencing problems with the first two? Simply because I like the desktop format which incidentally had no blemishes or scratches and the clarity of the images on the monitor. Also, you can't beat the price. I use his computer for general internet browsing, music listening and light office work. The computer loads quickly at startup and the wifi works flawlessly. Videos play with great clarity.
This is where I must compliment Blair for their excellent customer service. Each time I called, they were quick to respond to my problem and in a courteous and efficient manner. I received the replacements within a matter of a few days. They were difficult to reach by direct phone but they allow you to leave your number and they return your call when an agent becomes available.
Would I buy from Blair Tech in the future? Absolutely yes!

I purchased in February 2020 and has constantly used this computer ever since with no problems. The wifi adapter that comes in the package must be inserted to achieve the wifi connection which is very simple. I have even connected 2 printers and a cricut machine to this PC and still it works great. I design tshirts and other customized items on a regular basis. I am writing this review because Windows have recently launched Windows 11 and I'm currently not able to upgrade using this system but I plan to. I am trying to find out if this PC has TPM chip apparently you needs this for the recent update. However, Windows 10 will be supported until the year 2025.
Again wonderful product, however, it is refurbished which means your experience and what each individual customer receive will not always be the same or even as the picture shown. I hope this helps you all.

Waste of time and a money. Buyer beware. Just because something is preowned or “refurbished,” it shouldn’t be trash. I purchased this for my nephew for Christmas. Upon opening the computer for set up on the 25th of December, we noticed the font of the screen was scratched (picture attached). Once plugged in and turned on, we noticed the whole screen was/appeared shattered all across it (pictures with swirl white background attached). Obviously it was unusable and not up to bar with the advertisement. And talk about a crappy “gift” to give someone (he’s 11 hence the purchase of a refurbished computer but still, I didn’t know it would be trash). When contacting seller, they did apologize and they did send a “replacement” once we confirmed to them that we had sent back the broken screen and it’s corresponding cord. When we received the “replacement” it was honestly worse than the initial shattered one (picture attached). It was NOT the 19’ inches as advertised - it was 17’ - and yes, I measured diagonally as you do with all electronic screens, tv’s, etc. The replacement monitor was a joke and looked like it was from the 1990’s. After messaging with the seller, I decided to just return it - not worth the hassle - and of course they kept a restocking fee of about $40 bucks, which to me is theft. I didn’t return it because I simply changed my mind. They sent a broken one first, then sent an item not as advertised the second time, which is why I returned it. I will be contacting Amazon directly regarding this as I believe this was theft and false advertisement. So as nice as all these other reviews are on here, beware that you do in fact get what you pay for. It’s cheap sure, but so are their products. Cheap, defective, and broken. And, they still make money. Buy new, save yourself the grief of having to purchase, return, and lose money on junk.

I don’t often write a review I products I purchase, but I am really impressed with what I purchased for my mom. She is totally satisfied with what she received. I have to say there’s more value in the purchase than what we paid. I totally recommend this company if your in the market to buy. For a refurbished computer I’m really impressed how they shipped the product. The boxes were secured inside a larger box and the computer came to me as though it was a brand new computer. Thank so much and I really look forward to my next purchase with this company.

reviews.review: Dead On Arrival.I wasn't too picky on appearance on refurbished product, but it was guaranteed to work fine. Won't power up. Seller is dragging their feet on return for this.
Great computer for a business. Lots of memory and just fast enough for office work. But it’s not for gaming or doing massively hard tasks.

The system's got some power. Slap a graphics card WITH a new power supply and you can have a decent gaming experience. It DOES have wifi, but its not built in. It comes with a small usb wifi dongle thing in the same box as the mouse so don't throw that out! The dongle seems to be pretty weak so I wouldn't use this too far from the source. Speaking of the mouse, mine came absolutely smashed. Why a 5 star review then? Must've been during transit. I don't like to review things out of the sellers control, but I will contact them to see if I can get a replacement. Just have a spare mouse in case.

I received my tower a little earlier than expected, awesome! About a week or so after, I was emailed by them to check on the product and make sure everything was good. I told them about the wifi chip acting up and me having to switch it from USB to USB. They had me explain what was happening then they immediately sent me out a new one. Wow, they were so nice and accommodating. If you were thinking or on the fence about getting this unit, I would hop over to our side. You won't be disappointed.

I ordered this computer because it had everything I wanted and was described as "looks and works like new." The description was "refurbished to like new condition." It arrived dented and ragged. A metal cover on the back with cutouts for the USB port connections was put on in such a way that the ports were obscured. I could not plug in any USB connections. I sent it back with clear descriptions about what was wrong. I spoke with customer service several times. I told them I wanted another computer like the one I ordered, except one that would work. Refurb Ninja returned the exact same computer (same serial number) with no corrections or repairs. Of course I sent it back. I was totally disappointed with Refurb Ninja and could not give them any stars.

reviews.review: Quick delivery and exactly what I needed

Not a lover. There is a rattle noise happening when the left side of the keyboard is in use. The space bar is a little louder than the rest of the keys as well, and the mouse is not very ergonomic (nor is the keyboard, I prefer a bit of a steeper slant myself, this is very minimally raised). I do like that the mouse has a very quiet click.
I think I will be returning this set.

Love how quiet the keys are but they still make a satisfying noise 😂🫶🏽💜 no connection problems, came with an extra usb thing but I’m not sure why, it’s not needed, as one connects both the mouse and the keyboard. 10/10 for me !

I love this keyboard. It is sleek, and the cover really makes typing even more silent. It is comfortable to type, and has light indicators for the number lock/caps lock. My only wish is the mouse to be more ergonomic, but it's not horrible. Overall I would recommend it. Don't forget, it doesn't come with batteries ( 2x AAA for keyboard and 1x AA for mouse).
This set makes me happy to write my notes and do admin throughout the day. The keys are comfortable and it is nice a slim!
I'm probably returning it. Really disappointed with the colour.
I was shipped the keyboard and mouse set with the receiver. I find it odd because the back of the mouse was sealed with a sticker and everything. It makes no sense why it should be missing.
Nice and works well so far. Mouse need to be turn off and on, if the laptop went to sleep. Its a bit annoying but not a deal breaker

i love this keyboard, im a cad tech so i need a good keyboard and mouse to get a lot of use out of. ive gotten multiple compliments on it and its a super cute color. It comes with a silicone cover to put over the buttons for everyday use and i love it. im actually wearing it down and would love to buy just another silicone matt to replace this one. keeps me from getting my keys stuck with dirt and dust and still get the full color and cuteness of the keyboard. O! the mouse is perfect too, i have smaller hands and cant with the bulky mouses so this one is perfect! will update with pictures later!
Nice color, nice quality as in the website..
Quiet keys, mouse is very responsive

I used the keyboard all day and it was actually pretty sturdy. It sits a little lower than I would like but my wrist weren't uncomfortable at all.

I love the soft buttery feel of the mouse. I will write another review with updates in 6 mths. To see if I still feel the same way.

reviews.review: Takes a little getting used to after a standar dell keyboard but I like the sound (quiet) when the silicone cover provides in on top. Super lightweight. Mouse is nice also.

I love my new pink keyboard! The main reason I bought this one was for the color but I am pleasantly surprised at the quality. It's very comfortable, lightweight, the keys don't feel cheap and it's small so doesn't take up a lot of desk space. The mouse is very comfortable to use and very sensitive, I love it! No complaints at all from me.

Inexpensive but better than satisfactory, as excellent functioning and appealing, esthetically. The mauve colour is more appealing than the usual black , grey or white.fare. Everything works well; quiet, yet affirmative keying; bright green CAPS LOCK LED, which is necessary for awkward 'typers' (like moi) who don't look at the screen as they type away -- only to discover a whole paragraph is in CAPITAL letters, except of course, the first letter of every sentence, which is lowercase.

Recommend for sure!

reviews.review:
I bought this because I recently replaced my PC tower with a laptop, but I didn't want to get rid of my tower and want a simple case to store it in the meantime. If you need this for regular travel, I would recommend spending a little more and getting something sturdier.

To be one-size-fits-most, this case is a little bigger than my tower (which is 17.5"L x 18"H x 7"W). This case leaves a lot of extra space around my PC.

That wouldn't be an issue, except for the hard plastic feet on the bottom. My tower does not balance perfectly on all of them or between them; instead, it sits on one set on one side, putting my tower off-balance, even when packed with foam around the sides. The thin, flimsy base insert it comes with isn't sturdy enough to distribute the weight of my tower over the feet; it just bends.

As a result, when my tower is stored in this case, it tilts to one side and falls over. This is exacerbated when I have accessories in the front pouch, the weight of which pulls the case and tower down to one side (ironically, the large accessory pocket to accommodate my keyboard and cords all with my PC was a major selling point for me). I've tried shifting the tower so it leans the opposite direction to counter-balance, but that is not effective and the tower just falls in that direction. I have to lean it against a wall when it's being stored.

I'm going to get a thicker piece of wood or particle board to cut to size and use as a base. This will distribute the weight of the tower over all four of the plastic feet and solve the balance issue. But I really shouldn't have to do that. It should come with a base sturdy enough to support the weight of a computer tower.

reviews.review: I was skeptical at first when I saw review videos. What I really needed was a mechanical keyboard that was a quiet as possible, and this Silent Red one is just perfect for the job. Not only are the keys quiet, but they feel very comfortable to type in, whether it be for gaming or work. I do plan on buying another one as backup.

We bought the keyboard for the sleek white chassis and the sound of the Cherry MX Blue switches. The keyboard works amazingly, the Cherry software was simple to install and was not obnoxious or bloated.

Very satisfied with this purchase and would not hesitate to recommend this keyboard to anyone!

Note: the white keys scuff VERY easily if using a black keycap removal tool. This is not a knock against the keyboard or quality of the keycaps, simply a warning against making the same mistake as I did.
Love this keyboard. The silent switches sounds great and the texture of the keyboard is good. Wouldn't hesitate to purchase again.
Doesn’t click loudly, nice color scheme.

UPDATE - I still love this keyboard. But today I noticed that the symbols on two keys (brackets and braces) were printed upside down. When you switch them to be right side up they look ridiculous. I use brackets for encryption a lot. I'll either swap them out or try not to look at the keys too close. If you're a perfectionist it's really annoying. See picture 3 after I turned them the correct way.

First of all, I'm not a gamer. A little nerdy though. I do digital forensics so I'm always on the computer. I don't always like turning on the overhead office light since it's super bright but I couldn't see my crappy dell keyboard. Floor lamps can't be conveniently placed and a desk lamp gets in the way of my mega monitor.

Enter this keyboard. I tried and rejected many. I HATE loud keyboards. The red silent switches are an absolute dream. I didn't think silent and mechanical could go together so beautifully.

I took one photo of it straight from the box and one after switching out the caps with tiny print to pudding key caps. Switching the caps was pretty easy though these keys are a little close so be careful.

The good:
-Not blindingly bright which is my preference.
-Silent but tactile. Ah it's so beautiful to my ears.
-The texture of the keys is like a gaming console. It may wear badly over time but for now it's satisfying.
-The cord is a decent length.
-I didn't have to download software. It worked out of the box and you can change colors easily.

The less good but not deal breakers:
-The board is angled really high even with the feet down. A wrist rest is a must otherwise you'll be in serious pain.
-Ultra fine print characters on some keys combined with the dim lights on highest setting would be frustrating. I'm not middle aged and my eye sight is 20/15.
-The key profile is a little high too. I'll get used to it but if this is your first mechanical it's surprising and will slow your typing speed.

Overall I'm satisfied and it exceeded my expectations. I'm so happy I went with this as opposed to $200.00+ keyboards I was looking at. I like this even more.

I hope it holds up over time. I'll be absolutely gutted if it gets glitchy or breaks.

This keyboard is awesome. I don’t know much about keyboards, so I did some research on Cherry before I bought it. The noise is perfect for me - not too loud, but not quiet either. It’s got the clicky sound I like to hear when typing for work, and I type all day. I love the color effect too, it’s fun to watch and makes my desk less boring.

I don’t use this for gaming at all, but it’s a very high quality keyboard. I type for the majority of my work day and this keyboard always keeps up. It’s the perfect size for me, keys are a great height, and it’s customizable. My long nails don’t even bother the keys, it’s wonderful. Would recommend this brand to anyone in the market for a quality keyboard!

The blue cherry switches sound great. The tactile feel of the key press is crisp (not spongy like cheap keyboards)

The software allows you to set the color of the keys however you want and the default programs of the key colors are pretty cool(like the key lights can radiate out from the key you press).

It’s a standard design size and layout wise (I wish the volume controls were easier to press with one hand for example (instead of fn+f2/f3)).
Replaced my old keyboard and the transition was seamless. Very nice click clacks

Keyboard did excellently for the few months that I've had it. However, 'D' key rapidly began to wear and now squeaks, gets hitched up a bit. I have some much older mech keyboards that never had this issue arise.

I was looking to pick up a decent wireless keyboard/mouse for really cheap as I didn't want to invest too much into my work from home set up considering I'm not sure how long it will be necessary. Accordingly, this keyboard/mouse setup is decent. It's not going to blow you away like a $80+ combo would, but it works and it does a pretty good job.

The connection is pretty simple, really once the batteries were in, the plug was in and the units were turned on, they worked instantly, no drivers necessary.

The mouse is a tad flat/small so it's not ideal for working long hours. I do have a nice gaming wireless mouse that $200 that I use given I'm so used to the DPI settings, but the other mouse is okay, really depends on your mouse preferences.

Overall, great value for the price and it gets the job done. Based off the photos you can probably tell if it fits your ergonomic or comfort needs, but the functionality is definitely there.

Recommended.

reviews.review: The keyboard is very sturdy. Types really well. I actually like typing again. Looks good too. The mouse is accurate and glides smoothly. Highly recommended. 👍

I love this thing. It's ADORABLE, comfortable, and to use. Every coworker has gone bananas when they see it. The keys are soft and easy to type with, and all the normal keyboard functions are there (when using w/Windows). The mouse looks/feels a bit cheap, but works perfectly fine. I have been using the set for a week now and haven't experienced any issues (no connection issues or lags, battery life ok, etc). My only complaint is that the mouse falls asleep very quickly, and I'm having to train myself to click it to turn it back on (as opposed to simply moving it around). All in all, would buy again 100%.

Almost every other sentence has multiple errors where keys just weren't registered or get sticky. Often the keys go Capital out of nowhere and its not that cap locks is on, I use shift to capitalise and its like it gets stuck so even when I let go, letters still type in cap. It has seriously reduced my wpm because of how many errors it makes, I spend way too much time correcting signal errors when typing. Have been unable to contact seller since.

I love love love this product. I wasn't expecting the wireless USB to connect to both the mouse and the keyboard, and I love that it does! Additionally, it came with a little brush that can clean in between the keys!
It's very convenient. The size isn't too small and not too big, so it's just right (for me, personally at least). The color is just as shown, which I love! It's such a pretty pastel color. The keys can be a little loud if you're typing a lot, but I personally like the clicky sound. I will say that it does require two AA batteries (one for the keyboard and the other for the mouse), so make sure you have those!
I will say that the mouse had a weird little (very little, as shown in the 2nd picture) stain just slightly under the left button. I tried cleaning it off with a q-tip and some rubbing alcohol, but it wouldn't come off. To be honest though, I don't mind it since you can't really see it anyways because of how small it is and since its under the button lol. That was the only little thing I could nitpick at, but otherwise, everything else is just lovely! I definitely recommend.

Bought this keyboard for my home office. I had an issue where the mouse wasn’t working aware from the keyboard and when I emailed the company’s help through Amazon, the person on the other end was responsive and helpful. More recently, I misplaced the fob rendering the keyboard and mouse useless. I decided to just ask to see how I could obtain a replacement fob and an hour later, the same person (from months ago) answered my inquiry again is arranging for me to receive a replacement fob in the next couple of days.
I’ll be purchasing from this company again for my work office in the near future because the keyboard is great! I love the feel of a mechanical typewriter. It’s compatible with my wrist rest, it doesn’t feel fatiguing when typing for hours. And most importantly their customer service is outstanding!

This keyboard is nice and comfortable and has a great sound while typing but when I got to typing quickly the added height to the keys made mistakes in my typing. I love it otherwise but since I was using for work from home I ended up giving it to my daughter.

  • Frosted Metal Cover: The top board of the Horus keyboard is made from durable aluminum material makes the structure steady and still with slim form. The classic black frosted surface process offers an advanced minimalist look and nice fingerprint-resistant touch.
  • 30% Cutted Ultra-Thin: Low profile designed throughout the whole keyboard from the bottom board, middle low-profile red switches (actuation force: 40g) and the top keycaps aim to shorten the distance to actuation as much as possible.
  • More Extra Practical: Set with 4*5 on-the-fly macro keys and a dedicated function area for media control. Convenient to rec frequently used macros without software, play the next song, or just scroll for volume adjustment.
  • More Details Redefinable: Along with tank-solid material is the Redragon core software driver support, 16.8 million colors backlighting, standard keys remapping, and infinite keybindings are all available for personal re-mod.

reviews.review:
Upping my 3 star review to 4 after living with this for a couple more weeks. Granted, this is subjective, but here are my comments that might sway you if this kinda stuff bugs you:

1. Key feel. This is totally subjective, but the mechanical keys on this model have absolutely no extra initial resistance - the pressure needed to depress them is constant through the key press. My other keyboards (mechanical and scissor-type) have that first extra little bit of resistance you need to overcome to get the key down. I have a light touch when keyboards and kinda rely on feeling that initial 'give' of the keyboard to know I've actually engaged the key (and also that I HAVEN'T, in the cases where I accidentally bump an adjacent one). My original review harped on this a bit, and lead to the original 3 stars. Over the last couple of weeks I've gotten more used to the feel of this keyboard though. It isn't anywhere as annoying as I first thought, and I'll probably get completely used to this over time. And given the build quality of the keyboard, I'll likely have it for a long time, so there is that!

2. I should have noticed this in the product image, or maybe I did but it never clicked (see what I did there?)... The dual-use keys (i.e. numbers, special characters) on most keyboards have the main use indicated large and in the middle (i.e. the "1" key's "1") and the smaller shift character above (i.e. the "1" key's "!"). On this one they are the same size and beside each other. Again, not a problem for touch typers who have memorized every special character on the qwerty keyboard. Maybe I'll get used to it, but the special characters are harder to read as they are beside the main ones. Check the product image and decide for yourself.

3. I like a bit more angle on the keyboard than this one gives, even with the legs raised.

Other than the above old-man rants, the keyboard is very solid. It looks like it'll last for years, and the extra function buttons will come in handy. Macro buttons, volume control, and fully customizable key lighting (down to the individual key, when you use their utility program to config the keyboard). It'll probably last long enough that I'll get used to the key feel. Probably last long enough that I'll get used to the key stencils. Probably outlast my old man butt.

This seemed like a fair product in build and features. I like that it was low profile and the quietness of the switches. But ,the lighting malfunctioned after a couple of hours use . So back it went. A bit disappointing. This could be a one off but it left me hesitant about buying it again and I purchased something else and bought quiet switches to replace the standard ones. I know , a bit more money but everything is works fine.

Edit: I was contacted by the company and was pleasantly surprised by the lengths they went to in regards to making this right and my satisfaction. This does not happen often . I have a replacement keyboard that has no issues, which means I have no issues. Well done on the customer service.
It's perfect. For a mechanical keyboard, it's very quiet. The keys feel great to use. The light show that it gives you while you use it is fun.

I use this work work as I wanted a low profile Mechanical keyboard at a price my wife won’t divorce me over. I never thought I’d buy redragon as I have always had Logitech /Corsair keyboards which all worked fine for many years, but wanted something different. I have a Corsair k70 Low profile rapid fire speed to game on for comparison and have wanted the g815 for a year or so, price made that keyboard less a viable option.

Pros:
- price compared to g815 and k70 low profile.
-fair quality (metal frame is solid enough)
- rgb adjustability (neat modes and decent preselected Colors) adds some flair.
- tested for gaming and honestly surprised me, I would totally start my son on this keyboard for gaming, as the key presses work very nicely together. Very light to depress and actuate.
-media buttons work fine, the rubber feeling isn’t that terrible at all. The volume rocker works fine but is very rigid, not as smooth as k70 or a Logitech. But you get one, so +.
-possibly hotswappable keys, which could make things interesting, I’m the future for variety or improved key caps.

Cons:
-fair quality (key caps and depress doesn’t feel as solid as k70) but not bad either and office typing has a nice feeling when typing.
- RGB could be a bit brighter, it is on the subtle side similar to g815. K70 lighting is far brighter and more customizable but would look more “gaming” and not office-esk.

TLDR
Pleasantly surprised, still not high end quality (3.5 on 5)but in price category for low profile, with numpad and media buttons it’s worth a serious look. I would purchase again.

This is my first low profile mechanical keyboard. It has very good feel on hand. light weight and USB port is on the side. But the F2 key backlight is sucked at pink no matter the RGB profile.

[Update]
The support team from Redragon has contactd me and I was inform this is by design. The F1-4 will light up if M1-4 key are programmed. To get rid of the F1-4 key light up, press and hold FN+ESC for 3s.
The support team are very kind and have fast response. Great experience over all.

Best quality for its price, light, easy, design, volume controller, thin, key clicking sounds

Good for gaming and working

Look: 10/10
Feel: 10/10
Value: 10/10
Ease of use: 9/10

I toiled back and forth between Red Dragon and some of the more known and expensive brands. Boy am I glad that I picked this up. For half the price of other brands and comparable models, this keyboard works like a dream. The RGB options are endless, the switches are nice and light for those who type alot and the responsiveness in game is unparralled.

A couple of opportunities for improvement:
1. How the heck do we program these G buttons?!
2. Why does every model need its own red dragon app? I had to download two different ones before I found the right one for my model.

Its a good enough keyboard for the price. The macro keys are awful though and so is the software for it. Use the manual to set the macros with keyboard shortcuts since it wont work via software. Once you set them you cant expect them to always work eityer though after a few hours the macros are seemingly empty again and pressing them does nothing. Besides that they are membrane and feel REALLY bad to press and sometimes when set dont even activate.
Other than the giant maceo thing the keyboard is nice.
Restituita subito. E' solo disponibile con il layout americano, non italiano.
A chi piacciono le low profile e non vuole spendere troppo questa è la tastiera giusta.
Hat alle was man braucht die Kids sind super die Tasten ebenso kann ich jedem empfehlen

reviews.review: The keyboard is very sturdy. Types really well. I actually like typing again. Looks good too. The mouse is accurate and glides smoothly. Highly recommended. 👍
I love my key board and I get so many comments on it lol

I love this thing. It's ADORABLE, comfortable, and to use. Every coworker has gone bananas when they see it. The keys are soft and easy to type with, and all the normal keyboard functions are there (when using w/Windows). The mouse looks/feels a bit cheap, but works perfectly fine. I have been using the set for a week now and haven't experienced any issues (no connection issues or lags, battery life ok, etc). My only complaint is that the mouse falls asleep very quickly, and I'm having to train myself to click it to turn it back on (as opposed to simply moving it around). All in all, would buy again 100%.

I bought this and have really wanted to love it but the keyboard supports at the top back broke within a month out of nowhere and the signal to the laptop always lags. Almost every other sentence has multiple errors where keys just weren't registered or get sticky. Often the keys go Capital out of nowhere and its not that cap locks is on, I use shift to capitalise and its like it gets stuck so even when I let go, letters still type in cap. It has seriously reduced my wpm because of how many errors it makes, I spend way too much time correcting signal errors when typing. Have been unable to contact seller since.
Three months of use and two keys have already faded - I know I didn't pay a bunch for it but I expected better quality or for it to at least last longer.
I like that the keys can pop off and I'm able to clean the keys once it gets dirty. I use this product in my craft room for my computer and it matches my decor. Compliments my space very well.
So loved it! Recommend it
The most cutest keyboard and mouse! I love the style and the sound it makes. It’s what I’ve been looking for !!!

Worth every penny! Super cool and cute keyboard. Does the job well 👌🏼
Might be confusing at first since they’re round compared to the usual keyboard keys, but it works fine! I ordered another one to use at work.
The colour and quality is same as described!

I love love love this product. I wasn't expecting the wireless USB to connect to both the mouse and the keyboard, and I love that it does! Additionally, it came with a little brush that can clean in between the keys!
It's very convenient. The size isn't too small and not too big, so it's just right (for me, personally at least). The color is just as shown, which I love! It's such a pretty pastel color. The keys can be a little loud if you're typing a lot, but I personally like the clicky sound. I will say that it does require two AA batteries (one for the keyboard and the other for the mouse), so make sure you have those!
I will say that the mouse had a weird little (very little, as shown in the 2nd picture) stain just slightly under the left button. I tried cleaning it off with a q-tip and some rubbing alcohol, but it wouldn't come off. To be honest though, I don't mind it since you can't really see it anyways because of how small it is and since its under the button lol. That was the only little thing I could nitpick at, but otherwise, everything else is just lovely! I definitely recommend.

Bought this keyboard for my home office. I had an issue where the mouse wasn’t working aware from the keyboard and when I emailed the company’s help through Amazon, the person on the other end was responsive and helpful. More recently, I misplaced the fob rendering the keyboard and mouse useless. I decided to just ask to see how I could obtain a replacement fob and an hour later, the same person (from months ago) answered my inquiry again is arranging for me to receive a replacement fob in the next couple of days.
I’ll be purchasing from this company again for my work office in the near future because the keyboard is great! I love the feel of a mechanical typewriter. It’s compatible with my wrist rest, it doesn’t feel fatiguing when typing for hours. And most importantly their customer service is outstanding!

This keyboard is nice and comfortable and has a great sound while typing but when I got to typing quickly the added height to the keys made mistakes in my typing. I love it otherwise but since I was using for work from home I ended up giving it to my daughter.
Color looks amazing. Keyboard makes such a satisfying click and responds really well. Overall not a bad product for its price
I love this keyboard and it is so fun to type on. All my students constantly want to touch it. I love that it is usb connected.

reviews.review: I don't see how this is a wireless product i had to plug the audio wire in to get sound but they are a very nice looking speaker

a decent upgrade over my laptop and computer monitor speakers. The sound doesn't exactly scream high quality and do sound "tinny" but apparently this is normal for new speakers as they have to "broken-in". The bass is very limited, you get to hear some bass, but don't expect to be blown away. The rgb lights do liven things up and look great. The cables connecting the speakers together are short, about 3 feet in length, and cannot be swapped out, but it's USB so you could use a USB extension cord. You can connect to other devices using the 3.5mm audio jack which is hard wired to the speaker itself, so you cannot change the cable if it happens to stop working. It has bluetooth connection as well but I have yet to try it.

Would I recommend this? for the price range yes, and if its on sale, then definitely. However, if you want amazing sound quality and don't mind spending more, than I would suggest doing so to avoid disappointment. For me, just a decent upgrade to what I had before without spending over $100, the Redragon GS812 Andante speakers are fine.

update after roughly 8 months of use: left speaker cuts out, and has lower volume than right speaker, crappy usb cable that cannot be replaced since the other end is hard wired to left speaker, have fun twisting and turning the cable to try to get the sound on the left speaker to act normal again, shoddy product avoid!

I have been looking forward to get these speakers and I have other redragon products that work great but these are not up to an standard

Once I set them up the audio cuts in and out and the Bluetooth drops non stop buyer beware on these speakers.

These speakers are good if you have a lap top and you want to improve the sound. The quality is better than built in lap top speakers. They sound like normal desktop computer speakers and they don't have as much bass as you would expect.

There is a design flaw that limits the use of these speakers. I have two 32 inch monitors. The speakers are taller than the bass of the monitor. The left and right speaker are permanently attached by a thin speaker cable. There is no way to remove this cable and there is no input jacks for speaker wire. This means you can't buy a longer cable. The main flaw is that this cable is not long enough. If you have a laptop then this will not be an issue. But if you have two monitors then there is no way to put these speakers on each side of the monitors. I had to lay the speakers on their side in order to use them. I could not stand them up.

Another design flaw became apparent as soon as I did this. The volume and bass knobs are located on the side of one of the the speakers. The decorative lights are located within the speaker and they shine out. When the speaker with the volume knob is placed on its side you can't see the decorative lights on the speaker. It is hidden from view. For the price these speakers don't sound as good as I expected them to sound. Maybe the reason for this is due to a short cable that prevents me from standing these things up.

This also makes the buttons and knobs harder to access as I had to place these speakers behind the monitors. I am using the 3.5 jack and plugging them in the back of my computer. There are no issues with that. They loose two stars because of these flaws. To be fair, you should not have this problem if you are using one monitor.

Sounds good but when playing game it sounds like it muted for 5 or 10 seconds then audio comes back I think it defective it does to all games for some reason when in game audio gets little low the speaker mutes and I think only loud sound will trigger the speaker but if the sounds is low the speaker stop responding and mutes it then turns back on when in game music kick back on well that what I think it happening so I want a half refund..

Speakers are pound and crisp, but the blue tooth to my computer disconnects and connects when something is played, but it works fine with my phone. At first I thought it was my computer but my computer connects to another Bluetooth device just fine and works fine. Not sure. But doesn’t really bother me. Other then that they work great

My first review was "I get that they are cheap and I can't expect studio quality from them but at least be functional. They are speakers with an audio lag and random periods where they mute all on their own. If they won't reliably do the one job they are supposed to do then what's the use?"
Since then the Redragon team has reached out to me to try to better understand the problem and even went as far as to ship me a replacement set of speakers and offer me a full refund. I may have just gotten a faulty unit but it's at least comforting to know that support is here to help and if things don't work out they will do their best to make things right. All my other Redragon products over the years work really well so I still have confidence in the brand even though I had one bad experience.
The speakers are suitable for the price, but the bass could be better. However, their customer service has been excellent so far. They have reached out, asking how they can make the situation right.

reviews.review: I needed a 4 monitor computer for stock trading and did not want to spend a fortune. This has worked out really well. It's big, heavy and noisy, at least compared to a new one. There is a steady whirr of a fan whenever it is on. When I booted it up the first time there was a really loud whirring for a few seconds, but as I don't do a lot of processing it hasn't come on since then. As the output jacks are VGA you will need to buy a VGA to HTML adapter for each HTML monitors. It came with a USB plug-in wireless receiver that allows you to access the internet. I had to call the help line once during the set-up and they were very helpful. You aren't going to find a 4-monitor capable P/C with this kind of power anywhere.

Very good condition, quick delivery. That would have been enough to make me happy, except that I had a problem booting the first time (it ended up being my fault). I called their support line and they were extremely helpful, leading me through some hardware inspections/diagnostics until the problem was solved. Type A, Class 1 customer service. I later had a question about adding memory (it is, after all, a server, not really a PC), and they sent me a document that led me through the process. 'Couldn't have asked for more!

The computer itself is top quality, sturdy and solid. HP offers a system performance adviser as a free download, and I highly recommend it if you want to keep track of what's going on inside the box; it provides a wealth of useful information.

One thing worth noting: It is a rather old machine, and it has a proprietary power supply. Exercising an abundance of caution, I picked up a refurbished spare, just in case something goes wrong. Of course, now that I have the spare, nothing will ever go wrong with the original. Oh, well.

Again, quick delivery, solid machine, unsurpassed customer service, great support (and did I mention a great price?). Five stars, and then some.

This item was labled new but side panel was scuffed and minor scratches. No problem.
The computer worked great until November 2019, in which the system started to freeze intermittently. there good days and bad days with multiple reboots.
This system is being repaired Stallion Tek for CPU / Motherboard issues awaiting it's return.

This HP Beast is fastest thing on no legs. Used refurbished look's brand new works great. Duel quad 3.3 gig processors 556 Gig ram 128 gig video card 2 TB hard drive. I do a lot of video with Gopro. Gopro software make's you convert their video before you can edit. My old computer would grind away for 20 minutes to process about 5 minutes of video the files are huge. The beast ripped through it in less than 60 seconds. Fans kick on and off according to processing load. You can hear the fans but its only temporary while she is eating which is not long. About 5 times cheaper going refurbished and its the same as new.

Pro: Fast speed; easy to set up.
Con: 1. The provided vga adapters are ridiculously useless. Anybody wants to buy such a powerful computer and link it to a vga monitor? I bought it for my hdmi tv. I had to buy an hdmi adapter, which is not expensive, but what a trouble! 2. The computer is good, but you can’t make it better. If you want to add another hard drive, more rams, etc., forget it! There is no room for such things.

reviews.review: Great monitor, a thin backlit LED coupled with an HP tower connected by an HDMI cable, HP tower has R/W DVD, intel chips, 8GB RAM and keyboard and mouse. Set up was easy (I love HDMI cables), deleted McAfee and installed Norton, connected to HP, updated drivers and Windows 10 OS. The Windows 10 Home update took a couple hours but was fine and finished correctly. Love it and my wife loves it, the monitor is the perfect size for her. We are very happy with the system and the price.

I had an issue with the computer out of the box, called HP support, and they refused to help me unless I signed up for a monthly fee. Won't buy another HP . I eventually solved the issue on my own. This was not the seller's fault, just HP'S
Nice screen and computer does what I need it to. I upgraded the memory to 16GB off the bat. I have had good luck out of HP products in the past, and I figure this one will be great as well.
No need for tech support. It serves its purpose a place to put trash

I bought this product for my partner Christmas of 2019. I plugged it in and he was supposed to set it up. Long story short after illness and recovery from a big fall...today, I asked my daughter, who is in from out of town, to help me get it up and running. It would turn on, but the programming to set it up did not start. It is just a black screen. The return window is over and so is the support, but in the fine print, it says it has a limited 1 year warranty. I guess it does not. I am out $500 with no way to get it back. Faulty product....limited warranty was a joke. I am 71 and with challenges when it comes to technology and limited income. I don't know who to talk to, but I am very upset. $500 is a huge deal to me and I feel defeated. If any one has any suggestions, I am open to them. Respectfully, Janie

name: Keychron Q3 Wired Custom Mechanical Keyboard, Full Aluminum Tenkeyless Layout 87-Key, QMK/VIA Programmable Macro with Hot-swappable Gateron G Pro Red Switch, Compatible with Mac Windows Linux (Grey)
description:
• Fully Assembled Keychron Q3 Customizable Mechanical Keyboard: With the classic tenkeyless layout, full aluminum CNC machined body, double-gasket design, and QMK/VIA support, the Q3 is designed for premium typing comfort and endless possibility on Mac, Windows and Linux.
  • QMK and VIA Support: Designed to enhance your creative workflow, you can easily personalize your own keymap to remap each key and create macros on the keyboard. The open-source firmware means endless possibilities for keyboard layouts, shortcuts, backlight effects, and more.
  • Double Gasket Design: In addition to the gaskets on the plates, we added silicone pads between the top and bottom cases to significantly reduce the sound resonance between the metals and reduce the noise of the impacted metals. This design allows the keyboard to maintain the flexibility of the gasket structure and improves the overall typing sound.
  • Hot-swappable: Pre-installed the pre-lubed Gateron G Pro mechanical red switch providing unrivaled linear responsiveness with up to 50 million keystroke lifespan. The hot-swappable sockets are mounted on the PCB and compatible with almost all the MX style 3pin and 5pin mechanical switches on the market (including Gateron, Cherry, Kailh, etc.), you can install or change the switches without soldering.
  • Easily Assembled: Designed every component easily assembled, you can customize and adjust each component you want. Note: The Q3 even supports third-party stabilizers, including Cherry or Durock.

reviews.review: Did not connect bluetooth to my mac computer after several tries. But I like the feel when typing.

Key chattering is really bad on this keyboard. I tried everything: replacing switches, plugging it into different USB ports, flashing firmware from the Keychron website etc. I cannot get it to work. Returned.

name: EPOMAKER EK68 65% Gasket NKRO Mechanical Keyboard with Knob, Hot Swappable 2.4Ghz/Bluetooth 5.0/USB-C Wired Wireless Gaming Keyboard with 3000mAh Battery, RGB for Win/Mac(Flamingo Switch)
description:
• 【EPOMAKER EK68 Gasket-Mounted Mechanical Keyboard】It is well acknowledged by the community that gasket-mounted keyboard has a cleaner sound profile compared to other mounts, such as top mount, and also gives a softer typing experience, which helps avoid hand fatigue for those who type for long periods. Given the benefits of sound and feel, EPOMAKER newly launched EK68 mechanical keyboard ultimately adopts this favored structure to provide a flexible, softer and quieter experience
  • 【Three Modes of Connectivity: Bluetooth 5.0&2.4GHz&Type-C Cable】Equipped with a 3000mAh large capacity battery, this keyboard supports wireless and wired connections. By the wireless option, either Bluetooth (up to 5.0) or 2.4GHz can be chosen. By the wired mode, a USB-C cable is included for fast and stable transmission. Seamless switching between every device is like a piece of cake
  • 【66 Keys+One Knob 65% Compact Layout】EPOMAKER EK68 custom triple modes mechanical keyboard is designed in a favored compact 65% layout to maximize the function while not waste a minimum of space. Housing 66 keys and one knob, EK68 will surely beyond your expectation with the hot swappable socket and programmable software, amazing RGB backlights.
  • 【Hot Swappable PCB, Compatible with 3Pin/5Pin Switch】EPOMAKER EK68 keyboard is equipped with hot swappable PCB to ensure free replacement or change of switches. You don’t need to solder it. It is compatible with most 3 pin and 5 pin mechanical switches, such as Cherry, Gateron, Otemu, Kailh and other MX switches and its clones. Hot swappable sockets not only extends the lifespan of key switch but also provides more possibilities for DIY lovers
  • 【Cherry Profile Double Shot PBT Keycaps】Despite the functionality, EPOMAKER spares no effort to present its aesthetics with a set of black&gold themed keycaps, made of high quality PBT material via double shot technique. The cherry profile PBT keycaps is durable, oil-resistant and stays true to color even after longtime use.

reviews.review:
Disclaimer: The Epomaker EK68 was sent to me for review. Of course, I will aim to be as objective and fair in the review. I also already own my custom Keychron Q1 which I am happy with so I'm reviewing this out of interest and to help other people thinking of picking it up. Take for that what you will.

I'll put the conclusion up here if you don't want to read through the whole review since it's quite detailed. Hope it helps!
------
Conclusion: Is this a perfect keyboard? Of course not. Parts of it feel a cheap for sure. Anyone can nitpick and criticize for days. But when I think about how much keyboards cost nowadays, it makes me realize that this is really a very good deal. For $130 CAD I get about 70% of my Q1 that cost me $300. Plus it can even be wireless! While I still prefer my Q1, I don't really miss it that much while using this, unlike some other keyboards I've tried where I instantly want to go back. This is especially true with all those gaming keyboards from big brands that easily run $200+ yet feel just awful to type on. Now, alternatively you could build your own custom keyboard to beat this but honestly, I highly doubt you can do it for $130. Basic switches and clone caps alone will set you back like $50-70. And with the custom hobby, you often have to wait months to get your kit in AND have to pay a ton in shipping and customs. This is on Amazon so everything is priced in and has modding options if you want to try. So yes, 5 stars for its value. 4.5 "real" stars because nothing is perfect. If you're someone who's just looking to get into mechanical keyboards, I think this is a very solid starter set. And who knows, the Epomaker EK68 might be enough to scratch that itch and you won't have to look back at this hobby.
------
What You Get: The keyboard itself (see below). A wireless dongle that can be stored on the keyboard itself. A generic braided long USB-C cable. A decent keycap/switch puller combo. A few spare switches. A few extra keycaps in different colors. I ordered Gateron Yellows but was sent Epomaker's Budgerigar's switches. More on that later.

Build Quality: It's plastic. All of it. That's not to say it's good or bad necessarily, I do think it's quite well built and feels sturdy. It's just a little lighter than I expected, especially since the Q1 is made fully out of metal and weighs like 5x more. It's still weighty enough to sit firmly on your desk.
It has kick-flip feet to give it a total of 3 typing angles. Note that if you want to do deep mods beyond keycaps and switch swaps, I don't think it'll be very easy. I don't see any outside screws anywhere.

RGB: The RGB is kinda muted. There's a thick white polycarbonate plate between the PCB and keycaps. The keycaps themselves aren't transparent in any way. Thus, the RGB from the switches is somewhat blocked. You can definitely see it no problem but it won't be a crazy light-show unless you're in the dark. Epomaker does give a ton of RGB effects options and should suit the majority of people unless you're super duper specific about the effects you want.

Wireless/Bluetooth: No problems with the wireless for me. You'll have to read the manual to know the instructions on how to pair via Bluetooth but using the wireless dongle was plug-and-play. Unfortunately, there's no battery-level indicator. With RGB on, I get about 2 days of use without needing to charge. RGB is extremely draining on the battery so it's not too bad IMO. My wireless gaming mouse has a similar thing where RGB on only gets it a day of life but a week without. As such, you can think of 2 days as a worst-case scenario and you should be able to get much, much longer with RGB off. I didn't test it in time for this review however. The EK68 does go into a sleep mode to try and conserve battery every now and then but it didn't give me any issues waking up. Just type. Think of this as a wired keyboard with wireless when you need it in a pinch instead of a truly wireless keyboard. I didn't have any latency issues whatsoever.

Knob: By default, the knob is volume up and down, but you can press it for mute/unmute as well. The knob feel is alright. You can feel each "click" for every step which I like but it doesn't feel as good as my Q1 it's a little mushier in comparison.

Switches: Like I said, I was sent the tactile Budgerigar switches. They're not too bad honestly. Factory lube could be better. I prefer Gateron Yellows since I like linear but these have been pretty decent to type on. And I got my highest ever typing test speed at 131 wpm with these the first time I used it. Coincidence? Probably. But it goes to show that it definitely wasn't slowing me down. The actuation point is a little weighty and is right at the start. Thus, it feels a little bit like a linear since you get past it right away instead of getting halfway before hitting it. It makes me feel kinda confident when I type, like when I press a key it's because I intend to; you won't be accidentally pressing keys with these. I've done a lot of typing and gaming on these and it performed just fine. I like these much better than Cherry and Gateron Browns or whatever other switches you find in generic gaming keyboards at Best Buy.

Typing Feel: I'm not totally sure what the gasket does but it does feel reasonably soft to type on, like I'm not bottoming out hard. I'm using it for like 14 hour days doing work or playing games and I haven't gotten fatigued at all. Unlike my Q1 though, it doesn't flex much at all. That polycarbonate plate is quite thick which contributes to the rigidity I suppose. The feel of each switch is fairly uniform, though the larger switches like the backspace does feel a bit different. My Q1 is softer and nicer to type on but not by that much.

Typing Sound: It's not a clicky keyboard so it's not super loud. It sounds a quite muted if anything, probably because of the full-plastic build and polycarbonate backplate. Don't get this if you want to flex your cool mechanical keyboard noises to your gamer friends over Discord. Out of the box, I think it sounds quite good for stock. It's a mix between clack and thoccy, leaning more on thoccy given its muted nature. I find it pleasant to listen to when doing focused typing in an office. You can see the video for how it sounds. I took it with my phone camera so it isn't the BEST audio quality but gives a general feel for it. Wear headphones to hear some of the bass.

The EPOMAKER EK68 is a remarkable keyboard that truly exceeds expectations. From its sleek design to its exceptional performance, this compact mechanical keyboard offers an outstanding typing experience that will leave you thoroughly impressed.

First and foremost, the build quality of the EK68 is outstanding. The compact 68-key layout strikes the perfect balance between functionality and portability, making it ideal for both work and travel.

The typing experience on the EK68 is simply delightful. With its hot-swappable keys, you have the freedom to customize your keyboard to your liking, choosing from a variety of switches without the need for soldering. The keycaps are made of high-quality PBT material, ensuring long-lasting durability and a comfortable feel while typing. The keyboard's N-key rollover and anti-ghosting features guarantee accurate input, even during intense typing or gaming sessions.

Furthermore, the EK68 is a true wireless wonder. With Bluetooth 5.1 connectivity, you can effortlessly connect it to multiple devices, providing seamless switching between devices and reducing cable clutter. The battery life is impressive, offering hours of uninterrupted usage on a single charge.

In conclusion, the EPOMAKER EK68 is a phenomenal keyboard that combines exceptional build quality, customizable switches, and wireless convenience. Whether you're a professional or a gaming enthusiast, this keyboard will undoubtedly enhance your typing experience. Its compact design, reliable performance, and sleek aesthetics make it a standout choice in the mechanical keyboard market.

Amazing feel, love the sound. The colours are great, don’t notice a lag when using Bluetooth or 2.4ghz. Think good factory lubed, hard to open. Easy to scratch if you use a metal Pry tool. Stabs didn’t have a lot of lube on them, but sound better then my gaming keyboard. Love it for typing then linears, don’t accidentally press anything. Spacebar has Akko lavender purple pro. First mechanical keyboard, happy with my purchase! The switch puller is easy to bend a bit. Looking on TikTok of reviews and different switches helped me decide which ones :)

Imagine getting into the keyboard hobby and thinking how much work you need to put in to make a great custom keyboard. That was me when I began my journey of making my own custom keyboard 2 years ago. Now you don't even have to lube the switches of a prebuilt keyboard because its already good. I recommend buying this keyboard and switching the keycaps or switches to fit your preference .

The Akko 3068B is a 65% keyboard kit. I got the Black & Pink version of the board with Akko CS Jelly Pink switches. I primarily used the 3068B with a PC running Windows 10, but I also confirmed that it works over Bluetooth with my Pixel 3 running Android 12.

The Akko 3068B shipped in a black cardboard box with a pink and black slipcover. The 3068B is pictured on the front of the slipcover, in addition to text specifying the chosen keycap profile and color scheme. There is also a sticker that denotes the hot-swappable nature of the 3068B's printed circuit board (PCB). The Akko logo and Akko's social media links and corporate contact information are provided on the sides of the slipcover. A sticker denoting the selected switch type is also found on the top side of the slipcover. Finally, a diagram of the 3068B identifying the board's shortcut keys is featured on the back of the slipcover.

Inside the box, the keyboard is stored in a polyethylene bag, which is seated inside a foam cutout. The top of the board is covered by a clear plastic cover. Besides the board itself, the package included a user manual, keycap puller, a USB-C to USB-A cable, and a variety of novelty keycaps. The 3068B also includes a selection of additional modifier keycaps in alternative colors and sizes for use with other keyboards. This is a nice touch.

The Akko 3068B has a plastic case with a thick bezel and rounded corners. The case is very heavy for a plastic board. The keyboard has a recessed USB-C port on the left side of the board. The bottom of the board has collapsible plastic feet with rubber caps.

On the opposite side of the back of the Akko 3068B from the USB-C port is a toggle switch for the keyboard's wireless functionality. This switch was not aligned correctly on my unit and required more force and finagling than should be necessary to switch on or off. It also did not lock fully into the "On" position, though the wireless functionality worked perfectly in both the Bluetooth and 2.4 GHz modes. I used the 3068B at my desk 1–1.5 meters from my computer, so I do not have a real sense of the limits of the wireless range. The keyboard does go into a power-saving sleep mode when using the 2.4 GHz or Bluetooth modes and requires a second or two after an initial input to wake up and begin registering keystrokes.

The layout is slightly more horizontally compressed than feels natural to me. I sometimes had an issue reaching for the "Backspace" key and hitting the "Tilda" key instead. I also do not understand why 65% keyboards typically opt to include "Page Up" and "Page Down" as two of the default options in the rightmost column of keys. Thankfully, this can be rebound in the Akko Cloud software. However, I greatly appreciate having dedicated arrow keys.

The keycaps are Doubleshot PBT in Akko's ASA profile. ASA uses roughly the same height as OEM keycaps but with spherical tops. I like this profile a lot, but I think I narrowly prefer Epomaker's slightly lower-profile GSA profile. The outlines of letters and symbols are very sharp, and the keycaps feel both smooth to the touch and robust in terms of build quality.

There are three indicator LEDs on the right bezel. The topmost light identifies the status of CAPS LOCK, and the bottommost light identifies whether the Windows key is locked, but I could not discover what purpose the middle light serves. As with the Akko 3061 I previously reviewed, the RGB lighting, while consistent, is not as bright as on other boards in its price range. These include those from MarvoDIY or even the various SK/GK rebrands I have used. The LEDs are north-facing.

With the Akko CS Jelly Pinks, the Akko 3068B has a deep, thoccy sound profile. The board sounds excellent out of the box, with just a hint of hollowness. That said, it is definitely on the louder side. The 3068B has the best stock stabilizers I have used on any budget board. There is little to no rattle on any of the stabilizers. I did not find it necessary to perform any mods on them, which is a first for any of the review units I've received.

The 3068B uses Akko's Cloud software for key rebindings, macros, and LED lighting customization. I did not use this software during my review period, as I was satisfied with the stock shortcuts. Akko has done a good job of picking stock shortcut keybindings that make intuitive sense on both of the boards I have reviewed from them. It is worth noting that the Escape, Windows, Right Alt, and Function Keys cannot be rebound under any circumstances, and some of the default function shortcuts cannot be remapped. These non-remappable shortcuts primarily control the backlight and wireless functionality of the keyboard. On the other hand, media controls and other miscellaneous shortcuts can be rebound. Also worth noting is that the wireless functionality switch on the back of the keyboard must be switched off to upgrade the keyboard's firmware.

Overall, I like the Akko 3068B a lot and feel very comfortable recommending it as a starter 65% keyboard.

He comprado este teclado para mi hijo y está encantado con el. Dice que el sonido es espectacular y que el manejo es muy cómodo. Soy una mera intermediaria pero os puedo asegurar que él tiene muy buena opinión del teclado y le parece que hemos hecho una muy buena compra, comparando con los teclados que ha utilizado de sus amigos.

I have only a week with it and I like it a lot. My last keyboard (G413 SE) was my first mechanical keyboard experience but with time I started to feel that it was really bad device for its price.

I wanted something "hotswapable" and wireless until I came across this keyboard. I think for a first experience into a mechanical keyboard it is a really good experience. They sound exactly as I watched in dozens of reviews.

Software for these board is as good as the keyboard. I found it pretty rough and uncomfortable to use. You need to save color profiles and rebound key profile separately. Sometimes it does not save or program crashes from time to time.

Flamingo switches are my cup of tee so I am happy with my choice and keycaps are really nice for the price. Really easy to type in. Due to the steel plate there is almost zero flex, so I guess gaskets are only for sound purposes. A shame because there are other brands that have same board reference that includes the PC plate.

Build quality is solid with some minor issues, like around the space bar, where the case warps a bit. Nothing noticeable but if one looks carefully can be spotted easily. There are also some keycaps, specially the yellow one that have some problem with legends but I am nickpicking. Again, for the price the quality is really good.

Overall, I liked the sound, build and typing experience out of the box; for the price it is a solid choice if you do not think to mod the keyboard for a while.

Los switches tactiles están bien, los keycaps parecen de buena calidad y el sonido me gusta.
Tambien me ha gustado mucho el detalle de los dos indicadores luminosos led para indicar el estado de la bateria y la conexión del teclado.
El precio en oferta es muy bueno.

description:
• 【Gaming Keyboard and Mouse】The mouse has 7 different lighting modes and effects. With 3 colors of variable backlight gaming keyboard, press once to change one color, you can also adjust the backlight color according to your preference, when you don't need it, you can easily turn off the backlight by pressing three times in a row.
