It ensures that you never miss a key or confuse a command in any usage scenario. It can give you the ultimate gaming or typing experience.
  • 【Ergonomic Design】 The stepped keycaps make it smoothly tilted to fit your hands easily, and the large bowed dual injection molded ABS keycap design effectively reduces hand fatigue and feels more comfortable. The keyboard's metal construction is extremely durable and stable, weighing in at 0.58kg, and won't move around while you play. No matter how big your hands are, this mouse ensures a perfectly comfortable grip and is ultra-light and silent, Excellent wear resistance.
  • 【Simple and durable】The keyboard and mouse are easy to install and remove, no need to install extra software. It plugs directly into your computer and the keyboard and mouse work immediately. Spill-resistant, durable construction keeps out liquids and dust for easy cleanup. Withstands a variety of environmental factors.
  • 【Customer Service】If you have any quality problems, please contact customer service and we will be happy to help you. We offer 30 days refund or replacement and 12 months warranty for quality issues. Wired keyboard combo is widely compatible with Win 7/Win 8/Win 10/Mac/XP / Vista.

reviews.review: I’m in love

Just got delivered today and unfortunately I will already be processing a return. This keyboard is SO loud. Many times today, I couldn't type while my customers talked. I found it to be very light, sometimes moving around while I worked. The mouse however, I just loved. Will be sad to see it go.

i was really excited about this keyboard when i ordered it, and its been a few months since buying and using. first, there are only 2 modes of the led which im pretty sure the pictures said it had more modes, one mode for just the led to stay on and the other for it to blink. secondly, the brightness doesnt even work. if i want it brighter, no response. if i want it dimmer, also no response. this kinda annoys me as sometimes i like my room dim and i want my desk area to match the vibe. also the numbers/letters are kind of faded so whenever theres a bright light (because im doing homework or something) i cant see the number or letter well. also, the flaps behind the keyboard are really small, so if you dont like having your keyboard flat down on the table, you may not want to purchase this keyboard as it doesnt really do a thing and i have to use my arm rest cushion to hold it up more. i also love to play games a lot, and the left shift of my keyboard cant click well along with some other keys. what i mean by this is that you have to press really hard on the key for it to be able to “activate.” whenever im playing games, i mostly use my pinky to press on the shift button as i have my other fingers on wasd and the space bar. i was also really excited about the mouse, but it looks nothing like the picture. the body part just looked like lighting ( sounds cool but it really isnt, cant provide a pic rn ) or just random lines squiggled. the left and right click part of the mouse also looked nothing like the picture? as i was just lines going down each side. the bottom of the mouse also has no good padding, so it’s very sensitive to a small move. luckily, i was able to turn it down so the sensitivity was how i liked it.
overall, im not happy or disappointed about this set, i just wish it was a little bit better. if you are someone who are big on appearance and the way it works, i wouldnt recommend this keyboard. if you just want an led keyboard with an led mouse then you should have no problem.

They keyboard was very good and is more than what I was expecting.
But the mouse is a little uncomfortable but other then that very good for it's price and is worth it.
And the noise on it was good not much noise and for it's low price they really went above and beyond.
My son absolutely loves this keyboard, the lights are really cool he said.
We love our new light up keyboard. They colors are pretty and it’s just more fun using it than a traditional keyboard.
I would give this 5 stars if I had received the color I actually ordered. Overall it works great and the setup was very easy. Just plug in the usb to the laptop and it instantly works.

name: Keychron K3 Ultra-Slim 75% Layout Wireless Bluetooth/Wired USB Mechanical Keyboard, Hot Swappable Low-Profile Keychron Optical Switch White LED Backlight 84 Keys Keyboard for Mac Windows-Version 2
description:
• Keychron K3, a compact 75% layout 84 keys hot-swappable ultra-slim wireless mechanical keyboard (Exclusive color scheme) built for peak productivity, a great tactile typing experience. Personalize per-key typing experience without soldering, and let you personalize per-key typing experience without soldering.
  • Be ready to multitask without missing a beat by connecting the K3 with up to 3 devices via the stable Bluetooth 5.1 chipset and switch between your laptop, PC, tablet and phone seamlessly. It also has wired mode with USB Type-C connection.
  • With a unique Mac layout, the K3 has all the necessary Mac multimedia keys while still being compatible with Windows. Extra keycaps for both Windows and Mac operating systems are included.
  • The redesigned low-profile Keychron optical red switch is 40% slimmer than conventional switches without sacrificing their typing experience. With the reinforced aluminum body (plastic bottom frame) make the K3 one of the thinnest and lightweight mechanical keyboards on the market.
  • You can easily hot-swap every low-profile optical switch without soldering to customize your typing experience on the K3 (*This keyboard is NOT compatible with any conventional MX style mechanical switch). The pre-installed low-profile optical red switch provides unrivaled linear responsiveness with up to 70 million keystroke lifespan, and it supports NKRO on the wired mode or 6KRO on the wireless mode.

reviews.review:
Ever since I learned about low-profile switches I have been trying to find a keyboard that fits all the things I wanted. There aren't a ton of options out there, but this one hit most of them so I purchased.

I typically have 60% keyboards but could not find one that was at the pricepoint I wanted. I liked the NuPhy Air60 but the price with shipping to Canada was almost 200$. I was nervous this keyboard would be bigger than I like, but happy to report that is it still extremely compact and actually about the same size as my existing AJAZZ K620T.

I originally wanted the Brown switches but I could only choose between Red and Blue at time of purchase. I went with Reds as I wanted it to be as quiet as possible for work. I watched some videos about what these low-profile Gaterons sounded like and from the videos I thought they would be louder, but it is actually extremely quiet and perfect for work. The videos must have put the mic right up to the keyboard. In an office the keys are barely audible. They are linear switches so no clicking, but there is a bit of gradient in the key pressure. I have had some Red's in the past with heavier caps that were a bit too smooth for me, these actually have a very nice key pressure and obviously short travel. There is some resistance and it feels nice.

I can definitely appreciate the updates with the V2 version of this keyboard. I definitely needed to use the legs for incline, very comfortable angle for me. I appreciate the keycaps, they feel nice and solid. I saw reviews from the V1 that said the keycaps feel cheap, these ones feel solid and durable. The shape could maybe be evolved as the rounded key edges sometimes caused me to make typing errors, but they could just be me getting used to new caps. I also appreciate the frame reinforcement, the build feels very solid but also very light. I could imagine it would feel pretty hollow and flimsy.

Overall I am very happy with my purchase and getting used to the switches and caps quickly. I don't really have any negative feedback yet but will update if things change.

Bought this back in early 2022, since then, I've gone through a replacement battery (the seller does provide a warranty FYI), and a few back-n-forth with their tech support through Amazon regarding the Bluetooth stability issue.

The keyboard works great when the rows lit up at least 4 rows (press Fn+B to check battery), anything below that, there's a consistent annoying loss of Bluetooth connection. This happens no matter if you're on Mac or Windows..

The BIG issue is that once the keyboard loses connection, while the "1" key flashes and the keyboard tries to reconnect, the computer thinks you're holding the key down. It's really annoying at work where you may accidentally delete/send/WHATEVER not intentionally. This issue is still there, been there for almost 2 years..

Would I still buy a Keychron keyboard? Yes, because I travel a lot for work, and this lightweight compact keyboard meets my need.
Would I recommend it to my friends? Yes, but only plugged in.
I wish the K3 version 3 could resolve the Bluetooth issue, at least Keychron is aware of it.

I like a low-profile keyboard, having been an iMac user for years before I got in to PC gaming, but they’re not always the most comfortable to game with.

I was struggling to find a keyboard that would be a slimmer profile but that was also nice for PC gaming. This one hits both, plus has the added bonus of being mechanical PLUS the keys are hot-swappable. The brown switches are perfect for me - not too loud when I’m typing away e-mails, but still satisfyingly tactile - and so far when I’ve been gaming, it’s also worked really well.

As for the backlight - it’s not bothersome to me, and if it is, I just turn it off. I don’t believe the one I got does RHB - but I really didn’t care about a backlight when I got this.

I was a bit nervous not having the number pad, but I haven’t missed it so far, and I’ve been using it for nearly a week.

I definitely recommend this keyboard (and brown switches) if you’re someone who wants to take the jump to a mechanical keyboard, but doesn’t want it to be too loud, and is looking for a lower profile style keyboard.
Great build quality, only wish it was angular shaped instead of having feet that occasionally fall down when pushed back

Aside from the poor battery life which is to be expected, it is great. I love how quiet it is.

It is worth noting that the brown switches require very little force to activate, which takes some getting used to.

reviews.review: These are really quiet when using. Have no issues with typing. The only thing is the colour - it’s more of a cream colour than white.

I'm using them right now!

The quiet press keys are nice. They feel good, and have a nice recoil on them. Delete feels too close for some reason. Looking at it, it looks ok. The mouse has a nice feature of picking pointing speeds (DPI changing).

Great price for a decent desktop setup.

This only disappointing thing is the color.
It's more cream than white. Other than that, it's smooth and the connectivity works fine.

Pros: quiet as intended. Nice cream color.
Cons: short cut key - not all of them works for Win11 out of the box. I've yet to try to re-program it to match the icon. Mouse is not as responsive as I thought, maybe I should change a battery to test, I'm pretty sure it's not for gaming.
Overall, fulfill the basic need for a combo and its price.
The keyboard is soft to touch and the mouse works pretty great 👍
Works great so far !
Great Product
Nice keybord for the price!

The multiple conversion features of the calculator is very useful. Keyboard is very quite, but the mouse not so much. Scrolling is not very smooth. Sometimes scrolling down results in a slight pause and then back tracking of a few lines before downward scroll continues. Very annoying when doing quick reviews of large documents. Changing the battery does not fix the problem.

Like another reviewer said the travel on the keys is too much for me- since you have to depress the key a long way to get a response- i.e. key depression too deep. Mouse is great, love the one dongle and so far everything seems well enuf built. It will take some getting used to for the key travel but for the price it is what it is and usable. Don't know about battery life yet.. The keys are quiet, the mouse is quiet as advertised. The sound volume control key up and down and mute don't work in the key board and it is a pain in the arse to have to control it during a video thru the computer.
Let her sleep peacefully

The keyboard is a great value for the price. Mine is in the key of G. I usually type in the key of A but I thought I would try a change. The battery doesn't come with it so be sure to have some on hand. Product works better when it's turned on.
Highly recommend

The keyboard is comfortably quiet and still gives a nice feedback on your finger, the mouse is bigger than I thought it would be, not like a travel mouse at all, very nice, responsive! And the nice red light touch when you click is just a cool aspect of it. Takes one AA battery while keyboard uses AAA.

I've got no bad things to say about this, it's a great buy.

reviews.review: I’ve been using this set for a month I wanted to wait a bit until I review. Let’s start with the UPS the MOUSE PAD is larger than most and I like it like that, the design is very nice colour is nice, a few lose stitches on the sides but that’s fine. The MOUSE, I love this mouse it’s my favourite thing about this set! It’s beautiful moves nicely, changes colours, you can change your DPI it’s way easier to use my knife in games now with the side buttons too, so this mouse is a go go GO for gaming! Now the KEYBOARD.... ahh well it worked really really well for a week or two and than buttons got really sticky and gave out some how, I never eat near it I’ve never spilt anything on it, I never slammed on it, just after a few uses of it, it gave out like my space bar I have press multiple times for it to work as with my 3 key and 5 letter keys. Now what’s cool about it though is that if you press FN and INS at the same time you can change the colour patterns and it makes the clicking noise, but in all I wouldn’t buy this ever again WASTE OF MONEY, I am going to now buy a new keyboard and hope for the best! Also it’s made out of this plastic no metal at all it looks kinda cheap but it feels nice. anyways DONT BUY UNLESS YOU JUSY WANT THE MOUSE AND THE MOUSE PAD THE KEYBOARD SUCKS!!!

The delivery as fast. It’s a great keyboard with awesome color changing options. It’s a little loud to type on. And it took me some time to adjust to where the number keys were located, as I was used to a different style.
But a goood buy.

The mouse was given as a gift to a co-worker. They like it.

Keyboard is amazing ! Works wicked the mouse is pretty cheap worked good for Warzone for about 2 weeks and it ended up to stop working but that's ok cause the keyboard was definitely worth it with the red keys.
The only thing missing with the Keyboard is the number pad on the right side. Everything else about the set is perfect and colorful, and I love the clicky sound from the keyboard. <3

Got the package early the keyboard works great and it’s really cool but the mouse sensor did not work and it flickered but only happened twice then it did not do that again making it un useable other wise I’m satisfied
It's pretty good. This type of keyboard is kinda soothing since it's the type I weaned on.
Great little set up for budget gamer , you can even swap out key switches and customize it a bit , if your into that kind of stuff
Conforme à la description.

Es de buena calidad para el precio y en lo que llevo usándolo no he tenido fallos pero si me gustaría que tuviera más facilidad el instalar el software de los periféricos y que este permita personalizar o hacerle algo al teclado, son cosas sencillas pero que dan puntos, lo otro es que me llegó de una marca diferente a la que anuncian pero no quiere decir que haya sido malo

This set is sooo cute. It really livens up my desk area, and I love how you can change how the lights look, or you can turn them off all together. The mouse is a great shape because this is one of the few mouses that don’t make my pinkie hurt. I actually take this mouse to work lol. The only negative thing I have to say is that this keyboard is VERY LOUD, like I barely want to type on it especially at night time. I’ve had some loud keyboards, but this one is bonkers lol. For $17 I wasn't expecting much. Came with a mouse, keyboard, and mouse pad. Was expecting nothing more than a fancy light show, but I ended up getting performance for use and for looks. Lots of cool effects to play with on the mouse and keyboard, goes better with the pink than I was expecting. As a personal preference, I'm not big on the clickity clackity sound from the keys and the tactile reset, it's much louder than I anticipated based on the description. Hard to argue the value though, I got an amazing deal. If the sounds of the keys ends up bothering me too much, my daughter has already fallen in love with the look and feel and laid her claim to it.
The key board was amazing . It's good and the mouse was light and wired to use but it works
According to my grandson this gaming keyboard is awwweeeesssooommmeeee

reviews.review:
I've had this for about a year now and I've enjoyed it very much, but there are important caveats to be aware of. If I went back in time I would've purchased something a bit different.

The cabinet is actually 23" deep door-to-back. I had to remove the back panel 'cause hardly anything fits in it otherwise. The side panels aren't very secure without the back, but they stay on just fine. It's advertised as a "wall-mount" - it seems rather large for that, but I got it because it was cheaper than other "floor" options. There's no attachment at the bottom for casters. Right now I have furniture risers underneath it, which prevents the sides from noisily shaking when I walk around (again, because I took the back off). The holes at the back aren't large enough to pass a power cable through, but they are big enough to pass a IEC 63020 (computer PSU style) plug through. You can get the reverse of a computer power cable and combine that with a regular power cable to run into a power bar if you're not using a UPS. Although, if you have the back panel off you can easily pass all kinds of wiring through it.

One thing I will say is it's very sturdy. I have a large heavy computer case sitting on top of the cabinet and it doesn't care in the slightest. I have a heavy 4U mount at the very top and it's been there for months.

The last thing to say about it is that it looks cool. I think that's a large part of the reason I got this one in particular. The glass door with the red accent - it looks like the powerhouse that it is.

Most of the network devices in your home come in two versions: an appliance that sits on a table or the floor and a rack mounted version that looks like a pizza box. If you have a router and switch trust me you will end up with a half dozen toaster sized appliances and wires going every which way. It looks awful and is impossible to maintain. Better to go with the pizza boxes mounted with screws in a vertical rack. The cables coming in and out can be zip tied together and labeled so they look neat. Same for power. Find a closet to tuck the whole thing into. The whole package could cost you a thousand bucks but for a couple hundred dollars SysRack will send you a cool looking locking cabinet with a glass door and blinking lights. Just like in the movies. Assembly is easy and best of all no more rat’s nest of phone lines, CATV cables, and Ethernet cables. You will keep it for years and when you move you just pick up the whole thing and take it with you so your streaming channels, online games and home automation thingies work just like before. Quality Canadian manufacturer, reliable service,
and affordable future-proofing. Don’t be intimidated by networking jargon. Jump into your digital future with both feet. This cabinet is the best tech investment you can make.
This cabinet is very sturdy extremely well-built looks great. Easy to assemble comes with all hardware.
I like the colors and how easy it is to remove the sides to get full access. Only thing I didn't like is the knock outs to feed cables in. I wish they just had the hole and supplied edge protection.

The front door doesn't align properly. Too much of a gap at the top. Have to lift the door to open and close. Also, as others have stated the lack of cable port in rear of cabinet and misalignment of screw holes.

Good wall mount network cabinet for the price. Delivered by Fedex in a well packed cardboard box with foam bumpers on all sides. That’s probably why all parts in the box were intact and in perfect shape. Assembly took no longer than 30 minutes and was really simple. I read other reviews about the hole lining up issue, but everything seemed to fit fine. It should just slip right into place and all holes line up perfectly. Otherwise, you’ll have to drill other holes like other reviewers say. The screws went in and tightened completely fine. Overall, the cabinet is sturdy enough for what I’m using and I’d recommend it to anyone who’s looking for a not expensive functional network cabinet. And yes... LOOKS FIRE too!

reviews.review:

  • EASY TO CARRY - With rubber carrying handle, You will be able to carry your PC tower and the accessories easily by single hand instead of using both hands to hug the PC case, and get a lot easier to put it into your car. Perfect desktop carrying case for your PC chassis when going on holiday, business trip, travel, office.

reviews.review: Unfortunately, the handle on the top of the harness did not reach to the other side of my case so I had to goto a special sewing store to increase the length of the handle to make it fit my case. I see now that this is the smaller harness. On Amazon.com, there are 2 options, a small harness and large harness. I recommend people buy the large harness. Amazon.ca or the seller should add the option to select the large harness. But I was able to successfully alter the harness for $20 extra and now it's perfect :)

Bought to transport an NZXT 510i case on the plane. Bit of a snug fit but I felt more secure knowing it's tight. With nothing else but the mouse pads and a few cables, it fit comfortably in the overhead compartment in an airplane.

Would recommend for anyone thinking of transporting their desktop as a carry-on but be sure to check desktop dimensions beforehand.
Doesn't for my lian Li mini (although it's bigger than most minis)

I really like it. My desktop is quite expensive...and I used to carry it around without this contraption, up and down 2 flights of stairs. Whenever I strap this brace on the PC, I ALWAYS feel anxious because it seems like it's not strong enough to carry 25, or so, pounds. Still, every time I use it, it works just fine and the handle always stays intact!

I don't know if I would travel with this brace outside of my house, though. I could easily see myself walking through a crowd of people, at the airport, and somebody bumping into it and causing something to break or be damaged. After all, the case is totally exposed. Dents and scratches are to be expected, if you're not careful.
One thing that I do feel is disappointing, about the strap, are the carrying pockets. They're just not big enough for me to carry valuable items, alongside the PC, and feel comfortable that those items won't fall out - and some have. Luckily, no damage has ever come to a mouse or game controller that fell out.
The pockets could easily be made larger and more secure. An average-sized keyboard looks sketchy on the side of the brace because its form-factor is so tall that it will tilt a little bit. It'll probably never fall over, but it's just another concern that I have.
It's not worth it to carry important things inside those little pockets unless those things are small enough to be inconveniences (like a usb drive or a mouse pad).

Regardless, the brace does its job VERY well and it enables me to travel with my desktop, more often than I should. As long as you clip it right and strap the velcro properly, your desktop will be safe in your hands.
Ease to use. Stable

I bought this to fit on a Dell Inspiron 3650. I am very well pleased with the product quality, but I was a bit misled regard whether it would fit my computer. The description says it fits cases "2 to 9 inches wide" and "11.5 to 18 inches tall".

My Dell 3650 is about 14" tall and 5" wide, so it should've fit nicely. However, it did not. The velcro (or magic, as the description states) straps are too long to wrap around my computer and still fasten.

The product is great quality and appears durable, but the description was very misleading for me, and now, I have a product that is not going to work as well as it should have.

Use this for a mobile gaming lab with custom built PCs. The pockets make the entire computer be self contained and can hold power cables, headsets, mice, keyboards, and mice pads. Straps adjust to fit device. Handles make transporting two a doable endurance workout or can get a monitor case to transport the whole setup in one go.

Ordered 3 pcs, one had faulty buckle which opened immediately under slight pressure, sadly this made it unusable. Other two were fine. Suggest you pay attention to the size, as it is way too small for larger cases.

name: Corsair 4000D Airflow Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case - Black, CC-9011200-WW
description:
• Combining innovative cable management, concentrated airflow, and proven CORSAIR build quality, the 4000D is a fitting choice for an immaculate high-performance PC.
  • The CORSAIR RapidRoute cable management system makes it simple and fast to route your major cables through a single channel, with a roomy 25mm of space behind the motherboard for all of your cables.
  • Includes two CORSAIR 120mm AirGuide fans, utilizing anti-vortex vanes to concentrate airflow and enhance cooling.
  • A spacious interior fits up to 6x 120mm or 4x 140mm cooling fans, along with multiple radiators including 360mm in front and 280mm in the roof (dependent on RAM height).
  • Put modern connections within easy reach with a front I/O panel including a USB 3.1 Type-C Port, USB 3.0 port, and a combination audio/microphone jack.

reviews.review:
TL;DR: top power button and USB ports are defective *on my unit* while the restart button functions, but it's still a fantastic case; I just hate the glass and the distractingly annoying RGB lights that must be on at all times. I like the cable management, that was well thought-out!

Oh, what a saga. New-ish AAA game titles (specifically for me "Tiny Tina's Wonderlands" ) are now requiring a MINIMUM of 8gb of VRAM, so I decide to get a new card with ray tracing (which is a waste because "Portal RTX" is only for freaking expensive Nvidia cards, not cheaper AMDs).

It arrives, but is too long for my original case because, you know, MEASURING IS A GOOD THING that is easily forgotten in the throes of "ooh new, modern and shiny!" shopping sprees.

After some research, reading and watching reviews, I decide on this case.

Three days of struggling, swearing and constant insert/remove video card due to troubleshooting later, my husband and I find out that my tower is defective. The top power button and USB ports don't work, but the restart button does.

My husband tried the power switch from an old case he had, and that one worked, so yes, there is a defect. Oh well, at least my system turns on and works nicely now with new large-capacity SSDs and a faster, better video card in a well-ventilated case.

Corsair is back at it again with one of their best cases yet!

The Corsair 4000D Airflow is an exceptional mid-tower case that has impressed me with its superb design, outstanding cooling capabilities, and overall performance. Corsair has once again proven why they are a leader in the PC hardware industry, delivering a product that satisfies both enthusiasts and casual users alike.

The 4000D Airflow has exceptional cooling performance. The case comes equipped with two pre-installed 120mm fans in the front. The generous mesh front panel design allows for excellent intake airflow, while the ample space for additional fans and radiators enables customization to suit your specific cooling needs. The case also provides convenient dust filters, making maintenance a breeze.

The interior design of the 4000D Airflow is well thought out, providing a spacious and versatile layout for easy installation and cable management. The removable PSU shroud and dedicated cable routing channels ensure a clean and clutter-free build. The tool-free drive trays are a welcome addition, allowing for hassle-free installation of storage drives. Additionally, the case provides ample room for large GPUs and CPU coolers, making it compatible with high-performance components.

In conclusion, the Corsair 4000D Airflow is a stellar mid-tower case that ticks all the right boxes. Its sleek design, outstanding cooling capabilities, spacious interior, and convenient features make it a top contender in its class. Whether you're a PC enthusiast or a casual user, this case offers an exceptional balance between style, performance, and functionality. If you're looking for a reliable and visually appealing case to house your next build, the Corsair 4000D Airflow should be at the top of your list.

I liked building two computers using this white case. There are a lot of features packed into this compact case, which would also make it a good choice for someone building a computer for the first time. My main complaint is the panel that covers where the cables go around to the back almost always has to slide to the second position. I had to do this both times because there was no other way that my 24-pin cable could fit through the gap at such a sharp angle. Now the cables in the back are visible. Another thing to consider is that if you're using PSU cable extensions, a non-modular PSU, and RGB controllers, then that HDD bay probably won't fit. Quality is quite good overall. The only place where it falls short is the bracket that holds the three fans on the side is a bit flimsy. Anyways, bought twice and happy with it both times. Comes with plenty of screws, zip ties, and two 3-pin fans.
Real nice case for an affordable price. Good RGB Corsair controller included with RGB fans. Nice cable management. A bit on the flimsy side but definitely usable. Super quiet fans as well !

Nice looking case and fits an ATX board perfectly, it was my first pc build and i wasnt too stressed figuring this case out, comes with the cables on the back already organized and managed. Temps only reach 68c with an overclock to 5ghz and with the 3060 running the case doesnt really get that loud at all, when idle its really hard to hear it, i can only slightly hear the sound of my AIO.
Definitly can reccomend this case, Not sure if it can fit 40 series cards though like the 4090 but it fits my MSI 3060 Gaming x gpu, i also built a second pc and it was easy to install a micro atx aswell.
The only con id say is the fact there is only 1 usb port at the front but that doesnt bother me since my rear IO has like 8 ports and my keyboard has USB passthrough.
I recomend buying the one with the fans, the one without rgb fans isnt really my favourite since its only controlled via voltage since it is only a 3 pin. Also they could make more room to more comfortably install a commander core XT but i managed to stuff it in there at the back.

This case was really good. It was shipped nicely, and packaged well.
However, on the metal side pannel there was a very noticable scuff going diagonally up the botton corner, luckily for me, I have that side against the wall.

I dont have any pictures of this tower but i built a gaming pc for my brother and when it is paired with
Corsair H100x RGB Elite Liquid CPU Cooler
Corsair Force Series Gen.4 PCIe MP600 1TB
Corsair Vengeance LPX 32GB (2 X 16GB) DDR4 3600
ASUS TUF Gaming H670-PRO WiFi D4 LGA 1700 (or similiar motherboards)
Intel Core i7-12700K Desktop Processor 12
CORSAIR RM Series (2021), RM750, 750 Watt, 80 Plus

you can play fortnite, gta5 (at mid graphics settings) and many other games without a graphics card so when you add a gpu
it will unleash ALOT more potential my brother and i are very pleased so far and i still think he is running without a gpu
Super

Après plusieurs mois d'utilisation, je suis vraiment impressionné par le boîtier CORSAIR. Voici ce que j'en pense en quelques points:

----------- Design & Finitions :----------------
Le boîtier offre une esthétique sobre et orientée Gamer, notamment avec le verre trempé qui permet d'exposer les composants internes du PC. C'est sans doute l'une des raisons principales pour lesquelles j'ai choisi ce modèle. Aussi il y a une version avec vitre avant ou avec grille, celle avec une grille a un meilleur airflow, mais j'ai investi sur un bon kit de refroidissement et j'ai pris le boitier avec une vitre avant car il est plus esthétique pour moi.

------------- Éclairage RGB: ---------------
Le système d'éclairage iCUE de CORSAIR ne déçoit jamais! J'ai pu personnaliser l'éclairage selon mes besoins et il est très facile à utiliser, et il se marie parfaitement avec le reste de mon setup.

---------------Air Flow:-------------
J'utilise plusieurs ventilateurs et le boîtier est conçu pour permettre une circulation d'air optimale. Même pendant les sessions de jeu gourmandes, ce qui est un gros plus pour moi.

--------------Espace & Modularité:-----------------------
Bien que qualifié de "moyen tour", le 4000X offre suffisamment d'espace pour tous mes composants, et j'apprécie vraiment sa modularité qui m'a permis de gérer facilement le cable management.

------------Facilité d'installation: ---------------
Le montage a été un jeu d'enfant. Tous les emplacements sont clairement identifiés et accessibles.

Cependant, rien n'est parfait. J'aurais aimé avoir peut-être quelques passages de câbles supplémentaires ou des options de personnalisation (quelques câbles restes bien visibles sur les photos), mais ce sont des détails mineurs au vu de la qualité générale de ce boîtier.

---------------Conclusion :------------------
Je recommande vivement le CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB à quiconque cherche un boîtier PC alliant esthétique, performance et qualité de construction. Je recommande vivement !

I recently upgraded my PC case to the CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB, and I must say, it's been a fantastic addition to my setup. Here's my unbiased review of this product.

Pros:

Stunning RGB Lighting: The RGB lighting on this case is a showstopper. The three included SP120 RGB Elite fans illuminate your PC with vibrant, customizable colors. The iCUE software allows you to sync the lighting with other Corsair peripherals, creating a visually cohesive gaming or work environment.

Excellent Build Quality: The case feels solid and well-constructed. The tempered glass side panel provides a clear view of your components, and it's easy to remove for maintenance or upgrades.

Great Cable Management: Corsair has designed this case with cable management in mind. There are plenty of cable routing channels and tie-down points, helping you achieve a clean and organized interior.

Airflow: Despite the emphasis on aesthetics, Corsair hasn't compromised on airflow. The front panel has a mesh design that allows for adequate ventilation, keeping your components cool even during demanding tasks.

Spacious Interior: The 4000X offers ample space for ATX motherboards and high-end GPUs. It also supports multiple storage options, including SSD trays and HDD cages.

Easy Installation: Installing components in this case is a breeze, thanks to the well-thought-out layout. The tool-free drive bays and PCIe slot covers make the build process smoother.

Cons:

Price: While the features and quality are top-notch, the price point may be a bit high for some users. However, considering the included RGB fans and overall build quality, it's a reasonable investment for enthusiasts.

Limited Radiator Support: If you plan on using a large liquid cooling setup, the radiator support might be a bit limited, especially at the front. You'll need to ensure that your chosen components fit within the case's dimensions.

In summary, the CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case is an outstanding choice for gamers and PC enthusiasts who prioritize aesthetics without sacrificing functionality. It offers a stunning RGB lighting experience, excellent build quality, and efficient cable management. While it comes at a premium price, it's a worthwhile investment for anyone looking to showcase their PC components in style.

Je suis absolument ravi de partager mon expérience avec le boîtier PC de chez Corsair. Dès le déballage, j'ai été séduit par son design moderne et élégant. Avec ses ventilateurs avant RGB qui illuminent subtilement mon espace de jeu, il ajoute une touche esthétique incomparable à ma configuration. Mais ce n'est pas que de l'apparence ! Ce boîtier offre une expérience d'installation et de gestion de câbles exceptionnelle.

L'un des points forts incontestables de ce boîtier est sa facilité d'installation des composants. Les emplacements parfaitement conçus permettent de monter les cartes graphiques, les disques durs et les alimentations sans aucun tracas. Même pour quelqu'un comme moi, qui n'est pas un expert en assemblage de PC, l'expérience a été fluide et sans embûches.

La gestion des câbles est un autre aspect remarquable. Grâce aux passages intelligemment placés, j'ai pu dissimuler habilement tous les câbles disgracieux, offrant ainsi un aspect soigné et bien organisé à l'intérieur du boîtier. Cette fonctionnalité s'est avérée essentielle pour maintenir une circulation d'air optimale et garder mon système au frais pendant de longues sessions de jeu intenses.

Les vitres latérales et en façade ajoutent une touche de transparence qui met en valeur l'ensemble de ma configuration. C'est un plaisir de pouvoir admirer mes composants et de montrer fièrement mon travail d'assemblage. Corsair a vraiment pensé à tout pour offrir aux utilisateurs un spectacle visuel incroyable, à l'intérieur comme à l'extérieur du boîtier.

Mais ce n'est pas seulement une question d'apparence. La qualité de construction du boîtier est exceptionnelle. Les matériaux robustes utilisés inspirent confiance et je sais que mes composants sont entre de bonnes mains. Le boîtier offre également une excellente isolation phonique, ce qui réduit considérablement le bruit de fonctionnement de mes composants, offrant ainsi une expérience de jeu plus immersive et agréable.

En résumé, le boîtier PC Corsair avec RGB et vitres latérales est un véritable bijou de technologie et de style. Il allie parfaitement le design moderne avec des fonctionnalités pratiques, comme une installation facile des composants et une gestion de câbles ingénieuse. Les vitres ajoutent une touche visuelle impressionnante, tandis que la qualité de construction assure une durabilité à toute épreuve. Si vous cherchez à donner un coup de boost à votre setup gaming tout en restant fidèle à la qualité, ce boîtier est un choix incontournable. Corsair a vraiment frappé fort avec ce modèle, et je ne peux que le recommander à tous les passionnés de PC qui veulent un boîtier à la hauteur de leurs attentes les plus élevées.

J'ai déjà monté plusieurs PC avec des boîtiers différents et j'ai été très surpris par la simplicité de celui-ci :
1/ Il est beau : Le mélange blanc et gris est nickel
2/ Il est très grand : J'ai monté un Ryzen 7 7800x3D avec un gros ventirad et la carte graphique est une Radeon 7900 XTX (la plus grande d'AMD) et j'ai largement eu la place.
3/ La "cable management" est très simple grâce à des passage très simple et des scratchs déjà monté.
4/ Nettoyage du PC facile grâce à des filtres en face avant, sur le dessus et en dessous.

Si vous aimez le look du boîtier et que vous montez votre 1er PC achetez les yeux fermés !!!

I had a prebuilt I bought a long time ago that I basically have upgraded into a new PC over the years. The only thing I haven't replaced is the case by this point. My old case wasn't awful, but it began to fall apart, and I always wanted a white PC case so I decided to give in and get this one! I don't regret it at all so far. It was really easy to set up, and the cable management is way better than other cases I have worked with (I have worked on a few PC's for my brother and friends as well). I also love how this case is a mid sized tower, but somehow has so much room? I found it much easier to work with compared to my old case, which was a large sized tower. Everything is really easy to remove and put back together, and it came with extra zip ties, velcro strips, and screws for fans and screwing in the motherboard, which is super nice. The only thing that I noticed was it doesn't fit a 140mm fan at the back of the case, which is what I had in my old case (this is user error, I didn't double check this. Just wanted to mention in case anyone might be unaware too). But the case came with two simple black 120 mm fans so I just used one of those no problem. It looks great and I am super happy with it!

name: NZXT H5 Flow Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case – High Airflow Perforated Front Panel – Tempered Glass Side Panel – Cable Management – 2 x 120mm Fans Included – 280mm Radiator Support – Black
description:
• HIGH-PERFORMANCE AIRFLOW: Perforated front and top panels direct filtered air through the case to cool down components and enhance performance.
  • DEDICATED GPU FAN: An angled 120mm fan draws air from below the case to provide direct cooling for your power-hungry graphics card.
  • SPACIOUS COOLING SUPPORT: Up to 280mm radiator support in the front, 240mm up top, and 120mm in the rear. Comes with two pre-installed 120mm fans.
  • READY FOR PERFORMANCE: Fits most NVIDIA GeForce RTX 40 Series graphics cards with its 365mm max GPU clearance. Display your GPU vertically using the NZXT Vertical GPU Mounting Kit (sold separately).
  • EASILY MANAGE CABLES: Wide cable channels with hooks, bridges, and straps take the guesswork out of organized cable management.

reviews.review:
This tower is everything that I hoped for. It provides for a massive amount of air flow and allows for a ton of installation possibilities with multiple mounting points and a clean, open frame. The tower is extremely well made and represents a significant value when compared to many other options out there.

This brand has earned a new customer in me for future builds.

The airflow in this case is amazing as well as how great it looks in general. Super easy to intall everything but if you don’t like to cable manage, and prefer to throw everything in the bottom where the psu is, there is not a lot of room due to the toilet bowl fan.
I’ve also never seen my rtx 4070 reach above 65 degrees while under load so I assume that the bottom fan is working.
Perfect, very easy to assemble.

Un boitier beau et bien conçu!
Super rapport qualité-prix

The glass panel is kinda hard to put back, it would be way better if the psu also has some mesh holes on top instead of it just being flat. Definitely a worth it case for airflow, should definitely get this especially if its on sale.

I built a system with an i7-13700K and an RX 6900XT. Everything is kept cool with an extra couple of 120mm RGB fans and a Deepcool LT520 85.85 liquid CPU cooler. Nothing overheats when cranking Cyberpunk 2077 in 4k ultra.

Installing components wasn't too tight if you follow a logical setup. I'm 100% happy with this purchase.
Would be nice if more fans would be included (has room for 6, but comes with 2). Otherwise, no real issues - like it so far.

I just moved my build into this case. It hides cables very well. I have yet to test the neat bottom fan but it does push cool air into the case fairly well I would say. The tempered glass window is a tad dark for my liking, might add some rgb. Thats why minus a star. Otherwise a great case for a simple air cooled build.

The NZXT H5 Flow Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case is a remarkable choice for gamers and PC enthusiasts who prioritize efficient cooling and stylish aesthetics. With its exceptional airflow design, versatile features, and sleek appearance, this case has truly exceeded my expectations. Here's why I highly recommend the NZXT H5 Flow Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case:

Optimal Airflow and Cooling: The H5 Flow case is specifically engineered to provide superior airflow and cooling performance. Its innovative design includes a front panel with large ventilation holes, allowing ample intake of fresh air. The pre-installed three 120mm fans ensure efficient airflow throughout the case, while additional fan mounts and radiator support offer customization options to suit individual cooling requirements. This meticulous airflow optimization keeps the components cool, even during intense gaming sessions.

Thoughtful Cable Management: NZXT has incorporated smart cable management features into the H5 Flow case, allowing for a clean and clutter-free build. The strategically placed cable routing channels and ample tie-down points make it effortless to route and hide cables, ensuring an organized interior. This not only enhances the overall aesthetics of the system but also promotes better airflow by reducing obstructions.

Easy Installation and Accessibility: The H5 Flow case offers a hassle-free installation experience. The tool-less drive installation system simplifies the process, allowing for quick and effortless installation of storage drives. The inclusion of removable filters for easy cleaning and accessibility to all major components adds to the convenience factor. Additionally, the spacious interior provides ample room for future upgrades and expansion, accommodating high-end components without compromise.

Stunning Aesthetics: NZXT's commitment to sleek design is evident in the H5 Flow case. The clean lines, minimalist exterior, and tempered glass side panel combine to create an elegant and modern look. The inclusion of addressable RGB lighting accents on the front panel adds a touch of personalization, allowing users to customize the lighting effects to match their setup. This case is a visual delight that will undoubtedly enhance the overall appeal of any gaming rig.

Durability and Build Quality: The H5 Flow case is constructed with high-quality materials, ensuring durability and longevity. The steel frame provides robust support and rigidity, while the tempered glass panel adds a touch of sophistication. The attention to detail in the manufacturing process is evident, resulting in a solidly built case that can withstand the rigors of frequent use and transport.

In conclusion, the NZXT H5 Flow Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case is a top-tier choice for gamers and PC enthusiasts looking for a blend of exceptional cooling performance, user-friendly features, and stunning aesthetics. With its outstanding airflow design, easy installation, and durable build quality, this case offers a seamless and enjoyable building experience. Whether you're a hardcore gamer or a casual user, the H5 Flow case delivers on both functionality and style, making it an excellent investment for any PC enthusiast.

タイトル通り、付属の2つのファンは３ピン回転制御無しタイプです。
常に最高回転数で回るので音が気になります。
価格的に中級クラスのケースなのでPWM制御のファンを搭載して欲しいです。
昨今のミドルタワーとしては少々気になる部分が有ります。
ここ数年で発売されているミドルタワーケースは廉価版でも360mm簡易水冷が装備出来ますが、このケースは装着不可です。
また、天上のファン取り付け数も120mmが2個でフロントが最大で140mmが2個までです。
簡易水冷はフロント280mmまで（これもギリギリで天井FANはフロント側ロープロでギリギリ）
天井240mmまでです。
FANを統一したかったのですが、手持ちのロープロFANが1個しか無かったので画像の様になってしまいました。
NZXTのKRAKEN280フロント装着です。少し見づらいですが、ラジエーターのホース部分がフロントFANギリギリなのでロープロで逃がしてギリギリです。
グラボが省スペースならラジエーターを反転させれば取り付け可能だと思います。
画像のグラボはRX7700TXで長さが328mmです。昨今のハイエンドモデル（330mm位まで）なら
フロントにラジエーターを取り付けても使用可能だと思います。

少々ネガティブな事を書きましたが、良い点も有ります。
①カッコイイ。
スモークサイドガラスでギラギラ光らせても下品に見えない。
②とにかく冷える。
フロントの大きな開口部でラジエーターの冷却を妨げないし、フロント吸気のFANを取り付けた場合でも
風の抜けがいい。
底面FANがグラボに向いているので直接風が当たるので冷却効果バツグン。
③配線の取り回しが楽。
大きなサービスホールが多いので配線の自由度が非常に高い。
裏も奥行きが大きめなので配線をまとめやすい。

ある程度制限がありますが、工夫次第でとても冷えるケースです。
初めての自作PCには向かないと思いますが、ミドルタワーケースとしての性能はピカイチだと思います。

Un gabinete muy practico en cuanto a gestion de cables tiene muuy buen espacio para acomodarlos, con el añadido de que ya hay algunas cintas de velcro ubicadas de tal manera que la guia y gestion de los cables sea mas facil, el ventilador a 45° en la parte baja ayuda muchisimo a mantener buenas temperaturas para el gabinete y en especial la GPU. Yo cambie el ventilador incluido por uno de mayor potencia y bueno que les digo. Recomiendo con creces el gabinete.

Auto losing a star due to this case being $100 and only comes with the back fan and the bottom fan. NO FRONT FANS AT ALL. Now i still bought this due to myself usually changing all the stock fans regardless on a new build. But take that into your cost considerations. You could probably buy a case in the $120-$140 range that actually comes with fans and spend the same. This case is probably a better buy around $80 or less if you catch a sale.

OKAY ACTUAL REVIEW TIME.

First things first. Before you buy this case you need to measure your parts you plan to put in the thing. Obviously from the picture i provided my 6900xt BARELY fit. Also limited me to top mount on the CPU radiator. But that is because i out a big boy in there. This case is 240mm ONLY! If they would have designed the top of the case just a SMALL fraction wider i may have been able to get a 280mm AIO up there. You could get a 280mm in the front panel if you have a smaller card and put the fans on the front side of the metal panel. At the end of the day this is a compact PC case so no lost love on these comments.

The front panel is easy to take off and allows good airflow so far. The little mesh filter that comes with it is a little flimsy but i truly could care less. If it fails or gets bad i’ll just cut a new mesh piece to replace it. LOVE the removable mount at front for the fans. Was able to install the fans OUTSIDE of the case and then pop it right in. Made the install so much simpler. The GPU bottom fan is unique and stands apart from any other case right now. I feel like it fits well with the case and serves a noble purpose keeping my 6900 xt cooler. The angle it gets actually hits my GPU’s exhaust coil perfect. But take note that it limited any extra room at the bottom for hard drives or long PSU’s. They did put a small mount for two right behind the motherboard if you need them. The mount comes off the case and it is easy to install the drives. I just use M.2 so i have no use. Decided to place my fan hub there Instead!

Air flow so far has not been an issue and i’m keeping steady on all my parts getting a nice breeze. I put 2 140mm Arctic front fans and 1 Arctic 120mm on the back exhaust. They are SILENT but this case also does okay at keeping any other noise suppressed.

NZXT is king at cable management and i really like the orientation of where to throw my cables. They give you a lot of different ways to work. Very large cut out at the top for the motherboard/fan/whatever cables that needs to go at the top. Makes working in it very easy. And this case did everyone a favor by putting all front panel cables into just ONE plug in. No more using a magnifying glass to see where the power switch and what not go on the motherboard!

Overall a 4/5 case. I think it is better suited being a little cheaper sell point because of lack of fans. But if you’re going to upgrade the fans anyways (like me) then it is still a great buy. I’m not mad i bought the case. I’d even consider buying it again for a new build one day.

It was easy to set up and has decent built-in cable guides on the back side to keep things relatively organized. It did not come with enough screws to properly mount the motherboard though. I got four though, I've seen others report getting 5 or 6.
The side panel locking thumbscrews are not aligned quite right and came crossthreaded, but it was an easy job to get them loose and attached 'correctly'. Definitely not the worst flaws one can encounter for a relatively cheap case.

name: GAMDIAS Apollo E2 Elite Gaming Case Mid Tower ATX 2 x 200mm ARGB Fan Trapezoidal Tempered Glass Panel with Tool Free Installation Tempered Glass Window (Apollo E2 Elite) Black
description:
• Extremely Spacious Room For Your System:Supports up to 360mm/240mm/120 liquid cooling radiator on the front and top, up to 120mm of 6 fans and 350mm long graphics card, high CPU cooler up to 168 mm, additional 2.5" SSD trays at the back panel, and easy-access dust filters at the top
  • Excellent Air Flow for Low Temperature: The Mid Tower ATX PC Case is allowed to upgrade for Top: 2 x 120mm, 2 x 140mm computer case fans; Front: 3 x 120mm, 2 x 140mm; Rear: 1 x 120mm for outstanding ventilation. With AIO coolers up to 360mm for the front and top, it's the best gaming case to keep your PC temperature low
  • Innovative and Extraordinary Design: Gamdias Mid Tower Case with innovative front RGB lighting panel with mixed glossy and matte black design brings the gaming PC chassis market a different and elegant design choice and makes your system builds astonishing
  • Great Expandability for Your System Config.: With 2 x 3.5” HDD bays or 2 x 2.5” HDD Cages/ 2x 2.5" Tray, USB3.0 x1, USB2.0 x2, and the LED button, the desktop pc case gives DIY builders ultimate flexibility to personalize their PC. Furthermore, it supports different mobo from EATX, ATX, Micro-ATX, Mini-ITX . 7 expansion slots allow you to fully utilize your motherboard’s expandability
  • Clean Design for Component Assembly: With the PSU Shroud Design and the Magnetic Dust Filter, the computer case doesn't only give a clean look for your systems but also makes the cable management easy and hassle-free

reviews.review:
Purchased the GAMDIAS Apollo E2 Elite for a Intel Core i5-12600k system that I just built paired with a
Thermalright PS120SE ARGB CPU Air Cooler.

Build quality: Honestly didn't have many complaints the case includes a tempered glass front panel and a tempered glass side panel that is on a removable door hinge and includes magnets to keep it closed. The quality of the hinge seems to be really good and its easy to remove and easy to open / close. The metal the chassis is made out of didn't have any noticeable sharp edges which was really nice.

Hard drive cage: The hard-drive cage is probably the only negative thing about the chassis, it is screwed into the case from the underside of the case which can make removing it / installing it a bit of a nuisance but overall its not a dealbreaker just something worth noting. Since I used a WD SN770 2TB Black NVME SSD I removed the hard-drive cage completely to free up space for all the cables from the non-modular PSU that I used. With the hard-drive cage installed it can make bundling up your excessive PSU cables a bit of a pain but it is manageable and possible if you decide to leave it in.

200MM Intake Fans: The included 200MM Intake fans are really nice and don't seem to make too much audible noise and I am really happy with them, the case also includes a LED button on the front panel that lets you change the colours as well as disable the ARGB LEDS altogether if you're not a fan of bright LEDS

Overall Impressions: For the price of the chassis I will probably end up using it with more builds in the future as I was really impressed with it. Large 200MM Intake fans and an overall really nice quality built chassis! If you found this review helpful check out my YT Neils Tech I hope to be posting more in 2024!

Thanks for reading!

the case seems pretty sturdy and well made for the price that it is my only gripe with it is that the rgb in the front fans cuts in and out could be some user error but im not leaning on it over all it is a good budget friendly mid tower that has lots of room to work in and lots of room to configure the fans or rads as needed only thing i would add is maybe front panel usb-c

I assembled my new PC using this case it's quite spacious and the LED fans are very bright and colourful and are easily controlled by the argb ports on the motherboard. The speed of the 2 fans in the front cannot be controlled by the motherboard (they are always on at whatever speed), but the speed of the rear case fan can be controlled via the motherboard. Fairly easy to cable manage in the case. The HDD cage cannot be removed in the bottom of the case. After I assembled my PC I peeled the plastic film off the glass panel on the front and noticed a small bubble in the glass from when the piece was made and small chip in the corner of the glass. After I assembled I didnt want to disassemble to return the case, so I decided to live with it, so check everything out on the case before you begin.

**UPDATE**
I reached out to the company about the chip on the bezel and they shipped me a new one within the week. GAMDIAS does stand behind their product. A quick tip do not use their site for reporting warranty issues go to their discord channel. They monitor that more frequently and are more responsive. I'm raising their rating to 4 because of the support I received. I can't give them a 5 because if the initial issue, but they did fix the problem in short order.

The fans does have a 5v 3 pin connector but upon connecting it to the motherboard it doesn't light up or change color with the motherboard. The case was banged up a bit the metal from the panel where the glass is was bent up but nothing to severe I easily bent it back down with a hammer and cloth to protect from scratches. There isn't that much room for the PSU, if you're getting a fully modular PSU you might have space problems, I fixed it by taking the HDD holder out since I'm using an SSD and an m.2 overall solid build

Good case with a lot of space , can accept a 360mm Rad in the front and I believe that a 240mm could fit on the top and NOTE THAT 140mm fit on TOP and also at the REAR EXHAUST FAN which is interesting , for me I added a old blue 120mm in the back and a 140mm on the top to exhaust at maximum the air of my FX 8350 that is getting very hot in gaming

Cons : RGB buttons to change Colors but it’s not a match for someone that want to have the same same color as interior RGB fan or Aio or Ram but it’s a nice cheap and affordable case for a cheap upgrade from older case with bad air flow or a simple build

Don't get me wrong, it's not bad. It looks great, it has a PSU shroud, 3 included fan, 2 of them being massive 240mm fans, included RGB controller button, tempered glass side panel, and there's a fair amount of room inside. My complaint is the metal quality, which is fairly thin, the cable management space in the back could be better, and I wished there would've been rubber grommets to hide the cable holes. Overall, it's a good case, especially if you can get it below 80$. But for the price I paid (110$ CAD) I wished I could've had a bit more. It's the same price I paid for my Inwin 303, which is a much more durable and well-made case in my opinion.

It's my first time trying GAMDIAS products. I wouldn't say I'm impressed, but I would consider them if their prices were a bit lower for Canada. Other than that, fairly good case, and it looks wonderful
Très bon boitier!
bien content de mon achat
just a little bit of info on how to build and install things, and where to plug the LED lights in would have been a good idea, the HDD encloser was a pain to get out and would not lock back in

Le +:
Le boitier et châssis est très bien beaucoup de place. Et dimensions du boîtier contenu pour la longueur!
Bon boîtier PC pour ventilation avec un ventirad (hauteur importante).

Le -:
Manque visserie "pour moi" un plot de fixation carte mère ATX sur chassis.
Épaisseur peinture noire sur les vis excessifs.
Ventilateur arrière pas RGB.
Doc indique buzzer pas vu.

Un montage spécifique pour contrôler les deux ventilateurs frontaux, passage par une alimentation Sata 12v.
Utilise partiellement les prises de la carte mère.Ce qui celons les cartes mères peut s'avère être un point positif!

Je suis satisfait de mon achat.

Only down side is the missing USB-C, necessary with todays electronics, but you can install an AIO in the top of the case so its good enough for building a gaming PC. It's nice having a door for access to the internals, no need for removing screws to get the panel off.

I was hoping that by going with big fans I wouldn't hear them and this case did not disappoint! I have to put an ear about 3 inches (8 cm) from the fans to hear anything at all. I appreciated the customizability of this case. I could fit a large video card (ARC 770) easily and I knew it'd fit beforehand because the dimensions were clearly defined on the market page. I was able to remove parts I didn't need with ease and the whole thing still feels solid. I love the big window so I can easily see the innards of my system (and the colors). There's lots of pass-through spaces on the motherboard mount to pass cables through to keep things looking nice and neat. I think this is my favorite case I've ever had and I've been building systems since the 90's. Very nice!
The only complaint I have is that the usb connectors are shallow and a little loose. If you slightly touch the chord near the connector it disconnects.

name: DeepCool CC560 Mid-Tower ATX PC Case, 4X Pre-Installed 120mm LED Fans, Tempered Glass Side Panel, Black
description:
• The CC560 mid-tower ATX case offers new and experienced builders a perfect start with great component compatibility and high-quality features.
  • Well-ventilated throughout with an airflow front panel and a large mesh top panel to ensure fresh air is circulating.
  • Ensure great cooling ability with four pre-installed 120mm fans with bright LEDs and optimized airflow.
  • Enough space to support multiple liquid cooling radiator configurations with room for 360mm/280mm radiators in front or 240mm on top.
  • Showcase your system build with a clean and clear full-sized window.
  • Install up to 3x 2.5in SSDs or 2x 3.5in HDDs in a removable drive cage for increased flexibility.
  • Keep important connectivity up front with USB3.0, USB2.0, and a combo audio jack.

reviews.review: Not looking to do anything complicated? This is perfect, quiet and decent cooling. Would have like to have more 2.5 inch bays but the 2 that are screwed to the case are good.

The case has 4 led fans included. It came with everything needed to attach the motherboard. The hard drive cage has two positions or can be removed entirely by 2 screws to fit a longer PSU if needed. Plenty of holes for wire management and a nice sized wire area behind the back panel. The glass panel came with plastic peel on both sides of the panel, which doesn't seem to be common but is a nice touch. Doesn't have rubber grommets around the wire holes but that is ok for the price, you could go up 30-40$ in case tiers to get those if they are important to you. Remember to remove the PCIe slot covers you will need open from the case before inserting the motherboard.

The case is visually nice as well, the white and black design looks good with a variety of component colors on the inside, you should be able to match almost anything with it.

The only complaint I have is the case did not come with a little screw bit to help put the motherboard stand offs in. Personally this does not matter to me as I have them already and other screw bits in my set. But for someone missing it, it does make inserting the standoffs straight a bit more difficult, Although it can be done by hand if needed, it will just be a bit more frustrating to do.

A decent case.

I have been building computers as an I.T specialist and hobbyist for over 25 years now, As A technician I have repaired a couple thousand machines over that time and probably built 50 machines for friends and family over the years.

This case is nothing special. It'll get the job done, but at $109 its overpriced. I know, that's the world we live in now.

I was getting an old P.C back from my son that I had built him in 2016 and I didn't realize he was sending the case back with the other components. The case from 2016 was a cooler master and when I compared these 2 cases (the original build and this case I ordered), they are virtually identical. I paid $30 in 2016 for that other case.

Had I known he was shipping the case back I would have saved the $109 on this one as it was no upgrade whatsoever (maybe a little cleaner). The old case has two usb 3.1 ports on the top of the case. This case only has one 3.1 port.

Oh and if you don't like green lights on your fans or it doesn't jive with your build don't order this as the lights aren't adjustable.
belle finition, acier bien plier peux être un peux plus mince que d autre plus chere mais tres solide
Off rip loving the design and spacing but could use some more white but all around looks beautiful
Ventilateur silencieux bonne puissance de lumière

easy peasy...no problems with the case other than i thought there was a scratch on the glass side panel but i was wrong. Peeled the usual outer layer of protective film off the glass after full assembly.
If this part of the build is satisfying to you...there are 2 layers; 1 on the outside and 1 on the inside of the glass. I'm new to pc building and this is the first case where i've encountered this.
Easy install, plug and play, I thought my power supply or the fans is defective but its my fault you can adjust fan speed and power on bios.

name: CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case - 3X SP120 RGB Elite Fans - iCUE Lighting Node CORE Controller - High Airflow - Black
description:
• Combining stylish tempered glass, customizable RGB lighting, innovative cable management and concentrated airflow, choose the 4000X RGB for a unique high-performance PC.
  • Show off your components and RGB lighting with tempered glass side and front panels, built with dedicated front ventilation channels for ample airflow.
  • The CORSAIR RapidRoute cable management system makes it simple and fast to build an immaculate, professional-looking system with major cables neatly routed through a single channel, with a roomy 25mm of space behind the motherboard for all of your cables.
  • Includes three CORSAIR 120mm AirGuide RGB fans, utilizing anti-vortex vanes to concentrate airflow and enhance cooling. Each fan is equipped with eight individually addressable RGB LEDs for brilliant customizable lighting.
  • Fully control and synchronize the RGB lighting for up to six fans with the included iCUE Lighting Node CORE and CORSAIR iCUE software.

reviews.review:
TL;DR: top power button and USB ports are defective *on my unit* while the restart button functions, but it's still a fantastic case; I just hate the glass and the distractingly annoying RGB lights that must be on at all times. I like the cable management, that was well thought-out!

Oh, what a saga. New-ish AAA game titles (specifically for me "Tiny Tina's Wonderlands" ) are now requiring a MINIMUM of 8gb of VRAM, so I decide to get a new card with ray tracing (which is a waste because "Portal RTX" is only for freaking expensive Nvidia cards, not cheaper AMDs).

It arrives, but is too long for my original case because, you know, MEASURING IS A GOOD THING that is easily forgotten in the throes of "ooh new, modern and shiny!" shopping sprees.

After some research, reading and watching reviews, I decide on this case.

Three days of struggling, swearing and constant insert/remove video card due to troubleshooting later, my husband and I find out that my tower is defective. The top power button and USB ports don't work, but the restart button does.

My husband tried the power switch from an old case he had, and that one worked, so yes, there is a defect. Oh well, at least my system turns on and works nicely now with new large-capacity SSDs and a faster, better video card in a well-ventilated case.

Corsair is back at it again with one of their best cases yet!

The Corsair 4000D Airflow is an exceptional mid-tower case that has impressed me with its superb design, outstanding cooling capabilities, and overall performance. Corsair has once again proven why they are a leader in the PC hardware industry, delivering a product that satisfies both enthusiasts and casual users alike.

The 4000D Airflow has exceptional cooling performance. The case comes equipped with two pre-installed 120mm fans in the front. The generous mesh front panel design allows for excellent intake airflow, while the ample space for additional fans and radiators enables customization to suit your specific cooling needs. The case also provides convenient dust filters, making maintenance a breeze.

The interior design of the 4000D Airflow is well thought out, providing a spacious and versatile layout for easy installation and cable management. The removable PSU shroud and dedicated cable routing channels ensure a clean and clutter-free build. The tool-free drive trays are a welcome addition, allowing for hassle-free installation of storage drives. Additionally, the case provides ample room for large GPUs and CPU coolers, making it compatible with high-performance components.

In conclusion, the Corsair 4000D Airflow is a stellar mid-tower case that ticks all the right boxes. Its sleek design, outstanding cooling capabilities, spacious interior, and convenient features make it a top contender in its class. Whether you're a PC enthusiast or a casual user, this case offers an exceptional balance between style, performance, and functionality. If you're looking for a reliable and visually appealing case to house your next build, the Corsair 4000D Airflow should be at the top of your list.

I liked building two computers using this white case. There are a lot of features packed into this compact case, which would also make it a good choice for someone building a computer for the first time. My main complaint is the panel that covers where the cables go around to the back almost always has to slide to the second position. I had to do this both times because there was no other way that my 24-pin cable could fit through the gap at such a sharp angle. Now the cables in the back are visible. Another thing to consider is that if you're using PSU cable extensions, a non-modular PSU, and RGB controllers, then that HDD bay probably won't fit. Quality is quite good overall. The only place where it falls short is the bracket that holds the three fans on the side is a bit flimsy. Anyways, bought twice and happy with it both times. Comes with plenty of screws, zip ties, and two 3-pin fans.
Real nice case for an affordable price. Good RGB Corsair controller included with RGB fans. Nice cable management. A bit on the flimsy side but definitely usable. Super quiet fans as well !

Nice looking case and fits an ATX board perfectly, it was my first pc build and i wasnt too stressed figuring this case out, comes with the cables on the back already organized and managed. Temps only reach 68c with an overclock to 5ghz and with the 3060 running the case doesnt really get that loud at all, when idle its really hard to hear it, i can only slightly hear the sound of my AIO.
Definitly can reccomend this case, Not sure if it can fit 40 series cards though like the 4090 but it fits my MSI 3060 Gaming x gpu, i also built a second pc and it was easy to install a micro atx aswell.
The only con id say is the fact there is only 1 usb port at the front but that doesnt bother me since my rear IO has like 8 ports and my keyboard has USB passthrough.
I recomend buying the one with the fans, the one without rgb fans isnt really my favourite since its only controlled via voltage since it is only a 3 pin. Also they could make more room to more comfortably install a commander core XT but i managed to stuff it in there at the back.

This case was really good. It was shipped nicely, and packaged well.
However, on the metal side pannel there was a very noticable scuff going diagonally up the botton corner, luckily for me, I have that side against the wall.

I dont have any pictures of this tower but i built a gaming pc for my brother and when it is paired with
Corsair H100x RGB Elite Liquid CPU Cooler
