you can play fortnite, gta5 (at mid graphics settings) and many other games without a graphics card so when you add a gpu
it will unleash ALOT more potential my brother and i are very pleased so far and i still think he is running without a gpu
Super

Après plusieurs mois d'utilisation, je suis vraiment impressionné par le boîtier CORSAIR. Voici ce que j'en pense en quelques points:

----------- Design & Finitions :----------------
Le boîtier offre une esthétique sobre et orientée Gamer, notamment avec le verre trempé qui permet d'exposer les composants internes du PC. C'est sans doute l'une des raisons principales pour lesquelles j'ai choisi ce modèle. Aussi il y a une version avec vitre avant ou avec grille, celle avec une grille a un meilleur airflow, mais j'ai investi sur un bon kit de refroidissement et j'ai pris le boitier avec une vitre avant car il est plus esthétique pour moi.

------------- Éclairage RGB: ---------------
Le système d'éclairage iCUE de CORSAIR ne déçoit jamais! J'ai pu personnaliser l'éclairage selon mes besoins et il est très facile à utiliser, et il se marie parfaitement avec le reste de mon setup.

---------------Air Flow:-------------
J'utilise plusieurs ventilateurs et le boîtier est conçu pour permettre une circulation d'air optimale. Même pendant les sessions de jeu gourmandes, ce qui est un gros plus pour moi.

--------------Espace & Modularité:-----------------------
Bien que qualifié de "moyen tour", le 4000X offre suffisamment d'espace pour tous mes composants, et j'apprécie vraiment sa modularité qui m'a permis de gérer facilement le cable management.

------------Facilité d'installation: ---------------
Le montage a été un jeu d'enfant. Tous les emplacements sont clairement identifiés et accessibles.

Cependant, rien n'est parfait. J'aurais aimé avoir peut-être quelques passages de câbles supplémentaires ou des options de personnalisation (quelques câbles restes bien visibles sur les photos), mais ce sont des détails mineurs au vu de la qualité générale de ce boîtier.

---------------Conclusion :------------------
Je recommande vivement le CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB à quiconque cherche un boîtier PC alliant esthétique, performance et qualité de construction. Je recommande vivement !

I recently upgraded my PC case to the CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB, and I must say, it's been a fantastic addition to my setup. Here's my unbiased review of this product.

Pros:

Stunning RGB Lighting: The RGB lighting on this case is a showstopper. The three included SP120 RGB Elite fans illuminate your PC with vibrant, customizable colors. The iCUE software allows you to sync the lighting with other Corsair peripherals, creating a visually cohesive gaming or work environment.

Excellent Build Quality: The case feels solid and well-constructed. The tempered glass side panel provides a clear view of your components, and it's easy to remove for maintenance or upgrades.

Great Cable Management: Corsair has designed this case with cable management in mind. There are plenty of cable routing channels and tie-down points, helping you achieve a clean and organized interior.

Airflow: Despite the emphasis on aesthetics, Corsair hasn't compromised on airflow. The front panel has a mesh design that allows for adequate ventilation, keeping your components cool even during demanding tasks.

Spacious Interior: The 4000X offers ample space for ATX motherboards and high-end GPUs. It also supports multiple storage options, including SSD trays and HDD cages.

Easy Installation: Installing components in this case is a breeze, thanks to the well-thought-out layout. The tool-free drive bays and PCIe slot covers make the build process smoother.

Cons:

Price: While the features and quality are top-notch, the price point may be a bit high for some users. However, considering the included RGB fans and overall build quality, it's a reasonable investment for enthusiasts.

Limited Radiator Support: If you plan on using a large liquid cooling setup, the radiator support might be a bit limited, especially at the front. You'll need to ensure that your chosen components fit within the case's dimensions.

In summary, the CORSAIR iCUE 4000X RGB Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case is an outstanding choice for gamers and PC enthusiasts who prioritize aesthetics without sacrificing functionality. It offers a stunning RGB lighting experience, excellent build quality, and efficient cable management. While it comes at a premium price, it's a worthwhile investment for anyone looking to showcase their PC components in style.

Je suis absolument ravi de partager mon expérience avec le boîtier PC de chez Corsair. Dès le déballage, j'ai été séduit par son design moderne et élégant. Avec ses ventilateurs avant RGB qui illuminent subtilement mon espace de jeu, il ajoute une touche esthétique incomparable à ma configuration. Mais ce n'est pas que de l'apparence ! Ce boîtier offre une expérience d'installation et de gestion de câbles exceptionnelle.

L'un des points forts incontestables de ce boîtier est sa facilité d'installation des composants. Les emplacements parfaitement conçus permettent de monter les cartes graphiques, les disques durs et les alimentations sans aucun tracas. Même pour quelqu'un comme moi, qui n'est pas un expert en assemblage de PC, l'expérience a été fluide et sans embûches.

La gestion des câbles est un autre aspect remarquable. Grâce aux passages intelligemment placés, j'ai pu dissimuler habilement tous les câbles disgracieux, offrant ainsi un aspect soigné et bien organisé à l'intérieur du boîtier. Cette fonctionnalité s'est avérée essentielle pour maintenir une circulation d'air optimale et garder mon système au frais pendant de longues sessions de jeu intenses.

Les vitres latérales et en façade ajoutent une touche de transparence qui met en valeur l'ensemble de ma configuration. C'est un plaisir de pouvoir admirer mes composants et de montrer fièrement mon travail d'assemblage. Corsair a vraiment pensé à tout pour offrir aux utilisateurs un spectacle visuel incroyable, à l'intérieur comme à l'extérieur du boîtier.

Mais ce n'est pas seulement une question d'apparence. La qualité de construction du boîtier est exceptionnelle. Les matériaux robustes utilisés inspirent confiance et je sais que mes composants sont entre de bonnes mains. Le boîtier offre également une excellente isolation phonique, ce qui réduit considérablement le bruit de fonctionnement de mes composants, offrant ainsi une expérience de jeu plus immersive et agréable.

En résumé, le boîtier PC Corsair avec RGB et vitres latérales est un véritable bijou de technologie et de style. Il allie parfaitement le design moderne avec des fonctionnalités pratiques, comme une installation facile des composants et une gestion de câbles ingénieuse. Les vitres ajoutent une touche visuelle impressionnante, tandis que la qualité de construction assure une durabilité à toute épreuve. Si vous cherchez à donner un coup de boost à votre setup gaming tout en restant fidèle à la qualité, ce boîtier est un choix incontournable. Corsair a vraiment frappé fort avec ce modèle, et je ne peux que le recommander à tous les passionnés de PC qui veulent un boîtier à la hauteur de leurs attentes les plus élevées.

J'ai déjà monté plusieurs PC avec des boîtiers différents et j'ai été très surpris par la simplicité de celui-ci :
1/ Il est beau : Le mélange blanc et gris est nickel
2/ Il est très grand : J'ai monté un Ryzen 7 7800x3D avec un gros ventirad et la carte graphique est une Radeon 7900 XTX (la plus grande d'AMD) et j'ai largement eu la place.
3/ La "cable management" est très simple grâce à des passage très simple et des scratchs déjà monté.
4/ Nettoyage du PC facile grâce à des filtres en face avant, sur le dessus et en dessous.

Si vous aimez le look du boîtier et que vous montez votre 1er PC achetez les yeux fermés !!!

I had a prebuilt I bought a long time ago that I basically have upgraded into a new PC over the years. The only thing I haven't replaced is the case by this point. My old case wasn't awful, but it began to fall apart, and I always wanted a white PC case so I decided to give in and get this one! I don't regret it at all so far. It was really easy to set up, and the cable management is way better than other cases I have worked with (I have worked on a few PC's for my brother and friends as well). I also love how this case is a mid sized tower, but somehow has so much room? I found it much easier to work with compared to my old case, which was a large sized tower. Everything is really easy to remove and put back together, and it came with extra zip ties, velcro strips, and screws for fans and screwing in the motherboard, which is super nice. The only thing that I noticed was it doesn't fit a 140mm fan at the back of the case, which is what I had in my old case (this is user error, I didn't double check this. Just wanted to mention in case anyone might be unaware too). But the case came with two simple black 120 mm fans so I just used one of those no problem. It looks great and I am super happy with it!

name: Cooler Master MasterBox Q300L Micro-ATX Tower with Magnetic Design Dust Filter, Transparent Acrylic Side Panel, Adjustable I/O & Fully Ventilated Airflow, Black (MCB-Q300L-KANN-S00)
description:
• I/O panel can be adjusted in 6 different locations and the Case can be positioned: vertical or horizontal
  • Edge to Edge Acrylic Transparent Side Panel offers a full view inside; CLEARANCE - CPU COOLER: 159mm/6.2"
  • Body depth height: can support normal size ATX power supply. Filter Type: Patterned
  • Front Magnetic Design Dust Filter with open perforated front, top and bottom for high air performance
  • Extra space behind the motherboard tray for hidden cable management
  • Fan and Radiator Support: The front supports up to two 140mm fans and up to a 240mm radiator. The rear supports a 120mm fan or radiator and the top two 120mm fans. All to ensure you don't have to compromise on performance
  • The MasterBox Q300L case supports CPU coolers up to a height of 159mm, graphics cards up to a length of 360mm, and power supplies up to a length of 160mm. Clearance - GFX: 360mm

reviews.review: If you're space limited and want a lightweight PC this is the case for you. Excellent breathability, very light, small, the ONLY issue is that the buttons and USB are on the side, which was a plus for me as I wanted the case flat against the wall!

It's a good MATX case. It's not too heavy as the window is made of poly (not tempered glass)

For the fans, it have 1 included CM fans. You can add 2x 120mm or 2x140mm fans on the front and top but It won't fit 3x 120mm.

Cable management wise, it have enough space to work at the back. You do have to tidy up the front as there's no PSU shroud.
I used it for gaming

Love this tower. It easily fits long GPU(gtx2070s) and there’s even more room for a bigger one left.
Love how it looks.
Can recommend.
Arriver plus vite qu'espérer. Mais le boîtier semble fragile au niveau de la vitre de plastique

I am not very happy with the order as I suspect I received a returned product (The plastic on the clear glass was definitely peeled and re-attached. I found a few hairs in the case. Luckily it did not have scratch mark/missing parts). But don't get me wrong, the case is great and here are the reasons:

The case is very affordable (Especially when it is on sale, I got it at $4x dollar). Basically you cannot find any other case at this price range.

The case is roomy and can fit a few SSDs. The case is also long enough to hold a long graphics card. It provide a lot of holes on the back panel for cable management.

The only down side is it only comes with a fan on the back but I guess I cannot complain that in this price range.
Plexi glass sur le côté facile a rayer

Great case comes with unexpected fan! Very modular will be in use for many years to come. Only gripe is that it doesn't support three 120mm fans at the front... would opt for two 140. Also coating on case makes fan holes to small, they had to be reamed with the end of my screwdriver.

Secondo me, nella sua categoria ovvero come case micro Atx, è semplicemente un BEST BUY ASSOLUTO.

- PREMESSA -

Non scherzavo prima quando ho scritto quella frase iniziale, non sono assolutamente un Fan di Cooler master, ma anzi il contrario, scelgo questo marchio quando solitamente voglio dei prodotti che seppur sono Ben fatti, risultino un pò più "economici", ma in questo caso, con questo Q300L, beh è tutta un altra storia.
E' un altra storia perché secondo me il prezzo è pure basso per ciò che viene offerto, a poco più di 35 euro possiamo assemblare su questo piccoletto davvero una piccola opera d'arte di computer, da gioco o no, con tutta la comodità e lo spazio che vogliamo!

Fino ad ora ho assemblato una miriade di computer, eppure questo case, devo dirlo, non mi ha solo soddisfatto ma anche stupito in parte, è riuscito a diventare la "casa" perfetta per delle componenti che anche se un pò datate stanno alla perfezione, facendo sembrare il tutto davvero accattivante e performante anche la dove in effetti non è.

- QUALITA' E CARATTERISTICHE -

Partendo dalla qualità costruttiva, devo dire che si parla di lamiera, una lamiera ben fatta e ben verniciata di nero, la struttura nonostante non sia troppo spessa rimane rigida e robusta quanto serve, il case anche da "completamente nudo" non da segni di strane flessioni e a mio parere è più che ottimo.
Oltre il case anche i pannelli laterali sono ben fatti, uno è realizzato anch'esso in lamiera e l'altro in plexyglass, un comune plexyglass bello trasparente e che permette quindi di vedere con facilità all'interno. Il plexy è fissato al case con 4 viti molto comode, queste 4 viti sono facilmente removibili grazie al loro grip anche con le dita.
Fornita in dotazione vi è anche una ventola sempre Cooler Master, che io personalmente ho lasciato nella parte posteriore del case per "buttare fuori l'aria" dal case, è una ventola 3 pin con velocità NON regolabile che risulta molto silenziosa e comunque valida da utilizzare anche se non personalizzabile, fosse stata rumorosa non l'avrei tenuta sinceramente perché si parla di una ventola basica da pochi euro.

Il case sarebbe di per se molto "nudo" esteticamente se non fosse per i due pannelli con grafiche magnetici. Questi due "pannelli" magnetici sono molto importanti perché oltre a fare da filtri dell'aria fungono anche da elemento estetico ricoprendo la struttura bucherellata del case stesso. Personalmente trovo il design e la grafica davvero belli e li tengo sempre montati.
I due pannelli sono prima di tutto intercambiabili tra di loro (anche se sono identici) poi possono essere smontati semplicemente sollevandoli senza alcuna difficoltà ed inoltre aderiscono perfettamente alla superficie del case tramite i magneti "flessibili" che sono davvero ben fatti.

Il pannello laterale è realizzato in plastica, presenta due porte USB 3.0 un ingresso microfono jack audio da 3,5mm, un ingresso cuffie audio da 3,5mm, vi è poi un piccolo tasto per il reset del pc ed un centrale e grande tasto di accensione, in generale anche questo pannello per me risulta ben fatto e funzionale, forse avrei preferito un tasto reset un pelo più grande ma in ogni caso funziona tutto perfettamente.

- SPAZIO E FUNZIONALITA' -

Questo case è piccolo, ma con TANTO SPAZIO DENTRO!

Adoro la disposizione interna delle lamiere che permettono davvero tanto "spazio di manovra" in fase di assemblaggio e che sopratutto permette di avere all'interno del "piccolo" case un GRANDE spazio per allocare tutte le componenti.
Le componenti possono essere sistemate con un alto grado di personalizzazione, dalla scheda madre all'alimentatore, dal dissipatore alle ventole si può andare a costruire davvero un bel pc in questo piccoletto.

Ovviamente questo è un case adatto a schede madri di TIPO MICRO ATX/MINI ITX e quindi bisogna assolutamente considerare questo importantissimo dettaglio prima di acquistare.
Detto ciò e considerato che non si andrà di certo ad assemblare su un case da 35 euro un pc da 2000 euro (anche se si potrebbe) dico che questo case è più che ottimo per realizzare comunque un ottima configurazione.

Come dicevo lo spazio all'interno può essere organizzato proprio come vogliamo, le cose che si possono fare sono molteplici:

-C'è la possibilità come nei case più costosi di "esporre" i propri ssd sulla parte frontale con un sistema molto semplice e funzionale a viti e gommini che vanno posizionati semplicemente.

-C'è la possibilità di montate un piccolo AIO a liquido con radiatore da 120mm a 240mm ANTERIORMENTE o fino a 120mm nella parte POSTERIORE (poi nel sito del produttore vi sono le specifiche più nel dettaglio)

-C'è la possibilità di montare anche un bel dissipatore ad aria con doppia ventola bello grosso come ho fato io e vedrete dalle foto

-Si può effettuare un cable management davvero di qualità nascondendo tutti i cavi alla perfezione grazie agli spazi ben studiati e comodi dove passare i cavi, nella parte posteriore vi sono ben 28 millimetri di spazio ricavato apposta per inserire diversi cavi comodamente.

- Ci stanno sulla parte anteriore due ventole da 120/140 millimetri, sulla parte superiore due ventole da 120/140 e sulla parte posteriore una ventola fino a 120mm.

- Ci stanno delle schede video anche importanti, io su questa configurazione ho temporaneamente installato una GTX 580, una scheda che è assolutamente IGNORANTE sopratutto in dimensioni, prende ben 3 slot posteriori ed è davvero grossa, più della mia 1070 montata sul pc principale! Quindi figuriamoci quante schede sono compatibili con questo spazio!

Scendendo nei dettagli specifici le dimensioni massime delle componenti utilizzabili (come descritto dal costruttore) sono:
-159 millimetri (15.9 cm) di altezza massima per i dissipatori
-360 millimetri (36 cm) di lunghezza massima per le schede video
-160 millimetri (16 cm) di lunghezza massima per gli alimentatori

Ottimo è anche dal punto di vista del flusso d'aria interno, niente da dire nemmeno da questo punto di vista in quanto risulta un case che permette degli ottimi flussi se la disposizione delle ventole viene ben studiata ovviamente, disposizione che però è davvero semplice creare grazie agli spazi già ben predisposti! Bastano due ventole anteriori ad aspirare ed una ventola posteriore e superiore a buttare fuori l'aria ed il gioco è bello che fatto.
Fino ad ora e lo utilizzo da mesi non ho avuto il minimo problema di surriscaldamento ne di temperature in generale nonostante la mia scheda video sia un vero e proprio "fornetto" da pizza che raggiunge gli 80 gradi a volte solo guardandola.

- PERSONALIZZAZIONE -

Eccellente, questo case è completamente modulare e può essere modificato in ogni sua parte.

- Il pannello laterale (con usb, tasto accensione ecc..) può essere completamente smontato e riposizionato e ruotato come e vogliamo.

- il pannello inferiore (la base del case) può essere svitata e riposizionata per "ruotare" il case a piacimento.

- Sulla parte posteriore troviamo fino a 4 slot smontabili per le varie schede audio/video ecc..

- I Filtri per l'aria sono intercambiabili, removibili a piacimento ed anche molto semplici da pulire.

Possiamo insomma sbizzarrirci su come assemblare il case con una personalizzazione davvero ampia per la sua fascia sempre di prezzo/categoria.

- COME LO UTILIZZO IO -

Beh l'ho scelto per un semplice motivo, volevo realizzare un buon pc "secondario" non da gioco ma dedicato alla navigazione/stampa 3d e controllo di stampanti in generale, nulla di impegnativo insomma, cercavo un contenitore per delle componenti che suppur datate considero ancora valide e che volevo "racchiudere" in un buon case.
In sostanza parlo di una mobo z77 micro atx, cpu i7 3700k, dissipatore ARTIC freezer 34 con doppia ventola da 120mm, alimentatore EVGA 500w 80+ BRONZE, scheda video gtx 580, ssd da 240 giga e hdd meccanico da 1 tera, il tutto condito da 2 ventole da 120mm corsair poste anteriormente ed una sempre corsair da 140mm posta nella parte sopra, niente di impressionante ma tutto più che funzionante anche grazie a questo case che è riuscito a racchiudere tutto EGREGIAMENTE.

- CONSIDERAZIONI FINALI E.. LO CONSIGLIO? -

Che dire, io personalmente lo adoro, sembra un case da nulla ed invece fa sembrare questo pc secondario una Bomba, ripensando poi quanto l'ho pagato quasi mi metto a ridere. Ben 35 euro per questo case secondo me vale SEMPRE la pena di spenderli, anche perché non ho mai trovato un case a così basso prezzo con tutte queste caratteristiche.

Certo non è privo di difetti, questo è chiaro, come ad esempio che molte parti siano realizzate in plastica sottile, come per il fatto che non vi è un "copri alimentatore" che possa meglio nascondere i cavi e l'alimentatore con cavi annessi rimarranno "a vista", come ancora che il pannello trasparente non sia in vetro ma in plexyglass che tenderà nel tempo a graffiarsi solo guardandolo, MA in linea di massima io ci ho trovato più pregi che difetti sinceramente. Difetti che posso lasciarmi alle spalle anche perché se volevo di più non stavo qua a spendere 35 euro ma andavo per prodotti molto ben più costosi sicuramente.

Il mio verdetto definitivo è quindi che SE cercate un buon case per una configurazione micro/mini ATX, e SE magari volete spendere poco ma ottenere Tantissimo, questo secondo me è un ottimo prodotto al quale affidarvi, senza alcun dubbio per me.
Sono stato personalmente ripagato da un buon risultato finale, una facilità di assemblaggio e spazio di lavoro ottimo, un prezzo eccellente con annesso risparmio per acquisto di altre componenti e quindi mi sento di CONSIGLIARLO al 100% senza nessunissimo dubbio per me!

Petit, hyper fonctionnel et joli. Et prix tout aussi mini.
De bonne qualité (sauf peut être le panneau en plastique transparent).
Je suis ravi de mon achat, le montage s'est fait hyper facilement (les ventilateurs ont été un peu galère a placer).
Coté utilisation, il chauffe un peu malgré des bons ventilos et espace dégagé. Mais c'est aussi parce qu'il y a un gros proc et cg dedans.
Super ravi mon achat.

Acheté pour remplacé ma tour Omen qui n'était pas assez ventilé. Maintenant plus de souci de chauffe, j'ai juste ajouté deux ventilos. Rapport qualité prix parfait et livraison rapide, de plus je la trouve très belle, mon mari a mise la sienne au blanc, pas mal non plus. Assez solide
Je recommande

This case is well laid out, with good mounting points for and HDD and two SSDs on the back side and plenty of space for cable runs (though with cables being long, you may still end up with spaghetti).

The case has plenty of mounting points for 120mm and 140mm fans, with markings to distinguish different holes. The case is also well perforated to increase airflow.

One things that may not be so good is that the front IO (power button and USB) can be moved. In theory this allows flexibility, but for my build, it not being hard mounted (and thus the space its cabling not being factored into design) means I had to put in an awkward place; a full length GPU prevents right hand mounting and a tall CPU cooler prevents top mounting.

The only real drawback with this case comes from modern motherboards and GPUs. Moderns GPUs can be THREE SLOTS THICK (!) and take up space. On the first motherboard I used, this was not a problem, but the PCI on the second board was lower, so the clearance between the GPU and PSU is far too small for comfort.

Lo use para una computadora que no tenia grafica, unicamente el procesador con grafico integrado, me sirvio bastante bien, pero si vas a usar grafica mejor busca otro, cuando puse una se calentaba demasiado, si solo usaras la integrada, este te ira de maravilla

name: NZXT H5 Flow Compact ATX Mid-Tower PC Gaming Case – High Airflow Perforated Front Panel – Tempered Glass Side Panel – 2 x 120mm Fans Included – 280mm Radiator Support – White (CC-H51FW-01)
description:
• HIGH-PERFORMANCE AIRFLOW: Perforated front and top panels direct filtered air through the case to cool down components and enhance performance.
  • DEDICATED GPU FAN: An angled 120mm fan draws air from below the case to provide direct cooling for your power-hungry graphics card.
  • SPACIOUS COOLING SUPPORT: Up to 280mm radiator support in the front, 240mm up top, and 120mm in the rear. Comes with two pre-installed 120mm fans.
  • READY FOR PERFORMANCE: Fits most NVIDIA GeForce RTX 40 Series graphics cards with its 365mm max GPU clearance. Display your GPU vertically using the NZXT Vertical GPU Mounting Kit (sold separately).
  • EASILY MANAGE CABLES: Wide cable channels with hooks, bridges, and straps take the guesswork out of organized cable management.

reviews.review: Great case, really great glass (looks like there is no panel it is so clear). If you read reviews, the must-have for this case is two front fans, once they are added the cooling ability of this case really excels. The neat feature is the fan at the bottom of the case blowing up at the GPU. Easy install, lots of space to hide things. It really is beautiful, I got the white one and added some LEDS and I still love looking at it.
Great looking case cooling is nice! And great price 👍

Is perfect for my first genuine build.

Has plenty of space, very modular, good air flow and best of all perfect cable management, every wire goes neatly in the back and plenty of straps to hold in place.

Highly recommend for a nice clean white build 👌

This case looks great and easy to set up and everything. The chassis is on the thinner side... I could easily bend it, you also need to "push it" to give it a bit force when screw your case fans in... that's how thin it is :( I'm still pretty happy with product considering its price.

The case is good in almost every way, the case looks very good, the build quality is good, the airflow is crazy but having an AIO on the front isn't good on this case. I had to remove and bend some the parts in the case in order to fit the AIO and even after it was fixed, I had to remove the bottom fan of my AIO in order to fit my 4070ti.

Nive looking white case thats easy to build in. It comes with an abundance of screws and spare standoffs. The included fans are good and they are 3 pin fans with a cable length of 62cm. Good quality case and is good for first time builders.

The case is simply the best case I ever got. Perfect size for my component and even into my desk did not take any space that I need. Fit perfectly into my desk drawer. You should not hesitate to get this case you will regret it
It's a good case

Whilst the delay on the delivery was a slight annoyance, the parcel arrived intact and is a really nice case, easy to assemble in and just a neat feature with the fan at the bottom of the case being pointed towards the GPU, though upon further testing, I found the bottom fan to be incredibly loud, even when configured to be run quieter.

As soon as I unplugged the bottom fan, suddenly my PC was quiet, so I feel as though the fan I have is either defective or the design wasn't well thought out

Rebuilt my computer this past summer and I am so glad I picked this absolutely BEAUTIFUL case.
I absolutely love it and the way my pc turned out. I bought some extra stuff to help make it look better like white fans, a white deep cool CPU cooler, and some PSU power cable extensions and all of these came together in this case and created something I am in love with. I have it on my desk and it looks so amazing.

I bought this for a PC build for myself and it has worked out absolutely perfect. I love the look of it and it was an easy assembly. The one thing I would say, is try to assemble the majority of the motherboard before you mount it in the case. It will save you some headache during the overall assembly of your rig. The cable management is good and it's nice having easy access to the hard drive mounts on the backside of the motherboard. Overall, very pleased with this purchase. I looked at a lot of cases and finally decided on this one. Glad I chose it.

I upgraded to an H5 Flow after using an H510 Elite for awhile and the thermal differences are insane. My 3080TI is 15C cooler at full load and my CPU is about 7-10C cooler. I replaced the stock fans with some Corsair RGB fans and the GPU intake fan with Noctua. It makes no noise whatsoever and looks fantastic. I recommend this case definitely for great thermals.

First the design is elegant. The price is best in class for this quality and style of case. If you still want a CD or DVD drive, this case does not allow for that. There are no external bays! But most computers do not include these drives as they are being phased out.
The strengths of this case are sturdiness, flexibility to route wiring, room to allow oversized heatsinks, and lots of add-on ports. It is a very heavy case (about 15 pounds empty). It has plenty of room for gaming video cards as you can see in my photo.
It is a builder's delight as it is open and roomy when you remove the tempered glass side. Most of the bulky (ugly) wiring can be hidden in the bottom compartment leaving a beautiful, clean finished build. I did have a little trouble opening the tempered glass side. There is just one tab, and you have to give it a pretty good tug before it breaks loose from its tight seal, at least that's how mine was. I also installed one as a server at a dentist's office. If allowed, I would give it a 4.5-star rating.

reviews.review: Great case for the price. The fans are nearly silent. The intake filter is awesome touch. The case fans and current cooling solution on my build is able to keep my dual xeons ~30c idle and I struggle to get it able 50c even with a full load. The whole time the computer is nearly silent! Over all I think it looks great! Issues I had, which are more so a function of the mother board I am using, are only 75% of the mounting holes lined up and I had issues routing my 24 pin. I also wished that every time the computer turns off the assigned rgb colors would not go back to the default rainbow.

This case is ok, but there are a lot of things that can be improved upon. First the case fans, they are RGB however they are ring style RGB fans and the pictures are a bit misleading in this way. Second There is no front air filter, so there is nothing to keep dust and dirt from being sucked into your system. Third is the side panels, when you remove the thumb screws in the back the glass panel starts to fall away from the case. If you need a cheap case to hold cheap parts this is an ok case, if you have expensive parts then send an extra 30-40 and get something better.
This case is amazing for my intel build. The rgb fans look amazing and have many settings and the cable management is great I’d recommend this case to anyone
I love this case. It has a real tempered glass panel, lots of visually pleasing LED’s, multiple cooling fans and sells at an amazing price!
I had a professional install the inner workings such as the mother board etc. but over all nice and quite

le ventilateur ne peux pas etre re-centré due aux filage et ils sont de 120mm
Pour les jeux
I love all the rgb fans, I love the entire case. Awesomeeee

Great PC case, loaded with RGB fans and included controller, the cons of the case are sharp edges and not enough cable space on the backside. Also lacks SSD mounts on the backside of the motherboard like some other cases of this style have.

It is a nice looking case all lit up. Lots of room for expansion and cable management.

VERY happy with my purchase! Plenty of room for everything, with ONE exception. As the product specs state, it only fits a couple 3.5" HDs...but I knew that going in. However, I did actually fit a 3rd in, but just let it sit on top of the bottom shelf. It's not secured, but I don't off-road with my Desktop in tow very often, so this is a null issue to me. Overall, got my 1TB Solid state drive, and over 10Tb of 3.5" hard drives for all my movies The case is an EXCELLENT value for the price. Very satisfied.

The case is sturdy the fans are amazing, quiet, and lit af, the glass is real glass so be careful but its an overall best in class buy, cables are a bit messing when upboxing but they are managable with the included zipties!

name: Corsair 5000D Airflow Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case - Black
description:
• The 5000D makes a stunning, showpiece-worthy PC easy to build, and even easier to keep cool with the space andflexibility to mount multiple 360mm radiators.
  • A high-airflow optimized steel front panel delivers massive airflow to your system for maximum cooling.
  • The CORSAIR RapidRoute cable management system makes it simple and fast to route your major cables through asingle hidden channel, with an easy-access hinged door and a roomy 25mm of space behind the motherboard for all ofyour cables.
  • Includes two CORSAIR 120mm AirGuide fans, utilizing anti-vortex vanes to concentrate airflow and enhance cooling.
  • A motherboard tray with customizable fan mounts allows you to side-mount up to 3x 120mm fans or up to a 360mmradiator, enabling new flexible cooling options.

reviews.review: Lots of room to build. Was able to build my pc the way I wanted. Would highly Recommend. I do wish however that the glass panel wasn’t as tinted. Even with a white mobo, and aio cooler you can’t see anything with the PC off and can only kinda of see things a bit with all the RGB on. So if you want to build in this case don’t worry what components you use because you can see them anyways lol.

The reasons I order the Corsair 5000D was because I wanted space to manage my cables, the ability to add up to 10 fans for great airflow, and I wanted a sleek looking case. This case delivered on all of my needs. There's so much space for cable management and all your hard drives so everything looks clean and tidy. I went with the Thermalright Phantom Spirit CPU air cooler, it's a big (similar to the Noctua NH-D15), so I needed space and airflow. The cooler fits in easily and there's a ton of airflow. My i7 13700k doesn't go over 32 degrees Celsius on idle and when I did a few CPU stress tests it never went over 85 degrees Celsius. The build quality is top notch and it definitely looks way better in person (especially in black). So sleek!
If you're looking for a case with airflow, enough space for a big CPU cooler, and a graphics giant card (I know, mine isn't in the photos) this is the case for you. I highly recommend it and well done Corsair!👍🏼
Its big for a midtower, but its amazing the space it has. No need for a full tower with this case.

This is an awesome case...if you don't plan on using the HDD cage. This is absolutely perfect if you only plan on using SSD drives and M.2 drives.

There are several design flaws with this case otherwise I would have given it a 5/5 review.

Huge Flaw one: HDD cage is an absolute nightmare to deal with. The default position of the cage is VERY close to where the power supply sits. You will have cable issues even with a normal sized modular PSU. Personally I think the designers should throw out the 3 side fan mounts and move the HDD cage much closer to the front of the case away from the PSU. Unfortunately if you get ride of the 3 side fan mount you also lose important cable management grab points. Did the designers actually try this out in the real world?

Flaw two: On the glass side of the case (right next to motherboard) there is a cover plate that helps hide all your cables that come in from the back side. It is a great idea to keep everything pretty. However the designers did NOT give enough clearance. My EVGA power supply cable that feeds the motherboard had one heck of time fitting in place because of this cover plate. I was very tempted to rip the plate out because it put a LOT of tension on the cable (the neck of the cable is reinforced and therefore thick). In the end I had to put the cable at an odd angle to make it fit but I am still worried about long term damage.

Flaw three: Why does the front of the case only come with 1 fan? I knew it beforehand so I wasn't surprised and pre-ordered 2 extra non-rgb fans. Ridiculous though that I had to do this.

Other than these 3 flaws this case is awesome. I love the magnetic fan filter covers! I love the easy access to the top and front fans with snap on covers. The case feels very much a deluxe case but the designers need to revisit and fix the flaws.

This is a very well designed case for great airflow. It looks amazing with my LED fans. The built in cable management system is phenomenal. Glass is nice and thick. The case is very sturdy. My PC build was very easy and fast with this case. Please type of extra space also for future expansion. Would highly recommend.

Don't use the tempered glass panel if you have a 4090 in this case. The glass panel was causing a concentrated area of heat where the 4090 card power cable almost touches it. This was tripping a sensor for me and causing a reboot. I replaced the panel with a normal one(same as the other side) and all is good. Besides that, the case is amazing.

I honestly like the case, but the case I received was missing a leg, and a few other small quality issues...
The design is better than I hoped though, and I was happy with the overall case. But just as a warning I worry about they quality control, or they are sending out faulty cases on purpose. Either way I am sure it will be likely hit and miss, I would suggest checking your case as soon as it arrives to make sure it isnt' faulty in some way that makes it unusable for you...

My 4 stars for Value for money is more like a 3.75, as I have to take some off for that QC issues...

Received the corsair 5000d and was surprised how sleek and clean it looked , seems like a high quality product , lots of air flow , lots of storage, and alot of space to add in the new generation of products , only thing i personally could do with out is the glass side panel , nice piece of tempered glass ,but a little finicky to remove without hitting the corners off the table/floor , but the glass sits flat when installed and adds that nice look to the computer if youre running RGB lighting.

Didn't add a photo as it's late at night when writing this review and honestly, the pictures that showcase the product to a good job at showing the most important aspects to it. To make this the easiest to digest, I'll make a pros and cons list really quickly & expand more at the bottom if needed.

Pros : This case is EXTREMELY spacious compared to its little brother the 4000D. Prior to getting this case when I was cross-checking specs for GPU clearance among other things, the 5000D just made the most sense when you consider how massive partner cards are getting & the multitude of ways a person can set their airflow up. Having not only the front panel, but also the side panel directly next to it for a total of 6 intake fans if you're wild enough, with plenty of room at the top of the case for either a radiator or rear exhaust to compliment the back exhaust fan. Plenty of cable ties, so many I'd be shocked if any person in the world uses the amount Corsair supplies, but better to have them and not need them than need them & not have them. A PSU end-panel shroud & side panel shroud (side panel shroud in the case you're not planning on having fans mounted to the side panel) to make things look very well cable managed & hides any not-so-great cable management as well. Easy to remove hard drive bays for more PSU cable space. Included 90 degree USB 3 header which was an unexpected but very much appreciated inclusion. Ease of access to every panel & dust filter throughout the entirety of the case. Overall a very good for future proofing case (although we don't like to say future proof in the tech world, this case seems to be a safe bet). All in all, if you install some really high quality fans in here, you're basically guaranteed some very acceptable temperatures from your hardware as this case when setup up accordingly MOVES AIR.

Cons - The rubber grommets that you use to manage your cables through one side of the case to the other are not the best quality. If you're planning of forcing that 24 pin mobo connector through the rubber grommet, keep this in mind. If gentle and not too forceful (unlike I was) then you'll have no issues. I on the other hand, managed to someone apply enough for the outright remove whatever adhesive was keeping the grommet bonded to the metal case. Now I have to be extra careful in the future when re-cable managing, but I'll take that as a my fault for being to rough I suppose. Just assumed in a $150+ case that important areas like that would be a bit stronger given how stiff PSU cables are from any given PSU supplier. Another con I feel the need to mention, albeit a small one, was completely mis-aligned magnets on the cases top dust filter. The magnets on one side are purposely offset as to allow radiator fan clearance among other great reasons, but mine for whatever reason was already peeling off and crooked... had to fix & make sure the adhesive re-stuck itself. Size may be a con to some, as this case is a big boy... definitely a full size ATX in every sense of the word. Last con I feel is worth mentioning as this may make or break what color a person chooses for their build (white or black case), keep in mind the black case does in fact come with a SMOKED glass side panel, unlike the white version of this case. It's not horrendously dark, if you have components with RGB on them you're 100% be able to see them, but nevertheless the side panel is for sure a darker, more smoked look when compared to the white version.

All in all I see this case lasting me many years to come, & with many different builds as time goes along. I highly recommend if you're looking for a standard ATX case that's capable of push tons & tons of airflow, while still having adequate space and dust filters.

8.5/10 rating.

Rating: 5/5
Price when purchased: £139.99

Pros:
- Exceptional value for the price point.
- Prompt and secure delivery with meticulous packaging, nestled in foam and safeguarded with transparent foil.
- Significant enhancements over the 4000d airflow model, including a glass door feature and an adaptable internal layout. If your initial component arrangement isn't optimal, the flexible inner walls make adjustments a breeze.
- Perfectly accommodates the MAG Z790 TOMAHAWK motherboard.
- Inclusion of 2 fans and a fan controller enhances its value proposition.
- Maintenance is straightforward with easily detachable nets ensuring cleanliness.

Cons:
- Its weight (13.84kg / 30.51lbs) can be a drawback for those considering mobility. I initially contemplated transporting it from the EU to the UK but ultimately chose to purchase a second unit for the UK.

I've always been partial to Corsair cases, having previously owned the 4000d airflow. Transitioning to the 5000d airflow feels like a significant upgrade. This model boasts an array of detachable compartments, increased easy-to-clean airflow nets, and the added functionality of a hinged glass door. The design is accommodating, allowing for greater ease when setting up, particularly when connecting cables and fans. Aesthetically, the case is a stunner—sleek and modern. It's refreshing to see such a refined design at this price point. My initial reservations about fitting the Z790 TOMAHAWK were put to rest—it integrates seamlessly.

It took three tries, but I finally received a "Corsair 5000D Airflow Tempered Glass Mid-Tower ATX PC Case - Black" with no damage. First case was used (lower price) but missing many items, second case was new but came with a shattered glass panel. The third was perfect. I wanted to upgrade the review rating ASAP since this is an excellent case and deserves acknowledgement in that regard.

I have it assembled with an Asus Rog Strix Z690 E, i9-12900KF, a MSI Suprim X 4090 Liquid GPU with a 240mm rad (top mount) and Arctic 360mm V2 rad for CPU (front mount) with front fans added to achieve push/pull. The PSU is a Seasonic Vertex GX-1200 (strong and quiet). It was a bit tricky but I was able to mount the video card in a normal orientation without inducing any severe bends in the GPU hoses, Consequently, a vertical GPU mounting was not needed.

I was able to mount the CPU AIO with with hose end of the rad mounted at bottom. This helps as the air pockets form at the top of rad so with hose at bottom there is never gurgling and the pump never experiences startup cavitation (note pump is lower than that rad top, the highest point). This placement was simplified by (1) arranging the push/pull setup which moves the Arctic CPU rad backwards (a bit closer to CPU) and (2) the large cut out in PSU shroud that Corsair helpfully provides for this purpose.

Positioning the CPU rad hoses at bottom allowed for easy installation of the Suprim 240 rad (pull fan orientation) and permitted a total of 3 fans at top. I removed the two noisy/ineffective stock MSI fans from the Suprim rad (I left the original MSI GPU card assembly fan). The system now uses 13 Arctic P12 PST fans which are inexpensive, quiet with excellent airflow. The 64GB of Corsair Vengeance 6600 ram is under a Corsair DIMM fan fixture that uses Noctua NF-A6x25 fans. The Arctic AIO includes a PWM VRM fan and the PSU fan is 135mm PWM. So 18 fans total all PWM.

One image shows the system running Cinebench R23 simultaneously with Fire Strike Extreme Stress. The total power draw is 850W which the Seasonic Vertex GX-1200 handles easily. Though there are 18 fans total, the Fan Xpert 4 software in combination with Nvidia bios runs the fans so that in this extreme condition they are relatively quiet. In normal gaming the fans are inaudible.

I am not too keen on glass panels in general, so I ordered from Corsair a cable side panel to replace the board side glass panel (Corsair cleverly permits the side panels to interchange). I would have preferred that the board side panel be more fully perforated but it's not needed in this case which provides very adequate airflow. And yes, I paid $15 more to hide the system and the RGB lighting (which is all turned off anyway). The machine is for gaming, not gawking. If what I wanted was to see pretty colors under glass, I'd get a salt-water aquarium.

I really don't understand the obsession with glass sides. Even if tempered, if the glass does break it will make a huge mess and will still offer risk to children/pets. A perforated steel cover would be more practical and certainly sturdier. It would allow just as much of the RGB vanity lighting to show through as would the dark glass panel. It should at least be an option.

In conclusion, I have learned that buying a used case is false economy. It might be fine to purchase other things used, but considering all the bits and pieces that go into a case, unless you can get a 50% markdown and can tolerate the inevitable missing parts, a new case is the best bet.

This Case worked well with my setup, In total i was able to fit 10 noctua fans in this case (3 in front pulling, 3 on side pulling, 3 on top AIO exhausts , 1 out the Back exhaust) i was worried about the amount of heat in the case with my build, but this case does handle airflow well, the 3 side fans are able to pull fresh air into the case and there is a shroud to direct this air straight over the motherboard, while the 3 front fans are also pulling air in to help cool the GPU, i did top mount my AIO and setup my fans to exhaust air out of the case through the radiator, to prevent the system from pulling dust in. though there are really nice filters on the top front and side of the case. i just didnt want to worry as much about dust build up. my CPU stays nice and cool due to the amount of air moving through the case. GPU temps are fantastic. my only two complaints about this case is the fact that i had to slightly rotate my radiator to clear mobo power cables and the glass has a slight tent to it making it more difficult to admire the beauty of my build. other than that it was a dream to work with. Cable management was a breeze.

This is probably the easiest case I've ever personally built in. Tons of options for airflow / fans / radiators (although not perfect, I'll explain later). The velcro cable ties are a nice touch, and they even throw in some extras in the accessories box which bodes well for cable management. Corsair includes some extra parts, like an optional bottom/front panel replacement if you need more space for things like front mounted radiator tubing. The only downside I found is the top fan / radiator mount. If you want to top mount a radiator and your motherboard has its CPU power pins at the top, you might run into trouble due to how close the radiator comes to the motherboard. I had to re-route my CPU EPS 12V cables around the radiator which was a slight hassle. Although it seems somewhat counter-intuitive, if you plan on top mounting a radiator I would advise putting the motherboard in first before mounting your rad. Aside from that, this case was really fun to work in.

name: Thermaltake Tempered Glass Black SPCC Micro ATX Gaming Computer Case
description:
• Mesh front panel with built-in Blue LED strip
  • Compact Micro-ATX form Factor Design with full length PSU cover
  • Ideal for AIO solutions up to 240/280mm
  • I/O port: USB 3.0 x 1, USB 2.0 x 2, HD Audio x 1

reviews.review: Le ventilateur est peu bruyant. 2 petits filtres pour l'air qui entre qui sont aimenté, yen a un des 2 qui fit un peu moins bien. Le devant du casing semble difficile a démonter. Et je ne voit pas de filtre a cet endroit

Good case. Cheap, not to flashy, glass pannel, basement, good drive mounts, good cable manegment. Good everything so far.

The only problem ive had is you do NOT use two 140mm fans like shown in the add. The front io wires interfere and results in only one fan fitting at the very bottom. Not a deal breaker but you should know.
I absolutely love this case it comes really simple instructions it’s compact it fits everything nicely
Cheap built made to look like a good quality one, but it does the job.

It is a decent case except two cons:
1) usb 2.0 ports in 2022. Are you serious? I wish Thermaltake would use only one front usb 3 port instead of using precious usb 2.0 header on my mobo
2) not good for aio coolers. As you can see aio water pipes of the Kraken M22 are on the gpu and that's the only place I could put them without getting bubbles or water pump getting stuck.

I have not built a computer since 2010 so I searched long and hard for months before I settled on parts. This is the case I chose do to price and features, it seemed to strike a great balance. The case comes well packed (maybe over packed, lots of waste) with clear instructions for taking it apart. It is easy to route cables with lots of room behind the MB and back panel. I built a micro-atx system and all parts fit easily. I only have two complaints, I guess with the old case you could remove the PSU shroud, but the one in my case is riveted in so it cannot be removed. Also the psu shroud is almost touching my video card (Asus 1660super) with only about 1/4inch gap between the gpu and psu shroud. The Asus 1660s is a "double wide" card, so if I had ordered my original gpu pick, a triple wide card, it would not have fit in the case without drilling out the rivets and removing the shroud. Something to be consider when selecting your case. The tempered class is nice and the blue LED stripe on the front is a nice touch (it can be turned off with a front panel button if you don't like it). The case comes with screws, MB set offs and zip ties. All in all happy with this case, and would probably still have purchased it even with the gpu/psu problem.

Pros:
- Product is affordable
- Has awesome design
- Built in Case dust filters at the front, top, and bottom for the Power supply.
- Top dust filter is magnetic and can be removed. I'm not sure about the other dust filters, though.
- Has a big PSU shroud to hide cables underneath
- Supports 3x 120mm / 2x 140mm at the front, 1x 120mm / 140mm at the top and back.
- Comes with one 120mm fan at the back
- Optional blue LED at the side.
- Airflow is fantastic! I've put 5x 120mm fans and the temperatures are amazing.

Cons:
- If you're installing a semi modular power supply, then you might take a while to manage your cables like me. In the end, I still figured it out, though.
- Tight space for the SSD SATA and power connectors . I almost bent my connectors; however, this can be avoided if you're careful.
- The front dust filter is kinda useless. The holes are too big and dust is surely to enter your pc. It only filters a little bit of dust. There is no thin sheet of foam that serves as a filter. Other expensive cases has this feature. At the very least, since it has bigger holes, the airflow is fantastic. With that said, you might have to blow clean your pc with an electric duster every month.
be carful with the glass its awfully heavy

I want to like this case. It has good cable management, it's easy to work in, and it's a great price. I had no issues getting parts installed and the glass looks amazing, something you usually don't see at this price point. Unfortunately, there's 2 things that could be brushed off as minor inconveniences, but it's enough for me to knock off a star.

First, the power indicator is red and the case light is blue. This was something I saw people talking about before I bought it, but since I was doing an anti-rgb build, I didn't care. But now that I have it, I hate the red button so much. Luckily, you can turn off the blue LED strip that runs along the front of the case. However, the red power LED is bright enough to ruin the look of a build, especially if you are going for a blue colored one. If you don't care that much about aesthetics, then it's not a major issue, but it is such an annoyance that I felt like bringing it up.

Second and MUCH MORE IMPORTANTLY, it is wayyyyy too easy to accidentally push the power button. It isnt as much of an issue if you have the PC sitting on top of your desk, but in my setup, I have it sitting on a shelf near the ground. I have accidentally kicked or bumped into the power button like 3 or 4 times now, and I'm not even that clumsy. Just getting in and out of my desk and grazing the button is enough to turn off the computer. I don't know why they decided to have the power button protruding from the case like it does. I have a feeling that it'll be just as easy to bump into it if it's on top of your desk. Reaching over to grab something like a mic or your phone or something can become a risk just because of the stupid button.

Also, no USB-C support? It's 2023, let's get at least one on the front panel. Won't knock a star off cause that's something you can see before you buy. But still I think Thermaltake can add one in the future

I can't knock it too much tho. For the price point I really don't know if there's a better case out there. I'll eventually upgrade my build, and when I do, I will likely buy a new case to go with it. If you're working on a budget and want something gets the job done AND shows off your expensive parts, this is pretty darn good.

can easily accommodate a few ssd's with a non-modular power supply and an mATX motherboard.
just enough space behind the tray to fit the cables required.
the included fan is near silent and offers plenty of airflow for my low end web surfing build. but there is plenty of room for more fans or even liquid cooling.

This case is much smaller than a 10 year old case I was using. I happened to have a micro ATX motherboard that was 10 years old. The system was working fine. I also had a 2 year old power supply. The original power supply for the system failed 2 years ago.

New motherboards have a different layout. They allow SSDs that plug directly into the motherboard without needing SATA cables. This is a significant improvement. This case also allows installation of 2.5" SSDs without too much trouble.

The challenging part is installation of 3.5" hard drives. These drives are heavier. The system used by this case requires you to attach a rubber grommet into one of their enclosed mounting screws and then slide the drive into place. There is a keyhole shaped area on the metal chassis. If you do it correctly the drive drops into place. Just to ensure a really tight fit, I used zip ties to prevent 3.5" drives from moving.

Finally, you need a modular power supply for this case. SATA data connectors are no problem as long as you remember drives are mounted directly on the sheet metal. SATA power connectors can be challenging. Power supplies have daisy chained SATA power connectors. Since the drive is mounted directly on the sheet metal, you have part of the power cable going underneath the drive. You can avoid this problem by using SATA power connectors that are not daisy chained. Thermal difference using a smaller case is +5C. I'm now running the CPU at about 35C for the CPU and 34C for the motherboard. In a non-compact case with the same motherboard and a bulldozer AMD processor, the CPU runs at 30C and the motherboard temperature is 26C. The larger case has 4 fans inside. You can install additional fans at the front of the compact case but I didn't see any need to do this.
I was able to take a Dell mother board and put it in these case. Done! It was also a father and son bonding moment. Done! Buy it!
It's a really great case and I have had zero problems with it. It is a great budget PC case

name: Cooler Master MasterBox TD500 Mesh White Airflow ATX Mid-Tower with Polygonal Mesh Front Panel, Crystalline Tempered Glass, E-ATX up to 10.5", Three 120mm ARGB Fans & ARGB Lighting System
description:
• Polygonal Mesh features a 3-dimensional contour and is also capable of simultaneously providing high airflow and dust filtration.
  • A crystalline tempered glass side panel dons a crystalline design, precision engineered for strength as well as aesthetics.Materials:Steel, Plastic
  • Three included addressable RGB fans flood the build with lighting while providing considerable airflow.
  • For enthusiast-grade cooling, 2,360 millimeter radiators are supported on the top and front panel to keep the most extreme systems cool.
  • Support for up to 7,120 millimeter fans and front, top, and rear liquid cooling ensure the utmost in performance.

reviews.review: This unit is great, it looks fabulous, it has excellent airflow it also has lots of lighted fans, however. If you have a regular ATX motherboard and you have or want to use a 280mm double or triple liquid cooler radiator you will not be able to fit them in the case together. after I installed my full ATX motherboard into this unit I then found that I could not fit my 280mm double3 fan radiator in the top of the case, the Ram dimms on the motherboard get in the way of the fan, and before you ask, the 280mm radiator does not fit in the forward position only on the top of the case, so I was forced to take my dremmel to cut slots in one of my Fan shrouds to allow room for the Dimms to fit when I installed the fans. This would definitely be a deal breaker for many out there, but I wasn't going to return the 280MM fans and radiator and pay more for the 240mm version, so I modified the fans to allow everything to fit. Other than this "little" problem the case is excellent and the design of the case is overall excellent. The wire routing can give you an extremely clean install with only a tiny bit of wires visible and the sculpted glass door on the left side is seriously cool and yes, it is Glass, not polycarbonate. the overall construction quality is excellent and is perfect for someone who is looking for a good quality case I have zero complaints about this case, with the exception of it saying it will fit a 280mm dual fan radiator as this is only technically true, but don't expect to fit your full size Motherboard afterwards. So my advice is that if you like this case and also want to use a dual fan radiator do not buy a 280mm unit, but buy the 240mm triple, double or single radiator. If you intend to install a single 280mm fan radiator I think that there should be enough room for it and the motherboard, but no double and a triple will not fit this case at all.

It's sizeable: ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360 at the top, and squeezed a (slim) case fan at the back.
Comes with 3 fans on the front - a good thing. However, the front panel / fans hub is.. subpar. It's screwed into the inner wall of the case in a manner that it blocks one of the cable management aperture - meh. And the 'Reset' button.. does not seem to be connected anywhere from that hub. Probably it could be figured out, but I left it not working. Not that I care for a reset button, it's just that the whole item gives.. 'made in a garage' vibes :D
Overall happy with the outcome, probably not much more to expect in its price range.
Vas très bien pour passé les cables.
Love de case with rgb fan

The rgb fans on the case didn't work at the first time, so I thought I was gonna return it. But after two days of discovering and researching,
I finally found that the wires are plugged wrongly. After I fixed it, I can now change the rgb colours using the small reverse button near the power button. 10/9.9

Let me tell you, the Cooler Master MasterBox TD500 Mesh White Airflow ATX Mid-Tower is the Beyoncé of computer cases. It's got style, it's got grace, and it's ready to slay your computer game.

First off, the polygonal mesh front panel is like looking at a beautiful diamond. It's geometrically pleasing to the eye, and it's so mesmerizing that you may forget to even turn on your computer.

But once you do, oh boy, does this case light up! The three 120mm ARGB fans are like little disco balls spinning in your tower, and the ARGB lighting system is like having your own personal rave party. It's so cool, you may just have to invite all your friends over just to show off.

And don't even get me started on the crystalline tempered glass. It's like looking into the crystal ball of your computer's future. You can see all the components working in harmony, and it's almost like they're putting on a show just for you.

Plus, this bad boy can handle E-ATX up to 10.5", which means you can have all the space you need to fit in your components like a game of Tetris. And with the mid-tower size, you won't have to worry about it taking up too much space in your room.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a case that's both functional and fun, look no further than the Cooler Master MasterBox TD500 Mesh White Airflow ATX Mid-Tower. It's like having a party in a box, and who doesn't love a good party? 5/5 stars, would rave again.

Ho scelto il modello TD500 Mesh Nero
