In retrospect, I think it probably makes more sense for them not too because you really need specialty fans to get the best cooling here, and if they'd added those, the price would have been significantly higher. I explain below.

As to the people saying their hardware gets hot, I suspect the main difference is what you are running and the type of fans you have. If you are running a brand new micro-atx motherboard/cpu and a big GPU, you aren't likely to see a big heat issue if you tune and face all your fans CORRECTLY. I would suggest however 3 - HIGH PRESSURE 140mm fans for the 3 front intake fans because the glass front obstructs direct airflow to them. High pressure fans will pull more air through the slits between the glass front and the case than a standard fan will. A standard fan will flow more air, but they can't pull or push air well against restrictions. The difference in the fan is just the blade width. The wider the fan blade, the higher the pressure the fan can transmit. I use Fractal High pressure fans.

I specifically bought this case for its E-ATX capabilities. I am running a dual CPU server/workstation motherboard, and I can attest that this thing definitely heats up quickly with this setup. For this price point and case size, I can live with managing the heat situation, but its certainly not exceptional for a case. The biggest issue I have faced and its worth noting is that if you are running an E-ATX board, the TOP COOLING FANS WILL BE PARTIALLY OBSTRUCTED. This means you will need to purchase slim 15mm thick fans (120mm or 140mm) if you want to use the the top fan mounts. There are not very many choices here, and mostly they are not cheap.

The design is otherwise simple but elegant. I like the glass front and side panel with a hinge, and the isolated area under the board for the power supply. I also like that it fit my Supermicro E-ATX dual cpu server motherboard. There was only 1 standoff hole that wasn't used, and it was within 2 inches of another standoff anyway, so no stability issues with mounting or board flex. I don't think I've owned a case before that had no external drive bay slots before, not that you need those nowadays. I knew it had none when I bought it, it it really didn't hit me until I started looking at accessories to buy and was seeing external drive bay stuff I couldn't buy that I would otherwise have. No biggie though.

In all, just be aware of what you are buying this for, your budget, and its shortcomings and I don't think you will be dissatisfied if you keep your expectations reasonable. Just a word to the wise, if you weren't aware it does not come with fans, you might want to make sure you get all that figured out before you buy this case, because depending on what you are going to use it for, you may need a more custom configuration.

name: LIAN LI PC-O11 Dynamic Razer Edition Black Tempered Glass ATX Mid Tower Gaming Computer Case - PC-O11D Razer
description:
• Case Type Tower Chassis
  • Structure Dual Chamber
  • Dimensions (W)274Mm X(H)449Mm X(D)446Mm
  • Country Of Origin : China

reviews.review: amazing

This case is really amazing, but the one I recieved had some issues. The led's seems to be messed up and some of them are displaying the opposite color. It ws also missing the bottom fan filter. Building in it is a dream, as there is soo much free space in the back, and the psu in the back is so great. Yes it means a wider case but it also means less height, which creates much more visually pleasing dimensions overall. I'd probably go with the Dynamic White edition if I were to purchase again, as the rgb's included probably aren't worth the upcharge, especially when I got a case that legit can't display razer green, as green/red are the colors that are swapped. I can't think of any way to fix this, or where this swap would even be to start with.

Edit- I managed to fix the rgb by cutting the ribbon wire near the end in half. The connectors were frayed, so I cut off that bit, and there was enough remaining to connect it still. It's way better looking now, and I'm surprised how much having the correct colors improves my appreciation for the RGB.

This is a great case. It was well thought out an very well constructed. My only quibble and it’s very very VERY minor is the lack of a reset button (just power on case). That’s it … I’m happy with this case.
Product arrived earlier than expected and in excellent condition and works great the rgb looks incredible and the amount of space available for parts is perfect plus gotta love Razer

It's like the motherboard is a few mm too low and the GPU won't sit all the way in the pcie slot.

Really disappointed

Overall I've been wanting to build on the LianLi XL thinking the dynamic won't be big enough, but after a couple of hours, fits a 3090, with a 360mm AIO with a pull-push configuration. Case design fits 9 fans but can handle 12fans (3more on the back of vertical mount). Added 4 x 40mm RGB bar which sits perfectly, a couple of gorilla tape and you're good to go.

First delivery was a mess with the box scratched 24 inch long 2 inches large hole. Tempered glass panel has also ben scratched in the process. There was no way I could keep that as my first build.

That said, Replacement arrived before I even had the time to ship the default one which probably excuse the first order I guess!

Like I expected now, my own Lian Li 011 Razer Edition PC Case. Now let’s shove that Ryzen 7, 5700XT Sapphire NITRO + in there 😁

This Lian li dynamic Razer edition is a great case, great cable management, great airflow etc and i have lots in this, cable extensions, corsair commander pro etc! Case is well designed ...except for the HDD holder at the back not the cage, pretty hard to get sata cables connected as it sits flush, should have a holder that sits a bit higher, hence I installed mine at the bottom of the case. Other then that would highly recommend this case

This case is great. Read on for my experience.

First, hardware specs:
-Intel i7-11700k
-MSI MPG Z590 Tomahawk Motherboard
-Venroo U6Pro CPU fan
-Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro 16GB DDR4 3000Mhz
-EVGA RTX 2080ti
-EVGA SuperNOVA 1000w Fully Modular
-Samsung 970 EVO M.2 NVME 500GB
-Samsung 860 EVO 1TB SATA SSD
-9x Lian Li UNI AL fans

Purpose:
I bought this case as a replacement to a previous case which had terrible airflow. This case was recommended to me from a friend, and the positive YouTube reviews were compelling enough for me to make the purchase.

Arrival:
This case is a full-sized case, and it's big and heavy. I'm 5'4"/115lbs and due to the nature of the size of the box, I struggled a bit to get the case out of the box - My arms are too short. The case was packaged well, and I had no concerns of lack of protection.

Unboxing:
Inside the box, there was obviously the case. In addition, it came with a pretty terrible manual which didn't explain much. However, I was pleasantly surprised to see it came with a storage container with a variety of screws. While each screw type was individually packaged, it was nice to have an immediate storage container for mounting hardware. A nice welcome considering I don't have a "work area", and this was a kitchen table project.

Case disassembly:
I have a minor complaint with the case disassembly. You can't remove the side panel without removing the top of the case. I'm saying this is a minor complaint as it's not difficult to take apart the case. No tools are necessary, although I did use a screwdriver to loosen the screw which secures the swappable disk drive bays. Either my grip strength is awful, or they're incredibly tight. Whatever. Moving on! The top of the case is removed by a sliding button on the rear of the case. After the top is removed, the tempered glass panel and the metal side panel slide straight up. Easy peesy.

Interior quality:
Overall constructions and materials are great. I had no concerns about something cracking if I had torqued a fan screw too much. The top and side panels have magnetic dust filters, and there is a slide out dust filter for the bottom. There are two dogs in this house, and pet fur is always an issue. Relating to my minor complaint above, I wish I didn't have to take the top off to remove the side panel in order to clean the dust filters. At least, the bottom dust filter is ridiculously easy to remove and install.

Cable management:
I saw there are some complaints in other reviews relating to cable management. I didn't have any issues. There is a ton of space on the back side of the case. And I even added extension cables to my power supply. A couple cable ties to coil up the excess resulted in a clean install both in the front and back. The power supply also installs in the back so it is not visible through the tempered glass panel.

Swappable hard drive bays:
This case comes with four bays. I removed one of them as I didn't need it. Mounting the drives was easy, and there were no alignment issues with sliding the drives into the SATA ports. Each port has a SATA cable and power which need to be connected.

Front panel:
The case has an RGB strip which is controlled with a button. Each time you press the button, you switch to a preset design/color. A cool feature, but I never change it because I honestly forget it exists. There are two USB ports on the top front and two on the bottom front so whether you keep your PC on the floor or on your desk, there's something for everyone. There are TWO USB 3.0 connectors, and my motherboard only has one USB 3.0 header so I am not using the front bottom USB ports. Check your motherboard to see if you have more than one USB 3.0 header on it. Otherwise, you'll be buying a PCIE USB 3.0 card. The USB-C port on the front is a nice touch as my previous case did not have this option, so I had to use the USB-C port on the motherboard which was inconvenient. First world problems, I tell you.

One minor challenge:
This isn't really a problem with the case, however it's more of a problem relating to Lian Li's thought regarding its other case accessories. Due to the size of my CPU cooler, I'm unable to utilize the PCIE x16 slot on my motherboard. I debating on purchasing the vertical mounting bracket from Lian Li, but according to their reviews, it only leaves a couple of millimeters of space between the GPU and the tempered glass panel. If they're going to offer a vertical mount, perhaps they should build the cases a bit wider - although this case is already pretty large. I don't know. If it's already this big, what's another inch and a half in width? But this isn't really a problem with the case but more of a problem relating to a combination of my choice of CPU cooler as well as motherboard since I probably should get one with more x16 slots. Obviously, I did not reduce my rating because of it.

CPU Temperatures:
Of course, mileage may vary as it depends on your hardware, fans, cable management, etc. Keep in mind the i7-11700k is notorious for running extremely hot. In this case, temperatures have been fantastic. I haven't seen anything above 74C degrees during a 15-minute CPU stress test. At idle, temperatures sit around 30C degrees.

GPU Temperatures:
Same disclaimer as above as you may get different results, but during gaming at 1440p/105fps, I haven't seen GPU temperatures over 65C. At idle, temperatures sit around 45C degrees.

Summary:
Buy the case. You'll like it. If it has a genie which can grant wishes, I have yet to discover its ability. But considering the great job Lian Li has done with the case, I wouldn't be surprised.

First, the gear:

Gigabyte Aorus Elite X570 MB
Ryzen 3700X CPU
Sapphire Pulse Radeon 5700XT GPU
Teamgroup Dark Za 32GB 3200Mhz RAM
3 Corsair QL120 fans (side)
6 Thermaltake Riing 12 Plus Premium fans (top and bottom)
1 Be Quiet! Shadow wings 120mm white fan (rear)
Thermaltake Toughpower 750W Modular Gold rated PSU
WD Black 500GB NVME M.2 SSD
Seagate Firecuda 2TB SSHD
Pccooler GI-D66A

Recently, I decided it was time to upgrade my PC. Initially, I went with the Fractal Meshify-C White case. It was a good case, but it had some drawbacks that made me realize that since I'm building a quality gaming PC, why settle?

Several things made me decide to shop for a better case: The space behind the motherboard wasn't enough for all the cables and controller for the fans, and I was tired of having to physically mash the left panel down to get it to close. The front PCB was built into the front panel, so any time I wanted to open it up, I had to be careful not to put too much stress on the connecting cables going to the motherboard; and finally, in order to have 3 intake fans on the front of that case, you had to remove the panel on the shroud, which left an ugly, gaping hole exposing all the cables that you want to hide. Initially, I modified the panel and used my angle grinder to make a cut out to allow room for the 3rd fan, but the cut was very uneven and I had to use some car weather stripping I had laying around to hide the jagged edges. So I began to shop for a better option.

Enter the Lian Li O11 Dynamic XL. I'd never bought a case this expensive before, so I read and watched every review of it I could find. I was tired of the compromises that companies made in the $75-$100 price range, and the O11 XL seemed to be what I was looking for, so I pulled the trigger.

Package arrived on time, no visible damage. The case itself was in perfect shape, no dents or scratches on the glass panels.

First impression: This case is freakin' SWEET! Finally, I have a case that checks all the boxes for me, and looks amazing! I love the glass front and side and the brushed aluminum finish on the front. Everything about this case has a very high quality feel to it. All the panels fit together perfectly, no annoying gaps.

The LED strip looks great, too, very bright and colorful with smooth transitions on the RGB patterns. I like that it has the M/C buttons on the front to change modes and colors. Switching to the 8th mode (LEDs will be off) syncs it to my MB via Gigabyte's RGB Fusion software.

This case is large, which I love. There's so much room to work with, and I have plenty of options for future upgrades and additions.

I really like the hot swap bays. I took one out for cable management and used the other one for my 2 TB SSHD.

This case has TONS of options. There's so many mount points for drives and SSDs, it's ridiculous.

I'm running an air cooled build, and this case is great for that. Some reviewers recommend the original O11 Dynamic for air cooled builds, but the clearance for tower CPU coolers is a bit low on that one. I had originally ordered that one and then I checked the clearance specs from Lian Li's website and realized that my Pccooler GI-D66A was too big. The XL is perfect for that cooler, it fits with a few mm's to spare. Also, I wanted a 120mm rear exhaust fan and the XL is the only model that has a place for it.

The craftsmanship of the case is straight up on point. I'm really impressed. You really do get what you pay for, and I am glad that I spend the extra $ to get a case worthy of my build.

Building in the O11 XL was a good experience. The size of the case allowed for ease of assembly and nothing was too cramped. For example, on the Meshify-C I had to use needle nosed pliers to get the CPU power cable inserted into the MB, since there was no room to get my hand in between the plug and top of the case. With the O11 XL, I had more than enough room to get my hand in there.

With all the fans, controllers, etc. I have TONS of cables. Cable management in this case is great, the layout is perfect for hiding all the wires behind the MB. I like the cable shroud panel in the back as well, it helps hide the insanity lol. The openings in the front are well-placed with nice rubber grommets, allowing me to have the cleanest looking build yet.

The versatility of this case is a big plus. I was able to move the PSU up to the middle, remove one of the hot swap trays, and use the top one for my hard drive, thus allowing space at the bottom for the fan controllers and PWM hubs.

Placing and mounting all 10 of my fans was easy, I really like that the SSD trays are removable, with one more plate to hide the gap when using 3 120mm fans on the side. I also love the 3 fan tray on the bottom, it made mounting those 3 intake fans a breeze. Currently I have the 3 side and bottom fans as intake and the 3 top and 1 rear as exhaust for a slightly positive pressure air flow setup. I am slowly migrating to all Corsair QL fans, as the white really matches up well with the case color, and these fans have rear LED rings as well, so whether I mount them as intake or exhaust, there's no compromise in LED visibility.

So what about temps? Same as the Meshify. CPU temps at idle in 30's, full load in 60's. GPU junction temps when playing graphics intensive games like GOW5 is 70s-80s. Nice.

I LOVE THE GPU BRACKET! My sapphire pulse GPU is pretty long and it has a bit of a sag. In the Meshify, I used a GPU stand, but I realized that I couldn't use a stand on the O11 XL, since the bottom fans would be in the way. Lian Li thought of everything though, and included a GPU bracket that can support up to 2 GPUs. As I was building, I noticed the instructions recommended putting the bracket hardware on the 2 MB mounting screws just to the left of the right edge. However, the heatsink of my MB PCH was too thick. No problem, I just installed the bracket on the two outermost mount points, and it just cleared my SSD ports and works great! GPU is nice and level.

This case is so well built that DB levels with all 10 fans running is quite low, and air flow is more than sufficient for proper temps both at idle and under full load stress tests. Pretty much no difference from the open front design of the Meshify C.

All in all, am I glad I got this case? HELL YES I AM. It looks great, performs great, and has all the room and options I need for both now and in the future.

I definitely recommend it!

The case seemed good and I like the aesthetic. Built my PC within a week of receiving the case. The last thing I did was remove the protective plastic from the glass panels and I immediately noticed multiple small chips in the large glass side panel. I contacted Amazon but was told to contact Lian Li because Amazon could not replace individual parts and I did not want to disassemble my entire PC to return the case. Lian Li is now refusing to replace the glass panel because they "can't see the damage." I will change my review if the situation is resolved, but it appears this company is not willing to stand behind their products.

Update: After days of back and forth and sending additional photos, Lian Li still claims they cannot see the issue but is finally willing to replace the damaged glass panel. Updating review to 4 stars. So far the case is great but it's disappointing that it takes a week of arguing to get a damaged part replaced.

I got this "compact" ATX case and these guys make seriously high quality stuff with an eye for detail. The case is about 1.5x the width of your standard ATX case, making it closer to a large box than a typical tower.

The extra width facilitates a machined aluminum mobo partition with PSU bracket on the backside to hide it and any 3.5" HDDs as well as any cables you don't want showing. The only thing I'm iffy on is the bottom mounted SSD 2.5" drive mounts, but even with those in use* you can install a vertical GPU riser if you want. It can hold two 360mm (three fan) radiators with room to spare. You can of course use any size radiator + fan combo in any of the three mount positions, but it appears max capacity is two 360mm rads and another 240mm radiator up top (three radiators total)**. Oh and it can house your RGB and/or fan controllers in a special mount slot, with lots of covert places to do custom mounting with velcro if necessary.

This beautiful case is also meant to mount small to large water tanks/reservoirs in several places, even next to the vertical GPU on the base panel (or so it looks). I always thought a pair of small but strong magnets on the bottom of the tank and on the outside bottom of the case would work in any mid-large ATX case and not effect any components or magnetic disc drives so long as they are a reasonable distance away like they would be here, but that would be dangerous and only attempted if you are a pro and know the risks of magnets and PCs.

Last but not least, the case RGB works with Razer Chroma software so no need for any third-party utilities from Lian Li. If you use MSI/Mystic Light compatible boards, the latest version of that now works with Chroma Studio. Of course you can use any mainboard and/or third-party software and tools you want, but since you use Chroma, may as well run it all through one app. All my fans, RGB, peripherals, controllers, everything, all controlled with Chroma and one software interface. Can't overstate how nice it is to not have to screw with several control interfaces or BIOS tools or remotes.

This case is built incredibly well, uses real tempered glass, and has sturdy metal and aluminum components. It has a very aethetically pleasing exterior with a clean, custom look and feel and is purpose made to show off a liquid cooling setup or other internal modding. I'll try to post pics of my Troll Green build once I decide on hard or soft tubing. This case will live through many hardware upgrade and is a modder's dream to build in.

*it looks like you may lose one SSD mount slot if your vert-GPU bracket is very large or has odd dimensions.
**the manual lists three rads as possible, but I'm using just one 240mm and one 360mm with fans in the remaining slots to move air up and down the case.﻿

First off this bad boy is big! Spacious and easy to access everything. I have not had one complaint from this tower. The manufacturers sent me everything in tip top shape. The glass panels were sealed and was even sent extra screws and parts just in case anything was broke. It is a very beautiful case and it’s also uniquely build. There is another 011 Lian li case but this one is the part 2 of the series they call this one the deluxe edition. They also just released a mini version of this case that is completely all white as well. Check it out if you need something smaller and which looks alike, that one was made for an all white build purpose like this one as well but some Of my build has black accents on but it’s not a big deal. Now back to my review. I Installed everything neatly in this system because the side plates have a compartment where you put all your cable management and hard drives. I left it a mess in the back lol because In the beginning I had so many Installations to do. So I had to wire everything first lol. But overall I made it look neat after everything was working. I have nothing but happiness when I finished this build. I wasn’t able to put an RTX card but I installed a 1080 TI for regular gaming and some streaming task. And ladies and gents let me tell you the temperature stays at 50 idle and the cpu stays around the 30-40 degree temperature. I used a Corsair radiator with double fans. I also used some cool master fans around my build and let me tell you wow, beautiful rgb. Once I turned this bad boy on. This tower makes any build look spectacular and ready to show off and display. But this Lian Li 011 deluxe tower is not space hungry. if you need space for hard drives and wires this thing is truly your friend when it comes to compatibility and storage. I definitely recommend it. Don’t lose out.

name: Miuzei Case for Raspberry Pi 4, Raspberry Pi 4 B Case with Fan 35mm, Pi 4 Model B 5V 3A Type-C Power Supply for Pi 4 B case, 4 pcs Aluminum Heatsinks Support Rpi 4B 8gb/4gb/2gb (No Raspberry Pi board)
description:
• Miuzei black acrylic case designed for protecting Raspberry pi 4 model b. It looks nice and light weight. ONLY compatible with Raspberry Pi 4.
  • Come with a large 35*35mm cooling fan and 4 pcs heatsinks keep your Pi’s CPU cooling faster and better even CPU in heavy load.
  • 3A USB-C Power Supply with 59 inch cable (ETL Listed) is designed and test for Raspberry Pi 4b.
  • Compatible with all ports, such as USB-C power connector, dual micro HDMI, Audio/Video, GPIO port, Camera Cable, micro SD card and more.
  • 1-Year warranty & lifetime technical support. Feel free to contact us; we always stand behind you.

reviews.review:
A slightly awkward build but seems to be the design for most of these units. Everything fit and all attachments work and are accessible.

Another review mentioned their micro-hdmi connector wasn't flush but this was not my experience and could be because of the shape of m-h cable adapter. It would be easy to use the included plastic foam to elevate the pi board a bit if this is a problem.

I used one of the screws to anchor one corner of the unit while building. This will work up and until the fan needs to be added which wil require it to be removed to accomodate (for building only)

This is a very well designed case. All the pieces fit perfectly around the components of the raspberry pi 4. The case is very sturdy and was easy to assemble. Once assembled it was easy to connect all the necessary cables. I am very impressed with this case and would recommend it to others
This was easy to assemble and the instructions took away any doubt everything you need is included,

Great case. I made one mistake of puting the final bottom level 180 backwards. This left me scratching my head, why my sd card was so hard to remove. I think pinching my sd card, hard with tweezers damaged my SD card unusable. But I put the bottom level the other way. Now my new SD card has a big access notch over it as it was ment to be. I will by this case again when I need one.

Product Design:
This Acrylic Pi 4 Case is a solid, well-built product while still being extremely small and very well detailed. The Fan fits perfectly and pulls the heat away from the included Heat syncs. This is simply a great looking product that works well for an outstanding price.

The Good:
- Solid Build with all the necessary parts to power, output video and keep the Pi 4 Cool
- Pi 4 board fits perfectly and looks great
- Case is completely silent on low as well as High Fan settings
- Rubber feet to help the case from slipping on surfaces
- Inclusion of 6’ micro to full HDMI cable and Micro to full HDMI adaptor

The Bad:
NONE

Conclusion:
An amazing performing Pi 4 Case with everything needed to fire up your Pi 4 and keep it cool. Do not hesitate on purchasing this unit, and it is worth every single penny.

Fast shipping from Amazon.ca as well. I received the case in less than 24 hours from ordering it

1. the case is formed by stacking of layers. Not so pretty.
2. it comes with a fan and power cord with switch
3. the instructions are simple and easy to follow.
4. The direction on fan is not mentioned in the diagram. not sure if they wanted to leave that choice to the owner :)
5. It is strange that the heat sink are not of exact size of the place it is going to stick to

i havent run any stress testing but the case would serve me all the needs if you just have the pi with you. so I am keeping it.

**** updated ****
Reducing the rating from 3 to 2 stars.
The voltage output is 5V @ 3A instead of 5.1V @3A (based on the official raspberry pi adapter for this model).

First of all, Pi 4 is fits very well, and this kit also included 35mm x 35mm Big fan that can be powered through 5v pins and it blows strong towards the raspberry board that cools down the pi very fast. The Charger rated 5v 3000mAh with switch on it also included in the box, it is enough to power for pi4. The kit also included 4pcs of the blue heatsink: bigger one for CPU, medium for wifi and the other small heatsinks are for the ethernet onboard. A bonus also includes a screwdriver so it can assemble the case. So far I really like this case kit because the quality is really good for the price and also includes additional accessories that I can use to maintain my Pi4. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who needs to cool down their pi4 and need a case.
Instructions claire et précise pour l'assemblage.

name: Miuzei Case for Raspberry Pi 4, Raspberry Pi 4b Case with Fan 35mm, with 5V 3A Power Supply, 4 pcs Heatsinks for Raspberry Pi 4 Model B 8gb / 4gb / 2gb - Support PoE Hat
description:
• ▶【Visibility Design】Highly Visible Acrylic Top Lid；You Can See the Running Status of Raspberry Pi 4 in Real-time and The Condition Of Parts of Inside The Case,The smoked tint top is a classy touch.
  • ▶【Split design/easy assembly】: 3-layer structure design, the upper cover and bottom can be disassembled separately to assemble other accessories, which is very convenient for users who often use GPIO&Camrea.
  • ▶【Dual Cooling System】Equipped with a 35 mm quiet fan (5500 rpm) and 4 × aluminium heat sink. This increases the cooling area and creates more airflow for quick cooling.
  • ▶【Easy access to GPIO and camera】：Miuzei Raspberry Pi 4B type chassis, each interface is fully adapted, and the external camera and GPIO expansion board can be perfectly matched.
  • ▶【ETL certified power supply】:5V 3A ETL Certificate Power Supply, Do Not Worry About Low Voltage and Current Instability. Universal USB-C Interface, Total Lenght：1.5m / 5ft.

reviews.review: Liked the price! Bought separate all would be twice the price. Easy to assemble and fits the Pi 4 nicely as a starter case. Power supply is a 3A USB C supply with a off/on power button on the cord. Heat sinks stick after removing the blue plastic from the double sided sticky tape. Fan mounts on the case which is already well ventilated. All purchased for my first Raspberry Pi 4. Works as intended and I could not be happier that I did not have to shop around separately for the included items.
Once assembled, this case is a good solid box. Assembly takes a few minutes more than other Raspberri pi boxes. Recommend it.

While it's not perfect (I always get a little nervous screwing into plastic), it's solid and decently designed. It's relatively simple to put together (the instructions aren't bad). It's plastic so while there's no passive cooling there's also nothing impeding Wi-Fi and Bluetooth communication. It has screw mounting holes for it you want to mount it on something. There's a bit of space between the top and bottom parts of the case to run ribbon cable out of in case you want to use the GPIO or camera.

Absolutely delighted with the case and the power adaptor. No issues at all in the assembly just to follow the 1 page pictorial instructions. Fan noise is minimal as I jumpered to low speed. Couldn't be happier and the price is just impossibl;e to resist buying.
The fan started to make weird noises after a month...

Love this little case. It's one of the best I've bought and it comes with everything, including a proper power supply, heat sinks and a fan. The fan is super quiet and you can choose 2 speeds. It was very easy to assemble (unlike many Pi cases) and came with simple instructions. Nice. Highly recommend.
Very nice looking case and easy to assemble. However, the fan didn't take long to start making noises.
great replacement and quiet fan - very easy to swap cases

Excellent valve for my Raspberry Pi 4. I liked that it came with everything I needed to assemble my Pi into a secure case. Would have liked the top to have been clear and a little more covering for the fan to prevent dust from entering. Fan seems to blow in instead of pulling heat out. But there are nice heatsinks included. I would recommend.

Considering that this comes with a power supply, it's a great value. The case is a good size and the fan is not too loud. This case is a good option if you don't need to regularly plug and unplug wires or cable to the GPIO pins, because that would mean unscrewing the top every time, or just leaving the top open or unscrewed. If you need to plug wires or cable to the GPIO pins and leave them plugged in, that will be fine, as they will fit through the gap underneath the screwed-in top. I have several Raspberry Pi 4's, and I bought one of these cases initially, then after evaluating it, I bought three more. I like it.

I really like this case, works well as a wall mount and the cooling is fine for my use of this Raspberry Pi. The one drawback is their choice of a 35x35x10mm fan. This is an odd size fan and it seems impossible to find a replacement for it that will allow you to use the PWM control via GPIO pins to let the RPi turn the fan on/off as needed. 40x40x10 PWM fans are readily abundant.

Hopefully they will over an update/upgrade to a 40x40x10mm PWM fan and top cover that matches.

Miuzei Raspberry Pi 4 POE HAT Case Kit

Purpose:
A case could be used for POE setup without compromise cooling and functionality.
Focus:
Cooling, Power Supply, Functionality-GPIO 40 pin cable accessibility, case.

Design:
This case is unique. The grey bottom piece on one side is slid in, the other side uses long silver screws to screw into the copper nut inside the case in the black colored middle part of the case shared with the top 4 screws. The maker could open and close the case infinite times without damaging the case and the case could be long lasting.

The middle black part has ventilation holes, the top piece and the middle piece has a gap in between to allow the camera, monitor and GPIO pin cables to stick out without problem.

The top cover and fan placement comparing to other pi cases is more in the center and higher, this is why it is designed for POE hat. When using a low profile POE hat, with extra height of space the fan is able to blow air into the gap between the hat and the modules like CPU, RAM, USB, NIC to cool them down; heat will not trap in between. Then blow out from the ventilation holes above the sd card slot.

Test:
Stock settings with Raspberry Pi OS

Room temp: 29c
Bare board 10 min idle temp: 58c
Bare board 10 min video stream temp: 75c

Reset to room temp wait for 30 min
Fan speed 3v3.
10 min idle temp: 42c
10 min video stream temp: 50c
Cool down in seconds after stream: 45c
10 min idle from stream: 42c

Pro:
In the test the cooling temperature shown with 16 degrees differences in idle and 25 degrees in video stream load. The fan produces close to 0 noise under 3v3.

Power supply with on/off switch, a case which could access GPIO, camera and display with POE hat without compromising much of the cooling efficiency.

Case is a bit flexible so when a cable is going between the top cap and the case, it will be elastic to let it pass without much pressure.

Case is higher compares to most other cases, gives more room to work with.

Cost yet effective.

Con:
Case could use a better color tone, like red, blue, yellow, orange for the middle part and the bottom could use black instead.

The supplied screw driver is useful but not magnetized.

No grill protection for the fan hole.

OverAll:
The Miuzei Raspberry Pi 4 POE Hat Case Kit is a well thought out designed piece with probably the cheapest(in price) material and achieved the highest result in terms of cooling and protection for a POE hat setup. Wish they would offer the kit bundled with an HDMI adapter or cable. Personally I would prefer this case over most other cases out there due to better cooling and more space for options to wiggle around.
Gr8 Gr8 Gr8 Quality

name: Thermaltake Tower 500 Vertical Mid-Tower Computer Chassis Supports E-ATX CA-1X1-00M1WN-00, Black
description:
• Vertical design with 3 pieces of 4mm tempered glass panel
  • Motherboard Support: Up to E-ATX 12*12
  • Fan Support: up to Eleven 120 mm Fans
  • Radiator Support: up to 360 mm on the Side
  • Drive Support: up to 1. Eight 3.5” HDD or 2. Four 3.5” HDD+ Eight 2.5” SSD

reviews.review: Building in this case is a breeze. I got room for a 4070 without having to remove the panel where the PSU sits. A+
Wanted a different look for my pc, this was perfect. Excellent quality, lots of room, fairly easy to assemble. Really like it.

This thing is huge. Offers a ridiculous amount of space for any setup. You can see in my pictures the difference in size between a standard tower and this absolute unit. I needed to a fit a 4080 and this does it nicely. If you have a 360mm liquid cooler, it will ONLY fit on one side of the case (right). 240mm (pictured) has many more options but I fit it to the top.

Some things to note, PCI connected cards are vertical as opposed to the standard horizontal position. I find this to be an advantage since the 4080 is so long, the stress is on the metal bracket rather than all along the length of the card. I still have a sag bracket but you may need more than the standard height if you elect to remove one of the bottom panels. It does take some getting used to since the top of the box gets cluttered with wires but is hidden when all buttoned up.

Almost every piece is removable. The large glass panels, the vented grills on the bottom, the top grate, its basically a giant lego piece. The frame flexes more than I'd like when the large panels aren't installed and the box is being moved. With the motherboard and other devices screwed down, it makes me extremely undercomfortable at the flex that will be transferred to the devices when moved without the panels.

I turned every fan to intake except on top where the hot air will exhaust. So far, works like charm with custom cardboard shroud and fans that exhaust the hot air outside in warmer weather. During the winter, the PC doubles as a space heater...

I like the case but i am one who like the fitment to be perfect. when asembled there is a gap visable on both sides. this gap is between the optional floor in the case and the side window. he gap is about a inch and 1/2 and you can see into the bottom of the case. I ended up fixing this buy putting it a piece of vinyl wrap on the glass plenty of airflow in the system even with a 360 rad. one of the better cases out there and with up to 11 fan mounts.

I love my new mini fridge. The easily removable glass panes and the spring release top panel are very convenient for making quick changes and cleaning. The case itself has a lot of room for fans, I figure two fans on the bottom front grill, 3 fans on either side of the case with the provided radiator mount, and 2 fans at the top of the case. If you’re creative you’ll get another radiator mount and put 3 more fans on the other side of the case for 10 total fans. Also, the back of this thing has enough room for about 135 hdds /ssds really can’t go wrong.

massive case for multiple applications, Im using this with Proxmox , to virtualize a couple of old physicall machines and setup TrueNas, with a full setup, 6 disks in a DAC setup to the VM itself and plenty of pcie cards(usb 3.0 , 10gbe, gpu and FXO card). I was trying to get the 900 version(even the 500 version is way big), but is to big for my desk or even my homelab. Its a great modular case, you can actually play around with a lot of configuration, but if you are going the "low budget way), this is not a great choice. The only way you can actually utilize this in full or effectively , will be to use full spec hardware. My recommendation is to go with the 200 version for an proper Mini/Micro-ITX build (you need to work a lot to try the same thing in the 100 version even for the Mini size motherboard) ...

It looks nice, the design is very good but realize that this is a HUGE case. Its not as long as other cases you have seen but its much taller than your normal case. The overall design of this case is good. There is plenty of space for everything. Unfortunately, the best setup for fans in this case calls for negative pressure within the case. This typically leads to dust coming into the case vs positive pressure. For their sake, Thermaltake has put meshes absolutely everywhere which is good but i still expect dust particles to get inside the case due to the negative pressure setup with an AIO 360 cooler. The plugs for the case are at the top and covered by a mesh. This is not a big deal if the case wasn't soo big. If you are putting the case under a table, trying to get to the plugs for usb, monitor, ect, is quite difficult.

name: Carrying Case for Steam Deck, Carbon Black Series Protective Case for Steam Deck Accessories with AC Adapter Charger Storage, SD Card Holder and Stand, Portable Travel Carrying Bag for Steam Deck Console
description:
• ✔️MOVMAO Steam Deck Carrying Case - Designed for steam deck console gaming PC and steam desk accessories, the carrying case provides daily safe protection, sturdy & durable, allowing you to store easily and travel friendly.
  • ✔️High Quality and Full Protection - Equipped with thickened EVA hard shell, the steam deck case could resist external extrusion, effectively preventing collisions and falls. And the groove design keeps it from pressing on the handle, the built-in fleece compartment protects the screen from scratches.
  • ✔️Upgraded Storage Space - Steam deck case space provides secure storage room for some Steam Deck accessories like Charger, charging cable, power bank,It is also built with SD card slots and mesh pocket,can hold small accessories,perfect design for your steam deck.(size 13 x 6 x 3.5in, storage space: 6.3 x 4.3 x 1.3in)
  • ✔️Stand Base & Double Zipper Design - The case for steam deck built-in foldable stand base design provides a better gaming experience,You can adjust the proper position with Velcro straps,The double zipper design with good closure ensures that accessories do not fall out.
  • ✔️Fashionable Travel Bag - This travel case effectively protects the steam deck while taking into account the aesthetic needs of going out. It is particularly fashionable and cool to carry, showing your cool trend of fashion technology. This is the perfect gift for anyone who have steam deck.

reviews.review:
Looking for a case that's as tough as your Steam Deck skills?
Look no further than the Carbon Black Series Protective Case! This case has everything you need to keep your Steam Deck safe and sound, including storage for your AC adapter, SD cards, and even a handy little stand. And if you're on the go, this portable carrying bag has got you covered.

It's the perfect accessory for the serious Steam Deck gamer, and at only $99, it's a steal! Don't let your Steam Deck get roughed up.

Short and sweet review: really great protection for the Steam Deck. Not "padded" with foam but rather uses a formed EVA insert that's mostly hollow and suspends to device to help absorb any shocks and bumps. Lots of extra room for accessories - this makes a great on the go solution. Nearly top marks with only a point off for cost given how simple a product it is.

This is a great case for any Steam Deck owner! The case is a semi hard shell design, which retains its shape fairly well with just enough give. The zipper is a dual model, so you can open/close from either direction.

The interior is lined with supple material to protect your device and items that you are storing. You can carry several SD cards, charger and other attachments that you may have for your Steam Deck. The deck fits nice and snug due to the molded casing inside.

It's a very nice case, doesn't cost all that much and is a valuable investment for your Steam Deck!

Most of this case feels like the stock Deck case. It is slightly thicker, under 1 inch.

The added space is used as a storage cubby in the middle of the base of the case, under where the Steam Deck fits. One thing I noticed is that the pocket actually is quite large and is a very obvious area to put accessories, charger, and even the dock in. It fits all those as well.

The interior is also very similar, its a soft fabric, with enough padding. The screen cover is soft and seems to work as intended.

Overall, I am happy with this storage case, personally I find that it is less of a travel case (I use a kickstand case with hard front cover, PD charger and USB-C cables) but more of a general storage and travel case when you NEED to bring everything (USB-C dock, charger, cables).

this case is an excellent upgrade over the stock case. i was just on a trip using the stock case and i was constantly afraid of losing my SD cards when i opened the case in the airport or plane and it didnt have any space to store proper charging cables, or a USB hub so i could play on a TV when i got to my destination. this case solves all these problems. its the same size as the stock steam deck case but its slightly thicker to make room for more storage space. i can easily store the charging cables, USB hub with room to spare and the folding screen protector in the case can hold many SD cards securely.

This case is very solid. Well built
Excellent quality hard case.
It came with an adjustable strap that makes it easy to carry.
It’s perfect for travelling with.

Wow this is not a bad case for the price which is Compatible with steam deck and is also a very solid hard cover shell which will definitely give a person game some protection from damage in my eyes which i like using products like this when I go traveling as i always look to buy a carrying case when it comes to buy a game console of any kind because is does help at giving a person game protection which this also comes with straps so if you walking I find it makes it easyer to walk with carrying it that way and in my eyes products like this if there great quality like this are always 5 stars 🌟 to me in my eyes ..THANK YOU FOR READING 📚 MY REVIEW 📚

Title says it all, this case is purpose built specifically for the Steamdeck not the Ally. For the Steamdeck it is an excellent case, I was hoping it would workout for the Ally but unfortunately not. Not the sellers fault so still leaving it as 5 starts as it really is a nice case, especially for the money.

Der Großteil dieser Hartschalentasche ist dem originalen Deck-Case ähnlich. Sie ist jedoch etwas dicker, jedoch nicht mehr als 2,5 cm.

Die zusätzliche Fläche wird als Stauraum in der Mitte des Taschenbodens genutzt, unter dem Platz für das Steam Deck. Es ist aufgefallen, dass das Staufach sehr geräumig ist und ein offensichtlicher Ort für Zubehör, das Ladegerät und sogar das Dock ist. Alle diese Dinge passen problemlos hinein.

Das Innere der Tasche ist ebenfalls sehr ähnlich, mit einem weichen Stoff und ausreichender Polsterung. Der Bildschirmschutz ist weich und scheint seine Funktion zu erfüllen.

Zusammenfassend bin ich mit dieser Aufbewahrungstasche zufrieden. Persönlich empfinde ich sie eher als Aufbewahrungstasche als Reisetasche (ich verwende eine Ständerhülle mit harter Frontabdeckung, PD-Ladegerät und USB-C-Kabeln), aber sie eignet sich gut als allgemeine Aufbewahrungs- und Reisetasche, wenn man alles (USB-C-Dock, Ladegerät und Kabel) mitnehmen möchte.

Meine Eindrücke und die von mir gefunden Vor- und Nachteile dieses Produktes fasse ich für alle, die nicht so viel lesen wollen, nachfolgend kurz zusammen:
+ Design schlicht, schwarz, sieht gut aus
+ gute Verarbeitung und scheint nach ersten Verwendungen auch recht robust zu sein
+ es passt das notwendigste rein, was man für unterwegs braucht (Ladegerät, Kabel, meine Mini-Tastatur und natürlich das Deck)
+ das Display ist innen gut geschützt, es wackelt auch nichts
+ zumindest beim Steam Deck werden hier nicht wie bei anderen Angeboten die "Joypads" dauerhaft gedrückt, sondern gehen gut in die dafür vorgesehenen Öffnungen

o theoretisch kann man dieses Case auch "umfunktionieren" für andere Decks. Ab Werk passt es nur für das Steam Deck. Da der die Hartschalen-Hülle aber sehr stabil ist wäre es potentiell auch für andere Decks denkbar. Man müsste nur das innere heraustrennen und dann mit Schaumstoff auskleiden, dann halt die entsprechende Form herausschneiden. Gut, das dürfte etwas Arbeit sein, aber nur so eine Idee

- derzeit keine negativen Punkte ersichtlich

Fazit: Das Case ist gut verarbeitet und bietet guten Schutz für den Transport. 5 Sterne

Das Case macht auf den ersten Blick eigentlich einen guten Eindruck. Es erinnert an das originale Case nur mit ein bisschen mehr Platz und dafür schlechterer Qualität.

Das Case ist leider etwas unförmig. Ich bin mir nicht sicher woher diese Unförmigkeit kommt, aber was kommt mir so vor als wäre der Reißverschluss leicht schräg, wodurch Boden- und Deckenteil leicht versetzt sind, wenn man die Tasche schließt.

In der Tasche sind verschiedene Laschen eingenäht die über oder unter dem Steam Deck platziert werden sollen. Diese Laschen sollten alle mittig eingenäht sein, sind aber leicht versetzt.
- Die Lasche die das untere Fach vom Steam Deck trennt ist einigermaßen gut platziert; keine Einwände hier.
- Die beiden Bänder mit Klettverschluss, die das Steam Deck in Position halten sollen, sind beide in unterschiedliche Richtungen versetzt, wodurch das Band schräg über der dem Steam Deck liegt; das ist ein rein ästhetisches Problem und damit durchaus zu verkraften.
- Die Lasche, die über dem Steam Deck platziert wird ist hier das größte Problem. Sie ist in meinem Fall ca. einen halben cm nach rechts versetzt, was dazu führt, dass sie den rechten Analogstick leicht zur Seite drückt. Ich möchte allerdings nicht, dass der Analogstick kontinuierlich belastet wird, während sich das Steam Deck in der Tasche befindet, weshalb ich die Tasche vermutlich nicht verwenden werde.

Ein weiterer Negativpunkt ist das Fassungsvermögen. Laut Produktbeschreibung finden hier Netzteil, Dock und Kopfhörer gleichzeitig Platz, was leider nicht der Fall ist. Das originale Netzteil passt, je nach Model bekommt man ggf. auch noch Kopfhörer unter, aber ein Dock passt nie im Leben mit in die Hülle, insbesondere nicht wenn man sein Netzteil mitführt. Hier handelt es sich einfach nur um irreführende Produktangaben.

Leider kann ich das Case niemandem empfehlen. Das originale Case, das ja beim Steam Deck mitgeliefert wird, ist sehr viel hochwertiger und liefert lediglich ein bisschen weniger Stauraum. Ich bleibe jedenfalls beim originalen Case.

Dieses Produkt erfüllt alle Erwartungen und hat auch eine gute Qualität, an der ich nichts auszusetzen habe. Leider ist der Preis nicht angegeben, sodass ich diesen nicht bewerten kann. Somit verbleibe ich vorerst bei guten vier Sternen.

name: Cooler Master MasterBox MCB-B320L-KGNN-S02 Micro-ATX with Dual ARGB Fans, DarkMirror Front Panel, Mesh Front Intake Vents, and Tempered Glass Side Panel
description:
• Mesh Intakes Large mesh intakes span each side of the front panel to provide additional airflow to system
  • Dual ARGB Fans Two pre-installed 120 millimeter ARGB fans can be managed by the motherboard connected by the included splitter to create a comprehensive ARGB lighting system. Clearance - GFX is 344mm
  • Tempered Glass Hardware custom-loop cooling or the pure pride of showing off the build in panoramic view through an edge-to-edge tempered glass side panel
  • Adaptable Drive Cage The drive cage is movable able to shift toward the front to accommodate for PSU space backwards to provide additional radiator space or even completely removed

reviews.review: good airflow. durable. good cable management

As my first build, I think it is a high quality case. It came with 2 ARGB fans, that were quite complicated to setup, my motherboard did not have an ARGB header so I had to use the reset switch with the controller, leading to less customization of the fans, but still good looking fans overall with about 10 presets bound to the reset button when you use the controller. The cable management room was good, although there could be a bit more room at the back of the case. There were many routing spots that were all good, although I would like one at the front of the case above the power supply for the graphics card. The airflow is very good, although once I get the money I am likely going to buy a 3 pack of fans, for the top and back. The PCIE cover brackets are very hard to manipulate and you cannot put them back, so when I made the mistake of taking out the first one instead of just second and third slots for the graphics card it led to an open hole into the case. It doesn't come with dust filters on the top. It is a fantastic looking case only with these very minor drawbacks. I would give it a solid 8/10.

Once your power supply is in, you CANNOT screw in your SSDs. In fact, I have to put them free floating on top of my hard drives because the 2.5" slots are simply impossible to work with. Otherwise, this case is beautiful, especially for the price! A steal if you're willing to make some sacrifices and cut your fingers a little bit trying to put it together
While it's advertised as a micro-atx case, it feels really big and durable, which I appreciate. This made the build process extremely easy, and the extra rgb fans in the front just adds so much more.

The case is good for its price. It has a good build quality and is quite easy to build in. The downside of the case is that you will need to break of the PCI slots for your GPU, so be careful for which one you take a part or you will have a hole.
An excellent case for today’s hot CPU’s. This case has excellent airflow…..lots of room for components…….and areas to hide wiring from view.
Jeux
The included case fans were pretty loud though but the rgb was worth it

Hello!

This is a great case, I believe. But, I do have some problems with it. Concerning the materials, concerns with airflow, and a problem with the particular purchase that I made.

I want to first say that the layout is pretty alright. It has great I/O, and it looks great. Cable management is made easier with areas for zipties, which the case provides you with. I personally got the acrylic version, and I believe that was the wrong move. If anyone buys this case, I recommend the mesh version, not the acrylic. However, it looks great nonetheless. It comes with a mesh filter for the top, if for some reason you decide to suck air through the top of the case, which probably isn't the best choice. The preinstalled fans run silent, which is great however I can't tell if the airflow I feel is due to low RPM, or the fact that the fans are too close fo a solid surface than I would appreciate.

Now for the issues I have with the case. The acrylic version specifically for my first point. You see, Cooler Master decided to place the fans rather close to the front acrylic. Which wouldn't be a problem if it was mesh and not acrylic. I personally think there was much less ventilation being used than was available, I guess this was an attempted placebo affect. Next up, I personally dislike the acrylic, because it's acrylic. It's very easy to scratch, which results in it looking bad. Something I admittedly should've thought about before purchasing it. With the combination of reasons, I beg you to get the mesh version and not the acrylic.

Lastly, this is a personal thing that is very likely to be an isolated issue. The two front fans arrived dead. I didn't knock a star off for this reason, but it is something that should be kept in mind. If this is a known issue, make sure you have a spare fan for diagnosis. To determine if it really is the fans on the case, or if you need to look at your motherboard.

In the end, I think this is a decent case. And if you are looking at this case, I recommend you look at the mesh version instead of the acrylic. It's a great step up from Cooler Master's MasterBox QL300, but only if you go mesh.

Up front, I'd like to say this is a great case...with some issues. None of these issues would stop me from purchasing again, but hopefully I can help prepare you before you buy this (Which you should).

First thing you should know is that the build and quality for the price are on par. I spent months researching and hunting deals that led me to this one. Sturdy frame, decent preinstalled rgb fans, mesh filters, adjustable harddrive case, tempered glass, air flow channels on the front panel and plenty of room for expansion even in a MATX case.

Now for the issues: you'll definitely be tight on room when dealing with cable management. The rear panel compartment is tight, no biggie, but you'll need to be on your "A" cable management game. And the preset cable management job you start off with doesnt exactly help. #2 is the instruction manual. Very vague especially with connecting the RGB fans. The rgb configuration can throw off a 1st time builder like myself but I'm sure you'll be able to resource for the right answer. #3 I get that this case is made for multiple MoBo sizes, but this case is advertised as a MATX box, yet the openings to feed your cables through do not match up easily to an MATX Motherboard. #4 I learned how to build PCs watching youtube videos and they typically build in a specific order. MAKE SURE TO START WITH THE CASE MANUAL INSTRUCTIONS FIRST. There are some things like removing expansion slots that will drive you mad if you've already installed your MoBo. Once you complete the "prep" stuff from the manual, you can follow along with most youtube builds with ease. I learned the hard way.

Overall this case is great, and obviously you'll have to play the tech lottery with DOA parts, but if you get a functional system you'll be happy!

Listen, I like it. It hasn't failed on me.

Pros:
Spacious (This things fits my 6900xt reference just fine)
Comes with 2 front case fans that aren't too noisy
Easy to take apart (tempered glass, front panel, back panel)
RGB (because.. lights)
Tempered glass so you can look at your bright shiny things

Con
Cable management is a pain (could be a "me" thing, but it's pretty tight back there)

I bought this case for my first build last year (5600g build) and it hasn't failed yet. Through my nervous reopening and upgrading parts (yeah, I still get nervous opening up my built system), it's still running fine.

I recommend

So ive read some reviews and alot of people mention the lack of airflow, I personally havent ran into this problem myself, though when I first got it both fans that came stock worked but only one's RGB was working so I contacted Coolermaster nd they sent me a new fan. Also had another 120mm fan from a older tower that I added to the top so 3 in takes (1 top, 2 front) and one exhaust (back) and my temps range between 35°-60° for my CPU and between 35°-70° for my GPU. My specs are,
-Ryzen 5 2600
-EVGA GTX 1070 SC
-Corsair Vengeance LPX 2x 8GB 3200mhz RAM
-Auros B450 M mobo

Only other possible downside is if you were looking to SLI gpu's this case wont allow it but that could be a combination w/ my MOBO too. Other then that I love this case, its sexy, sturdy and does everything I want it to do! The front panel is pretty basic (Mic/head phone jack, reset, power and 2 usb ports) but w/ it combined w/ my MOBO's IO in the back its perfect for me! Would totally recommend this to a first time builder or another gamer looking to upgrade or change their case w/ a budget/medium/lower high end gaming build!

First of all it's a big case. But don't think that means it can take a full size atx motherboard it can't. Your gonna be buying a micro atx and it barely fits. The main attraction to this is the led lighting system you can plug it and have pretty lights. Not something I am into personally but there you go. The power supply is on bottom. As are the bays for the hard drive. You are meant to put screws into your SSD and place them in case holes. No they won't stay and will soon be flopping about. Finally expect it to weigh a ton. I'm not a small guy and horsing this around is a workout. The layout is just wrong it challenges every time you could do without another challenge and finally - no cdrom place which may be standard these days but a disappointment to me.

reviews.review: Online reviews rate this case very highly, and rightly so. It's a bit smaller than the Obsidian 800D it replaced, but more usable room. The white version is less imposing than the black. Even with front mounted fans, my RTX4090 has over three inches of clearance. And lots of room in the back for cable management. Great case.
I like the space for building inside. Won't have problems putting a 4090 inside.
Je voulais une grande tour avec un ventilation d'air pour installer plusieurs fans. Superbe tour , je le recommande fortement.
Easy to install, personalize, and modify. Great airflow and cable management options.

Absolutely love this case, I will post once my build is complete. It is large and high quality metal. Lots of room for pretty much any kind of build. Plus the white is awesome all these other cases are a boring black and have a ton of plastic. I bought a 3d printer from amazon and now have my case themed. Even with the hot humid weather here the system stays below 35C , buy static fans to keep things cooled. Might buy another to build a pc for 3d rendering.

I had a 5000D prior to this one and it is an improvement in every way from it. It is a full tower case designed to be used for any purpose as it will fit all of your ideas inside of it. The side panels open up easy enough but won't open on its own. Fits a 420 AIO at the top. Can mount like 12 coolers if you really wanted to. Looks beautiful, love the white version personally. If you are into full tower cases, look no further.

J'ai mis 4 étoiles pour le bruit car le réglage par défaut est plutôt focus sur les performances en refroidissement que pour le niveau de bruit et les filtres antipoussières n'aident pas trop pour le bruit (mais réellement très efficace pour la poussière).

13900Kによる発熱対策として購入しました。
第一印象は「重い！！」です。フルタワーですから大きいのは当然としてとにかく「重い」です。
しかし反面とても堅牢です。強引に力を加えてもびくともしません。作りも中華製とは一線を画しています。標準で48cm三発のフロントファンとリアファン。私はこの前面ファンをコルセアのiCUE H170iのファンと付け替え（吸気）、本機標準装着のファンは天板側に排気用としています。ケース自体が大きいので取付けも楽でした。初心者はこのぐらいの大きさのケースの方が適しているかもしれませんので初心者用の評価は星5つとしました。
裏側配線スペースはもう少し深さが欲しいとも思いますが、まあこれぐらいで問題は無いでしょう。
発熱量の大きいCPUはファンはもちろんですが、ケースも本機のようにフルタワーとした方が何かとストレスが無いと思います。
軽さだけは星2つとしましたが、総合評価は星5つ。重量はやむを得ないと考えたからです。
いいケースだと思いますよ。

Molto spazioso bel flusso d aria in poche parole temperature bassissime
Approvato a pieni voti

Das Corsair 7000D Airflow bietet Platz im Überfluss und ist vor allem durch den großzügig bemessenen Raum über dem Mainboard und rechts davon, hervorragend für den Einbau einer Wasserkühlung geeignet, ohne zu wenig Platz zu haben, um die Strom- oder Datenkabel an das Mainboard anschließen zu können, wie es leider bei vielen anderen Gehäusen der Fall ist. Die Lüfter- bzw Radiatoren-Einbauplätze vorne, im Deckel und an der linken Seite, lassen sich alle durch das Lösen weniger Schrauben komplett entnehmen, so dass man die Radiatoren und Lüfter bequem außerhalb des Gehäuses montieren kann und diese dann nach Montage wieder ins Gehäuse einsetzen kann. Die Verarbeitung des Gehäuses ist einwandfrei und massiv, welches sich auch im Gewicht niederschlägt, das schon ohne Komponenten 18,7 kg beträgt. Das Kabelmanagement ist praxisgerecht gelöst und sorgt mit genug Fixierungs Möglichkeiten für eine saubere Kabelführung.

Mich hat die Verarbeitung, die durchdachte Flexibilität, das Raumangebot und die Qualität dieses Gehäuses überzeugt, so dass ich es wieder kaufen würde

What can you say about this processor that hasn't already been said. Just know you need a good cooler on it, because it does get HOT! Performance is great and with Intel's XTU app it is easy to overclock and achieve even more.

This is a great cpu, period.
*HOWEVER* get a thermalright contact plate to replace your mobo's socket clamp. This is a must have item to keep your cpu flat to make proper contact with your cooler. It's a 20 dollar part, installs in seconds and can lower your temps 10c easy.
Thank me later!
Superbe achat 👍

This processor performs well and is a solid performance upgrade from my old i7-6700K. According to HWMonitor, the CPU package hovers around 15W power consumption doing desktop tasks (web browsing / email / Office).

Compared to my i7-6700K (video card and PSU unchanged; new motherboard, ram, and heatsink&fan):
- System power consumption at idle and doing desktop tasks is about 5W higher than my 6700K in normal mode, or about 15W lower in “eco” mode in my motherboard’s settings
- Synthetic benchmarks (3dmark CPU Profile) indicate 2x performance for single-core processing and 4x performance for maximum threads
- Real-life video encoding is roughly 3x faster using PowerDirector

Note that this LGA1700 socket is known to allow some bending (this causes poorer contact with heatsink which may cause throttling). This can be remedied by installing a pressure plate (I bought a Thermalright LGA1700-BCF for around $12).

If you don’t need a built-in GPU, consider the i7-13700KF; the built-in GPU is nice to have but not always worth the premium. If you also don’t plan to overclock, consider the i7-13700F.

Processore AMD Ryzen 7 5800X (8C/16T, 36MB di cache, fino a 4,7 GHz max Boost)

📋 ⭐Descrizione del Prodotto⭐ :
Sò che chi compra questo tipo di processore sa esattamente di
cosa si tratta,tuttavia anche chi si approccia le prime volte
al cambio di un pc,attraverso le recensioni può farsi un idea
più chiara leggendo i pareri di chi l'ha comprato,mentre per i
dati puramente tecnici ci sono sempre le recensioni dei siti di
hardware con un infinità di test per tutte le esigenze.
in tutti i casi questo è un processore con otto core fisici e
sedici thread con una frequesza di base pari a 3,8 Ghz,con
un processo produttivo a 7nm e un boost clock che arriva fino
a 4,7 Ghz con un TDP di 105W e una temperatura di esercizio
definita sicura da AMD fino a 90°,dispone anche della tecnologia
PCI Express (PCIe) 4.0 e compatibilità con ram DDR4 fino a 3600Mhz

👩‍🎓Terminologia:
📌CORE FISICI
Con il termine core in informatica si intende tipicamente
il "nucleo elaborativo" di un microprocessore.
📌THREAD
Un thread in informatica,è una suddivisione di un processo in
due o più filoni(istanze)o sottoprocessi che vengono eseguiti
concorrentemente da un sistema di elaborazione a singlecore o
in multicore.
📌FREQUENZA BASE
E' la frequenza operativa minima alla quale lavora il processore
anche senza eseguire nessuna istanza/calcolo.
📌BOOST CLOCK
E' la frequenza operativa massima che un processore può raggiungere
a seconda dei processi che sta elaborando,questo boost clock è
raggiungibile in modo completamente automatico da un CORE alla volta
in modo alternato salvo modificare manualmente le opzioni del bios
della scheda madre e che da la possibilità di innalzare con le dovute
cautele la frequenza su tutti e otto i core simultaneamente;
quest'ultima operazione è comunemente chiamata "overclock manuale".
📌TDP
Il TDP è un'indicazione del calore (energia) dissipato da un processore
quando lavora a pieno carico(si misura in Watt).Si tratta del calore che
il sistema di raffreddamento dovrà smaltire per mantenere la temperatura
del processore entro una soglia limite.
📌Processo produttivo espresso in nanometri (nm)
è un processo produttivo della tecnologia dei semiconduttori,con cui
verranno prodotti i circuiti integrati a larghissima scala di integrazione(VLSI).
La fonderia TSMC ha realizzato in volumi i primi chip a 7nm nel corso del 2018
ed è attualmente il principale fornitore di processori con tale tecnologia.

Come si comporta il ryzen 7 5800x nei confronti della concorrenza?
il metro di misura con cui equiparare il 5800x di AMD per fascia di
prezzo e caratteristiche è l'INTEL i7 di 10°generazione 10700k e
quello di 11°generazione 11700k,potremmo considerare anche altri
processori di Intel aventi più core in quanto AMD ha fatto con il
Ryzen 7 5800x un lavoro così egregio in termini di performance che
potrebbe andare ad infastidire in determinati contesti anche processori
sulla carta più potenti e performanti,ma non è questa la sede per fare
paragoni a suon di dati,se volete approfondire ci sono una moltitudine
di comparazioni online,tuttavia almeno nei primi due esempi citati il 5800X
si assesta in prima posizione con un incremento di prestazioni su vari scenari
di utilizzo nell'ordine del 5/10% minimo fino ad un massimo del 20/25%.
Questi scenari includono indistintamente una media generale sia di giochi
che programmi professionali.
La piattaforma(scheda madre e chipset)di riferimento da me scelta per il mio
nuovo pc con R7 5800x è stata la Gigabyte aorus elite con chipset x570,
volendo avrei potuto ripiegare su una piattaforma con chipset x550 e non avrei
comunque perso ne la compatibilità con R7 serie 5000 ed un eventuale upgrade
a R9 serie 5000 ne avrei rinunciato al PCIe 4.0 ma ho preferito la x570 per una
moltitudine di funzioni in più legate ad esigenze personali.

Capitolo RAM DDR4 e compatibilità con i processori Ryzen:
Per la mia configurazione ho scelto 4 banchi di ram DDR4 da 8gb ciascuno con
frequenza di 3600Mhz e latenza cl.16 ma perchè?

La velocità della memoria DDR4 ha un impatto piuttosto marcato sulle prestazioni
dei sistemi Ryzen,non solo a causa del bandwidth;
La frequenza dell'interconnessione Infinity Fabric,la "rete" che permette ai vari
core e thread (i chip Ryzen sono basati su due CCX con quattro core ciascuno)
di "parlarsi" e amministrare i carichi,è legata proprio alla frequenza della DRAM.
A seconda dell'operazione e del core/thread chiamato in causa,può verificarsi una
latenza più o meno marcata che impatta sulle prestazioni finali,pertanto la velocità
della memoria DDR4 è quindi funzionale a ottenere il meglio dai chip Ryzen.
Altro aspetto da non sottovalutare è la "latenza" delle ram(il valore CL),più è bassa
e più le ram performano al loro meglio sempre relazionate al discorso di cui sopra,
siamo nell' ordine di un 3/5% come indice prestazionale,tuttavia è bene prestarci
attenzione quando si acquistano,ad oggi le CL16 hanno un buon rapporto prezzo/prestazioni
rispetto a ram con cl.15 o cl.14,scegliere ram con latenze superiori a cl.16 vanifica
prestazionalmente frequenze pari o superiori a 3600Mhz,salvo mettere mano al bios per
trovare il giusto bilanciamento tra frequenza e latenza.
Molti siti parlano anche di una sorta di "lotteria del silicio" con i Ryzen serie 5000,
in sintesi attraverso vari parametri in fase di test e tipi di dissipazione applicati
non tutti i chip della stessa famiglia e categoria raggiungono o addirittura superano
le specifiche del produttore,in questo momento i più smanettoni utilizzano un tool creato
ad hoc da alcuni programmatori per testare i propri processori ryzen,questo tool restituisce
dopo una moltitudine di test legati al carico,frequenza,overclock e temperatura un "parere"
sul tipo di chip testato e ne consigliano i valori da impostare manualmente nel proprio
bios per poter portare il processore ad una condizione di stabilità e prestazioni
ottimale,è un discorso un pò più complesso di come enunciato ma state certi che di appassionati
che testano e ne parlano nei vari forum internazionali ce ne sono tantissimi.
Il tool in questione si chiama: "Clock Tuner v.2.0"
e il risultato dato al mio chip è il seguente:
DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS
AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-Core Processor
CPU VID: 1055
CPU TEL: 1021
Max temperature: 67,8°
Energy efficient: 4,29
Your CPU is GOLDEN SAMPLE
💥 in sintesi il massimo del voto! 💥
in ultimo e poi concludo,come sistema di dissipazione,vi ricordo che il ryzen 7 5800x non ha
incluso in confezione nessun sistema di dissipazione,ho scelto il DeepCool castle EX 360mm,
trattasi di un dissipatore a liquido di tipo AIO con 3 ventole da 120mm non illuminate
(mi piace la discrezione) e avente una pompa di nuova generazione anti perdite con un anello
luminoso ARGB all'altezza della cpu con un effetto "specchio infinito",non è proprio economico
tuttavia è molto efficiente ed esteticamente discreto rispetto a soluzioni a Torre di imponenti
dimensioni ed esteticamente meno eleganti.
Nelle foto allegate si possono vedere le temperature di esercizio durante alcuni stress test con
cinebench R23,la curva di velocità delle ventole è stata da me impostata per avere una resa
dissipante proporzionale e crescente in base alle temperature,tuttavia ho rinunciato a qualche
grado in meno in condizioni di pieno carico a favore di un rumore meno invasivo in quanto ho il
case del pc sulla scrivania ad altezza di orecchio,comunque siamo abbondantemente sotto i limiti
massimi dichiarati da AMD.

📦 ⭐Confezione⭐ :
Premetto che il mio esemplare è stato acquistato sull'Amazon warehouse,quindi usato ma
"Ottime condizioni",me la sono rischiata in quanto l'usato di Amazon ha le stesse garanzie
di un prodotto pari al nuovo e mi è andata bene,la scatola era integra come da foto allegate,
il processore era in perfette condizioni,non presentava nessun residuo di pasta termica ne
aveva alcun piedino piegato,addirittura era presente il bollino adesivo identificativo del
processore e la confezione aveva ancora tutti i sigilli del caso; Grazie e brava Amazon 👍

🚚 ⭐Spedizione⭐ :
A cura di Amazon,quindi rapida,sicura e conforme agli standard dell'azienda

📉📈 ⭐Considerazioni finali⭐ :
Praticamente ho già detto tutto quello che pensavo nei commenti sopra,ottimo processore,
venendo dalla prima generazione di ryzen(quelli del 2017) il balzo prestazionale è stato
palesemente evidente,certo tanta potenza e prestazioni hanno comportato un prezzo abbastanza
più alto delle precedenti versioni e anche superiore ai diretti concorrenti che stanno giocando
la carta dei listini prezzi per farsi preferire,tuttavia,se la situazione non fosse così
disastrosa in termini di disponibilità,avremmo già visto come in passato una guerra dei prezzi tra
le due aziende leader,a mio avviso questo processore,ad oggi 21 maggio 2021,sarebbe dovuto costare
tra i 360 e i 380 euro,ma la scarsa disponibilità come detto è difficile per qualsiasi componente
lanciato sul mercato in questo anno e 1/2 di pandemia,chi cerca una scheda grafica sà di che parlo.
tuttavia quà stiamo analizzando questa CPU e per il lavoro svolto da AMD,andando a scalzare anche
l'ultimo trono di INTEL e cioè l'ambito "gaming" è inequivocabile che AMD abbia fatto un "LAVORONE"
Se fate lavoro+gioco+streaming questo è il processore adatto,se volete solo giocare e poco altro senza
le esigenze di tempi ristretti e prestazioni da top di gamma si può ripiegare anche su un più che valido

J'ai acheté ce processeur AMD Ryzen 7 5800X pour remplacer mon Ryzen 9 3900X en avril 2023.
