Update Mayo 2023
=================
Después de unos días de uso algunos mensajes de error se evidenciaban en Windows relacionados a memoria, después de leer las especificaciones de mi core i9 13900k y de la motherboard asus Z690-F encontré que las velocidades recomendadas eran de 4800MHZ para 128Gb así que ajusté la frecuencia de 5200Mhz a 4800MHZ con el XMP habilitado y los errores se fueron, de cualquier manera contacté al soporte de CORSAIR con el tema y justo el 5 de Mayo ASUS liberó una nueva versión del CHIPSET Versión 2251.4.2.0 la descripción dice "Improve system Stability & Security" asi que actualicé y subí las velocidades de la memoria a STOCK (5200 MHZ) con XMP, he realizado benchmarks y pruebas de velocidad con AIDA64 y todo va excelente después de 9 días de uso rudo, agrego una imagen con el benchmark obtenido con los 128GB de la memoria CORSAIR.

Update Abril 2023
=================
Crecí mi equipo a 128GB por necesidades de tener mis laboratorios y servers funcionales y mas que fascinado con las memorias, excelente respuesta con Linux y Oracle, te proveen bastante estabilidad.
En mi experiencia una vez que las coloqué el equipo no reiniciaba y se quedaba la luz naranja de la Motherboard encendido, tuve que deshabilitar el XMP del Bios y colocar el valor a AUTO para que el equipo pudiera hacer el Boot, una vez que las memorias son reconocidas puedes colocar nuevamente
la función XMP en el Bios y automáticamente se colocan las velocidades a 5200 MHZ.
Ampliamente recomendadas estas memorias para tu ensamble.

Octubre 2022
=================
Compré las memorias para un upgrade de mi ensamble usando un procesador Core i9-13900k con una motherboard ASUS ROG STRIX Z690-F Gaming. Me gusta ensamblar yo mismo mis equipos y busqué una motherboard que tuviera el soporte para la 13va generación de Intel encontrando esta que menciono. Realicé el ensamble en el case Cougar Conquer 2, el ensamble de procesador, cableados, conexiones y enfriadores súper fácil siguiendo los manuales. El dolor de cabeza vino cuando una vez instaladas las memorias CORSAIR el equipo no era capaz de bootear y prendía la luz naranja indicando problema en el VRAM es decir en las memorias CORSAIR DDR5, pensé que quizá las memorias venían dañadas o quizá yo hice alguna conexión errónea por lo que decidí repetir mi ensamble completo =D. Una vez completado el error permanecía y ninguno de los manuales ayudaba con algún posible FIX para corregir el error. Después de ponerlas y retirarlas N veces empecé a preparar una devolución de las memorias porque todo indicaba estaban dañadas. Vi algunos videos en internet y encontré una guía para un problema similar que recomendaban aplicar un UPDATE del BIOS. Por mi falta de experiencia desmonté nuevamente todo mi ensamble y realicé el UPDATE del BIOS a través de la conexión trasera FLASHBACK que provee esta motherboard realizándolo sin ningún componente instalado, después supe que no era necesario haber desensamblado todo mi ensamble por 3a vez y pude haberlo realizado con todo instalado =D El update del BIOS tomó alrededor de 20 minutos y una vez concluido realicé el ensamble nuevamente y WOOW el booteo se hizó de manera correcta levantando mi ensamble. Ejecuté la función de Overclocking de Intelligence Overclock de ASUS y las memorias fueron ajustadas a correr a 5600Mhz (su velocidad nativa es de 5200Mhz), después de más de 1 mes de uso no he tenido ningún problema y estoy más que FELIZ con mi adquisición, súper recomendables estas memorias para tu ensamble. Yo adquirí 2 memorias de 32GB cada una y si en un momento por alguna necesidad decido llevarlo a 128GB no dudaré en adquirir este modelo de Memorias. Espero mi experiencia ayude a alguien más en su ensamble / Upgrade usando estas memorias de CORSAIR.

Die RAM Riegel sind wie beschrieben.
Um die volle Leistung abrufen zu können muss man ins BIOS, dafür gibt es viele Erklärungen im Internet.
Ich habe 4 x 16 GB DDR 5 auf einem MSI Pro Z790 P WiFi und es läuft alles einwandfrei.

Im very happy with this Corsair DDR5-5200mhz memory. It looks great on my mostly white build PC and I have it running at 5400 via a user configurable XMP profile in my Gigabyte z690 aero D-BIOS.

It was not obvious at first why it was running at 4800 and that I only seemed to have one XMP profile to set. but as I discovered you can have up to 3 xmp profiles once set under advanced memory settings and SPD (Gigabyte z690 aero D)

I'm sure this memory can be run at a higher frequency but that will involve changing voltages and timings which can be troublesome if not done correctly, and the BIOS will have to be reset.

You can check easily if you have the correct speed by going to Windows Task manager/Performance and Memory tab, or,download cpu-z app.

I will purchase another 64bg of this memory to give me a total of 128gb for my system, which will be useful for vst libraries and video editing etc. But this will more than likely require adjusting voltages, etc, to get the required speed.

Highly recommended.

UPDATE. I bought another pair of these sticks (black) for a total of 128gb

I got the 64gb Corsair DDR5-5200mhz kits in the black version for an excellent price; this was to add to my Corsair 64GB DDR5-5200mhz white kit for a total of 128gb for my system. I would have preferred the white version I previously bought for my PC build, but the black sticks were much cheaper than what I originally paid; it was a no-brainer.

I have these sticks and the white ones in an MSI z790 edge wi-fi motherboard. I had a Gigabyte z690 D aero, with 64gb white set in my original review , but I had to get another motherboard for various reasons.

With just two sticks in my motherboard I managed to get them running stable at 5400mhz. (XMP profiles), which was great, but when I added 4 sticks at 128gb, the fastest I could get was 4800mhz, that was both motherboards.

However, Recently MSI updated their BIOS for this board which included fixes for better memory compatibility, so, I decided to try get 5200mhz running again, and to my surprise it worked perfectly, for a while. But, even after passing a memory test and playing a few games without any problems, I got a windows green screen error when I was closing down an app. So then, I decided to try and get at least 5000mhz running, which I have them running at now, stable. Actually, they are running at 5067mhz.

I'm very happy with this speed and do not mind losing 200mhz from the speed they are supposed to run at. In fact, the speed difference when I had 64GB running at 5200 and beyond is actually quite negligible, according to various memory tests.

Overall, I think this memory performs well and is from a top tier brand, which means better compatibility with motherboards. With future BIOS updates, perhaps 128gb might run at 5200 and beyond, stable, here's hoping.

Highly recommended

UPDATE 2.

MSI released another BIOS update (7D91vH4) for my z790 wifi edge motherboard, which includes improved memory compatibility and many other updates. I updated it and adjusted the Dram frequency to 5200Mhz G2, while disabling the XMP profile, and it has been running stable while doing memory tests and playing games etc.

I9-13900k
MSI z790 wi-fi edge
Gigabyte RTX 4070 aero
Asus Essence STX II sound card
Kingston 1tb KC3000 PCIe 4.0 NVMe M.2 SSD
Arctic liquid freezer II 360 RGB AiO
Another 3 nvme drives and two ssd’s

reviews.review: Works well.

光らないDDR5メモリ
OCはせず、デフォルトで安定稼働しています。
メモリチェックしてもエラー等はなし。
クルーシャルやサムソンのより安かったので良かったのかな。
セットする向きを間違えなければ簡単。

You can’t go far wrong with Corsair ram, the quality shines through, performance is great, not earth shattering but plenty fast enough for the majority of users, and price is very competitive for 32gb or ram, it’s a no brainer.
Ddr5 5600 Expo, funciona perfectamente con ryzen 5 7600.

If you try to use the EXPO I / II settings it won't boot (C5 errors), it's only going to boot on auto settings at a speed of 3600Mhz. You can set it to EXPO 1 timing with at 1.35V you can get it to run at 4600Mhz stable. 4800Mhz will give you at C5 boot error and 4800Mhz at 1.4v will give you a E6 boot error. This is the same with both kits I purchased, which have two different firmware versions.

Hopefully when a bios with AGESA 1.0.0.9 is released the board won't be so picky about it's Ram. If not I'll probably wind up selling the kits and getting a different set from the the tested list. At the time I purchased the kits very few kits were listed in 64GBs, but it's still on me for taking the risk.

name: LinkMore DDR4 Memory Module (3200MHz 32GB (2x16GB), UDIMM - Desktop Memory)
description: • LinkMore DDR4 DIMM Memory Module

reviews.review:
Was an upgrade to an existing desktop installation, was quickly delivered and easily installed.

Man, remember the first time I installed RAM; PC XT (8088/NECv20) used an ENTIRELY different memory bus. ;-)

Bought this to upgrade our custom, passively cooled, SFF, general-purpose home theatre PC and this stuff works great. Paired with an underclocked i5 6600, 500GB SSD, and a SFF 1050 Ti, everything from video streaming to ‘heavy’ web browsing works flawlessly. While I wouldn’t recommend it for anything like gaming, this stuff is great for general usage.

Ram is something where you just want to have as much as you can afford & not worry so much about the speed & so forth. Faster IS better too if you can afford it, BUT, in Ram, you really want QUANTITY even more than speed.

This is non RGB Ram, nothing really fancy, but it looks nice & is a clean design that won't break your pocket book.

Speeds & timings are a little on the slower side but specs are good & everything works as it should.

Ram is usually something that goes bad years down the road if it DOES go bad, or unless you get a bad stick out of the box which is rare, so only time will tell on the durability of this Ram. But it's good out of the gate as it were.
Has a 5 year warranty if you have any issues with yours.

2 sticks of 8gb, a total of 16gb of Ram is enough for most every day uses & PC's. Even 8gb is usually adequate. The less Ram you have though, the faster it will "fill up" & the more you will need to do a full restart to clear it so your PC doesn't slow down.

16gb is a good place to start as far as capacity. I always like to get a MoBo that has 4 slots for Ram though, and start with filling 2 of the slots with half the capacity of the MoBo, and then you have the option to double that later on with matched Ram. ...It's really best to not mix & match Ram BTW. Try to get the same kind & capacity sizes when you do add some. At least be sure you match the timings to prevent issues.

This is good Ram though, especially if you're on a tighter budget.

This is a great price for RAM, it's no fancy names or anything extra, but it does exactly what it says it does! Great value for your $, definitely worth it, especially if your on a budget! It's really all you need!

I was pleasantly surprised the ram performed up to speck as advertised on my B450 motherboard without issue. Looks like new name cheapo ram it is confirmed running it at 2,666mhz indeed. This pleases me.

reviews.review:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600MHz memory kit is a compelling choice for users seeking both eye-catching aesthetics and high-performance memory for their gaming or content creation setups. In this review, I will share my experience with this memory kit, focusing on its design, performance, ease of installation, and overall value.

Design and Aesthetics:
The standout feature of the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is its stunning design. The sleek and low-profile aluminum heatspreaders not only enhance the overall aesthetics of the memory modules but also contribute to effective heat dissipation. The customizable RGB lighting offers an impressive range of vibrant colors and lighting effects, allowing users to personalize their setups and synchronize the lighting with other compatible Corsair products. Whether you prefer subtle illumination or want to create a mesmerizing light show, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL delivers on both style and visual impact.

Performance:
With a frequency of DDR4 3600MHz and low latency, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit provides excellent performance for demanding tasks. Whether you're gaming, editing videos, or running memory-intensive applications, this kit delivers responsive and smooth performance. The ample capacity of 32GB ensures seamless multitasking and the ability to handle resource-hungry tasks without experiencing any slowdowns. The high-quality memory chips and robust PCB design contribute to stability and reliable performance, even under heavy workloads.

Easy Installation:
Installing the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is a straightforward process. The memory modules fit seamlessly into most standard DIMM slots, and the XMP 2.0 support simplifies the setup process by automatically configuring the optimal memory settings. The Corsair iCUE software provides an intuitive interface for customizing the RGB lighting effects, allowing users to easily sync the lighting with other Corsair components and create a cohesive visual theme.

Compatibility:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is compatible with a wide range of motherboards and platforms, including both Intel and AMD systems. This ensures that most users can benefit from the exceptional performance and stunning aesthetics that this kit offers. It's always recommended to verify compatibility with your specific motherboard before making a purchase.

Value for Money:
While the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is priced at a premium, it offers excellent value for users who prioritize both performance and aesthetics. The combination of high-frequency memory, low latency, ample capacity, and customizable RGB lighting justifies the investment for enthusiasts and gamers looking to enhance their PC experience.

Final Thoughts:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600MHz memory kit strikes an impressive balance between style and performance. With its stunning design, exceptional performance, easy installation, and compatibility with a wide range of systems, this memory kit is a worthy choice for users looking to elevate their PC setup. Whether you're seeking top-tier gaming performance or a visually stunning workstation, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL delivers on both fronts.

Disclaimer: I purchased the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB DDR4 3600MHz memory kit independently and did not receive it as part of any specific program or incentive. My review is solely based on my personal experience and observations with this memory kit.

I recently purchased the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB RAM kit, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations in every way possible!

the performance of the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB RAM is outstanding. It has significantly improved my system's overall speed and responsiveness. Whether I'm running resource-intensive games or multitasking between multiple applications, this RAM kit handles everything with ease. The 32GB capacity ensures that I have more than enough memory to tackle any task without experiencing any lag or slowdowns.

What truly sets this RAM kit apart from the competition is its striking design. The RGB lighting effects on the Vengeance RGB Pro SL are simply breathtaking. The vibrant colors and customizable lighting options allow me to create stunning lighting profiles that match my setup's aesthetic. The aluminum heat spreaders not only provide excellent cooling performance but also add a premium touch to the overall design.

Installation was a breeze thanks to Corsair's user-friendly software. The iCUE software allows for easy customization of the RGB lighting effects, and it integrates seamlessly with other Corsair components in my setup. Additionally, the XMP 2.0 support ensures that the RAM is automatically optimized for maximum performance, saving me the hassle of manual tweaking.

Corsair's build quality is top-notch, and the Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB RAM is no exception. The modules feel solid and well-built, assuring me of their durability. Furthermore, Corsair's reliable customer support provides an added layer of confidence, should any issues arise.

# VERSIONE LUNGA (andare in fondo per quella breve):

Invogliato dal prezzo interessante ho acquistato un secondo blocco da testare con uno "identico" sempre 2x8 DDR4-CL18 Corsair abbinate ad un chipset X470. Mentre prima riuscivo tramite XMP a farle funzionare a 3600, ora con i 4 slot occupati non si riesce più. La configurazione 4x8GB è a mio parere da evitare se si volesse utilizzare il profilo XMP fornito dalla Corsair, anche se sono stessa marca e modello.

Dipende molto sia dal chipset della motherboard che dal tipo di CPU abbinata. Non solo. Dipende anche dalla "lotteria del silicio", ovvero dalla fortuna di trovare RAM con chip (di silicio) di miglior qualità.

Analizzando bene le memorie ho potuto constatare che a questo giro il DRAM MANUFACTURER è "Hynix" (senza alcun riferimento al DIE Revision) mentre l'altra volta "Micron Technology" con DIE rev. E

Questo fatto non implica il non funzionamento delle RAM, ma rende più "rognoso" spingerle ai valori dichiarati dall'XMP certificati, in presenza di CPU con limiti sulla gestione delle frequenze delle memorie. Per esempio un Ryzen serie 2000 gestisce DDR da 2933MHz, mentre un Ryzen serie 3000 gestisce DDR da 3200 MHz. In entrambi i casi si possono "anche" spingere le ram a frequenze superiori, ma va a fortuna.

Ecco che scegliere 4x8 o 2x16 potrebbe fare la differenza in termini di stabilità. Se con due slot occupati si riesce a tenere la RAM a 3600 MHz, con quattro (e alcune CPU su certe schede madri) la frequenza massima supportata cala a 3466 MHz (se va bene). Infatti per ora non posso testarle alla loro frequenza nativa, me le tengo comunque visto il prezzo. Lo sapevo che sono ram basilari.

Consiglio quindi di acquistare queste 3600 MHz se l'interesse principale è quello di espandere la quantità di memoria, anche in virtù di un prezzo decente. Sono a basso profilo, discretamente raffreddate, ma le considero per lo più RAM da utilizzo generico, anche gaming. Magari su altre mobo riescono a rispondere in maniera migliore.

Le 3600 MHz però sono più veloci!!! Non è così perché la frequenza non è il solo parametro da considerare. I timings infatti sono fondamentali per capire la reale velocità delle memorie. Queste hanno una CAS LATENCY (CL) che vale 18 (CL 18). Se le rapportiamo a DDR 3200 MHz da CL 16 scopriamo che hanno praticamente la stessa velocità. Per trasformare CL in nanosecondi si procede così:

(CL nativa) / (frequenza di utilizzo reale se supportata) * 2000 = ... ns

CL 18 / 3600 * 2000 = 10 ns
CL 16 / 3200 * 2000 = 10 ns

Caso migliore sarebbe poter spingere queste 3600 con CL 16:

CL 16 / 3600 * 2000 = 8.8 ns

Caso peggior invece è quando non regge timings più bassi e la cpu/mobo non riescono a tenere nemmeno la frequenza nativa (massimo 2933 o 3200 MHz)

CL 18 / 2933 * 2000 = 12,27 ns (più alto = più lenta)
CL 18 / 3200 * 2000 = 11,25 ns (più alto = più lenta)

Così è spiegato facile, ma i timings sono tutti collegati tra loro e richiedono approfondimenti e tanta lettura. Vale la pena cambiarli? Direi di no. Vale la pena farlo perché si ampliano le conoscenze ed è divertente spremere qualche fps o nanosecondo in più, ma la componente fortuna (su componenti di qualità base) è LA discriminante principale. Se siete sfortunati con i chip non c'è OC che tenga...

Questo per dire che le ram vanno certamente abbinate alla CPU che si vuole montare. Non ha molto senso comprare RAM con frequenza superiore pensando che "andrà più veloce". Se la CPU supporta massimo ram da 3200MHZ allora si comprano ram da 3200MHz. Chi vuole fare OC sulla RAM lo può comunque fare e una ram da 3600 (tenuta a timings standard) riesce a gestirlo tranquillamente; il problema però risiede nella "bontà" del chipset della scheda madre e nella fortuna di avere una CPU fortunata che digerisce ram più spinte in frequenza. Meglio se le ram hanno lo stesso manufacturer, DIE e stessa REV.

La differenza in gaming non è poi così marcata anche se qualche FPS in più non fa mai male. Sempre considerando che 5/10 fps partendo da una base di 120 fps è una cosa, mentre 5/10 fps partendo da 52fps è un'altra.

Per esempio facendo uno di quei test 3D (non faccio nomi) per le GPU si nota che impostando queste ram a 2133 MHz (CL15, 15, 15, 36@1,2V) il divario con la loro frequenza massima supportata 3600 (CL 18, 22, 22, 42@1,35V) è pressoché inesistente. Gli FPS medi (average) sono praticamente identici, ma cambiano leggermente (e positivamente) quelli minimi e massimi. Cambiano i test di lettura e scrittura, cambiano parecchio perché sono molto influenzati dalla frequenza e da timing spinti. Però nella realtà cambia molto aspettare 50 sec o 1 minuto e qualche secondo? Se le finanze lo permettono allora si potrà investire in ram più performanti, ma sempre rispettando l'abbinamento corretto con CPU e MOBO.

I benchmark hanno senso? Direi "SNI" perché quello che conta è l'uso quotidiano. Se poi si vuole fare la "gara" a chi ce l'ha più "veloce"... va bene..., ma un gioco che gira a 90 fps tutto ultra non beneficerà poi così tanto di una ram apparentemente più veloce. Arriva a 95Fps? Sai che roba... mentre se si parte da 55fps allora raggiungere i 60fps potrebbe portare un valore aggiunto importante. Una fluidità più costante.

# VERSIONE BREVE (tornare sopra se non vi basta):
- abbinare sempre la RAM alla frequenza supportata dalla cpu (spesso si risparmia e si investe in altri componenti)
- frequenza maggiore non significa necessariamente ram migliore.
- non farsi prendere dalla smania dei 3/5 fps in più (tutti poi da dimostrare) Vorrei proprio vedere chi riesce a notare la differenza... tra ram da 3200MHz e 3600MHz.
- sono ram standard per configurazioni standard, da valutare le 3600 se c'è la previsione di upgrade della CPU. Un Ryzen 5800X nativamente supporta ancora le 3200MHz... e per fare un po' di OC occorrono forse ram di fascia più alta...
- prezzo buono per ampliare la quantità di memoria (pochi giochi e applicazioni richiedono 32GB)
- meglio sempre acquistare 2x16GB invece che 4x8GB, ma se il prezzo è buono si può rischiare anche il 4x8GB. Ovvio che se uno possiede già 2x8 non ha molta scelta...
- 2x8 GB vanno ancora benissimo per la stragrande maggioranza dei casi.
- preferire timings più bassi se le finanze lo permettono
- la stabilità viene prima di tutto
- 5 stelle no, ma 4,5 sì

In allegato i due screen delle due coppie da 2x8 (una coppia è Micron, l'altra -più recente agosto 2022- risulta Hynix)

so i got these to replace a set of adata 2x8gb at 2400 mhz. this corsair set was a bit of a hassle to get to work. the first try it only recognized 1 with both inside. the second time i just reseat the ram and it still didnt work. third time i just swapped the sticks and then it recognized both, i then had to go into bios to get it to run at 3600mhz.

this managed to boot and run without problems on a b350m bazooka motherboard. ive seen other b350 havers only able to get to 3200mhz otherwise it would blue screen. maybe i got lucky or this board just has better ram speed support.

as for performance, it helped stabilize some fps in certain games, both to maintain 165hz and also to help with the 1% lows. didnt give a crazy amount like you'd expect though, but it also helped basically everything load faster in windows. even something like epic games launcher now loads in under 20 seconds. satisfied with the purchase especially for the price, compared to other ram kits at this speed

update: this wasnt actually fully stable at 3600mhz, would sometimes blue screen during certain games, had to bring it down to 3200mhz, but it's still decent performance gain and in the future when i upgrade my motherboard, ill be able to run it at 3600mhz and get a slight bump in the future.

I've always stuck with Corsair as they are very good quality and don't have any problems, and this ram continues that honour.
When building my first PC I purchased one stick of 16GB which isn't recommended (I did this mainly for future proofing) but worked great, now jumping 3 years ahead I've purchased 3 more sticks and haven't had any faults.

The setup for these RAM sticks is very simple as they just need clicking into place and running the computer, sometimes when installing it would give a popup saying it needed to adjust the computer for the new sticks but didn't take long to get running.

I went for the 3000Mhz set and found them pretty quick for general use, gaming, streaming etc. After checking my bios I found they were running at 2800mhz by default which can be changed to run at full speed however after researching I found that the computer will set the best speed for it when installing.

Generally, I find these Corsair RAM sticks super simple which is great if you don't want to overcomplicate one of the more simple components of a computer. There isn't any software to install or customise the RAM, it just works.
Appearance wise there not as flashy as other more expensive sticks however they are still clean looking and blend with a matching colour motherboard very well.

These usually go on deals around Black Friday or Prime Day, which the deals are exceptionally good.

Overall I can recommend these RAM sticks, for the price they are excellent. Very simple but works well.

Like most ram modules you just plug these modules into the motherboard. If the left most slot you want to call number 1 and then 2,3, and 4, then...

...remove old RAM and install these 2 new modules in slots 2 and 4.

Check online your motherboard manual to see for sure if this is the case on your board. It is on the big majority.

Also, check the top specs your motherboard can run. Mine can only run up to 3200 Mhz so this is what I purchased. Also mine could only...

... take ram modules up to 16 GB. So I put in two modules of 16 GB for a total of 32 GB. This was to replace my old ram total = 16 GB.

Without connecting any wires or downloading or installing any software, the RGB will produce a really nice looking multicolored waterfall ...

... effect. You only need the software if you want to change the RGB show to something else.

This is a top brand of RAM. It pays to buy name brand quality!

Although some may not know, the best, most trouble free, and top performance usually happens with exactly 2 modules in your...

...motherboard's 4 slots. Next best is 1. Then 4. Then 3. So two 16 GB = 32 total is a better idea than one 32 GB module. It will run faster...

...almost always.

When putting more than one module in a computer make sure all of them are the same type and model number of the same brand...

... that way it is much more likely to work trouble free without problems.

Also to note, the iCUE software is somewhat or could be frustrating like I experienced. I downloaded it then installed and went into set some different colors. There were some strange buttons that didn't show pictures but would pop up text as to either set, accept or delete profile.
Regardless I set the Rams color that I liked and eventually my PC went to sleep, the Ram didn't turn off? After reading up it made sense as the RGB gets constant power from the 5 volt rail. Ok well there is a fix and that one was first I uninstalled and reinstalled the software and that fixed my menu issues, in fact the interfaced to the better as if it updated.
To set the Ram to go to sleep and turn off I applied this form the forum at Corsair.

Actually it is possible to disable the lighting for Corsair Vengeance RBG PRO RAM in iCUE.
1. Open iCUE
2. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel
3. Delete ALL lighting effects
4. Click "SETTINGS" on the iCUE title bar
5. Toggle "Enable full software control" to the opposite of what it was just on
6. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel again
7. Delete ALL lighting effects
8. Click "SETTINGS" on the iCUE title bar
9. Make sure that the "Enable full software control" box indicates it is enabled, if not, enable it
10. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel again
11. Customize your lighting effects at your discretion

You should now have disabled all lighting effects while your machine is asleep.
Verify by putting computer to sleep.

"Ich habe kürzlich das Crucial RAM 32GB Kit (2x16GB) mit DDR4 3200MHz und CL22 erworben und bin wirklich beeindruckt von der Leistung und der Qualität dieses Speicherkits.

Die Installation war denkbar einfach. Die Riegel passten perfekt in meine vorhandenen RAM-Slots und wurden sofort von meinem Motherboard erkannt. Nach dem Hochfahren meines Systems konnte ich sofort eine spürbare Verbesserung der Gesamtleistung feststellen. Mein Computer lief deutlich reibungsloser und konnte mehr Aufgaben gleichzeitig bewältigen, ohne ins Stocken zu geraten.

Die 3200MHz Geschwindigkeit sorgt für schnelle Datenübertragungsraten und trägt dazu bei, dass Anwendungen schneller geladen werden. Das ist besonders bei anspruchsvollen Anwendungen wie Bildbearbeitung, Videobearbeitung und sogar Spielen spürbar. Das Multitasking wird ebenfalls erleichtert, da der RAM genügend Spielraum bietet, um mehrere Programme gleichzeitig offen zu halten, ohne dass die Leistung darunter leidet.

Was die Leistungssteigerung noch beeindruckender macht, ist der CL22-Timingswert. Obwohl dies nicht der niedrigste Timingswert auf dem Markt ist, hat Crucial hier eine gute Balance zwischen Geschwindigkeit und Stabilität gefunden. Die RAM-Riegel laufen absolut stabil und ich hatte keinerlei Probleme mit Abstürzen oder Freezes.

Die Wärmeableitung wird durch die Aluminium-Heatspreaders auf den RAM-Riegeln unterstützt. Dies ist ein nettes Extra, besonders wenn du dazu neigst, längere Sessions mit intensiven Aufgaben zu haben. Die Temperaturen blieben während meiner Tests im akzeptablen Bereich, was zusätzliche Sicherheit und Langlebigkeit für den RAM bietet.

Alles in allem bin ich äußerst zufrieden mit dem Crucial RAM 32GB Kit DDR4 3200MHz CL22. Es hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen und bietet eine spürbare Leistungssteigerung für meinen Desktop-PC. Die Qualität, die Geschwindigkeit und die Stabilität machen es zu einer hervorragenden Investition, besonders für diejenigen, die ihre Computerleistung verbessern möchten, sei es für den professionellen oder den Gaming-Bereich."

Ich betreibe auf meinem Rechner mehrere virtuelle Maschinen, daher habe ich einen höheren Bedarf an RAM, inzwischen habe ich meinen Rechner mit 2 Kits des Crucial DDR4 Pro 32GB RAMs (16GB je DIMM) mit Heatsink auf 64GB aufgerüstet.

Der RAM überzeugt mit seinen technischen Daten und dem dafür günstigen Preis. Der Heatspreader hat ein schlichtes Design und wirkt nicht verspielt, wie die RAMs anderer Hersteller.

Die lange Garantie von 10 Jahren hat mich ebenfalls überzeugt.

Ich habe noch ein weiteres System, welches ich zukünftig ebenfalls mit diesem Produkt aufrüsten möchte.

Ein Kritikpunkt wäre die CAS Latenz von 22, wobei dieser Wert bei weitem nicht so relevant ist, wie viele Menschen glauben. Daher führt dies auch nicht zu einer geringeren Sterne-Bewertung.

plug straight in and go - easy install.

I replaced 16gb of 3000mhz CL16 Corsair Vengeance LPX with this 32gb kit as I was regularly hitting the buffers with web browser, teams, lots of documents, pdf's and ppt's all open whilst working from home. I was a bit apprehensive with the CL22 latency albeit at 3200mhz but at the price it seems a good deal and I don't need a bleeding edge overclock for gaming these days.

but after a couple of weeks I thought I would see how far it could go whilst keeping it sensible..

Currently running happily at 3600 mhz CL18 (18-22-22-22-42) at 1.35v

3600 mhz is the sweetspot for ryzen zen3 processors so i am pretty happy with that for an overclock and its within XMP specifications.

I tried 3600mhz CL18 (18-20-20-20-42) @ 1.4v and it was not happy with errors during posting

will update if i get any further..

the reason for writing this was the lack of information on the web about overclocking this memory - hope its helpful

reviews.review: I've been using Kingston ram for about 7 years now, their higher models offer competitive speeds and timings to other brands. With less noticeably impactful components in comparisson to say a GPU or CPU I will recommend on brand from my experience with their stability or customer service since most users won't notice a difference in practice. I used this particular model in a build last year and it hasn't caused any headaches and the system works great. RAM likely won't be a large bottleneck for the average gamer in speed or capacity but new windows versions and poorly optimized triple A games are putting the latter to the test along with single stick pre-built pcs. If you're looking for a capacity upgrade or need to swap to dual channel this will work great. Highly recommend.

purchased this to replace a set of ram which was faulty

this set runs at 3600mhz 18-22-22-22-38 on ryzen 9 3900x and b550 tomahawk no errors after 10 passes of memtest86+

no fancy RGB no frills just good DDR4 ram which i found on multiple motherboard QVL lists

I think it’s running at 2400mhz out of the box with my system, not at the 2666mhz as they advertised. Still havnt enabled the xmp on it to get advertised speeds but it’s good fast ram. Runs stable, should be able to get my advertised 3600mhz but even if it doesn’t they were decently priced and fit my build.

Works with my Ryzen 7 5700x and fits in my Corsair 200T case which required ram height of 38mm or less with a top mounting AIO.
I believe it’s single side chips ram which make them kinda over priced for being 16Gb mods.

Corsairs ram was an issue and so I thought I’d give these a try and they weren’t to disappoint.
Kingston rams picked up the ball where Corsair dropped it.

I’d buy these again.
Price is okay.
Runs at 3600
can't go wrong with Kingston

No problems detected, installation simple and easy. Ram worked out of the box with 5900x and MSI tomahawk x570. No blue screens, no issues at all.

Worth the money.

Yep, it works just fine!
Unlike the G.Skill defect (who never got back to me for RMA -in your face G.Skill)
what can you say? Great memory does what memory should.
Running at default 3600MHz speed and runs really stable.

Comprar 32 GB (2x16) de 3600...ha sido...una aventura que ha puesto de manifiesto una cantidad de errores de la logística de Amazon que nunca hubiera imaginado:
Pedido realizado el 16-6 junto con varios artículos más. Primera fecha de entrega estimada de este artículo, se cambia. Finalmente sale desde Italia, el día que estava previsto ser entregado. Dado que ya no podré atenderlo en la dirección original, el nuevo día de entrega que me indican, Amazon via web, me deja indicar un locker. La fecha prevista de entrega al locker es el 23-6. Efectivamente....pues no lo entregan. Lo intentan entregar el lunes 26-6...pero algo sucede y en dos intentos , no pueden. El dia 27-6, lo vuelven a intentar , y de nuevo por dos veces, no pueden.
Entonces contacto con el servicio de atención al cliente via chat (hablo con dos personas diferentes), porque no puedo cambiar de nuevo la dirección de entrega, y me dicen que la cambian ellos y que seguro que el 28 la recibiré en la nueva dirección que ya no es un locker.....El día 28-6....como os podeis imaginar....NO lo intentan entregar en la nueva dirección sino que de nuevo van al locker y no pueden entregarlo.....de nuevo contacto por chat con el servicio al cliente.....de nuevo hablo con dos personas diferentes. Una me dice que cancela el pedido y me reembolsa el dinero, porque no se puede cambiar la dirección de entrega, y el locker está averiado y no pueden avisar al transportista ni el transportista me puede llamar a mi porque si la entrega es en un locker, no les consta el teléfono del destinatario. Digo, bueno, pues lo recompro y ya está.....pero al ir a recomprarlo, el precio se ha incrementado en un 30%.
Contacto de nuevo con servicio al cliente, me dan explicaciones, pero no soluciones, me ofrecen esperar al día siguiente para cancelar el pedido y intentar un reemplazo por el mismo precio antiguo......buff en este punto ya llevo dedicadas al chat tres horas.....quedamos asi.....pero finalmente, en un segundo intento de entrega del dia 28-6 a última hora, finalmente consiguen dejarlo en el locker...a pesar de que el servicio de atención al cliente el día 27 me aseguró que habian cambiado la dirección entrega....Conclusión...innumerables fallos imperdonables en un gigante como Amazon.
Necesitais que os los remarque ????
1- Sucesivos incumplimientos de fecha de entrega.
2- Incomunicación entre transportista y Amazon teniendo un locker averiado.
3- Imposibilidad de cambiar la dirección de entrega a pesar de que en el tracking de amazon se indica que se haga via Servicio al cliente.
4- Servicio al cliente incoherente, con actitudes y aptitudes individuales y nada standarizadas.
5- Si la entrega es en un locker, el transportista no tiene manera de avisar al cliente de cualquier incidencia.
6- Poca optimización del transportista, hasta 6 intentos para entregarlo, donde no podía ni debía.
7- Poca capacidad resolutiva del servicio de atención al cliente, toda actuación posible era a dias vista y con perjuicio para el cliente.

Yo he tenido tiempo y ganas para dedicar más de 6 horas de mi vida a esta incidencia...y eso sin contar los perjuicios que he tenido por el retraso en más de 6 dias en la entrega por incompetencia logística de Amazon.
Servirá para algo ?????
Mejorará Amazon algo en todos estos temas ????

Me dejo algún otro problema visible en el chat mantenido con servicio al cliente, repito, casi tres horas entre dia 27 y 28….para nada.
Tá funcionando...nada contra por enquanto.

Games don't glich anymore love it

Good price for 32 GB of DDR4. Also great for Ryzen systems as they run better with higher speed RAM and 3600 is the sweet point. Have never had any compatibility issues and I have always used Corsair memory in my systems. Some people have mentioned issues when using 4 sticks in their systems but have not had any myself.
Solid for its price point.

So after a bit of testing (loosening timings, voltage adjustments) it will only run stable at 3333 (Ryzen5900X/B550). Will not run at 3600 or anywhere beyond 3333 at advertised timings (18 22 22 22 42 and 1.38v). Probably pressed my power sw/reset about 25 times and ultimately pulled power cord a few times, so gave up. Did not open case and reset BIOS since a pain to do. Good luck to those who purchase

Update after a few weeks
I can now confirm that it runs at rated speeds and volts. However, pack your patience - required several resets power on/off, black screens (lost count) and at least 1 bios clear etc. Aalsmot corrupted Win 10 but I created system restore points just in case. I think the best thing is to burn them in for a few weeks then slowly raise to rated speeds - some speeds that my PC will not boot or boot a few times then stop are 3466 and 3533 for whatever reason. 3333 is fine but eventually this will stop. Loosening memory timings do not work. I used Bios memory settings for the correct rated speeds and confirmed with CPU-Z, AIDA and others. So long story short been running at 1T 18 22 22 22 42 65 1.36V for last 2 weeks stable. Don' know how my PC did not go up in smoke after all this. Hopefully it runs like this for the rest of the year

Before I think is the hard drive problem then change to the ssd. loading is faster but still have some stutter during seemless loading or ingame realtime cutscene but after change to this ram, all the game load super fast, no stutter to realtime cutcene. So the ram frequency play a part too. before this, I use crucial 16g+16g 3200 ram kit.

Éstas memorias las eh probado en plataformas Intel de 10ma hasta 12va generación sin problema alguno, también en ryzen desde chips b550 de diversos fabricantes hasta los modelos x570.
La configuración xpm funciona en cada vez en diferentes placas madre sin detalles.
La latencia no es la más baja pero no tendrás problema de calentamiento alguno, eh bajado la misma mediante BIOS hasta cl16 sin que afecte rendimiento ni estabilidad.
100% recomendable, el paquete me llegó en tiempo y bien empaquetado y caja cerrada con sus sellos ( importante mencionar ya que actualmente muchos envían Open box).

Der Corsair Vengeance LPX DDR4 3600-Arbeitsspeicher hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen. Mit 32GB (2 x 16GB) bietet er mehr als genug Kapazität für anspruchsvolle Aufgaben wie z.B. Video-Editing.

Die Geschwindigkeit von 3600 MHz sorgt für eine reibungslose und schnelle Leistung, und die niedrige Latenz gewährleistet eine effiziente Datenverarbeitung. Die Installation war kinderleicht, und mein System lief nach dem Einbau reibungslos.

Die Corsair Vengeance LPX-Module sind zudem für ihre Zuverlässigkeit bekannt, und ich hatte bisher keinerlei Probleme. Sie sind auch optisch ansprechend und passen gut zu anderen Komponenten in meinem System.

Der Corsair Vengeance LPX DDR4 3600 eine ausgezeichnete Wahl. Ich bin äußerst zufrieden damit und kann es nur empfehlen.

Ram Corsair Vengeance Lpx Ddr4-Ram 3600Mhz 2X16Gb CL18.
Voglio sottolineare che una 3600MHz CL18 e una 3200MHz CL16, sono identiche, stessa latency.
Non mi è mai servito più di 16GB di ram, fino a quando non ho scoperto Stable Diffusion, e la ram non mi bastava più.
Ho visto subito la differenza aumentandola.
Un processo molto pesante su 16GB di ram impiegava 22 minuti, con i 32GB di ram s'è ridotto a 17 minuti.
La mia RTX ha solo 6GB di vram ma in qualunque caso serve la ram di sistema per far girare tutto, e solo Python se ne prende oltre 7GB.
Stable Diffusion ha bisogno di 32GB, altrimenti si è limitatissimi.
La ram della Corsair è ottima, appena installata, riconosciuta in automatico a 3600MHz.
In precedenza avevo una G-Skill da 3000MHz che dovevo tenere a 2933MHz perchè altrimenti non reggeva e mi crashava il sistema.
Ricordo che la G-skill la pagai 150 in 2x8GB, ed era il prezzo più vantaggioso in quel momento...
La prossima mobo avrà almeno 64GB, ma per il momento la vecchia rig va ancora ottimamente.
Corsair Vengeance, ora sceglierò sempre queste.

RAM DDR4 della Corsair con involucro di dissipazione integrato. Prodotto di qualità eccellente ad un ottimo prezzo. Attenzione che i 3600 Mhz dichiarati sono raggiungibili solo attivando l'overclock SPD dal BIOS della scheda madre.

name: LinkMore XE200 1TB M.2 2280 PCIe Gen 3X4 NVMe 1.3 Internal SSD, Solid State Drive, Up to 2100MB/s for Latop and PC
description:
• 【Star up easily and quickly】PCIe Gen 3*4 NVMe 1.3 , hign speed interface help your computer boot faster to a new level. *Please make sure your devices are compatible with NVM PCIe before purchasing.
  • 【Effective transfer speed】Sequential read and write speeds up to 2000MB/s and 1500MB/s
  • 【Excellent performance for work and gaming】High speed, high performance, and low power consumption meet the various demands of gamers.
  • 【3 year warranty】: Made in Taiwan.Provide 3 year limited warranty and free tenique support.

reviews.review:
Product Info:
The drive specs on the back of the box: 256GB PCIe Gen3x4 NVMe M.2 2280 with a Read/Write speed up to 2500MB/s / 2100MB/s depending on the capacity. It also comes with a 3yr warranty.

I checked the datasheet specs on the manufacturer’s site for this driver and it seems the specs are a bit different. It shows a max of 2000MB/s Read and 1000MB/s write, so I wish they spent a bit more effort to provide the proper information on their packaging material.

Performance:
I put the drive through its paces using an external USB-C NVMe enclosure as well as in a computer and running benchmarks using CrystalDiskMark8 as well copying files to and from the drive.

USB-C NVMe Enclosure:
- CrystalDiskMark: Read = 1050.79MB/s and Write = 950.84MB/s.
- Windows Write: Writing a 12.7GB file into the drive took 34.28secs = 370.48MB/s Write speed.
- Windows Read: Copying out the same 12.7GB file took 37.4secs = 339.57MB/s Read speed.
- Windows Write (small files): Writing 5.98GB of smaller multiple files ranging from a few hundred megs to 1GB into the drive took 67.24secs = 88.94MB/s.
o This was exceptionally slow as the peak speed was 54MB/s, but subsequent copy of the same data files were able to copy at 389MB/s.
- Windows Read (small files): Copying the same 5.98GB of files out of the drive onto my laptop took 60.95secs = 98MB/s Read speeds.
o Recopying the same files out took only 16.31secs = 366MB/s

During the speed tests, it seems on initial write & read of multiple smaller files the drive seems to struggle with the throughput as you can see it spike upwards and then slows down and then keeps repeating, so the transfer graph is very jagged. Subsequent copies of the same files into and out of the drive seems to work as it’s supposed to. Not sure if there’s a caching issue or if there was some other factor causing the slowness.

HP Laptop Install:
To eliminate the USB port or enclosure as the speed limiting factor, I installed it into my laptop and installed a fresh copy of Windows 10 and reran the CrystalDiskMark tests and was pleasantly surprised that the max Read speed was 2360.39MB/s & the Write was 1200.26MB/s. The Read speeds jumped over 2X and the write speed up 25%.

I couldn’t run the Windows copy as the laptop only had one drive and it wouldn’t be a proper test to copy from itself into itself.

Overall, I found the LinkMore XE200 256GB PCIe NVMe 2280 M.2 drive performed very well. In an external enclosure, it performed OK, but that performance quickly jumped and exceeded its advertised specs on the manufacturer’s website datasheet specs when directly installed in a computer. The drive is actually faster than the original drive that came with the HP laptop and now is the permanent drive for the unit.

I won't spend a load of time and words going into reams of specs that are available in more detail from the seller. What I found is that this low-cost drive has so far performed almost as well as the higher priced big brand names. The only thing I can't comment on is how well it works over time compared to the other brands.
👀 The only spec I will include is a screenshot of the write speed when first used in an external 10Gb USB C enclosure before installing it in the PC. While not as fast as brand name drives, this is plenty fast for most applications. It is faster than most users would need a drive to be. Boot time and shutdown are measured in seconds.
» Pricing is in the ballpark with other after market brand drives of the same capacity.

Would I recommend this for a gamer, someone that uses photo/video editing applications, or someone who doesn't back up their important items? No, not yet. It will need to prove itself over time, and no amount of testing with Crystal mark or other performance software can provide that detail. For the average user that does back up their important items, it's a great way to upgrade an older laptop or add a second drive to a PC if the MoBo has space. If there are any problems down the road, I will follow up.

I have had it running on a PC as the OS drive that's been in operation 24/7 for the last four weeks. I'm using it to run a game server for some friends and which means there are a lot of writes, so this is a great test. It was installed with no issues, and both Windows 11 and Windows Server 2019 were installed without the need for any drivers. I tested it on Windows 11 but then installed Server 2019 for stability. Other than restarts due to updates, the machine has never gone down. It does have a decent heat sink on it and runs no hotter than the big brand name drives.

Do I have enough confidence that if I needed another drive, I would get a second one of these, yes. I will need a 1TB NVMe drive in a couple of months for a new build, and considering the performance is very good, and the drive is 35% of what I would pay for a brand name, yes, I'll save some money and order a LinkMore.

If you are an enthusiast looking for a M.2 NVMe SSD that's significantly above-average for your top of the line gaming gear or multimedia editing studio, then this is not for you and look elsewhere. If you are looking for something that's a significant upgrade to your existing/old SSD and in need of a budget drive as your system drive to speed up initial boot time, then perhaps give this a shot.

This is another one of those non-brand name NVMe SSDs that I've never heard of but it claims to be made in Taiwan which is much more desirable (if you build your own computers from parts especially in the 90's, then you know what I'm talking about); however, I see no indication that this is actually made in Taiwan so I'm not sure what to think of that at the moment.

With that being said, its performance is actually quite good considering its price.

Read: 2183 MB/s
Write: 1089 MB/s

Both its read and write speeds appear to be slightly higher than what's being advertised here 2000/1000 MB/s); however, it claims a much higher throughput (2500/2100 MB/s) from the box it comes with. Though, it does mention the speed varies and depends up capacity which is often the case for any flash-based devices including USB drives and NVMe/SATA SSD drives.

It's using Phison PS5013-E13-31 SSD controller which does NOT include DRAM cache which is one of the reasons that this is a budget NVMe SSD. Well, you get what you pay for and it's a reasonably trade-off if you are short on budget.

All things considered, this is a fairly decent budget NVMe SSD that's well-performed and it's reasonably priced at $34 for 256GB. It's a great upgrade for ordinary SATA SSD (assuming your MB supports and/or has the slot for it) and you WILL see noticeable performance boost in in comparison to SATA SSDs.

  • Optimized for maximum bandwidth and tight response times on the latest Intel and AMD DDR4 motherboards.
  • A custom performance PCB provides the highest signal quality for the greatest level of performance and stability.

reviews.review:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600MHz memory kit is a compelling choice for users seeking both eye-catching aesthetics and high-performance memory for their gaming or content creation setups. In this review, I will share my experience with this memory kit, focusing on its design, performance, ease of installation, and overall value.

Design and Aesthetics:
The standout feature of the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is its stunning design. The sleek and low-profile aluminum heatspreaders not only enhance the overall aesthetics of the memory modules but also contribute to effective heat dissipation. The customizable RGB lighting offers an impressive range of vibrant colors and lighting effects, allowing users to personalize their setups and synchronize the lighting with other compatible Corsair products. Whether you prefer subtle illumination or want to create a mesmerizing light show, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL delivers on both style and visual impact.

Performance:
With a frequency of DDR4 3600MHz and low latency, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit provides excellent performance for demanding tasks. Whether you're gaming, editing videos, or running memory-intensive applications, this kit delivers responsive and smooth performance. The ample capacity of 32GB ensures seamless multitasking and the ability to handle resource-hungry tasks without experiencing any slowdowns. The high-quality memory chips and robust PCB design contribute to stability and reliable performance, even under heavy workloads.

Easy Installation:
Installing the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is a straightforward process. The memory modules fit seamlessly into most standard DIMM slots, and the XMP 2.0 support simplifies the setup process by automatically configuring the optimal memory settings. The Corsair iCUE software provides an intuitive interface for customizing the RGB lighting effects, allowing users to easily sync the lighting with other Corsair components and create a cohesive visual theme.

Compatibility:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is compatible with a wide range of motherboards and platforms, including both Intel and AMD systems. This ensures that most users can benefit from the exceptional performance and stunning aesthetics that this kit offers. It's always recommended to verify compatibility with your specific motherboard before making a purchase.

Value for Money:
While the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL memory kit is priced at a premium, it offers excellent value for users who prioritize both performance and aesthetics. The combination of high-frequency memory, low latency, ample capacity, and customizable RGB lighting justifies the investment for enthusiasts and gamers looking to enhance their PC experience.

Final Thoughts:
The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600MHz memory kit strikes an impressive balance between style and performance. With its stunning design, exceptional performance, easy installation, and compatibility with a wide range of systems, this memory kit is a worthy choice for users looking to elevate their PC setup. Whether you're seeking top-tier gaming performance or a visually stunning workstation, the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL delivers on both fronts.

Disclaimer: I purchased the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro SL 32GB DDR4 3600MHz memory kit independently and did not receive it as part of any specific program or incentive. My review is solely based on my personal experience and observations with this memory kit.

Einen Dauertest habe ich sein gelassen, da mir die Spannung für den RAM-Controller der CPU doch viel zu hoch war.
Das Ganze lief mit 1,40V ... selbst wenn es etwas unstabil werden würde, hätte ich noch auf 1,45V den VRAMs erhöht. War aber soweit nicht nötig.

Derzeit laufen die Speicher, wie meine vorherigen Patriot Viper 4000 ... auf 4266 MHz bei CL18, top stabil in der Konfiguration 2x 32 GB.

Ich bin von den Speichern sichtlich zufrieden und RGB musste einfach sein .. ;)

Kann ich nur empfehlen ! :)

If I had to do it all over again, I'd buy 4 x 16's instead of 2 x 32's. For the extra $20, the extra sticks give the controllers more access or so I've seen on a you tube video. It depends on the motherboard somewhat, but that's what I've gleaned from a YT video I watched assuming the motherboard has 4 slots.

Also, it's worth the while to check BIOS or download MSI to see what your comp will allow for ram speed. I bought 3200's going with the ram speed that the prebuilt came with, but could have used 3600's and would have, had I known in advance that I could. There is a modest improvement in performance, from 3200 to 3600 if a comp can go with higher mhz.

From what I can tell, GPUs and memory may be on a constant upward pricing swing. In the not too distant future and due to my tight budget, making a custom build will be out of reach. These ram sticks were at a reasonable sale price and for a recent ASUS TUF B450-Plus Gaming build. As a hobby coder and as someone who opens far too many memory hungry apps while learning and exploring thingies, these added the much needed headroom to do just that. After installing, all that was needed was to update my bios and to enable D.O.C.P. in the bios. They ran flawlessly!

I ordered 2 of these 64gb kits for a total of 128gb of RAM, which it turns out, were completely different versions of each other i.e. same name, branding, etc. but since they were different versions/firmware of each other, one of the kits was not compatible with my board. One of the kits had green pcb for the memory sticks and the dims did not align with my motherboard, but you couldn't tell from the outside packaging (also the sticker was covering the version type anyway) so whoever packaged the order initially wouldn't have known ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Since then, I returned one of them and have gotten my refund. As for the other kit it works just as intended, so I'll give it marks where it's due

Recommended!

reviews.review:
So when I got the ram I ended up spending like 1 to about two hours trying to install it. I got a asrock b450 pro4 board. I got a ryzen 5600x cpu I recently had 16gb of this ram, then I decided to get the 32gb version of it. My motherboard max ram is 64Gb adding it up I was basically installing 48Gb all together. But for some reason when I add the two 16gb sticks with the two 8gb sticks, my computer for some reason would not boot up. Now this was me switching the rams around trying to figure out what was the problem. Because before I had some different brand name rams I mixed it with the Vulcan’s and it worked at 24gb but iv learned mixing different ram brands can cause issues and lower performance. But my pc still booted up, and ran pretty decent. But for some reason adding the same Vulcan Z”s 32gb with the 8gb ram did not boot up. At this point I was confused. Because it is so post to boot up, I ended up checking my motherboard website
I was missing bios update 8.01 v2 1.2.0.8 apparently this update is for amd/ intel motherboards as well. It is so post to help with memory of your motherboard. So if you don’t have it please download it! A lot people that have gaming computers pre built just to game don’t know about bios updates. After removing one of the 16gb sticks and leaving the two 8gb sticks my pc finally booted up. I am still confused to the point where I don’t understand why it dose not boot up with both 16gb sticks and only one. I’m still getting my 32gb performance on my pc so I am happy with it. Now I just have one brand new 16gb ram stick collecting dust until i can figure out how to install it and get my 48Gb performance. Honestly I don’t know if it’s the company because i have seen a few reviews that these type of sticks are corrupted. So if you decide on buying Vulcan brand ram sticks good luck it might work and it might not work so your playing a dirty ball game :) hopefully if you missed this review before u bought the ram, and u have the same problem and u manage to find this an u try my methods explain above. An it helps YOUR WELCOME :)

Bought 4 sticks for my 5800x and ROG STRIX B450-F GAMING II motherboard. 2 sticks work fine at 3596 MT/s, but only in the A2 and B2 slots. To get 4 sticks to work, I had to reduce the speed to 3533 MT/s.

I did not have to RMA this RAM, but at one point I thought I would need to, and I'm pleased to report that I was able to get an RMA number online within minutes with just the serial number from the RAM. Compare this to other manufacturers who require you to produce a receipt and supply the vendor name, purchase date, etc. I very much appreciate the no-hassle RMA process and lifetime warranty of this RAM.

This RAM works great on a Gigabyte AB350-Gaming-CF board with a Ryzen 3 2200G processor, with an XMPP profile enabled in the firmware. Recommended purchase.

First time building a machine in a long time so this is my first rgb ram. Cost was great at the time for the speeds. The rgb is very bright and syncs with some of the top rgb controls. I'm using aura sync and it worked flawlessly.
Both sticks are good out or the box, zero issues. I may even pick up another 8x2 set for 32gb of ram total. Without massive Photoshop or video editing 16 is probably enough already, and anything over 32 is definitely overkill.

I think this is the most RAM I have ever had in a computer I have owned. Long gone is the time when I exceeded the 4K of RAM in my Vic20.
I was looking for a little boost for my desktop, this was it. Easy enough to install for my who has been doing this for decades. Click add to cart, what do you have to loose?

The specs are exactly as advertised. Installed on MSI Pro Z690-A DDR4 mobo and had no issue with installation. The main reason I chose this over "gaming" specific RAM is that it's an excellent price and I don't want my computer to look like a 14 year olds idea of a space ship. So far so good.
Comme titré. L'overclock préétablit s'engage sans problème dans le bios.
just installed them fixed a ram issue i was having, seem to be more compatiable with my board, works exactly as advertise and also came very quickly

This seems to be very good and affordable RAM. Looks like high quality Made in Taiwan. Worked right out of the box.
I recommend.
I ordered the MSi B450-A Max Pro motherboard when AM5 came out and paid around 80$ for it. A bit expensive but it is an ATX board. This RAM works with this motherboard right out of the box and is paired with an Ryzen 5900X. Super easy to install and flash with the BIOS button the Bios for the Ryzen 5000 series CPU's. Worked right out of the box. The board is better than the B450 board I have from Asus. Easy to install in my XPG Invader case.
At the beginning when freshly installed Windows 11 I got lots of sound problems. After installing the crap of MSi drivers and Utilities which actual version MSi's MSi Center was offering, my sound got messed up completely. Sound stutters becauso of the new sound drivers, Chipset drivers and the like. Headphones and 5.1 Speakers intermittently connected/disconnected causing delays and stutters. Looked like an software issue of MSi software. That foreced me to reinstall and erase from scrap Windows 10 and it offered then to upgrade to Windows 11. After that the problem was gone with only Windows drivers. Do not download the crap MSi Center offers. It can break your OS.
Other than that this board suggests it has 2 full fledged PCIE x 16 slots of the 3.0 type. At least that is what customers will think easily. Think twice. It has only one x16 PCIE 3.0 slot and the long one below has x16 openings but only half of those have connector pins installed and the manual says it is not even an x8 slot but rather an x4 only. And to add insult to injury that slot is only 2.0. Completely misleading for an new buyer.
On the lower slot I have the GT 1030 GDDR5 from MSi installed I had still from Q1 2020. It works on low settings on some games like HnG from 2016 and gets between 52 fps and 60 fps.
Other than that this MSi board works way better than the Asus B450 board I have on my other system from last year. The RAM slots are way easier to use and the sticks slide into them like lubricated. The dual channel works on this board which is on my Asus most likely defective (Asus refuses warranty). I use it with 32 GB (2 x 16) TeamGroup TCreate RAM sticks. High quality 3200 Mhz sticks for relatively cheap.
It is a good strong board with 2 massive coolers on the Mosfets. These massive coolers impressed me as an new inexperienced buyer for my very first build. So it slipped to me the issue with the PCIE "x16" slots.
This Motherboard worked straight out of the box. I use the Ryzen 5900X with this with an Gamemax Gamma 500 AM4 cooler. The coolers does not fit well the AM4 system since it's clip is way to stiff so I had to take the cooler off the CPU and bend a bit the clips till it fits just with a little pressure. Install the air coolers without too much pressure so it is not loose but can slide a bit is fine before snapping it gently in place. As original fit I got 66 Celsius to 70 Celsius on idle or doing basic work with that processor, but after bending the clips to aliviate the pressure I get now at the moment 51 Degrees Celsius. So if too much pressure is applied by the cooler onto the processor that rises the heat to a difference of about 20 Degrees Celsius. Any of these standard air coolers with heat pipes will be able to cool the Ryzen 5900X easily. While gaming it gets to about 61 degrees Celsius. My case has 3 fans in the front and 1 in the back.
MSi's UEFI is a bit confusing if one is used to the Asus UEFI. But it has basically the same features but it is way more confusing. The fans can be adjusted better on MSi's BIOS. But with this 5900X duo deca core CPU, the PSU is annoyingly loud all the time. While on Ecomode with 65 Watts the whole system draws on gaming about 150 Watts. The board seems to have no problems to deliver power to the 5900X.
Running Cinebench with this board and 5900X CPU with settings to Ecomode 65Watt, the case fans kick in, the CPU has an temp of 61 Degrees Celsius after 5 Minutes Cinebench, the Mosfets have an temperature of 58 Degrees Celsius and the PCH has an temperature of 50 Celsius while the Cooler Master Silencio 120mm fan I put on the Gamma from GameMax CPU cooler, turns 1000 rpm and all 4 Arctic F12 120mm case fans show an rpm of 700.
I am surprised how this GameMax Gamma air cooler is able to maintain cool this CPU. So the huge aluminum coolers on the Mosfets of the MSi board sure do their job.
The board has lots of fan headers. Thats very good.
I recommend this board for the AM4 system but be aware of the cheating PCIE slot advertisement, the sound problems and the rather difficult to use UEFI settings. But this is an robust board.

I purchased this for a non-rgb SFF build on a 12 series Intel system.

The product arrived very quickly and packaged nice for safe transport.

I needed lower profile memory for a SFF build and decided to try this memory out. I have seen it recommended by PC builders for the last few years and decided it must be sufficient.

I have been using this memory now for a couple months and am completely satisfied with the performance, reliability, and the great value compared to other big name brands. It is not that bad looking as well.

Performance wise, it is on par with any other memory with the same MHZ and timings. It also overclocks nicely if that's still your thing.

I would definitely recommend this to others

What can I say. If you're looking for speed and 32 over 16 GB, it's grat value for the price as of the time I'm writing this. I tried it in several amd boards ranging from b450's through x570's. Non of the had this ram on their QVL, but XMP/EXPO/DOCP all worked correctly on every board I tried it on. MSI, Asus, and several Gigabyte boards.

Also to note, the iCUE software is somewhat or could be frustrating like I experienced. I downloaded it then installed and went into set some different colors. There were some strange buttons that didn't show pictures but would pop up text as to either set, accept or delete profile.
Regardless I set the Rams color that I liked and eventually my PC went to sleep, the Ram didn't turn off? After reading up it made sense as the RGB gets constant power from the 5 volt rail. Ok well there is a fix and that one was first I uninstalled and reinstalled the software and that fixed my menu issues, in fact the interfaced to the better as if it updated.
To set the Ram to go to sleep and turn off I applied this form the forum at Corsair.

Actually it is possible to disable the lighting for Corsair Vengeance RBG PRO RAM in iCUE.
1. Open iCUE
2. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel
3. Delete ALL lighting effects
4. Click "SETTINGS" on the iCUE title bar
5. Toggle "Enable full software control" to the opposite of what it was just on
6. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel again
7. Delete ALL lighting effects
8. Click "SETTINGS" on the iCUE title bar
9. Make sure that the "Enable full software control" box indicates it is enabled, if not, enable it
10. Click "LIGHTING EFFECTS" on the left panel again
11. Customize your lighting effects at your discretion

You should now have disabled all lighting effects while your machine is asleep.
Verify by putting computer to sleep.

I recently upgraded my gaming rig's memory to the Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO 16 GB kit (2 x 8 GB) DDR4 3000 MHz C15, and I'm absolutely thrilled with the results. This kit delivers on both performance and aesthetics, making it a perfect choice for enthusiasts and gamers alike.

What sets this kit apart, however, is the mesmerizing RGB lighting. The customizable lighting effects are a treat for the eyes and allow for seamless integration with the rest of my RGB setup. Corsair's build quality shines through as well. The heat spreaders not only keep the modules cool but also add to the overall aesthetics. The kit feels sturdy and well-made, which is something I value in any PC component.

In conclusion, the Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO 16 GB kit is a top-tier choice for anyone looking to enhance their system's performance and visual appeal. Inoltre, la Corsair è nota per il suo affidabile supporto tecnico, quindi in caso di domande o problemi, si può contare su un servizio clienti competente.

In conclusione, i banchi di RAM Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO DDR4-RAM 3600 MHz sono una scelta eccellente per coloro che cercano prestazioni elevate, un design accattivante e una personalizzazione RGB. La loro velocità di clock, la qualità costruttiva e la facilità di installazione li rendono una scelta affidabile per potenziare il proprio sistema di gioco. Consiglio vivamente questi banchi di RAM a tutti gli appassionati di gaming e a coloro che desiderano un PC performante e dal look unico.

La memoria Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO DDR4-RAM è un'opzione eccellente per gli appassionati di gaming e per coloro che cercano prestazioni affidabili e un'estetica accattivante. Con una frequenza di 3600 MHz e una capacità di 16 GB (2x 8GB), questa memoria offre un'ottima potenza di elaborazione e un'esperienza fluida durante l'utilizzo del computer.

Una delle caratteristiche più evidenti di questa memoria è l'illuminazione RGB. Corsair ha integrato LED RGB personalizzabili sulla parte superiore dei moduli RAM, che possono essere sincronizzati con altri componenti del sistema utilizzando il software Corsair iCUE. Questa funzione consente di creare effetti di illuminazione straordinari e di abbinare l'aspetto del tuo computer al tuo stile personale.

Dal punto di vista delle prestazioni, la frequenza di 3600 MHz offre un notevole aumento delle prestazioni rispetto alle memorie DDR4 standard a frequenze inferiori. Questo rende la Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO una scelta ideale per i giocatori che desiderano ottenere il massimo dalle loro sessioni di gioco e per gli utenti che lavorano con applicazioni impegnative dal punto di vista delle risorse, come la modellazione 3D e il rendering video.

La memoria Corsair è rinomata per la sua affidabilità e qualità costruttiva. I moduli sono realizzati con componenti di alta qualità e utilizzano un dissipatore di calore per mantenere le temperature sotto controllo anche durante carichi di lavoro intensi. Ciò aiuta a prevenire il surriscaldamento e assicura un funzionamento stabile e duraturo.

Un altro aspetto positivo di questa memoria è la sua facilità di installazione. I moduli sono compatibili con la maggior parte delle schede madri DDR4 e possono essere installati rapidamente senza complicazioni. Inoltre, Corsair offre un'assistenza clienti solida e una garanzia limitata a vita sui suoi prodotti, fornendo una tranquillità aggiuntiva agli acquirenti.

Tuttavia, è importante notare che il prezzo di questa memoria potrebbe essere leggermente superiore rispetto a modelli simili senza illuminazione RGB. Quindi, se l'aspetto estetico non è una priorità per te, potresti considerare alternative più economiche. Inoltre, assicurati di verificare la compatibilità con la tua scheda madre prima di effettuare l'acquisto.

In definitiva, la Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO DDR4-RAM 3600 MHz 2x 8GB Memoria è una scelta solida per coloro che cercano prestazioni elevate, un'estetica personalizzabile e un'esperienza di gioco fluida. Con la sua potenza di elaborazione, affidabilità e illuminazione RGB accattivante, questa memoria si distingue come una scelta eccellente per gli appassionati di PC gaming e per gli utenti che richiedono elevate prestazioni dal loro sistema.

Arrivati nella confezione originale perfettamente sigillata.
Dopo l'installazione vi ricordo solamente di ATTIVARE la ram dal BIOS; di base la RAM va a 2133 MHz, per farla andare a 3600 bisogna attivare 'na roba sulle impostazione del BIOS durante l'accensione del PC.
Per tutto il resto per adesso sembra andare molto bene, il PC è diventato decisamente più veloce e, ciliegina sulla torta, la luce si può personalizzare (anche direttamente spegnere) con il programma corsair iCUE, il quale mostra anche altre cose interessanti tipo la temperatura (si può anche personalizzare la luce in modo che cambi in base alla temperatura, facendo diventare la luce rossa in caso la temperatura si alzi troppo).

reviews.review: Ordered 4X2GB DDR2 modules. One set would not allow the computer to post, the other set worked fine. Sent back for refund, replacements arrived, worked with no issue. It should be noted that you CANNOT overclock this RAM. It runs at exactly the timings and FSB multiplier indicated, if you push it at all, you get instability and crashes. But at default speeds, solid as a rock and replaced my bad memory in a computer that's nearly 17 years old and still going. Recommended, there's not really any better, cheaper options out there.

Yes this is DDR2. It's old tech but I needed these modules to upgrade a very old laptop and get it working again to an acceptable level of performance. This memory + a small SSD upgrade allowed the old machine to run windows 11 (yes 11 !). The laptop is an old HPDV6500 but with a little bit of tinkering as well as some debloater tools., it is now running a windows 11 home smoothly.

The memory came in a sealed retail packaging. Installation was fairly simple and replacing the existing 1+1 modules with these new 2+2GB modules improved the performance.

About a year ago I purchased a used Dell Optiplex 780 Small Form Factor computer. It originally came installed with Windows 7 and 4GB of RAM but recently upgraded to Windows 10. A few months later I upgraded the HDD with an SSD. It made a big difference. Over time and a few installed programs later it was starting to be less responsive and programs were taking longer to load.

Looking through task manager I could see the total memory usage with several programs running was showing well over 70%. Thinking I might need a memory upgrade I did a little research and several people were saying some Dell computers were finicky with regards to RAM upgrades. One manufacturer in particular was recommended and said it was guaranteed to work but quite expensive at the same time.

Long story short . . decided to purchase the TECMIYO 16GB (4x4) Kit based on its high user ratings. A couple days later the package arrived and the new RAM modules were installed. Everything went without a glitch and an overall easy upgrade. Happy to say my new old system is a lot snappier and responsive now and total memory usage is showing just over 40%. Highly recommend this RAM! Great price and works on a Dell 780 computer!
I got it few days ago, so far no complaints. It was pretty tricky to install however.
The reason for 4 instead 5 stars is that I have ordered DIMM but received UDIMM version. However, it works very well and it is slightly faster than the version I have ordered.

reviews.review: No longer able to get the cooler master N200 case for our in store pre built system for business clients ( something nice, and good quality that lacked the side window for business computers ) I turned to this case in the similar price range. These are currently out of stock as well after ordering 3. Soft metal. One of the 3 had it's side smooshed in and no signs of damage to box. The RGB strip is nice and has a button next to the power button that switches between the patters. This case cost about $55 when I purchased it and this is the general quality of cases in this price range. As long as you don't set anything on it, or stare at it too hard, the case should hold up ok.

This case is all steel aside from the front panel. RGB on the front is a nice little addition. I needed a cheap case with the option for a front drive bay, as I was building for an elderly relative. It is a nice size, and much lighter weight than the 2014 acer tower it replaced. Front intake probably isn't the best but for integrated graphics builds this case will do just fine.

I knew it wasn't high quality, but I did expect the motherboard to line-up which it didn't. The mounting screws were already present though I had to disassemble some components in order to make things fit. I'd probably go with a low end Fractal Design or Cooler Master next time because the steel is of better quality. You can't use dual 140mm fans in the front if you wish to utilize the supplied RGB/LED that requires a 3pin or 4pin connection.

After gradually upgrading my computer, I found that I had enough parts to build a "fun" computer to try out various Linux distros. However, I needed a small cheap case. Here is the good: It looks nice. The sides bulge out which makes laying the power supply wires under the motherboard mount pretty easy. The steel is thin, but of good quality. (Screws did not strip the threaded holes.) A full size ATX motherboard fits. There is a 5.25 inch drive bay.

The bad: The 3.5 inch drive cage mounts at the bottom of the case right where it interferes with the USB3.0 socket on my motherboard. I had to mount the drive using the screw holes more forward in the case. The instructions are worthless. Mounting more than one 2.5 inch SSD would be very difficult. The included case fan is (as expected) cheap.

Would I buy it again, knowing what I know now? YES
It worked well for the price.

reviews.review: NOT ALL PROBLEMS CAN BE AUTOMATED SERVICE AND IS NOT ALEAYS YES OR NO QUESTION, TRY BRINGING BACK PEOPLE INSTEAD OF THIS AUTOMATED CUSTOMER SERVICE CRAP. WILL NO LONGER BUY COMPUTER PARTS FROM EITHER KEDUERS OR AMAZON. Lucky you don't have negative stars for your review you would get minus five stars.
I love that there is organization with the chords and clips to help stay organized as the build progresses

Case looks amazing and the quality is top notch. I transferred over my gaming system to this case and everything fit perfectly. I did not use the fans that came with the case but the fans too looked like good quality fans and I will probably use them on my next pc build.

I'd like to preface by saying that it is a good quality pc case, especially for the price and the amount of space it gives you to work. One thing I must note is that my case fans all came installed as exhaust fans meaning there was no airflow coming into the pc. I was not able to make note of this until my pc was forcefully powered down, I'm assuming due to overheating the cpu during a game. If you setup the pc as it comes to you, you run the risk of suffocating your components which could lead to potential damage. Once the case fans are changed to an orientation that provides adequate airflow, it is not as authentically pleasing as it is advertised. Sure you can buy extra case fans for the top that can function as an intake, but there generally should be more intake than exhaust in a pc and four exhaust fans just is not acceptable. TLDR - beware when installing, all fans may be exhaust fans

Pero de momento, si buscas ampliar RAM DDR3 1600 Mhz, con la mejor relación en precio, al menos aquí en Amazon es la mejor que encontré, y de paso, le daba una oportunidad a este fabricante, que aún siendo poco conocido, tenía buenas opiniones.
