I purchased this memory as I had been advised that if you have two different memory sticks (one 4GB and one 8GB), the motherboard would use single-channel access to the RAM, so I thought I'd see a huge memory speed increase by going to two sticks of 8GB (16GB total). So I was very disappointed to notice no speed increase at all after installing the two sticks of 8GB. Thinking something was wrong, I looked again and learned that the motherboard had been using dual-channel for 4GB across both sticks (8GB total) and single-channel for the remaining 4GB on the second stick - so this is why I hadn't noticed a huge speed increase...... Of course, this is my own fault - but I am happy to have 16GB now - and if I go application heavy in the future then I'll appreciate having dual-channel across 16GB! Product arrived on-time, and in good shape.

I have always bought Crucial memory as I've never had any problem with previous purchases, the products come with a decent warranty, and they guarantee it'll work with the computer so long as you use their application prior to purchasing. So took screen shots to prove that I had tested it prior to purchasing - knowing that I could return it if it didn't perform as expected. It's a pretty easy system to use.

It's pretty slow and has difficulty even just running Windows 11 processes, but at the end of the day it's a single stick of low speed 8GB memory that didn't even cost 20 bucks. Saves me from having to drop 100+ dollars on a set of decent gaming memory before I even know the motherboard works, and now it can go into the box of spare/test parts for later. TL;DR, you won't be doing any hardcore gaming on this stick but it works for quick and cheap testing or maybe if all you do on your PC is data entry or emails.

reviews.review:
Was an upgrade to an existing desktop installation, was quickly delivered and easily installed.

Man, remember the first time I installed RAM; PC XT (8088/NECv20) used an ENTIRELY different memory bus. ;-)

Bought this to upgrade our custom, passively cooled, SFF, general-purpose home theatre PC and this stuff works great. Paired with an underclocked i5 6600, 500GB SSD, and a SFF 1050 Ti, everything from video streaming to ‘heavy’ web browsing works flawlessly. While I wouldn’t recommend it for anything like gaming, this stuff is great for general usage.

Ram is something where you just want to have as much as you can afford & not worry so much about the speed & so forth. Faster IS better too if you can afford it, BUT, in Ram, you really want QUANTITY even more than speed.

This is non RGB Ram, nothing really fancy, but it looks nice & is a clean design that won't break your pocket book.

Speeds & timings are a little on the slower side but specs are good & everything works as it should.

Ram is usually something that goes bad years down the road if it DOES go bad, or unless you get a bad stick out of the box which is rare, so only time will tell on the durability of this Ram. But it's good out of the gate as it were.
Has a 5 year warranty if you have any issues with yours.

2 sticks of 8gb, a total of 16gb of Ram is enough for most every day uses & PC's. Even 8gb is usually adequate. The less Ram you have though, the faster it will "fill up" & the more you will need to do a full restart to clear it so your PC doesn't slow down.

16gb is a good place to start as far as capacity. I always like to get a MoBo that has 4 slots for Ram though, and start with filling 2 of the slots with half the capacity of the MoBo, and then you have the option to double that later on with matched Ram. ...It's really best to not mix & match Ram BTW. Try to get the same kind & capacity sizes when you do add some. At least be sure you match the timings to prevent issues.

This is good Ram though, especially if you're on a tighter budget.

This is a great price for RAM, it's no fancy names or anything extra, but it does exactly what it says it does! Great value for your $, definitely worth it, especially if your on a budget! It's really all you need!

I was pleasantly surprised the ram performed up to speck as advertised on my B450 motherboard without issue. Looks like new name cheapo ram it is confirmed running it at 2,666mhz indeed. This pleases me.

In looking to upgrade the RAM in my workstation, I came across many options: heat spreaders, RGB, etc..
My workstation, however, requires JEDEC memory modules, which limited my choices somewhat. Not that it matters, as my workstation's case does not have a clear side panel to see what's going on inside.

I came across this Timetec Hynix 16 GB kit, and although I have never heard of Timetec, I have had Hynix based RAM in a couple of my previous workstations, and so decided to try this out.

The kit arrived in well packaged condition, seals intact and all.

Installation was fairly straight forward; remove old memory modules, align the notch of the new ones with the indentation on the memory module slots, and push into place.

Upon initial power up of my workstation, I was greeted by a blank screen for a good 15 - 20 seconds. Although terrifying at first, I did not get any BIOS POST beep codes indicating RAM issues, so I decided to wait it out instead of hard powering off and on again. Shortly after, I was greeted (and relieved to see) Windows 10 starting up; I guess my workstation needed some time to initialize itself with the newly installed RAM.

In Windows 10 Task Manager, the newly installed RAM appears to be running at the correct speed of 2666 MHz. So far so good, and the performance gain of having 16 GB of RAM is very much noticeable.

It may not have any fancy head spreader, or fancy RGB, but if you are in need of JEDEC RAM, I would highly recommend Timetec Hynix.
svolgono egregiamente il loro compito sono veloci e affidabili riconosciute subito dall'intero sistema
Mejor de lo esperaba, no tuve ningún inconveniente con la instalación. Lo mejor que el envío fue muy rápido

The delivery was prompt even during this Covid19 epidemic, even arriving a day earlier than I expected it to. Once it arrived, opening, unpacking the box, opening the package the RAM came in all took longer than the actual installation into my Acer Aspire desktop. All in all, it probably took less than 10 minutes from the time the delivery was dropped off to starting up the computer with the additional 16GB of memory.

To begin with I only had 1 stick of 16GB, so adding this doubled it to my computer's maximum of 32GB. Once installed, the boot-up time for my Debian-based Linux distro was noticeable quicker, as well as the time it took to automatically login. Furthermore there was a great increase in both the time it took to launch several apps along with running those several at the same time. For instance, prior to adding this RAM I was able to run several apps all at once, but each app made the computer lag a little bit more each time. Now I can run VLC, Firefox with YouTube playing, GIMP, Inkscape, my Terminal and Libreoffice without noticing any lag whatsoever.

I won't lie, there's probably some better, faster RAM available, but since I don't play any games, this RAM is a great, budget-friendly addition which makes using my computer quicker and more reliable for everyday use, plus coding, watching videos, playing music, and graphic design here and there, and so on and so forth.

If you need some additional RAM for the uses I've described, this 16GB will suite your needs perfectly. I imagine the same is true if you need Timetec's other sizes like 4GB, 8Gb, and 32Gb, in both the desktop and laptop varieties. I don't think the make single sticks of more than 32GB, but they do make kits ranging from 1x4GB, 2x4GB, 4x4GB, 1x8GB, 4x8GB, all the way up to 8x16GB and 4x32GB, both of which would give you a whopping 128GB RAM.

What's more all these various kits are quite reasonably priced. Like I said above, these may not be the top of the line when it comes to RAM like HyperX, Corsair, Patriot, or G.Skill, but at the end of the day all you need is budget-friendly, easy to install, and reliable memory, this Timetec Hynix IC 16GB DDR4 2666MHz RAM is a perfect fit. I also imagine the plethora of other kits made by Timetec will suit your needs for a good price and reliability as well!

reviews.review:
I recently acquired the CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600 (PC4-28800) C18 Desktop Memory to pair with i5-13600K and 4080 FE, and I must say it has been an excellent addition to my PC setup. In this review, I will share my experience with this memory kit, focusing on its performance, aesthetics, and overall value.

Performance:
The CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO memory kit boasts impressive performance specifications. With a speed of DDR4 3600 and a CAS latency of 18, it delivers fast and responsive performance for demanding tasks. I noticed a significant improvement in overall system responsiveness, particularly when running resource-intensive applications and multitasking. The increased memory capacity of 32GB ensures smooth performance and effortless multitasking, even when dealing with large files or running memory-intensive software.

Aesthetics:
The standout feature of the CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO memory kit is its stunning RGB lighting. The individually addressable RGB LEDs on each module can be customized using the CORSAIR iCUE software, allowing for a wide range of lighting effects and color combinations. The lighting synchronization with other compatible CORSAIR products further enhances the overall aesthetic appeal, creating an immersive and visually striking setup. The sleek, low-profile design of the modules adds to their visual appeal and compatibility with most CPU coolers.

Build Quality and Durability:
CORSAIR is well-known for its high-quality components, and the Vengeance RGB PRO memory kit lives up to that reputation. The modules are built with precision and attention to detail, ensuring long-lasting durability. The aluminum heat spreaders not only enhance the aesthetics but also contribute to effective heat dissipation, allowing for stable performance even during extended use. The sturdy construction of the modules provides confidence in their reliability.

Easy Installation and Compatibility:
Installing the CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO memory kit was a breeze. The modules fit seamlessly into my motherboard's DIMM slots, and the XMP 2.0 support made it easy to set up and optimize the memory settings for maximum performance. The compatibility with a wide range of motherboards ensures that most users can benefit from this memory kit without any compatibility concerns.

Value:
While the CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO memory kit falls in the higher price range, it offers excellent value for enthusiasts and gamers seeking high-performance memory with captivating RGB lighting. The combination of impressive performance, eye-catching aesthetics, and reliable build quality justifies the investment for those who prioritize both style and functionality in their PC setup.

Final Thoughts:
The CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO 32GB (2x16GB) DDR4 3600 (PC4-28800) C18 Desktop Memory is a top-notch memory kit that delivers not only exceptional performance but also adds a touch of RGB brilliance to your PC build. With its impressive speed, ample capacity, customizable RGB lighting, and reliable build quality, this memory kit is a worthy upgrade for users looking to enhance their PC's performance and aesthetics.

Disclaimer: I purchased the CORSAIR Vengeance RGB PRO 32GB DDR4 3600 Desktop Memory independently and did not receive it as part of any specific program or incentive. My review is solely based on my personal experience and observations with this memory kit.

The RGB is a little of a pain to get programmed and sometimes they don't like to do what you ask so sometimes you have to reload it and redo it even when hardware setting them but at the end of the day you don't buy gaming ram for colours as the first priority! The iCue is the only downside which isnt a knock so much on the ram but at least if you have several iCue products you don't have too many programs to change different RGB options in your case.

I knew going in that I would probably not be able to run this at the 3600 mhz that it was rated to work at, when I installed it on my setup. I am currently running a Corsair Vengeance computer with an i7 11700 non k cpu, and a MSI Z490-A pro motherboard.

Once installed and set to XMP it gave me the overclock error. I dropped it to 3200 mhz and it booted fine with no problems since. I am running bios E7C751Z1.2CB, or 2.CB is how CPU Z reads it.

It should easily go higher, but I will have to play with the overclock settings and see how high I can get it to work while being stable. This kit is using Nanya chips, at least the sticks I have, which is fine.

Even if it goes no higher, it has been a good upgrade from 16 gb. Things seem to run very smoothly and I have no problems running discord and surfing the web on my second monitor, while gaming on my main one. I have two 27" MSI monitors side by side.

The rgb looks great, and since I have a Corsair Vengeance computer already it just worked right off the bat with my icue software.

I feel much better about having 32 gbs of memory for my future PC games. I also know that, although I have no plans too, in the future if I upgrade or change the motherboard and possibly the cpu, I can still use this memory and it will work fine at its rated speed of 3600 mhz.

I have no cons. Corsair makes great memory and other computer components, and this memory was a great value at this low of a price in the summer of 2023.

reviews.review:
So when I got the ram I ended up spending like 1 to about two hours trying to install it. I got a asrock b450 pro4 board. I got a ryzen 5600x cpu I recently had 16gb of this ram, then I decided to get the 32gb version of it. My motherboard max ram is 64Gb adding it up I was basically installing 48Gb all together. But for some reason when I add the two 16gb sticks with the two 8gb sticks, my computer for some reason would not boot up. Now this was me switching the rams around trying to figure out what was the problem. Because before I had some different brand name rams I mixed it with the Vulcan’s and it worked at 24gb but iv learned mixing different ram brands can cause issues and lower performance. But my pc still booted up, and ran pretty decent. But for some reason adding the same Vulcan Z”s 32gb with the 8gb ram did not boot up. At this point I was confused. Because it is so post to boot up, I ended up checking my motherboard website
I was missing bios update 8.01 v2 1.2.0.8 apparently this update is for amd/ intel motherboards as well. It is so post to help with memory of your motherboard. So if you don’t have it please download it! A lot people that have gaming computers pre built just to game don’t know about bios updates. After removing one of the 16gb sticks and leaving the two 8gb sticks my pc finally booted up. I am still confused to the point where I don’t understand why it dose not boot up with both 16gb sticks and only one. I’m still getting my 32gb performance on my pc so I am happy with it. Now I just have one brand new 16gb ram stick collecting dust until i can figure out how to install it and get my 48Gb performance. Honestly I don’t know if it’s the company because i have seen a few reviews that these type of sticks are corrupted. So if you decide on buying Vulcan brand ram sticks good luck it might work and it might not work so your playing a dirty ball game :) hopefully if you missed this review before u bought the ram, and u have the same problem and u manage to find this an u try my methods explain above. An it helps YOUR WELCOME :)

Bought 4 sticks for my 5800x and ROG STRIX B450-F GAMING II motherboard. 2 sticks work fine at 3596 MT/s, but only in the A2 and B2 slots. To get 4 sticks to work, I had to reduce the speed to 3533 MT/s.

I did not have to RMA this RAM, but at one point I thought I would need to, and I'm pleased to report that I was able to get an RMA number online within minutes with just the serial number from the RAM. Compare this to other manufacturers who require you to produce a receipt and supply the vendor name, purchase date, etc. I very much appreciate the no-hassle RMA process and lifetime warranty of this RAM.

This RAM works great on a Gigabyte AB350-Gaming-CF board with a Ryzen 3 2200G processor, with an XMPP profile enabled in the firmware. Recommended purchase.

First time building a machine in a long time so this is my first rgb ram. Cost was great at the time for the speeds. The rgb is very bright and syncs with some of the top rgb controls. I'm using aura sync and it worked flawlessly.
Both sticks are good out or the box, zero issues. I may even pick up another 8x2 set for 32gb of ram total. Without massive Photoshop or video editing 16 is probably enough already, and anything over 32 is definitely overkill.

I think this is the most RAM I have ever had in a computer I have owned. Long gone is the time when I exceeded the 4K of RAM in my Vic20.
I was looking for a little boost for my desktop, this was it. Easy enough to install for my who has been doing this for decades. Click add to cart, what do you have to loose?

This seems to be very good and affordable RAM. Looks like high quality Made in Taiwan. Worked right out of the box.
I recommend.
I ordered the MSi B450-A Max Pro motherboard when AM5 came out and paid around 80$ for it. A bit expensive but it is an ATX board. This RAM works with this motherboard right out of the box and is paired with an Ryzen 5900X. Super easy to install and flash with the BIOS button the Bios for the Ryzen 5000 series CPU's. Worked right out of the box. The board is better than the B450 board I have from Asus. Easy to install in my XPG Invader case.
At the beginning when freshly installed Windows 11 I got lots of sound problems. After installing the crap of MSi drivers and Utilities which actual version MSi's MSi Center was offering, my sound got messed up completely. Sound stutters becauso of the new sound drivers, Chipset drivers and the like. Headphones and 5.1 Speakers intermittently connected/disconnected causing delays and stutters. Looked like an software issue of MSi software. That foreced me to reinstall and erase from scrap Windows 10 and it offered then to upgrade to Windows 11. After that the problem was gone with only Windows drivers. Do not download the crap MSi Center offers. It can break your OS.
Other than that this board suggests it has 2 full fledged PCIE x 16 slots of the 3.0 type. At least that is what customers will think easily. Think twice. It has only one x16 PCIE 3.0 slot and the long one below has x16 openings but only half of those have connector pins installed and the manual says it is not even an x8 slot but rather an x4 only. And to add insult to injury that slot is only 2.0. Completely misleading for an new buyer.
On the lower slot I have the GT 1030 GDDR5 from MSi installed I had still from Q1 2020. It works on low settings on some games like HnG from 2016 and gets between 52 fps and 60 fps.
Other than that this MSi board works way better than the Asus B450 board I have on my other system from last year. The RAM slots are way easier to use and the sticks slide into them like lubricated. The dual channel works on this board which is on my Asus most likely defective (Asus refuses warranty). I use it with 32 GB (2 x 16) TeamGroup TCreate RAM sticks. High quality 3200 Mhz sticks for relatively cheap.
It is a good strong board with 2 massive coolers on the Mosfets. These massive coolers impressed me as an new inexperienced buyer for my very first build. So it slipped to me the issue with the PCIE "x16" slots.
This Motherboard worked straight out of the box. I use the Ryzen 5900X with this with an Gamemax Gamma 500 AM4 cooler. The coolers does not fit well the AM4 system since it's clip is way to stiff so I had to take the cooler off the CPU and bend a bit the clips till it fits just with a little pressure. Install the air coolers without too much pressure so it is not loose but can slide a bit is fine before snapping it gently in place. As original fit I got 66 Celsius to 70 Celsius on idle or doing basic work with that processor, but after bending the clips to aliviate the pressure I get now at the moment 51 Degrees Celsius. So if too much pressure is applied by the cooler onto the processor that rises the heat to a difference of about 20 Degrees Celsius. Any of these standard air coolers with heat pipes will be able to cool the Ryzen 5900X easily. While gaming it gets to about 61 degrees Celsius. My case has 3 fans in the front and 1 in the back.
MSi's UEFI is a bit confusing if one is used to the Asus UEFI. But it has basically the same features but it is way more confusing. The fans can be adjusted better on MSi's BIOS. But with this 5900X duo deca core CPU, the PSU is annoyingly loud all the time. While on Ecomode with 65 Watts the whole system draws on gaming about 150 Watts. The board seems to have no problems to deliver power to the 5900X.
Running Cinebench with this board and 5900X CPU with settings to Ecomode 65Watt, the case fans kick in, the CPU has an temp of 61 Degrees Celsius after 5 Minutes Cinebench, the Mosfets have an temperature of 58 Degrees Celsius and the PCH has an temperature of 50 Celsius while the Cooler Master Silencio 120mm fan I put on the Gamma from GameMax CPU cooler, turns 1000 rpm and all 4 Arctic F12 120mm case fans show an rpm of 700.
I am surprised how this GameMax Gamma air cooler is able to maintain cool this CPU. So the huge aluminum coolers on the Mosfets of the MSi board sure do their job.
The board has lots of fan headers. Thats very good.
I recommend this board for the AM4 system but be aware of the cheating PCIE slot advertisement, the sound problems and the rather difficult to use UEFI settings. But this is an robust board.

I purchased this for a non-rgb SFF build on a 12 series Intel system.

The product arrived very quickly and packaged nice for safe transport.

I needed lower profile memory for a SFF build and decided to try this memory out. I have seen it recommended by PC builders for the last few years and decided it must be sufficient.

I have been using this memory now for a couple months and am completely satisfied with the performance, reliability, and the great value compared to other big name brands. It is not that bad looking as well.

Performance wise, it is on par with any other memory with the same MHZ and timings. It also overclocks nicely if that's still your thing.

I would definitely recommend this to others

What can I say. If you're looking for speed and 32 over 16 GB, it's grat value for the price as of the time I'm writing this. I tried it in several amd boards ranging from b450's through x570's. Non of the had this ram on their QVL, but XMP/EXPO/DOCP all worked correctly on every board I tried it on. MSI, Asus, and several Gigabyte boards.

I ended up sticking it in my workshop computer. Simple Asus x570 tuf gaming plus wi-fi, running a Ryzen 7 5700g. Since the rig uses the on board IGP of the 5700g, it uses the system ram for video memory. The fastest you can put in helps, and this 4000 speed ram gets the job done at a great price.

I recently bought the TEAMGROUP T-Force Delta RGB DDR4 32GB for my gaming PC and I have to say I'm pretty impressed. The RGB lighting is gorgeous and syncs well with my motherboard. The performance is also top-notch, with fast speeds and low latency. The installation was easy, and the packaging was nice.

The only minor issue I have is that the RAM sticks are quite tall and they barely fit under my CPU cooler. I had to adjust the fan position a bit to make some room. It's not a big deal, but it would have been nice if they were a bit shorter or had a low-profile option.

Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase and I would recommend this RAM to anyone looking for a reliable and stylish upgrade. I give it 4/5 stars.

Good delivery partner and seller but ram itself is not that good of a quality cant push to the frequency specs and the heatsink along with thermal pad is not touching the last memory chip on either side, I guess that can be fine for normal use as the die can still dissipate heat through pcb and I dont see high temperatures on hwinfo ddr section

La mémoire Corsair Vengeance DDR5 64 Go est sans aucun doute une révolution dans le monde de la performance informatique. Avec son incroyable capacité de 64 Go et sa technologie DDR5 de pointe, cette mémoire incarne l'essence même de l'innovation de Corsair.

Lors de mes tests approfondis avec cette mémoire, j'ai été stupéfait par ses performances exceptionnelles. Que ce soit pour le gaming, l'édition de contenu multimédia ou les tâches de productivité intensives, la Corsair Vengeance DDR5 ne montre aucun signe de ralentissement. Les taux de transfert de données sont tout simplement éblouissants, ce qui se traduit par des temps de chargement raccourcis et une réactivité accrue de l'ensemble du système.

Un autre aspect remarquable de cette mémoire est son design élégant. Les dissipateurs thermiques en aluminium ajoutent non seulement une touche de sophistication à l'esthétique globale de votre système, mais ils garantissent également une gestion thermique optimale, permettant à la mémoire de fonctionner à des températures idéales même pendant les sessions de jeu intenses.

L'installation de la mémoire Corsair Vengeance DDR5 a été un jeu d'enfant. Grâce au design intuitif et à la qualité de fabrication de Corsair, les modules s'emboîtent parfaitement dans les emplacements DIMM de ma carte mère, sans aucun problème.

En outre, Corsair ne fait aucun compromis en matière de fiabilité. La réputation de la marque pour la durabilité et la qualité est solidement ancrée dans ce produit. Avec une garantie qui accompagne cette mémoire, vous pouvez avoir l'esprit tranquille quant à votre investissement.

En conclusion, la mémoire Corsair Vengeance DDR5 64 Go est une véritable prouesse technologique qui élève votre expérience informatique à des sommets inégalés. Ses performances éblouissantes, son design élégant et sa fiabilité à toute épreuve en font un choix indiscutable pour les utilisateurs à la recherche de l'ultime évolution de la mémoire informatique. Corsair a une fois de plus prouvé pourquoi il est un leader de confiance dans l'industrie, et la Vengeance DDR5 en est la preuve vivante.

Quello che conta invece è che:
- è stabile (stress test superati), è sempre meglio 2 dim da 32 che 4 da 16 per la stabilità

Consigliata!

Update Mayo 2023
=================
Después de unos días de uso algunos mensajes de error se evidenciaban en Windows relacionados a memoria, después de leer las especificaciones de mi core i9 13900k y de la motherboard asus Z690-F encontré que las velocidades recomendadas eran de 4800MHZ para 128Gb así que ajusté la frecuencia de 5200Mhz a 4800MHZ con el XMP habilitado y los errores se fueron, de cualquier manera contacté al soporte de CORSAIR con el tema y justo el 5 de Mayo ASUS liberó una nueva versión del CHIPSET Versión 2251.4.2.0 la descripción dice "Improve system Stability & Security" asi que actualicé y subí las velocidades de la memoria a STOCK (5200 MHZ) con XMP, he realizado benchmarks y pruebas de velocidad con AIDA64 y todo va excelente después de 9 días de uso rudo, agrego una imagen con el benchmark obtenido con los 128GB de la memoria CORSAIR.

Update Abril 2023
=================
Crecí mi equipo a 128GB por necesidades de tener mis laboratorios y servers funcionales y mas que fascinado con las memorias, excelente respuesta con Linux y Oracle, te proveen bastante estabilidad.
En mi experiencia una vez que las coloqué el equipo no reiniciaba y se quedaba la luz naranja de la Motherboard encendido, tuve que deshabilitar el XMP del Bios y colocar el valor a AUTO para que el equipo pudiera hacer el Boot, una vez que las memorias son reconocidas puedes colocar nuevamente
la función XMP en el Bios y automáticamente se colocan las velocidades a 5200 MHZ.
Ampliamente recomendadas estas memorias para tu ensamble.

Octubre 2022
=================
Compré las memorias para un upgrade de mi ensamble usando un procesador Core i9-13900k con una motherboard ASUS ROG STRIX Z690-F Gaming. Me gusta ensamblar yo mismo mis equipos y busqué una motherboard que tuviera el soporte para la 13va generación de Intel encontrando esta que menciono. Realicé el ensamble en el case Cougar Conquer 2, el ensamble de procesador, cableados, conexiones y enfriadores súper fácil siguiendo los manuales. El dolor de cabeza vino cuando una vez instaladas las memorias CORSAIR el equipo no era capaz de bootear y prendía la luz naranja indicando problema en el VRAM es decir en las memorias CORSAIR DDR5, pensé que quizá las memorias venían dañadas o quizá yo hice alguna conexión errónea por lo que decidí repetir mi ensamble completo =D. Una vez completado el error permanecía y ninguno de los manuales ayudaba con algún posible FIX para corregir el error. Después de ponerlas y retirarlas N veces empecé a preparar una devolución de las memorias porque todo indicaba estaban dañadas. Vi algunos videos en internet y encontré una guía para un problema similar que recomendaban aplicar un UPDATE del BIOS. Por mi falta de experiencia desmonté nuevamente todo mi ensamble y realicé el UPDATE del BIOS a través de la conexión trasera FLASHBACK que provee esta motherboard realizándolo sin ningún componente instalado, después supe que no era necesario haber desensamblado todo mi ensamble por 3a vez y pude haberlo realizado con todo instalado =D El update del BIOS tomó alrededor de 20 minutos y una vez concluido realicé el ensamble nuevamente y WOOW el booteo se hizó de manera correcta levantando mi ensamble. Ejecuté la función de Overclocking de Intelligence Overclock de ASUS y las memorias fueron ajustadas a correr a 5600Mhz (su velocidad nativa es de 5200Mhz), después de más de 1 mes de uso no he tenido ningún problema y estoy más que FELIZ con mi adquisición, súper recomendables estas memorias para tu ensamble. Yo adquirí 2 memorias de 32GB cada una y si en un momento por alguna necesidad decido llevarlo a 128GB no dudaré en adquirir este modelo de Memorias. Espero mi experiencia ayude a alguien más en su ensamble / Upgrade usando estas memorias de CORSAIR.

Die RAM Riegel sind wie beschrieben.
Um die volle Leistung abrufen zu können muss man ins BIOS, dafür gibt es viele Erklärungen im Internet.
Ich habe 4 x 16 GB DDR 5 auf einem MSI Pro Z790 P WiFi und es läuft alles einwandfrei.

Im very happy with this Corsair DDR5-5200mhz memory. It looks great on my mostly white build PC and I have it running at 5400 via a user configurable XMP profile in my Gigabyte z690 aero D-BIOS.

It was not obvious at first why it was running at 4800 and that I only seemed to have one XMP profile to set. but as I discovered you can have up to 3 xmp profiles once set under advanced memory settings and SPD (Gigabyte z690 aero D)

I'm sure this memory can be run at a higher frequency but that will involve changing voltages and timings which can be troublesome if not done correctly, and the BIOS will have to be reset.

You can check easily if you have the correct speed by going to Windows Task manager/Performance and Memory tab, or,download cpu-z app.

I will purchase another 64bg of this memory to give me a total of 128gb for my system, which will be useful for vst libraries and video editing etc. But this will more than likely require adjusting voltages, etc, to get the required speed.

Highly recommended.

UPDATE. I bought another pair of these sticks (black) for a total of 128gb

I got the 64gb Corsair DDR5-5200mhz kits in the black version for an excellent price; this was to add to my Corsair 64GB DDR5-5200mhz white kit for a total of 128gb for my system. I would have preferred the white version I previously bought for my PC build, but the black sticks were much cheaper than what I originally paid; it was a no-brainer.

I have these sticks and the white ones in an MSI z790 edge wi-fi motherboard. I had a Gigabyte z690 D aero, with 64gb white set in my original review , but I had to get another motherboard for various reasons.

With just two sticks in my motherboard I managed to get them running stable at 5400mhz. (XMP profiles), which was great, but when I added 4 sticks at 128gb, the fastest I could get was 4800mhz, that was both motherboards.

However, Recently MSI updated their BIOS for this board which included fixes for better memory compatibility, so, I decided to try get 5200mhz running again, and to my surprise it worked perfectly, for a while. But, even after passing a memory test and playing a few games without any problems, I got a windows green screen error when I was closing down an app. So then, I decided to try and get at least 5000mhz running, which I have them running at now, stable. Actually, they are running at 5067mhz.

I'm very happy with this speed and do not mind losing 200mhz from the speed they are supposed to run at. In fact, the speed difference when I had 64GB running at 5200 and beyond is actually quite negligible, according to various memory tests.

Overall, I think this memory performs well and is from a top tier brand, which means better compatibility with motherboards. With future BIOS updates, perhaps 128gb might run at 5200 and beyond, stable, here's hoping.

Highly recommended

UPDATE 2.

MSI released another BIOS update (7D91vH4) for my z790 wifi edge motherboard, which includes improved memory compatibility and many other updates. I updated it and adjusted the Dram frequency to 5200Mhz G2, while disabling the XMP profile, and it has been running stable while doing memory tests and playing games etc.

My current system specs:
I9-13900k
MSI z790 wi-fi edge
Gigabyte RTX 4070 aero
Asus Essence STX II sound card
Kingston 1tb KC3000 PCIe 4.0 NVMe M.2 SSD
Arctic liquid freezer II 360 RGB AiO
Another 3 nvme drives and two ssd’s

reviews.review: I was in market to buy a replacement chair and found this nice chair which was looking like my branded chair, which stayed with me for 15 years. I will definitely recommend anyone to buy this chair, if you are looking for an ergonomic chair. I am giving a 5 star with my usage for the last few days.

After using this ergonomic office chair for my work from home, Despite working many hours, I remain comfortable thanks to the swivel mesh design. Specially my back thanks lumbar support and moveable cushion. It is ideal for anyone thanks to the tilting and height adjustment options, fixed armrests, and PU wheels. I am impressed with this office chair. All the tools were provided to assemble. It was easy to put it all together. It has great back support. And wheels are very smooth!! I would recommend this for anyone looking for office chair.

We were renovating our homeschool room and work space, and all of the desks required new chairs because the majority of them were five to ten years old. Some didn't even have wheels to roll on any longer.  All of the children went online and chose chairs to fit their personalities, and this one was chosen by my teenage daughter.

She prefers the color black; therefore, the chair is perfect for her. She didn't want something too big, but she did need something to support her because she is a tall girl. This chair is quite comfy, simple to put together, and supports my daughter's posture and body.

This chair's mesh back support is appealing to me since it allows for constant airflow, which keeps my daughter from sweating and stinking up the room. She spends several hours a day in this chair, and the large cushions support her body without turning the seat cushion into a pancake.

The chair moves effortlessly, has adjustable armrests and a height adjustment, and comes with simple assembly instructions. We had the box unpacked and assembled, and the chair at her desk ready to use in fifteen minutes. It is also reasonably priced, which always makes a parent happy when they are overspending on children's stuff.

reviews.review:
So when I got the ram I ended up spending like 1 to about two hours trying to install it. I got a asrock b450 pro4 board. I got a ryzen 5600x cpu I recently had 16gb of this ram, then I decided to get the 32gb version of it. My motherboard max ram is 64Gb adding it up I was basically installing 48Gb all together. But for some reason when I add the two 16gb sticks with the two 8gb sticks, my computer for some reason would not boot up. Now this was me switching the rams around trying to figure out what was the problem. Because before I had some different brand name rams I mixed it with the Vulcan’s and it worked at 24gb but iv learned mixing different ram brands can cause issues and lower performance. But my pc still booted up, and ran pretty decent. But for some reason adding the same Vulcan Z”s 32gb with the 8gb ram did not boot up. At this point I was confused. Because it is so post to boot up, I ended up checking my motherboard website
I was missing bios update 8.01 v2 1.2.0.8 apparently this update is for amd/ intel motherboards as well. It is so post to help with memory of your motherboard. So if you don’t have it please download it! A lot people that have gaming computers pre built just to game don’t know about bios updates. After removing one of the 16gb sticks and leaving the two 8gb sticks my pc finally booted up. I am still confused to the point where I don’t understand why it dose not boot up with both 16gb sticks and only one. I’m still getting my 32gb performance on my pc so I am happy with it. Now I just have one brand new 16gb ram stick collecting dust until i can figure out how to install it and get my 48Gb performance. Honestly I don’t know if it’s the company because i have seen a few reviews that these type of sticks are corrupted. So if you decide on buying Vulcan brand ram sticks good luck it might work and it might not work so your playing a dirty ball game :) hopefully if you missed this review before u bought the ram, and u have the same problem and u manage to find this an u try my methods explain above. An it helps YOUR WELCOME :)

Bought 4 sticks for my 5800x and ROG STRIX B450-F GAMING II motherboard. 2 sticks work fine at 3596 MT/s, but only in the A2 and B2 slots. To get 4 sticks to work, I had to reduce the speed to 3533 MT/s.

I did not have to RMA this RAM, but at one point I thought I would need to, and I'm pleased to report that I was able to get an RMA number online within minutes with just the serial number from the RAM. Compare this to other manufacturers who require you to produce a receipt and supply the vendor name, purchase date, etc. I very much appreciate the no-hassle RMA process and lifetime warranty of this RAM.

This RAM works great on a Gigabyte AB350-Gaming-CF board with a Ryzen 3 2200G processor, with an XMPP profile enabled in the firmware. Recommended purchase.

First time building a machine in a long time so this is my first rgb ram. Cost was great at the time for the speeds. The rgb is very bright and syncs with some of the top rgb controls. I'm using aura sync and it worked flawlessly.
Both sticks are good out or the box, zero issues. I may even pick up another 8x2 set for 32gb of ram total. Without massive Photoshop or video editing 16 is probably enough already, and anything over 32 is definitely overkill.

I think this is the most RAM I have ever had in a computer I have owned. Long gone is the time when I exceeded the 4K of RAM in my Vic20.
I was looking for a little boost for my desktop, this was it. Easy enough to install for my who has been doing this for decades. Click add to cart, what do you have to loose?

The specs are exactly as advertised. Installed on MSI Pro Z690-A DDR4 mobo and had no issue with installation. The main reason I chose this over "gaming" specific RAM is that it's an excellent price and I don't want my computer to look like a 14 year olds idea of a space ship. So far so good.
Comme titré. L'overclock préétablit s'engage sans problème dans le bios.
just installed them fixed a ram issue i was having, seem to be more compatiable with my board, works exactly as advertise and also came very quickly

This seems to be very good and affordable RAM. Looks like high quality Made in Taiwan. Worked right out of the box.
I recommend.
I ordered the MSi B450-A Max Pro motherboard when AM5 came out and paid around 80$ for it. A bit expensive but it is an ATX board. This RAM works with this motherboard right out of the box and is paired with an Ryzen 5900X. Super easy to install and flash with the BIOS button the Bios for the Ryzen 5000 series CPU's. Worked right out of the box. The board is better than the B450 board I have from Asus. Easy to install in my XPG Invader case.
At the beginning when freshly installed Windows 11 I got lots of sound problems. After installing the crap of MSi drivers and Utilities which actual version MSi's MSi Center was offering, my sound got messed up completely. Sound stutters becauso of the new sound drivers, Chipset drivers and the like. Headphones and 5.1 Speakers intermittently connected/disconnected causing delays and stutters. Looked like an software issue of MSi software. That foreced me to reinstall and erase from scrap Windows 10 and it offered then to upgrade to Windows 11. After that the problem was gone with only Windows drivers. Do not download the crap MSi Center offers. It can break your OS.
Other than that this board suggests it has 2 full fledged PCIE x 16 slots of the 3.0 type. At least that is what customers will think easily. Think twice. It has only one x16 PCIE 3.0 slot and the long one below has x16 openings but only half of those have connector pins installed and the manual says it is not even an x8 slot but rather an x4 only. And to add insult to injury that slot is only 2.0. Completely misleading for an new buyer.
On the lower slot I have the GT 1030 GDDR5 from MSi installed I had still from Q1 2020. It works on low settings on some games like HnG from 2016 and gets between 52 fps and 60 fps.
Other than that this MSi board works way better than the Asus B450 board I have on my other system from last year. The RAM slots are way easier to use and the sticks slide into them like lubricated. The dual channel works on this board which is on my Asus most likely defective (Asus refuses warranty). I use it with 32 GB (2 x 16) TeamGroup TCreate RAM sticks. High quality 3200 Mhz sticks for relatively cheap.
It is a good strong board with 2 massive coolers on the Mosfets. These massive coolers impressed me as an new inexperienced buyer for my very first build. So it slipped to me the issue with the PCIE "x16" slots.
This Motherboard worked straight out of the box. I use the Ryzen 5900X with this with an Gamemax Gamma 500 AM4 cooler. The coolers does not fit well the AM4 system since it's clip is way to stiff so I had to take the cooler off the CPU and bend a bit the clips till it fits just with a little pressure. Install the air coolers without too much pressure so it is not loose but can slide a bit is fine before snapping it gently in place. As original fit I got 66 Celsius to 70 Celsius on idle or doing basic work with that processor, but after bending the clips to aliviate the pressure I get now at the moment 51 Degrees Celsius. So if too much pressure is applied by the cooler onto the processor that rises the heat to a difference of about 20 Degrees Celsius. Any of these standard air coolers with heat pipes will be able to cool the Ryzen 5900X easily. While gaming it gets to about 61 degrees Celsius. My case has 3 fans in the front and 1 in the back.
MSi's UEFI is a bit confusing if one is used to the Asus UEFI. But it has basically the same features but it is way more confusing. The fans can be adjusted better on MSi's BIOS. But with this 5900X duo deca core CPU, the PSU is annoyingly loud all the time. While on Ecomode with 65 Watts the whole system draws on gaming about 150 Watts. The board seems to have no problems to deliver power to the 5900X.
Running Cinebench with this board and 5900X CPU with settings to Ecomode 65Watt, the case fans kick in, the CPU has an temp of 61 Degrees Celsius after 5 Minutes Cinebench, the Mosfets have an temperature of 58 Degrees Celsius and the PCH has an temperature of 50 Celsius while the Cooler Master Silencio 120mm fan I put on the Gamma from GameMax CPU cooler, turns 1000 rpm and all 4 Arctic F12 120mm case fans show an rpm of 700.
I am surprised how this GameMax Gamma air cooler is able to maintain cool this CPU. So the huge aluminum coolers on the Mosfets of the MSi board sure do their job.
The board has lots of fan headers. Thats very good.
I recommend this board for the AM4 system but be aware of the cheating PCIE slot advertisement, the sound problems and the rather difficult to use UEFI settings. But this is an robust board.

I purchased this for a non-rgb SFF build on a 12 series Intel system.

The product arrived very quickly and packaged nice for safe transport.

I needed lower profile memory for a SFF build and decided to try this memory out. I have seen it recommended by PC builders for the last few years and decided it must be sufficient.

I have been using this memory now for a couple months and am completely satisfied with the performance, reliability, and the great value compared to other big name brands. It is not that bad looking as well.

Performance wise, it is on par with any other memory with the same MHZ and timings. It also overclocks nicely if that's still your thing.

I would definitely recommend this to others

What can I say. If you're looking for speed and 32 over 16 GB, it's grat value for the price as of the time I'm writing this. I tried it in several amd boards ranging from b450's through x570's. Non of the had this ram on their QVL, but XMP/EXPO/DOCP all worked correctly on every board I tried it on. MSI, Asus, and several Gigabyte boards.

I ended up sticking it in my workshop computer. Simple Asus x570 tuf gaming plus wi-fi, running a Ryzen 7 5700g. Since the rig uses the on board IGP of the 5700g, it uses the system ram for video memory. The fastest you can put in helps, and this 4000 speed ram gets the job done at a great price.

I recently bought the TEAMGROUP T-Force Delta RGB DDR4 32GB for my gaming PC and I have to say I'm pretty impressed. The RGB lighting is gorgeous and syncs well with my motherboard. The performance is also top-notch, with fast speeds and low latency. The installation was easy, and the packaging was nice.

The only minor issue I have is that the RAM sticks are quite tall and they barely fit under my CPU cooler. I had to adjust the fan position a bit to make some room. It's not a big deal, but it would have been nice if they were a bit shorter or had a low-profile option.

Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase and I would recommend this RAM to anyone looking for a reliable and stylish upgrade. I give it 4/5 stars.

Good delivery partner and seller but ram itself is not that good of a quality cant push to the frequency specs and the heatsink along with thermal pad is not touching the last memory chip on either side, I guess that can be fine for normal use as the die can still dissipate heat through pcb and I dont see high temperatures on hwinfo ddr section

reviews.review: Speeding up my older PC I got a better video card too.

Works great on my Optiplex 7040 SFF, first start the computer hung up and wouldn't boot up at all, I pressed Delete Key and entered a diagnostic page.
I selected system test and after about 15 minutes I selected restart and it restarted successfully and has been running fine since.
I also read online that people have removed the BIOS 3V button cell and press and hold the power button for 10 or 15 seconds to reset the BIOS settings, replace the Button Cell and replace the drives you have to remove to access the memory and Battery and carry on with finishing the upgrade process.

Pros: It works with the Lenovo Legion Tower 7i Desktop, it's very easy to install, after having it for over a month I haven't had any issues with it casuing crashes, lagging etc. My PC runs a bit smoother overall, and exports videos faster, with this RAM (had 16GB previously now have 32GB RAM after this upgrade). Has plug and play functionality with the adverised 3200mhz spees running right after install no need to change things in the BIOS. And it comes with a lifetime warranty.

Cons: Unattractive basic design, It's expensive in my opinion. I got this for around $145 but the current price is now over $200 CAD! In just a month the price increased rapidly which I definitely don't like and would recommend others try to snag this on sale, or consider buying from Amazon US which has this priced much lower (even with conversion) than it is in Canada right now as of posting this review in August 2022.

Overall I would recommend this Crucial DDR4 RAM to others 👍🏾
I ordered wrong product so had to return. But iSanek was pretty good and helped me in the process.
It's exactly what I wanted. Thank you
I installed this this 16GB RAM in a Dell XPS 8910 PC and it works fine.

I recently had to get a new PC because my existing one, which was 13 years old and due for replacement in any case, failed to come back after a recent short power failure. The new system I purchased only came with one stick of 8 GB, so I needed a second stick so that I could have my RAM run in proper dual channel mode. After working 40 years as a computer hardware tech, I was very familiar with Crucial brand memory and figured I would not go wrong with them, and I was right. I popped it right in to an empty slot and my new system booted up into Windows 11 without a hitch and has been running beautifully. You can't go wrong with Crucial memory. So I have a new PC, a new operating system and new Crucial memory, I have to say I am a happy guy right now!

I will be keeping an eye on memory prices and once they go back down again, I will be picking up either a 16 GB or 32 GB kit to fill my remaining two memory slots.

It used to be that you would just "buy RAM", and hope for a good price because a warehouse hadn't burned down recently. Once performance increased, however, so did the complexity of matching RAM to your system.

Nevertheless, reputable manufacturers provide compatibility tables, and enough specs to be reasonably sure you are going to have success, and these modules are no exception.

They aren't glamorous, but honestly, only fools of the highest calibre would buy RAM for any purpose other than to reliably store a large collection of 1s and 0s until the power is turned off.

I matched them to my el cheapo ASUS Prime B360M-A, and set them to run at the standard rated clock, and I've had zero memory-related problems since ( and it's been plenty long enough for such problems to show ). Overclocking is for dweebs.

Really, these are quite uninteresting parts, as they should be. Firefox has never been happier to squander as much as it likes on my 400+ open tabs. Arguably, I could close some tabs, and then I wouldn't need the RAM, but let's be real: at such an affordable price point, it's better to have it and not need it, than need it, and not have it. Besides, I run virtualized machines, and they love the extra breathing room.

Installée pour passer de 8 à 16 Go sur un PC Pavillon Envy 795-0005nf de juin 2018 équipé un processeur Intel i 5 8400, carte mère ATX, chipset H370. Toucher une masse pour éviter d'endommager les circuit par l'électricité statique.

Dopo mesi di utilizzo funziona pefe4ttamente, provate sia su Windows che Linux MInt per vari usi dai piu' intensi ai piu' tranquilli ed hanno sempre funzionato perfettamente accompagnate ad un altro modulo di altra marca da 16GB, mi sono assicurato di superare la soglia del primo banco di memoria spesso e vanno bene.

reviews.review:
I was looking for a quick and easy monitor that I could grab for work and this delivered basically next day.

Pros:
Relatively easy setup, good high quality visual. For basic office work solid option. Color correction not 100% so not the greatest for graphic artwork.

Cons:
The base and stand is a little tricky to connect to the actual monitor. I would recommend connecting the stand first before adding the base. There is a metal plate on the back of the monitor and you have to be very careful sliding it in, make sure it's at the bottom and you push forward all the way. Much easier when the monitor is laying flat on a surface.
I only used it for work and for that price, I think that this is a great monitor. It came packaged well and it comes with a HDMI cable as well.

I'm pleased with the monitor itself but I purchased this to save hooking up a second set of speakers. This is for a secondary computer in the office. Monitor is bright and clear. Many settings available for viewing if you want to reduce glare etc. Speakers are very tinny sounding so I usually keep the sound off. Since I bought this specifically to have use of the speaker function it's a bit disappointing.

Je l’adore !
Couleurs très belles
Livraison rapide
working
Needed a smaller monitor for extend DAW mixer view, it’s just right

I bought this item once, and was really happy with it, I bought a second time, product still good but screen color was not as vibrant as the first monitor i received. I tried changing every color setting on the monitor. I use the second one (i purchased) as my dual monitor and there is a noticeable difference.
Satisfied with the screen size, color and clarity. Speaker is good enough on this monitor.

Great for my personal needs.
If you are getting a monitor like this, high refresh rate and higher than FHD don't forget to double check your settings. I've seen a couple reviews that I think could have been solved by double checking this.

But on to the monitor itself. It's great! Bought it at ~$170 USD. Played games at double the quoted refresh rate and also at 30 fps. I haven't seen any ghosting, though this can happen apparently I may have just been very lucky so far. Refresh rates are great, playing Valorant, CSGO, and Apex hasn't been an issue. Losing gun fights in any of those games have been my own fault and not having hardware lag behind and my reactions not being able to quickly adjust.

If you aren't playing competitive games and are more looking for a media consumption tool or prioritize picture quality and color accuracy this probably won't be the panel for you. There are better options out there for that specific purpose but if you like to game and consume content this is a great bang for the buck monitor.

1 small gripe I would have, but I understand for the price point it can't really be helped is that the monitor stand that comes with it isn't height adjustable.
Not a big deal if you are planning on Vesa mounting it but something worth noting.

Also if you are planning on using this monitor and having sound out there are no on board speakers. Not an issue if you are planning on using headphones or have desk speakers but I have seen other reviews saying they were disappointed at the lack of them. So i figure I'd point that out if you were expecting them.

Overall for I'd recommend this monitor to anyone who needs a great budget gaming monitor. Like I said just make sure to double check your settings, on the monitor and on your PC, when you first plug it in.

I got two of these to be the "wingmen" for a 27" Dell U2719 I've had for some years. I wanted a triple monitor setup with the Dell centered, but I have a small desk, so larger monitors were going to overhang the desk sides and cause problems. These Koorui monitors are possibly the narrowest 21.5" monitor you can buy.

I can report that these are more than adequate, and raise that to fantastic given the price! Comparing them to a Dell Ultrasharp is hardly fair, but they're so close for day-to-day office productivity that I really don't notice. Another bonus is the PPI of 21.5" FHD to 27" WQHD is nearly identical. If you understood that, then you know why I think it's great. 😉

So, the nitpicks:

- kinda crappy blackpoint; would not recommend for movies or production graphics work
- the VESA mount area is flat at the bottom holes, and curved at the top ones; this means you will have to shim with spacers (I used three nylon washers at each of the top holes) if your VESA mount needs zero pressure to rotate correctly
- while these have speakers, they're an afterthought: you get what you pay for here

Overall, a superb value for adding some real estate, and a totally acceptable main monitor if you are on a tight budget.

I live on a sailboat with 12v power as most efficient options, so was looking for a decent inexpensive monitor that had a "brick" that provided 110v to 12v conversion. We eliminated the brick and wire the monitor direct to our 12v circuit breakers. The 12v plug needed seems to be fairly standard as I had previously bought 10 of them to use for other projects. I am NOT gaming or doing any high resolution color-critical work. The screen seems good and the price was outstanding. Though, wish it had built-in speakers. Shipped it to Malaysia where we were and it arrived intact. Amazon handled the duty and paperwork required to get it thru Malaysian Customs without any work on our part.

My monitor is used for for everything from Word Processing, Spreadsheets, Web Browsing, Streaming Video and occasional Gaming. I have found this monitor works great for me for all these tasks. Let me state that I am not a big time gamer. It allows me enough room and resolution to multitask and enjoy watching a lot of streaming video. I have used many monitors and this is my first curved one and I really like it. Great color, contrast and resolution and brightness....the overall clarity is great and for what I do and I like the 2K resolution. I had never heard of a Koorui monitor before, but took a chance on it because of price and features. So far after a couple of months of use I am very happy with it and only time will prove out its durability. Based on my experience so far I would recommend it to others looking for a nice reasonably priced monitor.

Tengo que admitir que tenía miedo que el producto llegara roto, pues una pantalla de monitor es muy delicada. Sin embargo, el producto llegó muy bien protegido, la instalación es clara y sencilla (sin necesidad de tornillos) e incluye un cable HDMI de poco más de un metro. Al principio tenía la impresión de que la pantalla era muy brillante, pero creo que esto se debe a que estoy acostumbrado a utilizar pantallas con muy poco brillo.

reviews.review:
I bought this monitor because I work from home 2 out of 5 days a week and the company changed my laptop with a brand new one which didn't have VGA input but only HDMI and my old monitor didn't. So I needed a new one with HDMI.
I searched and saw this one with good reviews and decided to give it a try. It's great, really great. I do know play games so I can't say bout that but the reviews said it was good for gaming too. As far as using my 2 screens (laptop and this monitor), it works perfectly. I strongly recommend it
Very comfortable to work with.
For $100 on sale. Bought 2 and both work great. I don’t need a high end monitor for what I do. I would definitely buy again.
Nice monitor, works well and does the job.

I recently acquired a monitor with high hopes of enhancing my computing and entertainment experiences. Unfortunately, my experience with this monitor has been quite disappointing, leading me to conclude that there are far superior options available on the market. From the moment I started using it, the glaring issues with the screen quality were impossible to ignore.

One of the most glaring problems with this monitor is the lackluster display quality. The screen looked dull and lacked vibrancy, failing to accurately reproduce colors and leaving images and videos looking washed out. The contrast ratio was abysmal, making it difficult to distinguish details in darker scenes or images. Even basic tasks like web browsing and word processing felt underwhelming due to the lack of visual clarity and crispness.

Moreover, the viewing angles were extremely limited, causing distortion and color shifts when looking at the monitor from even a slightly off-center position. This severely hindered any attempts to collaborate or share content with others, as the poor viewing angles made it practically impossible for everyone to have a comfortable and clear view of the screen.

The monitor's refresh rate and response time were equally disappointing, leading to noticeable motion blur and ghosting during fast-paced activities like gaming or watching action-packed movies. This lack of responsiveness detracted significantly from the overall experience and made these activities far less enjoyable than they should have been.

The build quality of the monitor left much to be desired as well. The construction felt flimsy, and the stand provided limited adjustability, which made it challenging to find an ergonomic viewing angle. The overall design lacked the sleekness and elegance that one would expect from a modern monitor, further contributing to the sense of disappointment.

While the price of the monitor may have initially seemed appealing, the compromised screen quality and overall performance were not worth the savings. It became evident that investing in a higher-quality monitor would have yielded a significantly better user experience and more enjoyable computing and entertainment activities.

In conclusion, I strongly advise against purchasing this monitor based on my subpar experience. The poor screen quality, limited viewing angles, lackluster performance in terms of refresh rate and response time, and overall unsatisfactory build quality make this monitor a regrettable choice. There are undoubtedly better monitors available on the market that offer superior visual clarity, responsiveness, and overall user satisfaction. I hope that my review serves as a cautionary tale for those seeking a monitor that can truly elevate their computing and entertainment experiences.
Merci pour tout

Really, it’s a 4/5 but I have to keep reminding myself that the monitor costs $115.

Customer service is super proactive and they stand behind their product. I had issues with the power cord and they resolved it very quickly.

I bought it as a second monitor and the picture quality is SHOCKINGLY good. My main monitor is a 144Hz AOC gaming monitor and the picture quality is almost indistinguishable between the two. I didn’t try gaming on it and to be honest, I have no reason to. For browsing and office work, there is absolutely no complaints.

The build quality is questionable. I almost thought the box was empty when I got it because of how light it was. The cheap stand has no rigidity and whenever I bumped my desk, it would shake. A LOT. I fixed this by mounting my monitors on a desk mount and have not had this issue since.

If it’s your only monitor, or you have a sturdy desk, then it’s probably not a big deal. If you have dual monitors, consider an arm (which I highly recommend.) It’s just something to keep in mind.

All in all, 10/10 value. I’ve been meaning to upgrade my second monitor for a long time but spending $150+ on a monitor that gets limited use just feels wrong. $115 however? No regrets.

I recently purchased the KOORUI 24 Inch Business Computer Monitor and I must say that overall it is a good product.

I did notice that the build quality of the monitor could be improved. The plastic casing feels a bit flimsy and the monitor wobbles slightly when adjusting the tilt. Despite this, I am still satisfied with my purchase and believe that this monitor provides great value for its price point. Overall, if you are in the market for a budget-friendly monitor with good display and connectivity options, I would recommend considering this product.
Je cherchais un écran ni trop grand ni trop petit pour mon pc et il est top, il fait le taff, rien a re dire.

I was concerned that it would be too heavy for the mount that the monitor it replaces uses. Should not have worried, it is very light. Someone commented that the build quality was not so great, but weight is not build quality. The build quality is fine and I don't usually care about narrow bezels, but this are narrow and that means it's not so large. The controls are awkwardly laid out, but they are on all monitors, and you aren't going to use them often. There are not enough types of inputs, but who cares. HDMI and VGA. We have purchased a handful of these screens for employees that don't have the best eyesight and don't need an extremely high res screen. 1080p at 24" makes for an incredibly easy-on-the-eyes workspace at an extremely affordable price. Color accuracy and brightness aren't off the charts or anything, but are adequate.

As long as these last more than a year or two, they are excellent monitors for the price. I'll update this review if anything changes

Otherwise the display is just what I wanted. Using it together with aida64 to display my pc temperature etc during gaming.

  • Supports Jetson Nano: Supports Ubuntu, single point touch, driver free
  • Supports PC.Using as a computer monitor, it supports Windows 10 / 8.1 / 8 / 7, five-point touch and driver free.
  • Touch orientation is adjustable with button.

reviews.review: This screen works out of the box with my Victron Cerbo GX, no drivers or config file changes needed. The smaller screen size fits better in the electrical panel of my boat.

Working with a Windows 11 PC, easy plug and play, works like a monitor no problem (rotate, etc.). When it comes to the touchscreen capability they do not clearly indicate that you have to make the panel your primary monitor to make it work. So if you want to make this a secondary extended monitor in a PC setup it will not work properly for you. Secondly, my unit arrived defective, the touchscreen setup was off, I tried the rotation, tried a Windows 10 machine, many different things. I click on the screen and it reverses the touch in an odd way, even using the screen rotation button it just make it vertically off. User manual is hard to find and barely contains any information (n9.cl/g9kl07). The only note referring to the touchscreen is "1) When the computer is connected to several different displays at the same time, only this LCD can be used to control the cursor on the main display, so we recommended setting this LCD as the main display.". The panel itself is super clear and nice which is unfortunate because I wanted a touch interface. DO NOT try to use this as a secondary monitor with touchscreen, look elsewhere or buy without touchscreen for a regular mini-monitor.
I am using this screen as a touchscreen doorbell answer station. It works perfectly for this. The small form factor does not cause an intrusion on the aesthetics of the interior of the builidng.
Whe u first bought it...it chraged up and turnes in but now wont do either
arrived broken

This screen works out of the box. It includes all the connectors that you will need including screws and stand-offs. Very easy to put together. Brightness is good. However, all of these goodness are useless because it randomly gives what I call a yellow screen of death (YSOD).
Look for something else.
Size is a factor and this works great as a plug and play monitor for moving between computers

The color temperature was a little cool out of the box, easily corrected thanks to the firmware onboard. Cover glass is very good, looks sharp, easily viewable way off to the side. I'm building an HMI for a machine controller, but I'm handling all of the UI and display myself. I just needed the display, memory, power supply, and management IC and this delivers. Plug and play, works perfectly in Linux, has onboard image scaling in case you're using it with a system that insists on 1920x1080 resolution (some gaming applications).

The cables included are just long enough to set the host device beside or behind the display but they're quality. For a more permanent solution you'll need to select cables suitable for your specific use case since system integration is beyond the scope of the display module. This keeps costs low, provides a workable solution, and prevents us from buying cables we may not even need, so I appreciate the decision.

The screws at the corners hold the display module, front, and back of the case together and provide an easy point for you to attach custom mounting options to the rear. If you'd rather add bolts, use adhesive, or something else like nanotape, the rear of the case is nice and flat. The two-position kickstand works very well and doesn't collapse accidentally in my experience, it has a nice cam detent molded into the stand. Don't forget to 'calibrate your display' in whatever OS you're using to get your touch digitizer coordinates where you want them but mine was pretty close to begin with.

This was a great addition to my pc, I rigged it to load to bios in case of pc backup issues because I was having difficulty with my HDMI TV not recognizing my main display, so this was a way to see my bios/pc display easily in the event of an emergency or component failure. It works great.

The only issue I have with the design is the ports should have been at a different angle or location because it’s inconvenient to mount and use in a traditional way. All of the ports are on the right side of the screen and protrude out about 2-3 inches when connected, effectively requiring more room if mounting it in a case.

I saw one other customer left a 1-star review, which seems unfair, so I thought I'd help offset that a little.

I got this to use as a KlipperScreen display for my Voron 2.4 3D printer, and I couldn't be happier. The colors are bright and vivid, the blacks are solid, the picture overall is smooth and crisp, and the touch interface is responsive and accurate -- this is basically as good as the display on your high-end smartphone.

The 1-star reviewer is partially right: the native orientation of this display is vertical (portrait), so when the Raspberry Pi in my Voron boots up, the console is sideways at first. There's probably a way to change the orientation with the boot flags, but it's not a problem for me, as the X server definitely outputs at whatever orientation you tell it to.

Overall, this is a very fine display -- a little on the expensive side, but worth it if you really need a quality image for your project.

This review is mainly for the people who plan on using this the same way I did.

Just attached this to my second monitor for a sensor panel. The screen came with all the adapters shown in the picture as well as all the cables. The cables are really short but this screen is meant for raspberry pi's so thats expected. The screen quality looks great and completes my setup. The USB power connector on the screen feels delicate to be carefull. The screen is very light but feels durable, trying to mount and connect it I was a little rough but no scratches or damage. The colors look good and crisp. I'm happy with my purchase, will update if anything goes wrong.
I'm happy with the function and quality of this display. I would buy again. It just needs to come with longer cables. As it's just too short to be very useful as it is packaged.
