reviews.review:
I have been using two monitors for ages, over the last five years I have been using 34" ultra wide monitors paired with a 27" 16x9 monitor, but I decided to try something new and purchased a Samsung CRG9 for gaming. After a couple of days, I was really missing my second display. I usually used it for keeping an eye on my temperatures and clocks while I'm gaming.
Needless to say, I thought a portable laptop screen might do the trick. Since it was just for displaying monitoring software I did not need anything high quality or fancy, so I ordered this 15" Koorui.
First oops was that I didn't realize my GPU did not have a USBc, but no problem since they also supplied an HDMI cable...oops again, there is no power adapter for the USBc cable...lucky I have a USBc on my motherboard, but they really need to include a power adapter with the monitor.
Initial inspection was much better than I thought it would be. The monitor feels a little premium, possibly due to the folio cover.
Powering on the device brought up the picture, and I was a little underwhelmed. The picture is slightly dull...just slightly. I tried adjusting the brightness and contrast, but it's as good as it gets. It's not bad really since I'm comparing it to the $1100 monitor above it, but it does do the job of displaying my monitoring software splendidly.

A couple of beefs. First, it would have been nice if the cables were longer. I had to use my own USBc cable because the one they provide is only about three feet long.
The second is that they, like the rest of the manufacturers, put the ports on the side of the display like a tablet.
Come on guys, this is a monitor, not a tablet. As you can see in the picture, the ports sticking out the side are an ugly quality of life issue could easily have been avoided. Recessing them in the back would have been perfect, but having them sticking out the back would hvae been fine as well. Anything but sticking out the side like this.

Other than that, it's the little monitor that could. It's working perfectly for the purpose I bought it for. Having it set up this way though, if I had to make the choice again, for this particular usage I would have picked a 14" model. The 15" is a touch too big for this purpose.

In any case, if this monitor turns out to be reliable then it's easily worth the price I paid ($117 + Tax). I would recommend it for this purpose.

For budget gamers like me who are also casual gamers, I got some tips to improve your experience with this monitor. Obviously for the price you will get what you pay for. However, you can still very much enjoy medium pace competitive gaming with the adequate tweaks in-game as well as in the monitor settings. I have enjoyed 60hz monitor experience for most of my time gaming and you should expect smoother gameplay as well as slightly more in-depth/ less pixelated video quality. That being said, there are limits to what games you can play. Using this monitor works well for me for Rainbow 6 Siege and Read Dead Redemption 2. I doubt playing fast pace triple-A games like Warzone will work with this monitor. Important to mention, after spending a few hours on this monitor I have gotten used to the ghosting where it seems not apparent to me anymore or it's so minimal. Just a warning though, do expect poor video quality to compensate for better motion. But overall in my opinion, the benefits outweigh the cons in my book. You sacrifice some video quality for more smooth motion as well as high refresh rate.

Steps to fix ghosting issues:
- Set contrast and brightness on monitor to 100/ max
- Turn on overdrive (OD) to extreme
- Turn on freesync premium and enable g sync in nvidia control panel
- Use Gamma 1 because you need that high contrast
- Ensure you use the 165hz in your windows setting as well as in-game setting
- In-game limit your fps to 165hz or unlimited
- In the nvidia control panel, manage 3D settings: turn low latency mode to ultra and power management mode to prefer maximum performance.

Now this part is subjective to users:
- In-game test out contrast and sharpness to near maximum effectiveness. You can over-saturate these effects which can become negatively impactful.
- In-game adjust brightness accordingly where you can see shades from black to white appropriately.

In conclusion, this monitor has been a good upgrade from my 60 hz monitor as it is smoother in gameplay and less pixelated when viewing from further distances. A good step forward from entry level gaming on a budget. Although setting up tweaks for games for the first time and later on will be an inconvenience but well worth it if you don't mind.

I love this monitor! I don’t know why I waited so long to have one. It came with a protective case-stand and 3 cords: usbC- usb-C, usb-usbC, and HDMI-mini HDMI. The only thing you will need is how to plug the usb to a power outlet. I didn’t need one because I already have one on my desk. I don’t do any design or any activities that require colour calibration, so the brightness and colours seem perfect to me. Connecting it was super easy and straight forward, no need to configure anything. The speakers are also pretty decent, and the monitor has a volume button on the right side next to the power button. If you push up, it will show the volume menu and if you push down it will first show the mode menu. From there you can choose: Standard, cinema, RTS, FPS or eye saver.
I haven't gave the time to explore its features but si dar so goid
Wish the setting buttons were easier to use but other than that it’s great
I bought this for my grandson for xmas
Bien pour le prix
Pour le prix il est très bien pour du 1080p

Out of the box the fit and finish and magnetic flap/stand all feel very high quality.

Without reading the manual (which wouldn't have helped anyway), I figured out how to plug it in and get it up and running in Windows 11. Pretty intuitive and well integrated process.

My 13 inch HP spectre has 2 USB-c ports. This monitor also has 2 USB-c ports. A single cable between them will work with any pair of ports. however in that case the brightness is limited at 50% due to power limitation. By connecting the laptop charger to the Koorui monitor, and with a single USB-c cable leading back to the laptop, there's no longer any power limitation and I can get 100% brightness and 100% volume. The pleasant surprise for me was the single display cable, also *back charges* the laptop, although at a low wattage. I can leave the laptop in high performance mode, and the battery drains only very very slowly and can last at least 2 days.

I bought two of these Koorui's, the second one used HDMI to mini HDMI with Windows 10, on an eight year old laptop. That also worked flawlessly. However, a second USB-c power source was needed to turn on the monitor at all (which it would do at full power), because HDMI doesn't deliver power.

These Koorui monitor feel more comfortable to read than either of my laptops (one of which is a high end 4k screen). It has a matte finish and nice looking black to white transitions, making photos look very natural. I really like the colors and reading experience.

The only downside I found was the manual. It repeats hazard warning in six languages, but doesn't tell you you need to hold down the power button for a few seconds to turn it on, because the power button doubles as menu and select button. The entire monitor settings UI is handled with only 3 buttons. It work well once you figure it out, but the "manual" doesn't have a single mention of any of this. Nor does it discuss compatibility and power requirements. Why try so hard at making a great product, but remain at such an amateur level writing the manual? That's the thing that bugged me.

For gaming you only get 60hz refresh, so I haven't tried it for gaming and don't plan to use it that way. For remote learning and remote meetings, a highly portable second screen is a really nice thing to have. Overall for the extremely friendly price, I really appreciate being able to purchase this product.
No le encuentro algo negativo respecto del precio vs producto

I have a dual monitor set up at home and I really miss the convenience and productivity when I’m on the road.

I grabbed this portable monitor in a protective case for a great value. It was a bit confusing to set up as you need to connect two cords but it works great!

I wanted to use it at home as a third monitor and bought an adaptor to do so. Unfortunately, it flickers on and off. It’s possible my computer (Dell i5 Inspiron) doesn’t have enough processing power to support 3 screens in total. When I choose my next computer I will make sure it works. It’s a great little screen and the resolution is fantastic!

reviews.review:
I bought this on sale, so the price was very good compare to similar competing brands. Overall I am satisfied, and this works for what I use it for (use it as secondary monitor during presentations). I do not particularly care about color accuracy, and I do not use this outside to care about brightness.
With that being said, out of the box the colours were noticeably inaccurate and greenish. I had to dig into the menus to create a custom color by adjusting RGB values. It never got very good, so if you think you want to watch videos, look at pictures, or play games on this, this is probably not for you. It does save the color settings even when powered off, so that's good.
The only minor annoyance is that it does not save the brightness settings and resets it back to 4 after every power off. The screen needs that to be on "10" for it to be usable. When I'm not using this for presenting (as a second cloned monitor), I use it to view and compose a lot of text, such as documents and emails. It is ok for that, but I really wish it could go a little brighter.
If this was not at the price point that I got it at I would have returned it and looked for another portable monitor, just because of colors and brightness. Otherwise the monitor works great over USB-C (only thing I have used so far).
Very nice to use with my laptop to get a second monitor, great for travels.

This USB C portable monitor works well enough and has good brightness/viewing angles. IT IS NOT A TOUCH SCREEN, nor does it support HDR on Windows 11.....can't comment on Windows 10 HDR support.

The provided cables are nice quality, and the connection points on the monitor feel good as well.
Worked no problem like a charm when it arrived. Stored it safely with my laptop. When I went to use it again, would not connect. Kept saying no signal. Very disappointed.

Some people mention Touchpanel on comments i didn't see any of this in product details so im gonna assume they had a different IPS panel.

The image quality is fine in fact its better than some gaming monitor i paid 500$
People mention menu not savings settings This is incorrect the only setting it does not save is brightness in usb-c mode and its mostly due to computer/tablet side config. ( Still a bit annoying to raise brightness from 4 to 10 in usb-c mode ) Doesn't apply in HDMI mode it stays to set settings.

The speakers included are a bonus for those that want to do raspberry setup all in one but they are very low qualitys speakers so don't expect much from them ( on par with some 10$ bluetooth speakers from unknown brands )

For $129 CDN ($40 off) I wasn't expecting much, but OMFG this is perfect for travelling when I need to have dual monitors for my laptop. Complete efficiency with this attached. I might even ditch the laptop and just use my Samsung S22 with DEX. It supports touch and I can do everything from my phone on a larger screen (no wireless screen sharing needed!) So far extremely happy. 1080p with HDR is a bonus. The IPS looks very good, and when side by side with my Mac 13" with retina the quality is on par, and has enough gamut for most day to day things. No ghosting that I can detect, tho not sure GnG ms (might be 5ms)

I might buy another one...

Good portable monitor. Excellent price. Touch screen works whenever your source is full featured. Just that it's a bit dark and no brightness adjustment when using hdr. Also there's a 1"band of unusually different brightness in the upper half of the screen when in hdr, though unnoticeable in default mode.

For me I have changed up my whole office environment and while this may seem counterintuitive to go with a portable monitor versus you know curved monitor with Vesey Mount I'm doing this because my intention is to move this into a mobile office at some point and I want to be able to minimize my power requirements and this monitor fits that intention.

i bought this as a cheapo so i could lie in my bed and play diablo and stuff, given the price i expected it to be somewhat shonky but its actually pretty decent, the picture is nice, its light, while the plastics feel a shade cheap overall it feels fairly robust. my only real gripe would be that the menu seems like its expecting 4 buttons but there are only 3 on the device

it comes with cables too which i kind of wasnt expecting and im not sure if its not mentioned or if i didnt notice but it does also have HDR, its not the best HDR in the world but what can you expect at this price. ive also found the screen way more useful than i expected in general

for under a hundred quid its a bargain little screen

I purchased this monitor to use as a 2nd monitor for my laptop and also to use as a gaming monitor for my Nintendo Switch.
The monitor is very easy to use. It comes with a built in stand and protective case which keeps the monitor safe and also provides you with an excellent stand so you can get the right viewing angle.
The monitor has several input methods including USB C and HDMI. I have it connected to my laptop with power via USB C and video output from my laptop to the monitor via HDMI. The monitor can then be set up through my laptop as a 2nd monitor so I can work on my laptop screen and view videos on this portable monitor.
The image quality is excellent and the display is 1920x1080, the brightness and contrast can be adjusted very easily via the menu and plus and minus buttons on the front of the display.
The portable monitor has built in speakers which are nice and loud and clear.
Overall I am delighted with this monitor and for the following reasons I have decided to rate it 5 stars:
Excellent case/stand
Very easy to use
Excellent image quality
Excellent sound quality
Good connection options

Got this for Christmas from my wife so I could play my xbox while she watches the TV lol , and I'm super impressed with it bright vivid colours and very sharp in HD , works great with xbox one and there is no ghosting or lag , comes with a nice wallet it sits in to protect it. Came with a USB C to USB C cable , a mini hdmi to Hdmi cable plus its USB C charing cable and plug , love this screen highly recommended 😀
Broke after 1 use, absolutely useless quality

Before you install, I highly recommend looking up a tutorial online and updating your raspberry software to the latest release.
I'm very satisfied with the size and quality of the screen, the touch screen is very sensitive and you don't have to push extremely hard. This is also a benefit because I can keep the screen protector it comes with on and not have to worry about tapping the screen too hard.
There are lots of tools provided, including standoffs, pin connectors, and a graphics bus. I also recommend getting a case: it helps out everything together really nicely.

I suggest you to power the screen and the Pi independently if you don't want to have undervolting issue with the Pi

Good, but the documentation doesn't give the best way to wire it up. Input power should be to the Pi, with jumpers to the screen. Wiring it the other way around (as the documentation suggests) leads to undervolt warning icons on the Pi's screen, even when using a 2.4A power supply.

Googling this issue will show more info.

Had to reinstall the latest version of the OS to get this to work. The pointer is not quite where my finger is located. It's up and to the left on my set up. And now that i have this screen, i can't set the unit down at all unless i want the board (GPIO pins facing down) taking all the weight. I need some kind of protective frame built to make sure I'm not stressing any important bits. It's more awkward now than ever.

The device worked fine for me (5 stars), but the ribbon cord is so short you have to put your Pi flat against the back of the screen (almost) - ie you can't even have a little room to work on your system, and can't put your machine in a box and run it up to your screen, unless you buy a separate longer ribbon (looks like about $9 on Amazon).
Sin problema RP 3
Der Screen ist mit einem Raspberry 4 montiert und liefert ein gutes Bild. Auf dem Raspberry läuft Octoprint und somit kann der 3D Drucker auch ohne PC schön gesteuert werden.

OK. This is in my opinion a decent touch screen.

Plus points:
Worked out of the box with latest Raspian on Pi 3B+.
Very simple to connect and configure. (The driver board was already connected on the one I received, just had to connect to the Pi.).
Touch is responsive, works well.

Negative points:
The position of the SD card slot on the Pi makes it fiddly to access when the screen is connected with the ribbon cable. Especially if you have it any kind of enclosure. So you can't change operating envoirnment easily.
This is a bare screen and driver board (no bezel or enclosure).

Raspian issues:
The screen will first boot upside-down in many available cases. this is easy fixed (Google it) but is annoying :) .
The virtual keyboards with the latest Raspian OS on Pi 3B+ (my experience) are pretty useless, but this isn't an Android phone, so make sure you have a wireless keyboard with a touchpad.

Das ist ein guter Bildschirm/Touchscreen mit einem sehr guten Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis. Wer glaubt das ganze wäre plug-and-play, der irrt sich auf jeden Fall. Man muss sich schon mit der Materie beschäftigen, mehrere Tutorials durcharbeiten und ggf. suchen, was sich zwischen den Distributionen geändert hat. Aber die Mühe ist es auf jeden Fall wert. Ich möchte nicht mehr ohne arbeiten an meinem Laser.

Pour ceux qui auraient des difficultés d'assemblage, recherchez sur le net Elecrow Raspberry Pi 3 Display 7 Inch Touch Screen pour une notice d'assemblage partielle mais en anglais . Il existe plusieurs tutos dans Youtube toujours en anglais. La carte contrôleur de l'écran ne possède aucune LED donc impossible de savoir si la carte est correctement alimentée sous 5V. Bien nettoyer les contacts du câble plat car la présence de vernis m'avait laissé l écran totalement noir identique à l'écran hors tension... ou hors service.
Vérifier la bonne orientation du câble plat partie conductrice grise vers le haut sur le connecteur de la carte contrôleur et l'autre bout de ce câble la partie grise conductrice orientée vers le connecteur de la caméra sur le Raspberry. L'écran reste totalement noir au démarrage du boot le temps que le port video soit activé durant la progression du boot puis s'illumine. Le résultat est de bonne facture très compacte et si pratique quand on a plus besoin de clavier ni souris. Le montage devient "presque" une tablette tactile précise et efficace. L'économiseur d'écran éteint totalement l'écran comme s'il était hors tension. Attention de ne pas couper brutalement l'alimentation du Raspberry en pensant le shutdown activé!
Le seul "petit" reproche est l'impossibilité de règler luminosité et contraste car l'écran est un peu trop lumineux le soir ou dans la pénombre. Mais on s'habitue très vite pour l'utilisation ioT des objets connectés. J'en commande un second dans la foulée. Bon assemblage pour ceux qui vont ouvrir les deux boites!
PS. même le samsung avait souffert pour la photo devant la luminosité de l'écran!

reviews.review: Perfect addition to the NZXT H9 Flow case. Minor case modification and worked with no issues just plug and play.

I Bought this as my plan is to modify my case and to mount it in the front pane, as my case is all mesh design so no glass panel. The purpose of the purchase is to use it as a sensor panel. The picture quality is fantastic, I'm quite impressed. I have the resolution set at 1920 x 1080. I did purchase an adapter so it is powered directly off the motherboards USB header pins. I will update once I have designed the display using Aida64. I will be mounting it in my Asus Prime case AP201. Also as others have stated before the included cables are very short. So you will need to purchase separate cables to your desired length. The touch screen does work however it's not needed for my use of the display panel. I would recommend this one if your looking to for some extra bling to your case!

Bought this based on the number of good reviews.

Upon powering it up with no hdmi connection, vertical lines on right. It eventually disappeared but another problem was apparent. Ghosting. It's almost as if there was screen burn in. Lines were still visible or due to it becoming an artifact. Even after the screen was turned off for a while, the ghost image was still there.

The settings on the raspberry was also updated as required to make it work with the screen resolution.

Also I have no idea if this was a defective item that was returned and then put back into stock and sold again... will return this one and purchase another one to see if I have better luck the 2nd time.

UPDATE - 2nd one works, so updating my review to 4/5 (only because the first unit was defective)

LIke some of the other people when i first got the monitor hooked up it set me up with a default driver from nvidia and i had a small screen and a lot of lines on the right hand side and some across the bottom. I tried to manually install a driver in windows 11 and just couldn't find one online. But after a normal restart the screen kicked right on and started to work fine. It list the driver as Generic PnP Monitor. I can choose the recomended 1024*600 or 800*600. Both do work and the touch screen started to work also. I can move my mouse curser with just touching the screen. Been using it for a few days now to display wallpaper engine while out of a game and then load Aida64 on it when in game. Again it won't turn the screen off unless you chose to power off your usb devices from within Bios. Or what i did was buy a usb hub with on/off switches and use the switch to shut that port off if i leave my system running over night. Here is the link to the hub i am using. https://www.amazon.ca/gp/product/B00BWF5U0M/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_image_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Hope this helps some of you

This screen works great. But when you just try and Pollux it in out of the box, depending on your system, you will see those vertical lines. This is a driver issue. I installed the proper drivers for this’d display and vertical lines went away and have never returned, been months now. As for people crying about mounting hardware. This screen clearly shows what it comes with and how it looks. I bought this screen specifically because it had no huge mounts or bezels. I wanted a clean screen that i can create my own mounts for. This fit the bill perfectly.
It's a great screen, and does what I expect, but it did not come with mounting screws.

Monitor is bright, clear, and surprisingly good resolution for such a small screen. My only gripe is that the screen's backlight doesn't turn off even when the monitor is put to sleep, so you have unplug the USB cable to turn it off.

p.s. If you're also planning on using the display inside a PC case, I highly recommend buying a new flat HDMI and USB micro cable, since the ones that come with the display way too short and chunky. And to hold the display up I simply used a spare case PCIe panel screwed to the bottom of the case, and attached the display to that with a 3M Command Strip.

Screen seems to work great. Mounted it inside PC case as a hardware monitor. Purchased different cords to match the length I needed. Comes with acceptable cables. Great picture quality. Haven't used touch screen, unneeded with my application.

Picture quality is really good and easy installation however you will need M2.5 screws which was not provided. Also the cables provided is very short and chunky. I bought thinner hdmi and micro usb to route the cables around. Other than that well pleased.
Just make sure you buy thin HDMI and Micro usb cables!

Great little screen! Worked right out of the box. Brightness and clarity are good also. The screen is easy to drive with HDMI input and is being powered by a USB port from the back of my computer. Only think I wish was that the screen backlight would turn off when my computer goes to sleep. The backlight is rather controlled by an on/off switch on the back of the display and doesn't sense if the display is getting a signal or not. Other than that; super happy!

Many people here are looking at these panels for DYI sensory panels for there PC. I spent a lot of time looking at many different panels to try to find better value or at least something that made the most sense for my project. Funny thing is I started off with this panel first and thought there has to be a better option. Long story short not really even when I considered spend more money.

These types of mods get expensive really fast. $80 for the panel, $60 for Aida64 (You can use the trail but eventually you will pay the money because you want everything unlocked), $30 for alternative skinner cords that are longer the moment you see the cords you will want to change them. I knew this from the start so in my mind this panel costs $120 because I got new cords to go with it longer for cable management. Then maybe $5 for the little standoff box to give mounting options but honestly tap could work just as well it's really light.

Next you have things like buying a motherboard header to micro USB i wasted more money when I realized I did not have the slot available on my moba. This panel because it's higher resolution and quality does require a fair amount of power.

Also I went with the 7" to be honest if you have the space go bigger there was no changes to my temperatures or any impact. I do enjoy looking at it

I was thought many times if sending everything back but ultimately it was 100% worth it in the end.

Minor Q&A if you use the mobo header it turns off with the PC. If you use USB you can still turn it off with the PC just change one settings in the bios and continue with life. It's the onboard USB power.

ASUS Z690-E --->Advanced -->onboard devices and configuration --->USB power delivery in soft state

It's pretty similar for most motherboards. Lastly have fun.

I like this as this is affordable and came with everything you need. I use this as a dual monitor for my macbook pro. Work as intended. If using this with a laptop make sure your laptop has an Hdmi port or like my case I had to buy a powerhub that had an Hdmi port on it. Works great.

reviews.review:
As someone who spends long hours in front of a computer screen, I understand the importance of having a high-quality monitor that provides an immersive and comfortable viewing experience. Recently, I decided to upgrade my monitor to the KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor, drawn to its IPS technology, sleek design, and promised eye care features. With hopes of enhancing my visual enjoyment and reducing eye fatigue, I eagerly incorporated this monitor into my workstation.

Why I Needed the Product:
My previous monitor was outdated, and I desired a larger screen with better contrast and brightness. Additionally, I wanted to protect my eyes from strain and fatigue caused by long hours of staring at a screen. The KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor seemed like a suitable solution, offering improved visuals, reduced eye fatigue, and versatile connectivity options.

Pros:

Immersive Visuals and Wide Viewing Angle: The IPS technology and ultra-thin bezel design of the KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor deliver brilliant and clear visuals. The wide viewing angle of 178 degrees ensures a pleasant visual experience from any angle, allowing me to appreciate the sharp and delicate images displayed on the screen.
Eye Care Features: The monitor incorporates flicker-free technology, a blue light filter, and 99% SRGB (NTSC 72%) color saturation. These features contribute to a more realistic picture, reduced eye fatigue, and increased visual comfort during long hours of use.
Versatile Connectivity: With HDMI and VGA ports, the KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor offers versatile connectivity options, allowing me to connect it to various devices such as Xbox, PC, and laptops. The 75Hz refresh rate and Full HD 1920x1080p resolution ensure high-quality images and smooth transitions, facilitating a seamless switch between work and entertainment.
VESA Compatibility: The monitor stand is quickly installed and supports a 75x75mm VESA mount, providing convenience and flexibility in positioning and adjusting the monitor. The tilt feature allows me to find the best viewing angle, enhancing my overall comfort and experience.
Cons:

Inconsistent Contrast and Brightness: Unfortunately, I found the contrast and brightness of the KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor to be lacking. The screen failed to deliver the desired levels of contrast, resulting in a somewhat dull visual experience.
Occasional Glitches: One significant drawback I experienced was occasional screen glitches and momentary blackouts when connected to my Mac. While I suspect that the issue may be related to the dongle connecting the laptop and the screen, it remains a frustrating disruption to my workflow.
Conclusion:
In conclusion, the KOORUI 27 Inch Computer Monitor offers a mixed bag of features and performance. While it delivers on its promise of immersive visuals, wide viewing angles, and eye care features, the inconsistent contrast and occasional glitches dampen the overall experience. Despite these drawbacks, the monitor's versatile connectivity options, VESA compatibility, and reasonable price point make it a viable option for those seeking a budget-friendly upgrade. However, it is important to be aware of the potential issues with contrast, brightness, and occasional glitches, which may impact the overall satisfaction and reliability of the monitor.

Today I set up my dual KOORUI 27" model N07 monitors. I was somewhat worried by multiple reviewers reporting that this model isn't really a 4K screen. So while I don't usually write reviews, I'm here to assure you the N07 is in fact a 4K screen with resolution of 3840x2160 and refresh rate of 60hz.

And I know why some people got this wrong. When I unplugged my old 1920x1080 monitors and tried to use the same HDMI cables, Windows identified the monitor as having a 1920x1080 native resolution. But my cables were very old. I plugged both my new monitors in using DisplayPort cables and they were instantly reporting 3840x2160. My monitors did not come with DP cables, just new HDMI cables. But my office had extra DP cables laying around.

If you're still having trouble getting 4K on one of these, be wary of adapters, such as DP-to-HDMI, DVI-to-HDMI, etc. Also try shorter or newer cables. You CAN get 4K out of HDMI cables, but remember that HDMI has been around since 2002 and that standard has gone through many versions with new capabilities over the years.

As for reviewing the other aspect of these monitors... they look great to me! Neither of mine had dead or stuck pixels. the colors look good and image is sharp. I'm not a professional monitor reviewer, but these seem like perfectly good office monitors for a fantastic price compared to big brand names. I took a chance on some of their smaller screens several months back and was blown away at the quality and low price. I'm glad this higher end model hasn't let me down!

Sono rimasto piacevolmente sorpreso dalle prestazioni offerte dal monitor esterno da 27" a 75 Hz che ho recentemente acquistato. Questo monitor offre un eccellente rapporto qualità-prezzo, soddisfacendo le mie aspettative senza svuotare il mio portafoglio.

Iniziamo parlando delle dimensioni: il pannello da 27" offre un'ampia area di visualizzazione, che consente una maggiore immersione durante l'utilizzo. La risoluzione è nitida e la qualità dell'immagine è davvero buona. Anche i colori sono ben bilanciati e vividi, offrendo un'esperienza visiva piacevole durante la visione di contenuti multimediali o durante l'utilizzo quotidiano.

La frequenza di aggiornamento di 75 Hz è un vantaggio significativo per gli appassionati di gaming o per coloro che lavorano con applicazioni che richiedono un movimento fluido. Ho notato che i movimenti sullo schermo sono più fluidi e reattivi rispetto al mio precedente monitor. Anche se non è la frequenza di aggiornamento più elevata sul mercato, per il prezzo a cui ho acquistato questo monitor, è una caratteristica davvero apprezzabile.

La connettività è facile e veloce grazie alle opzioni di porte disponibili. Ho potuto collegare facilmente il mio computer tramite l'interfaccia HDMI e ho apprezzato la compatibilità con altri dispositivi grazie alle porte VGA e DVI. L'angolo di visione è ampio, permettendomi di guardare lo schermo senza perdere qualità visiva da diverse posizioni.

Una delle cose che ho apprezzato di più è stata la facilità di configurazione. L'interfaccia del menu è intuitiva e mi ha permesso di regolare facilmente le impostazioni dello schermo secondo le mie preferenze personali. Inoltre, il monitor è dotato di un supporto regolabile in altezza che mi ha consentito di posizionarlo in modo comodo e ergonomically corretto.

Non posso dimenticare di menzionare il design estetico del monitor. Con cornici sottili e un aspetto elegante, si adatta bene a qualsiasi ambiente di lavoro o a qualsiasi arredamento domestico. Non solo offre prestazioni solide, ma aggiunge anche un tocco di stile alla mia postazione.

Complessivamente, sono davvero soddisfatto del mio acquisto del monitor esterno da 27" a 75 Hz. Le sue prestazioni solide, il rapporto qualità-prezzo eccezionale e la facilità di utilizzo lo rendono una scelta eccellente per chiunque cerchi un monitor affidabile per le proprie esigenze quotidiane o per il gaming. Consiglio vivamente questo monitor a chiunque sia alla ricerca di un'opzione di qualità senza dover spendere una fortuna.

Der Monitor hat mich absolut beeindruckt. Die Bildqualität ist gestochen scharf und die Farben sind lebendig und realistisch. Die Größe des Bildschirms ermöglicht es mir, mehrere Anwendungen gleichzeitig zu öffnen und produktiver zu arbeiten.
Die schlanke Bauweise des Monitors passt gut zu meinem Schreibtisch und verleiht meinem Arbeitsplatz ein modernes und ansprechendes Erscheinungsbild.
Die Benutzeroberfläche ist benutzerfreundlich und bietet eine Vielzahl von Anpassungsoptionen, um das Display an persönliche Vorlieben anzupassen.
Dieser Monitor hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen und ist eine Bereicherung für meinen Arbeitsplatz. Ich kann ihn ohne Vorbehalte empfehlen.

I purchased this monitor for work purposes. I can't offer any insights on gaming, but I can give pros and cons in other criteria.

Pros:
1. Compatibility- Once assembled, I connected the monitor to my Mac for the first time in less than a minute. There was seamless compatibility between the two devices. I encountered no glitching of any kind.
2. Picture Quality- When doing work, I see no issues with the quality of the picture. I was able to read and type without complication. The monitor even includes different viewing modes for gaming, cinema, and eye-saver (to reduce optical stress from staring at a screen).
3. Included Items- The package includes an HDMI cord, which I thought was very satisfactory considering the low cost. While I have to use an HDMI to USB-C cord because I have a Mac, it's beneficial to have an extra HDMI cord at hand.
4. Value- I am very pleased with the incredible value. Koorui makes high-quality monitors for a low price by not including speakers. For working, I see no need for speakers. However, even if you do need speakers you can always connect a soundbar, stereo system, or even a portable speaker to your computer to get sound. Great price for a great monitor.
5. Design- This monitor does not look like something you could purchase for this price. It has a sleek and simple design with very little border around the screen. Furthermore, the size is great for the price they are asking. I was amazed by how large it was!

Cons:
1. Assembly- The instructions on the box and manual for assembling the stand were difficult to read and the portrayed pieces did not match those delivered to me. I was better off just assembling off of common sense.
2. Picture Quality- I wouldn't recommend this monitor for cinematic purposes. The picture quality of videos is definitely pixelated. However, you get what you pay for.

Conclusion:
Overall, it is an efficient monitor for a good value. I experienced some issues, but it was worth it in the end.

name: ViewSonic VA2447-MH 24 Inch Full HD 1080p Monitor with Ultra-Thin Bezel, AMD FreeSync, 75Hz, Eye Care, and HDMI, VGA Inputs for Home and Office
description:
• VERSATILE MONITOR: 24 Inch Full HD (1920x1080p) LED monitor with thin bezels and 75Hz refresh rate
  • ENHANCED VIEWING COMFORT: Flicker-Free technology and Blue Light Filter for reduced eye fatigue
  • ULTRA-SMOOTH GAMING: AMD FreeSync technology enables fluid and tear-free gameplay
  • OPTIMIZED VIEW SETTINGS: Offers “Game;” “Movie;” “Web;” “Text;” and “Mono” presets
  • FLEXIBLE CONNECTIVITY: The VA2447-MH supports laptops; PCs; Macs and more with HDMI and VGA inputs

reviews.review:
The ViewSonic VA2447-MHJ 24 Inch Full HD 1080p Monitor brings together innovative design and high-quality performance, delivering an immersive user experience tailored for both home and office environments.

The moment you set your eyes on this monitor, the ultra-thin bezel captures your attention, offering a nearly seamless viewing experience. This design feature allows for more screen space, which is particularly advantageous for multi-monitor setups. The matte finish on the screen was also a pleasant surprise, helping to reduce unwanted reflections and glare that could disrupt the viewing experience.

A stand-out feature of the VA2447-MHJ is its advanced ergonomics. The monitor offers a broad range of adjustments for tilt, height, swivel, and rotation, allowing users to personalize their setup for maximum comfort. These ergonomics, combined with a reasonable 24-inch size, make this monitor a good fit for those who spend extended hours in front of a screen.

The 1080p Full HD resolution ensures crisp and clear visuals. While this is now somewhat a standard feature in monitors, the added AMD FreeSync technology takes the display quality to another level. For those unfamiliar, FreeSync synchronizes the monitor's refresh rate with your device's graphics card to prevent screen tearing, ensuring smooth visuals even during high-intensity gaming or video playback.

The VA2447-MHJ also sports a refresh rate of 75Hz, which is a small step up from the standard 60Hz most commonly found in monitors. While the difference may not be noticeable for general web browsing or office work, the added smoothness is a welcome addition for gamers or those who often watch high-speed videos.

A commendable feature that ViewSonic incorporates into its product is the eye care technology. This feature includes a flicker-free backlight and a blue light filter, both aimed at reducing eye strain during extended use. As someone who spends several hours in front of a screen, this is an addition I truly appreciate.

As for connectivity, the monitor supports HDMI and VGA inputs, offering a fair bit of versatility. However, the absence of a DisplayPort or USB-C might be a limiting factor for some users, especially those with newer laptops or gaming consoles that have moved away from HDMI and VGA.

In conclusion, the ViewSonic VA2447-MHJ is a reliable, high-performing monitor, offering a solid balance between aesthetic design and functional features. While the connectivity options could be broader, the overall package is quite compelling, making it a robust choice for both home and office use. The advanced ergonomics and eye-care technology further demonstrate ViewSonic's commitment to delivering not only performance but also user comfort and wellbeing.

The picture isn't the best gaming/editing monitor out there, but for what they say they are, they match the description perfectly. I rated the picture at 4 for this reason.

The stands themselves are simple but useful enough, and collapse back down the way they were shipped if you want to store them a little easier, they clip solidly to the back of the monitor and that doesn't interfere with any mounts you have also installed.

This monitor is amazing, the moment I plugged in the HDMI, the picture comes out nice and clear. The only downside is the manual, which tells next to nothing on how the onscreen menu operates, and it took me 1 to 2 days to figure out what to do. Besides this, everything else is good for a monitor in such price range.
You cannot beat the Viewsonic line-up. When it comes to durability, sharpness, resolution, and watching your budget,, this is where you want to spend your personal, as well as corporate dollars.
For this long history and reliable branded product, with this price, what can you complaint?
This is a fine deal but if you need crisp text you'll need a lower dot pitch and higher dpi monitor.

reviews.review:
I bought this 27" curved monitor specifically to watch blu ray movies from a close distance, about 1 meter or 3 feet. My old 28" screen showed color distortions in the corners at that distance and this curved Samsung solved that problem.

The reason that I chose this monitor over others in the same price range was the native 3000-1 contrast ratio on the VA screen. A higher contrast ratio will give you deeper black levels, much more than the common 1000-1 ratio on IPS screens. It's not OLED levels of black but it's not an OLED priced screen. (I got mine for 50% of the current price). And forget about the "Dynamic Contrast" scam that promises 1,000,000-1 contrast ratios, you'll want to immediately disable that horrendous feature and then you'll be back to 1000-1.

I found a site that has the optimum color/contrast/brightness/ect settings for this monitor and they made a huge difference. I'm amazed at how good the image is on this screen. For instance, grass looks green like grass should, not the sort of lime green that I see on so many screens. And my gold standard is the red color of the engineering class uniforms on the original Star Trek. They look fire engine red instead of the slightly magenta hued red that I see on so many uncorrected screens.

I only use headphones fed from the blu ray player so the speakers aren't an issue for me and I find the controls quite easy to use.

Being a curved screen there is a sweet spot for viewing which I find to be around the one meter distance. There's no viewing from a side angle on this screen, it's kind of a one person device. But when you get this monitor set-up it does nothing annoying, it's a pure delight to have in front of your eyes.
I was looking for a second PC monitor to mount a dual screen setup for my home computer and I found that Samsung 24in monitor at a price I just couldn't ignore. :-)
great product worked as advertised

Pictures nice works just fine, the curve is kinda not really distinguishable after using it for a bit but it looks nice in the room. I got the used one on special and its the visa mount screws that where missing so no big deal really. Overall very happy but the curve is for bigger screens in my opinion

Only 3 months old and 2.5 months in the monitor screen developed a blue spot in the screen.
Can be very annoying at times. Watching something dark on the screen all your eye sees and is attracted to is the blue spot.
Not as noticeable on pale scenery but very noticable on a dark one.
I Was Not expecting that to happen so soon after purchasing the monitor. Very disappointing!
I like the curved screen and the picture color is clear and sharp but how long before I get more spots?
Or will this spot keep getting larger now that it is there. Is it just a defect on my model or are all the models faulty?
Don't know, but time will tell for sure.
I had hoped to be able to plug in a blueray or dvd player, but no chance of that.
I onlygave it 3 stars because of the Blue Spot appearing in the screen so soon after purchase.

an excellent budget gaming monitor. As a big brand factory, Samsung keeps making very high-quality monitors as always. This curved gaming monitor is a very good choice for gaming. It has a high-speed gaming mode for playing gaming and an eye-sync feature for protecting your eyes from long-time gaming. I very enjoy it. But there are some improvements are also need to be pointed out. firstly, the 32-inch monitor stand is tended to be "too short", and the monitor stand does not support adjusting the height. I am using this monitoring for both gaming and daily use. This monitor is used as an extended monitor for my laptop. It is hard to adjust the height of this monitor to fit my laptop. Second, it is hard to buy a monitor arm for it. The current market has classified monitor stands/arms/mounts into different categories, less than 12 inches, 13 inches - 27 inches, 27 inches -32 inches, and more than 33 inches. The 27 inches - 32 inches class monitor arm may not be the best choice for this monitor because of its weight but the 33 inches class monitor arms are usually costly. Third, this monitor does not contain the speaker, microphone, or camera features. For your best gaming experience, you need to spend more money on these features. overall, this monitor still be a good 2K monitor product and a good choice for a $200 level budget monitor.
Je l'utilise pour le travail. Aucun aspect négatif.

Amazing budget curve screen for 1 person work station and movie watching.

Pic quality, and everything is really good, been using a few weeks now. Highly recommend.
El paquete llegó en muy buen estado y bien empacado... Me gustó que cumple todas las expectativas, los recomiendo
Monitor perfeito, o tamanho é ótimo a imagem nitida. Atendeu minhas expectativas pela qualidade e custo benefício. Recomendo.
Buena calidad y buen precio. Llegó en buen estado
Got my money's worth with this.

Nice low price however mine arrived with a dead area and chipping on the bottom that suggests someone tried to open it up either to attempt a repair or to remove the base which appears to impede tilting ability when mounted. Check it well. Return process seems easy enough just sad I wont have it in time for the project I intended.

name: Samsung LS24R350FZNXZA 24" LED-Lit Monitor 75Hz Freesync Dark Blue Grey (LS24R350FZNXZA)
description:
• 3-Sided Bezel-less screen for Maximum viewing and dual monitor set-up
  • AMD Radeon Freesync provides reponsive game experiences and no screen tearing.Power supply:AC100~240V
  • 75Hz delivers more fluid picture
  • Flicker Free and Eye Saver mode to reduce blue light and make viewing more comfortable
  • Game Mode - Adjusts any game to fill your screen and optimizes contrast for better game exeperiences
  • G-Sync compatibility allows fast-action and stutter-free with AMD FreeSync Premium

reviews.review:
This monitor has several attractive features. It can be used with many operating systems including Windows 7. Plus it has the option of using an HDMI-DVI Cable, an HDMI Cable, or a D-Sub (Analog type) Cable. Take note, it does not have a usb drive cable option.

I'm not a gamer. I play basic things like chess, backgammon, and other games, so I can't comment on it's gaming features.

I mention the input options because in reading some answers to a question I put forward on how to shut this monitor off, someone who obviously answers questions without understanding or reading them claimed falsely that her monitor shut off when she shut her computer off. That is not the case.

USB ports are the only things I know of which shut down automatically when you power off your computer or laptop. If a usb port is an option it's not an option on this monitor, and I wouldn't select that option anyway because it would needlessly use up a usb port.

My computer has 5 usb ports. One is used for my mouse, another for my wireless keyboard, The other 3 I use for everything else. Sometimes I move files from a usb to an external hard drive for storage purposes, so having 2 usb inputs on the front of my tower comes in handy. I wouldn't want to lose that ability by having to devote the 3rd rear input to my monitor. I have a 3 port splitter on that right now for a usb drive I keep plugged in for daily storage of things like emails etc...

Too many devices these days charge or work off of usb ports, and nobody makes a laptop or tower computer with 152 usb inputs. So I chose to opt for the D-Sub cable option.

I could also free up 2 more usb inputs on the back if I opted for 5 pin type inputs instead of usb inputs for my mouse and keyboard.

This monitor, like all others I've ever owned has a power cord. The power cord does not plug into the back of a tower computer or a laptop, hence turning off your computer or laptop won't shut it off.

I own an old 1970's era Realistic model stereo amp which has power outlets on the back. One works independent of the amp, and the other is for my turntable. It works with the amp. When you power off the amp, the turntable powers off as well. I'm not aware of things like tower computers or laptops with this feature where you can actually plug in another device which will shut off when you shut off the main device.

As a rule, one should take note that if a device has it's own power supply, it does not just go into standby mode when you power off your computer. Nor does it shut off automatically when your computer powers off. It has to be shut off to actually be off. That power supply is where the power comes from. It's not coming from the computer, so shutting the computer off does not shut off power to the monitor.

Some people who answered had some somewhat helpful advice. But many didn't seem to grasp a very simple question about how to shut this monitor off.

When I checked some reviews I found some proper helpful advice.

One review noted the backwards nature and stupidity of putting the power button on the back of the monitor where it is hard to reach and work and the fact that this monitor is backwards to most in that a blue light comes on when it is shut off, and there is no light on when it's in use.

My previous monitor would - like most - have no light on when turned off. When you would power down a yellow light would come on, and you would click on that to shut it off. When you would power up (assuming you power up your computer before powering up your monitor) a blue light would come on and stay on during use. Otherwise if you opted to turn the monitor on first, the yellow light would come on until you powered up the computer, then the light would turn blue and stay on during use.

This monitor, as someone else rightly pointed out - is all over the map in that regard.

To shut it off you power down your computer, then you have to reach under to the back of the monitor and push the only button it has on it (stupid design flaw most would agree). When you do that it puts up an on-screen menu. Rather than having a sensible option like pushing it once more to shut it off - instead a refresh icon appears in the middle of the button, so you have to "toggle" down to the bottom of the button and select the power icon. Once you've done that, then you have to push that button.

By toggling down what you have to do is press the very bottom of the button on the back. At first I couldn't figure out how to do that, but if you press the bottom like you would with a joystick it will select the power button option.

Only then - once you've pushed the button for the third time in all, will the monitor power off

Again, when you shut your computer off, the blue light will blink every few seconds. That means it's still on. It's not in standby or off. It is still sucking power when the blue light is blinking. Only when you go through the 3 steps in shutting it off - as described above, will that blue light become constantly on, and thus the monitor is truly shut off.

As other reviews have pointed out that is very backwards to how most monitors work. When your computer is on and you have the monitor on - the blue light is completely off. Yet when the blue light is constantly on, and not blinking - that's when it's off.

When you start your computer you have to push to button on the back to turn the monitor on.

I hope this helps anyone buying one of these monitors. Overall I'm happy with this monitor. It's a wider screen than my previous one. An Acer which worked fine for about 23 years in all. But overall better and much lighter in terms of product weight.

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)

The Samsung 32" FHD FreeSync Monitor (LS32B300NWNXGO) in sleek black is a visual powerhouse that combines a spacious display, high-resolution FHD clarity, and FreeSync technology for an incredible viewing experience. Whether you're working, gaming, or streaming, this monitor takes your visual experience to the next level. Here's why I believe the Samsung 32" FHD FreeSync Monitor deserves a glowing review:

Generous 32" Display: The sizeable 32-inch screen offers a wide canvas for work, gaming, and multimedia, enhancing productivity and immersion.

Full HD Clarity: The FHD resolution ensures sharp and vivid visuals, making every detail pop with lifelike clarity.

Smooth Gameplay: FreeSync technology synchronizes the monitor's refresh rate with your graphics card for tear-free and smooth gaming, even during fast-paced action.

75Hz Refresh Rate: A 75Hz refresh rate provides smoother motion and reduces motion blur for a more enjoyable gaming and viewing experience.

Versatile Connectivity: With HDMI and VGA ports, you can easily connect your devices, making it perfect for a range of applications.

In conclusion, the Samsung 32" FHD FreeSync Monitor is a visual delight for work and play. Its generous display, FHD clarity, smooth gameplay, high refresh rate, and versatile connectivity options make it a top-tier choice for those seeking an exceptional visual experience. I can't recommend this monitor enough; it has become a valuable addition to both professional and entertainment setups, delivering stunning visuals and responsive performance. Whether you're editing spreadsheets, battling foes in your favorite games, or indulging in multimedia content, this monitor ensures that you'll be captivated by its visual brilliance.

Review: The Samsung LS24R350FZNXZA is a game-changer for budget-conscious buyers. Its 24" LED display delivers stunning visuals with vibrant colors and sharp contrast. The 75Hz refresh rate ensures smooth visuals, perfect for both work and play. Freesync technology eliminates screen tearing, enhancing gaming experiences. The Dark Blue Grey finish adds a touch of elegance. Easy setup and intuitive controls make it a hassle-free addition to any workspace. An unbeatable combination of quality and affordability!

Great monitor, clear picture, great brightness. The only thing I'm not excited about, is the controls for it. Took me a few minutes to find them. They are behind the right side. Middle button brings up on screen and go from there. It's like the tv remote: you have to toggle l/r/up/down, and it's small. A better design would give it a 5 star rating. But, I don't really have to change any settings. Other than that, great monitor. Recommended.

2nd monitor I purchased as I like the first one. Came from the Amazon warehouse and they failed to include part of the stand but I had one from wall mounting a previous previous purchase.
4.5 stars for the monitor
2 stars for Amazon.

I mainly use my 13" MacBook Pro for music production, programming, and then some general web browsing, writing, and real casual general computer work. I'm not a gamer so I don't need 120Hz refresh rates. All I needed was something that would be easy on my eyes, look good in my space, and have a nice crisp display.

This monitor is simple to set up. It's got 3 screws. You can move it side to side but there's only 20 degrees of vertical movement. That's fine if you want to look at your monitor head-on or angled slightly up at you but if you need something that tilts downward you'll have to get a VESA mount that either clamps to your desk or mounts to your wall.

22 inches is plenty big with an HD screen and just what I needed when in a dual or triple monitor situation (occasionally I use my work-provided monitor in a 3 monitor setup).

For music production it doesn't strain your eyes to be staring at it for hours on end. Same when you're programming. Any monitor will give you eye strain eventually but this one is not going to give most people any issues most of the time.

You have options for HDMI or VGA connections. In my case I had to use a VGA cable for my work monitor in the past so I got an adapter for my laptop for USB-C to VGA connections. This works fine and the quality is the same as HDMI with this particular monitor because VGA quality goes up to around a thousand more pixels than 1080p and supports a refresh rate of 85Hz (assuming you didn't get a cheap cable). This monitor has a 75Hz refresh rate so using a VGA connection is not going to reduce quality. In fact I suspect that they chose HDMI and VGA precisely because the monitor works within the VGA spec and HDMI is just a very common connector these days so they included both while excluding DisplayPort because that's mainly used for higher spec machines and people shopping for a budget monitor likely wouldn't have a DisplayPort compatible computer. Plus DP is not super common anyway outside of offices and expensive computers and has little practical benefits over HDMI to the average person right now.

But don't let the fact that this is a budget monitor fool you. If you know you need higher refresh rates because you'll be watching movies and gaming then sure, this isn't for you. If you know you're going to be doing work, browsing the web, watching YouTube videos, coding, doing regular boring average computer stuff, then this is going to be more than enough for you. This is the monitor that should be the default standard for everyone looking for an external laptop monitor or that would come with any PC bundle. I wouldn't want lower quality and most wouldn't even notice higher specs if it had them. It's in the perfect spot.

If you need an excellent monitor that isn't a thousand dollar gaming monitor that's basically a flat screen TV made for the Super Bowl then this will be as good as any other.

Lo uso como equipo para mi home office, excelente para trabajar con tus sheets. Si es cierto que la configuración normal cambia el color (lo detecté con el hangout) pero como no soy diseñador no pasa absolutamente nada. No tiene bocinas por lo que usará la de tu compu (igual para trabajar nada que no afecte) y tiene solo 2 entradas (una VGA y una HDMI) asi que es bastante sencillo.

En resumen, si solo la usas para trabajar, excelente, todo lo demás se queda corto

Product came in exactly as described. I don't game - so not sure on quality for that. I had the larger version at my old work and absolutely loved it. Needed a monitor for an at home workspace, and bought this again. Great quality, clear picture. Use it as a second monitor for my MacBook Pro and love it!
Todo excelnet

Ya compré con esta vez 2 monitores iguales el primero venía en perfectas condiciones y se miraba muy bien pero esta vez no venía con fugas de luz y se miraban mucho los pixeles como si no fuera el mismo monitor de la primera vez q compré me decepciono

name: TP-Link 10/100/1000Mbps Gigabit Ethernet PCI Express Network Card (TG-3468) - PCIE Network Adapter, Network Card, Ethernet Card for PC, Win10 supported
description:
• Ultra Fast: 10/100/1000Mbps PCIe Adapter upgrade your Ethernet speed to Gigabit
  • Automation: Wake on LAN supporting Auto Negotiation and Auto MDI/MDIX
  • Supports: IEEE802.3x Flow Control for Full duplex Mode and backpressure for Half duplex Mode; 4k Bytes Port: 1x 10/100/1000Mbps RJ45 Network Media
  • Compatibility: Windows 10, 8.1, 8, 7, Vista, XP
  • Dual Bracket: Low profile and standard profile bracket inside works with both mini and standard size PCs
  • To ensure compatibility, you may need to update the adapter’s drivers after an OS update. You can find our latest drivers at TP-Link Canada website
  • TP-Link offers 2-year warranty and free 24/7 technical support

reviews.review:
The TP-Link 10Gb TX401 Ethernet card has a hardware design that supports Wake-on-LAN (WoL). Most other 10Gb Ethernet cards from other brands do not support WoL. When the PC is put to sleep mode, the TP-Link TX401 remains switched on and connected to the network while waiting for a Magic Packet to resume the PC if this option is enabled in Windows.

The TP-Link TX401 has a Marvell (formerly Aquantia) AQtion AQC107 chipset running at PCIe 3.0 speed. All three cards I received came with firmware version 3.1.100.

Instead of using the drivers provided on the CD-ROM, I downloaded the latest official drivers and firmware from Marvell Public Driver Downloads website. In Category, select Marvell Public Drivers and in Part Number, select AQC107 and click Apply to view available downloads.

I updated the cards to firmware 3.1.121, and I'm using Marvell Windows drivers version 3.1.7.

For my LAN setup, the TP-Link TX401 cards are connected to a TRENDnet TEG-S750 5-Port 10GbE switch. The switch is also connected to the 10G Ethernet port of the Bell Giga Hub. Surprisingly, I get a stable 10 Gbps connection speed over CAT5e cables with a lenght of 40 foot max. Even though the 10G speed is perfectly stable, I will upgrade the cables to CAT6 to meet the minimum requirements for 10G Ethernet speed.

Files copy between PCs are at full 1GB/s speed using NVMe drives. Of course, I get slower speed with SATA SSDs or HDD drives. For internet speed, I always get the full speed that the Bell Giga Hub gets because the LAN is not limited to a slower speed.

The TP-Link TX401 will auto negociate with slower LAN speeds (100Mbps, 1Gbps, 2.5Gbps, 5Gbps). I tested it with an older TRENDnet TEG-S350 2.5GbE switch and it works just fine at 2.5G speed.

So far, so good. Very happy with the result.
Super bonne carte réseau qui donne bien un 2.5gb et il est pas chère.
Connexion beaucoup plus fiable et robuste que la carte réseau intégrée à la carte maitresse.
Easy installation as plug and play. Getting 150mb/s transfer rate.
Ran out of box with zero issues. make sure to install appropiate drivers. Speeds are awesome
The TP-Link 2.5GB network card worked just like it should. Got my full internet speed up and down.

I recently purchased this card and installed it on my Sanethouth Z77 motherboard. As anticipated, the PCIe x1 slots were not compatible, but I encountered an unexpected issue with the second slot that has 16 lines - it simply didn't work. I'm not sure about the reason behind this. However, when I installed the card into the black 4x PCIe slot, it worked flawlessly and instantly. The inconsistency regarding the 16x lines slot remains a mystery to me.

Overall, I'm highly satisfied with the card's performance on my motherboard. It was a breeze to install (except for the aforementioned slot issue) and has been working flawlessly since then. I highly recommend it to anyone with a Sanethouth Z77 motherboard.

I only have a 2.5Gbps switch in my network, so I was hoping that this 10Gbps NIC would motivate me to update my home network.

I just got this card to replace a 2.5Gbps NIC that I had which was randomly loosing connection.
This card worked well for a few days, but has started to also loose it's connection randomly.

I initially used the latest drivers that I could find (3.1.7) but after the regular connection losses, I reverted to the previous drivers (3.1.6).
So far, after 12 hours, I haven't had any issues yet.

I checked and the 3.1.7 drivers just seem to have updates for Windows 11.
Since I'm on Windows 10, I don't care about those.

TP-Link manufactures quality networking gear. Over recent years, I have relied on a TP-Link modem and I currently running TWO TP-Link routers, one as a 'root' router, the other as an 'extender/bridge' router. Always rock-solid and reliable. (I retired the TP-Link modem only because TP-Link does not manufacture a stand-alone DOCSIS 3.1 modem.)

Note that there has been, over the years, four versions/itinerations of this (1 Gigabit PCI-Express) card. Sold and shipped by Amazon, I received Version 4.6 of the card. So Amazon is selling (direct) and shipping current stock. You can check the version of the card by looking at the label on the outside of the box … or at the sticker on the card. Oddly, the MAC address is not given on either the box or the card; if you need it, you will have to snag it out of your router's DHCP list.

Installation into a WinXP SP3 w/ circa-2007 Intel mobo was quick and straightforward:

All the drivers come in the box on a mini-CD but to be sure I would be current, I instead downloaded the most current Version 4 XP drivers from the TP-Link support webpage for the card. That was a .ZIP file; I extracted all the files into a temporary folder. Powered down the computer. Snapped the card into a vacant PCI-Express x 1 slot on the mobo. Powered back up and got the "Welcome to the Found New Hardware Wizard" pop-up. The XP driver install instructions provided by TP-Link (at their website) were very close, but not entirely 100% spot-on; if I recall correctly, from the pop-up I followed the path:

InstallFromAListOrSpecificLocation
Don'tSearchIWillChooseTheDriverToInstall
HardwareType (choose NetworkAdapter)
Don't bother to choose a specific adapter from the given list, instead click on
HaveDisk, then Browse (to the .inf file in the temporary folder), then Open it.
Click on OK. Ignore incorrect driver warnings and click ContinueAnyway.

(I think the warning is being 'thrown' by the fact that the TP-Link card is built on a Realtek chip & drivers.)

Bam! Device and drivers installed. Device is named 'TP-Link Gigabit PCI Express Adapter.' The three needed driver files were dropped into the Windows/System32 folder. Swapped the Ethernet cable onto the card. Opened ControlPanel/NetworkConnections. Disabled the mobo Ethernet port, renamed it 'Mobo Ethernet.' Enabled the TP-Link Ethernet port, renamed it 'TP-Link Ethernet.' Deleted the temporary folder. Rebooted the router, just to be sure. Up and running !!

I didn't pick up the download speed improvement I was hoping for, but I've definitely excluded the Ethernet port as a speed constraint. (Paying for 1Gb, pulling 220Mb … time to get a techie out here to test the speed at the coax connector!)

In any case, this card is very inexpensive … and it is also a quick, easy solution under XP and older mobos.

I’m a tech, I beta test tech for various companies. So it’s natural for me to test each piece of tech I acquire. I have a custom built pc with the intel 13900, a 4090 gpu connected using 1gig up and down internet speeds. I started having throttling occur on upload, limiting me to 100meg upload speed. So I started troubleshooting, after a week of testing I decided the weakest link was the built in Ethernet adapter, others reported similar issues with my particular motherboard. So I ordered this unit, I’m always an overkill kind of guy with tech, so getting a 2.5g unit seemed appropriate.

The unit arrived quickly, and was simple to install. It worked out of the box but of course I went to their website and upgraded drivers. First series of tests show my ping had been cut more than in half from 20 to 8. The speeds were faster slightly than before although a gig is a gig is a gig. That said, I soon encountered the exact same issue of throttled upload. I found it interesting that it seemed to throttle to 100megs give or take a few. At this time I recognized the issue was either my cable, modem or the actual line to my home. I replaced my Ethernet cord with a new one, and since fiber optic doesn’t usually degrade, it’s unlikely a line issue altho it could be a node issue down the line. Armed with the knowledge I had, I reached out and it was discovered my modem was failing. So even tho this unit didn’t specifically solve my issues, it did allow me to find the cause, and since it is a better ping, that to me is worth the cost of this card. Plus it gives me a backup connection if needed. I will be keeping this card and I will update once I get my new modem, and witness the difference real time. Should I encounter issues going forward I will also update this review.

Ultimately I like this adapter, it’s super simple to install and use and it did improve my connection ping and speeds. If I ever use it to transfer data locally I will also post an updated review on that.

Ho comprato questo prodotto per aggiornare la scheda di rete di un vecchio pc la quale non era Gigabit ma solo Fastethernet. La differenza tra fastethernet e gibabit é la velocitá di trasferimento dati che per la scheda fastethernet é pari 10/100 mbs mentre per la scheda di rete Gibabit puo'arrivare sino a 1000 mbs laddove anche gli altri comp[onenti hardware della rete siano dotati di porte ethernet Gibabit. La scheda é di piccola dimensioni e si monta negli slot pci x1 o x4 della scheda madre del pc. A differenza di altre schede quindi, questa non richiede uno slot pci express x16. Per capirci, gli slot pci express x16, sono quelli di maggiori dimensioni in cui solitamente si installano le schede grafiche dedicate o le schede audio dedicate mentre gli slot x1 o x4 sono quelli piú piccoli posti normalmente al fianco degli slot pci express x16. La scheda non richiede alimentazione autonoma, ma viene alimentata dalla scheda madre. Nella confezione olte alla scheda e ad un minicd contenente i driver forniti dal produttore, troverete, una piccola staffa in metallo, che vi consentirá di installare la scheda nei case mini-itx, laddove ne possediate uno. In difetto, la scheda é installabile dall'utente in tutti i case midle tower e full tower. Il controller della scheda di rete é Realtek ( quindi Tpc link é il produttore della scheda ma non del processore che la controlla), e viene identificata nel pannello di controllo di Windows 7 ( voce Gestione dispositivi - schede di rete ) come Gigabit Realtek family Controller. Si tratta di un controller economico montato quasi sempre sui pc preassemblati piu'recenti,. Il prodotto in questione é un prodotto economico non certo quidi di alto livello e le prestazioni velocistiche nel trasferimento dei dati tra pc collegati in rete riflettono esattamente il fatto che il controller sia un entry level, poiché, nonostante io possegga un router con porte gigabit, la velocitá della mia rete cablata con cavo rj 45 tra due pc non supera i i 40/50 mbs di media, raggiungendo picchi sporadici di 60 mbs. Si tratta di un buon risultato che soddisferá sicuramente l'utente medio e meno l'utente enthusiast o comunque colui il quale abbia necessitá di utilizzare la rete per fini professionali o semi professionali che , al contrario, esige grande celeritá nel trasferimento dei volumi di dati. Se si sta scegliendo, pertanto, una scheda di rete, avendo come unico obiettivo le prestazioni velocistiche nel trasferimento dati, bisognerebbe dirigere l'attenzione verso prodotti piu'costosi con controller Intel i quali risultano in assoluto i migliori ma che purtroppo costano il triplo rispetto alla scheda oggi recensita. Attenzione quindi a determinare prima e con attenzione il risultato che vi aspetterete dalla configurazione della vostra rete (Lan), poiché se state mirando alle prestazioni pure, alla velocitá, dovete dirigervi verso altri prodotti ben piu'costosi, se, al contrario, volete solo aggiornare un vecchio pc, sprovvisto di porta ethernet gigabite e vi accontentate di buone velocitá di trasferimento dati ma che, tuttavia, non sono velocitá da ''prima della classe'' allora il prodotto in questione é quello giusto per voi. Una precisazione; quando parlo di velocitá nel trasferimento dati, mi riferisco al tempo impiegato ad esempio per trasferire con la funzione ''copia ed incolla'' una cartella o un file da un pc ad un altro pc collegato nella stessa rete, non mi rifersico invece alla velocitá di navigazione internet poiché, laddove il vostro modem o router sia collegato al pc tramite cavo di rete ethernet o comunque tramite wireless, la velocitá di download o upload ( cioé di scaricamento e caricamento dati) dipende dal vostro Provider di servizi Internet ( Tim, Vodafon, Fastweb, ecc) non certamente dalla scheda di rete ethernet che non possiede alcuna incidenza sotto questo profilo.
Per quanto riguarda l'installazione, molti utenti riferiscono che il sistema operativo Windows 7 abbia cercato automaticamente i driver per il prodotto, dopo aver rilevato la scheda alla prima accensione successiva alla sua intallazione. Ció é avvenuto anche nel mio caso ma l'operazione non é andata a buon fine e la scheda non ha funzionato correttamente. Quindi ho disinstallato il driver generici installati da Windows Update in automatico, ho riavviato il sistema operativo, avendo cura previamente di spegnere il modem ed, una volta raggiunto il desktop, ho insallato i driver forniti dal produttore con il disco di installazione (mini-cd) che accompagna la scheda di rete. Tutto é andato bene e la scheda funziona correttamente sotto Windows 7 a 64 bit versione professional. Molti utenti inoltre, affermano che sotto Windows 10 , i driver siano preinstallati nel sistema operativo e che pertanto la scheda, una volta installata, venga riconosciuta senza necessitá di alcun ulteriore download od operazione da parte dell'utente. Personalmente non posso confermare né smentire poiché, come giá detto, io l'ho testata esclusivamente sotto sistema operativo windows 7. In alcuni casi la scheda di rete aggiuntiva rispetto a quella nativa giá installata all'interno della madre puó andare in conflitto con quest'ultima; per tali evenienze é necessario disabilitare la schede di rete dal bios ( voce: on board lan) oppure dalla pannello di controllo di windows ( voce : Gestioni dispositivi- Schede di rete - Disabilita dispositivo o Disintalla Dispositivo). affinché la scheda di rete aggiuntiva possa funzionare correttamente. Nel mio caso non é stato necessario disabilitare nulla, la scheda di rete Gigabit Realtek di TpLink funziona perfettamente anche senza disabilitare la mia vecchia ethernet con velocitá Fast (10-100) e, pertanto, adesso posseggo doppia uscita di rete. Nella staffa di metallo che sorregge la scheda di rete vera e propria sono integrati tre led verdi che si accendono quando la scheda é in funzione ed incominciano a lampeggiare ad intermittenza, per segnalare il passaggio dei dati. Il prodotto é buono ed economico e lo consiglio per un utilizzo medio, per i palati piu'esigenti, cioé gli utenti appassionati di informatica ed elettronica, nonché per coloro che vogliano un prodotto da adibire ad utilizzi piu'impegnativi o professionali, invece, consiglio di guardare altrove, innalazndo chiaramente il budget di spesa ( i chipset di rete Intel sono un'ottima alternativa). Il prodotto é arrivato molto velocemente, ha impiegato solo 3 giorni e mi é stato consegnato dal corriere Bartolini. Non posso attribuire piu'di 4 stelle, non perché abbia trovato dei veri dfietti nel prodotto ma semplicemente perché si tratta di un prodotto economico, dalle funzionalitá e dalle prestazioni basiche, adeguate all'utente medio ed il cui prezzo é pienamente conforme a quanto offerto. A mio giudizio per attribuirgli 5 stelle sarebbe stato ncessario riscontrare funzionalitá e caratteristiche straordinarie in relazione al prezzo di acquisto che questo prodotto non possiede, pur non deludendo sotto alcun punto di vista. Segnalo comunque la presenza tra le funzionalitá aggiuntive della scheda di rete, l'opzione ''wake on lan'' la quale deve essere previamente abilitata, consentendo di risvegliare un pc che sia in stato di sospensione o ibernazione mediante l'utilizzo di un altro pc facente parte della stessa rete. Per sfruttare questa opzione, peró sono necessarie 4 condizioni: la prima é che il computer che si intenda risvegliare sia dotato di SCHEDA DI RETE ethernet con funzione '' wake on lan'', la seconda condizione é che la SCHEDA MADRE del computer da risvelgiare supporti la funzione '' wake on lan'' , ( anche essa attivabile dal bios), la terza condizione é che il computer da risvegliare NON SIA SPENTO ma solo in stato di sospensione o ibernazione, la quarta condizione é che il computer da risvelgiare e quello risvegliante FACCIANO PARTE DELLA STESSA RETE. Se non ricorrono tutte le 4 condizioni sopraelencate, la funzione wake on lan non é utilizzabile. Spesso con il termine ''wake on lan', negli articoli suyl web, viene identificato anche il procedimento di accensione a distanza di un pc spento (e non solo posto in stato di sospensione o ibernazione) nonché l'accensione a distanza di un pc spento mediante l'utilizzo di un pc risvegliante che non faccia parte della stessa rete Lan. Tale terminologia é inesatta, comuqnue per vostra consocenza, potrebbe risultare utile sapere che l'accensione a distanza sia di un pc completamente spento sia di un pc non facente parte della stessa rete é procedimento ben piu'complesso della ''wake on lan'' pura, poiché richiede l'utilizzo di appositi software, spesso molto costosi, esige naturalmente la scheda di rete e la scheda madre del pc da risvegliare con funzione wake on lan ed, infine, richiede conoscenze approfondite sul funzionamento delle reti telematiche di cui l'utente medio é ignaro.

Had a heck of a time getting 2.5 gig up and down and it was all due to the drivers. I bought this since I have fiber and the router speed check was at 2.5 gigs. The problem was in not keeping the original drivers it comes with and dont update them. The updated drivers would only allow me 1450 down and 1150 up speeds. Make sure your router can handle the 2.5 gig since most cannot. Some have a 2.5 gig port in coming but in most that is the only port that works at 2.5 gig and its not an out going port. Most outgoing are only 1 gig speed rated since most services are not much more. After some tweaking and playing with the drivers the speed is 2350 both up and down. Took a bit but I am finally happy with this and getting the speeds I was promised. The install is super easy and the drivers load easily also.
