Instalar un SSD en la PS5 es muy fácil y no anula la garantía. Solo necesitas un destornillador de estrella y quitar una de las cubiertas para tener acceso al compartimento del SSD. En dicho compartimento hay un tornillo que hay que quitar para introducir el SSD. Una vez instalado tienes que atornillarlo de nuevo y poner la cubierta.

Es hora de hablar del rendimiento. El fanxiang S770 de 4 TB ofrece una velocidad de lectura de hasta 7.300 MB/s en PC, mientras que en PS5 es algo inferior. A la hora de escribir puede alanzar hasta 5.400 MB/s. Como puedes ver, son unas velocidades de transferencia muy rápidas. Así pues, no hace falta decir que este SSD se convierte en una excelente opción para todos aquellos quieran ampliar la capacidad almacenamiento de la consola de Sony por poco dinero.

El fanxiang S770 de 4 TB también es una opción a tener en cuenta si juegas en PC. De hecho, cada vez hay más juegos donde se recomienda tener una de estas unidades de almacenamiento rápido, por ejemplo, The Last of Us Parte I. En definitiva, es uno de los SSD más rápidos que puedes conseguir ahora mismo a buen precio, y por si fuera poco incluye el disipador de calor, algo que nunca está de más.

Los SSD de 4 TB de marcas como Samsung y WD suelen más caros, mientras que el fanxiang S770 de 4TB puede ser tuyo por tan solo 230 euros. ¡Vaya chollo! Es un precio muy tentador y más si tenemos en cuenta que estamos hablando de un SSD compatible con PS5. A nivel de rendimiento, no tiene nada que envidar a otros SSD de marcas mucho más conocidas.

Encore peu connue en France, Fanxiang est une marque chinoise qui propose des SSD à des prix particulièrement compétitifs. Mais pas cher ne signifie pas médiocre pour autant. Le SSD S880 a subi 88 heures de tests rigoureux ainsi que 5 tests stricts histoire de garantir sa résistance et sa fiabilité sur le long terme. Le SSD dispose d’une garantie de 5 ans et Fanxiang annonce une endurance de 2800 TBW.

🔳 Caractéristiques détaillés du SSD S880 4TB :
Modèle: 5880
Interface: M.2 2280 (protocolo NVMe 1.4)
Contrôleur SSD : MAP1602A from MaxioTech
Modules Mémoire : 232-layer TLC NAND flash (Made by YMTC)
Température de fonctionnement: 0°C-70°C
Température de stockage : -40°C-85°C
Poids: 0.045g
Taille: 80*22*2.5~3.4mm
Capacité: 4To
Service après-vente: 5 ans

Installé dans un boitier externe USB-C Thunderbolt 3 (40Gbps) en tant que disque de sauvegarde 4TB pour mon Macbook Pro (oui je sais c'est overkill), ce disque annonce des performances vraiment excellentes (7300MB/s en lecture séquentielle et 6800MB/s en écriture séquentielle). Hélas je n'ai jamais réussi à les atteindre puisque le TB3 même à 40Gbps n'est pas assez rapide.

Voici mon feedback sur ce disque SSD S880 4TB:
✅ RAPPORT QUALITÉ/PRIX IMBATTABLE à ce niveau de capacité/performance
✅ Équipé d’un autocollant de dissipation thermique au graphène, cela permet une dissipation de la chaleur et empêcher le SSD d’atteindre des températures élevées.
✅ Format M.2 2280 compact tout ce qu'il y a de plus classique.
✅ Il exploite à merveille l’interface PCIe 4.0 NVMe 4X pour offrir des débits extrêmement élevés...
✅ ...tout en conservant une consommation et une chauffe maîtrisée (ça chauffe quand même pas mal hein, on ne va pas se mentir)
✅ Vitesse annoncée jusqu’à 7300 Mbps en lecture séquentielle et jusqu’à 6800 Mbps en écriture séquentielle. De mon côté, j'étais plutôt sur environ la moitié des chiffres annoncés (en USB-C donc). Je n'ai pas pu vérifier sur un PC en PCI 4.0 4X.
✅ Débits théorique 13 fois supérieurs à ceux d'un SSD SATA.
✅ 2800 TBW !!
✅ Garantie 5 ans.... 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
❌ Pas de cache DRAM ! Mais il y a un pseudo cache SLC pour les bursts d'écriture
❌ Une marque encore très jeune (les S880 sont sortis en Avril 2023, c'est très récent...). Il y a peu de recul encore sur la fiabilité long terme. D'où le fait que je l'ai mis en disque de sauvegarde, car il sera peu sollicité, et si un jour une sauvegarde n'aboutit pas car le disque est défaillant, je pourrai toujours le changer rapidement, plutôt que de perdre toutes les données d'un disque principal en production ^^

Le mot de la fin : Sur mes premiers essais depuis plusieurs mois, les performances restent stratosphériques pour un disque utilisé en externe en plus. C'est pour moi un excellent achat. Je vous le conseille.

È un SSD con dissipatore di calore, adatto per Ps5, serve per aumentare gli 825 GB disponibili della Ps5 che si esauriscono con pochi giochi.

È un SSD del modello M2 PCle 4.0. con una velocità dichiarata di lettura e scrittura di 7300 MB/s, che poi rivelereanno effettivamente essere circa 6500 MB/s.

Veniamo alle fasi di montaggio dell'SSD:

Si prende uno dei due cuscinetti termici, si rimuove la pellicola e lo si posiziona sulla base del dissipatore di calore, poi si mette sopra l'SSD con il chip verso l'alto e si mette l'altro pad termico a coprire la parte superiore dell'SSD. Fatto questo si prende il dissipatore che si posizionerà sopra il pad termico e si preme verso il basso cosi da fissarsi.

All'interno della confezione troviamo 5 viti nere, ne vanno usate 4 per bloccare l'SSD al dissipatore con il piccolo giravite in dotazione.

Fatto questo è tutto pronto e dobbiamo smontare la ps5 prendendola in posizione orizzontale, facendo scorrere prendendo gli estremi e sollevandola leggermente. Davanti a voi dovete avere il retro della ps5, messa in posizione orizzontale dovete farla scorrere verso sinistra. È una procedura che richiedere una leggera forza all'inizio e pazienza, anche se non riuscite subito, prendetevi un attimo e riprovate con calma senza farvi prendere dalla foga.

Rimosso il pannello, in alto troverete un alloggiamento per l'SSD aggiuntivo. Rimuovete la vite, il coperchio e inserite l'SSD completo di dissipatore nel giusto verso. Con la rondella e la vita presenti fissiamo il tutto e richiediamo coperchio e Ps5.

Una volta accesa la Ps5 apparirà il messaggio che vi dirà di aver rilevato il nuovo SSD e se formattarlo. Cliccate su formatta, fatto questo vi indicherà la velocità massima di lettura e sarà pronto all'uso.

La procedura non è difficile, richiede molta pazienza ma è fattibile per tutti, nulla di trascendentale. Adesso c'è tantissimo spazio e non bisogna più cancellare giochi e salvataggi.

PRO
Ps5 finalmente completa in tutto, installazione intuitiva, SSD capiente

CONTRO
Velocità effettiva inferiore a quella dichiarata

Adesso la mia Ps5 ha lo spazio necessario per poter giocare con serenità senza stare lì a rimuovere o fare calcoli su cosa salvare o cancellare.

Peccato per la velocità dichiarata che non viene raggiunta e per questo motivo lo valuto 4 stelle ma resta comunque un valore di tutto rispetto.

Se volete una Ps5 capiente e funzionale con più giochi installati sopra, questo SSD può fare al caso vostro, va bene per entrambe le versioni di Ps5.

Spero di esservi stato utile.

👋 Ciao lettori, oggi vi parlo di questo SSD targato Fanxiang che mi ha lasciato molto colpito!
☁️ Personalmente ho acquistato la variante S770 da 2TB

📢 PRIME IMPRESSIONI:
Packaging con l'SSD, nulla più nulla meno, dissipato passivamente che promette teoricamente delle ottime performance, ma sarà vero? Controlliamolo insieme!

⚙️ SPECIFICHE TECNICHE:
Fanxiang lancia questo prodotto con un bel pacchetto di specifiche, partiamo innanzitutto da un PCIe 4.0 che garantisce alla PS5 di leggerlo (PS5 non è compatibile con nessun NVMe che non sia almeno PCIe 4.0), poi troviamo ben 2GB di DRAM nel caso della variante da 2TB della Sk Hynix, chip che promettono bene, affiancato da una NAND di YMTC ed un controller di InnoGrit entrambi assolutamente niente male, a livello di componentistica usata per quanto mi riguarda, c'è da stupirsi considerato il prezzo!

🚀 MA QUANTO E' VELOCE?:
Mantiene la promessa fatta, infatti grazie al PCIe 4.0 affiancato da delle componenti evidentemente di livello, raggiunge senza problemi i promessi 7000MB/s in Read e 6600MB/s in Write, assolutamente niente male!

🎮 PS5 READY:
La PS5 digerisce tranquillamente questo SSD ed una volta in game, le prestazioni che fornisce sono assolutamente equiparabili al SSD nativo della Play, carica molto velocemente i giochi e grazie alla DRAM li sposta anche molto velocemente tra SSD Esterno e interno o viceversa.

🟨 Nota: Il profilo del dissipatore passivo è ottimizzato per PS5, questo significa che lo shielding che devi rimontare per chiudere il vano del inserimento SSD su PS5 si chiude tranquillamente anche con il dissipatore installato.

🔥 DURABILITA':
Fanxiang garantisce ben 1400TBW di durabilità (ovvero 1400TB di scrittura su disco), che sono tantissimi, facendo finta che ogni gioco per PS5 sia di 100GB, dovreste scaricare 100GB di giochi per 14 MILA VOLTE.

🕒 3 MESI DOPO E QUALITA' PREZZO:
Ad oggi non ho avuto nessunissimo problema con questo disco e mi sento di essere pronto a consigliarvelo, le performance che ho ottenuto sono state davvero ottimali soprattutto per il prezzo pagato, per quanto mi riguarda ne vale la pena.

🏁 FACCIAMO IL PUNTO:
Un disco di un brand emergente che contro ogni aspettativa (considerando i trascorsi dei nuovi brand di SSD orientali), si comporta benissimo ed ha velocità assolutamente adeguate a quello che promette.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐/5

Yo en mi caso lo e tenido que devolver pero no por que esté defectuoso ni nada por el estilo.
Simple y llana mente por que en las especifocaciones ( para los que no somos expertos en informatica ) no especifica que no es compatible para placas base que solo tienen ranuras de lectura para SSD M.2 SATA III
Ya sabes, si tu placa es alho antigua y solo lee SSD M.2 tipo SATA III estas tarjetas de memoria no te valen, son de lectura NVMe y no SATA III con lo que mira bien en tu librito de la placa base y mira que tipo de tarjetas SSD M.2 lee tu placa o te tocará devolverla, tambien mira si son 3.0 o 4.0 o 5.0 es posible que el tipo de generacion tambien de error de arranque por compativilidad.

name: Kuesuny 16GB KIT (2X8GB) DDR3/DDR3L 1600MHz Sodimm Ram PC3/PC3L-12800S PC3/PC3L-12800 1.5V/1.35V CL11 204 Pin 2RX8 Dual Rank Non-ECC Unbuffered Memory Ram Ideal for Notebook Laptop Upgrade
description:
• ★ Memory Model: DDR3 DDR3L 1600MHz PC3 PC3L 12800S 16GB Kit (2x8GB) Laptop Ram. (Before purchasing, please ensure the RAM model, RAM slot and max memory of your laptops. Before installation, please wipe connection finger gently with eraser.)
  • ★ Strong Compatibility & high stability: The ddr3l 1600mhz sodimm ram is designed for selected Intel, AMD & Mac systems, providing your laptop with superior compatibility and the stability required for a long-term system operation.
  • ★ High Quality Chip and Strict Test: All chips are 100% tested and meet the RoHS, JEDEC, FCC and CE-EMC standards.
  • ★ Plug and Play: Memory upgrading is the fastest, easiest, and most affordable ways to immediately improve the performance of your computer. If your laptops runs slowly, memory upgrading can solve your problems effectively.
  • ★ Lifetime Warranty & Technical Support: If for any reason you're not completely satisfied with this ddr3l 1600mhz sodimm ram, please feel free to contact us.
  • ★ Please Kindly Note: This is non-ECC memory only for laptop, in case of no work before purchase please check the correct ram model, maximum memory, number of ram slot of your computer. Before installation, please ensure that RAM slots are in good condition, clean out the slots with canned air; meanwhile clean RAM stick’s connection figure gently with eraser, don’t use corrosives, like ethyl alcohol.

reviews.review: With both sticks in the system won't get past the bios splash screen, it even posts slower. But with either stick in either slot it works just fine as long as there's only 1. I'm keeping 1 old and 1 new stick in and it's working fine. Running a memtest now but I expect it to pass. I suspect the issue is with the laptop rather than the ram. The laptop maximum is 4GB but it may be having issues at its limit? Booted it to Linux Peppermint once after the change and it's clearly much faster than it was so I'm happy from a speed perspective without testing that specifically.
Doubled my ram in computer works much faster now!!

Bought that to upgrade the kids laptop that is an old but still working gen 3 Core i5 that was struggling with Microsoft Teams gobbling up all the ram. 8gb wasn't enough so bought this 16gb kit to max it out and it made a world of difference. Basically extended this laptop life instead of ending up in landfill/recycling center for cheap. Highly recommend.
Excellent performance and compatibility
My old Lenovo has new life. Quadrupled the main memory sped it up quite noticeably. Easy to install.

Générallement la mémoire viens en paire. J'avais 8Gb de RAM, je m'attendais a trouver 2 X 4Gb dans mon ordi. Hé bien, non, j'avais une barre de 8Gb et un barre de libre. Une seule barre de 8Gb m'aurait donc suffi pour monter a 16Gb qui est le max pour mon ordi. Vérifier avant d'acheter. Les barres sont plug & play, tu installes et ca fonctionne.
The ram was exactly what I needed and it worked perfectly and it arrived within three days
works well installed 4 8gb booted computer and now have 16gb. computer is faster. also installed ssd kingston, works well together.

Für den alten Lappi musste ein neuer Arbeitsspeicher her denn mit 4 GB und Betriebssystem Windows 10 läuft alles im schneckenbetrieb. Ich habe mich ein wenig umgesehen was es so zu kaufen gibt und habe mich für dieses Produkt entschieden. nun habe ich 16 GB und der Laptop rennt wie eine alte RennSemmel. Der Einbau war etwas fummelig aber hat gut funktioniert Punkt ich kann dieses Produkt auf jeden Fall weiterempfehlen preis-Leistungsverhältnis ist top und die Lieferung war auch sehr gut.

Sembra banale dire che hanno funzionato appena inseriti nel PC HP EliteDesk 800 mini G1 ma sono stati la mia "seconda" scelta visto che avevo acquistato altro brand che invece hanno fatto cilecca!
Quindi direi che vanno molto bene, testati ormai da giorni , senza problemi!
considerando il prezzo e la spedizione rapida meritano le 5 stelle

Nada mal, anda jalando bastante bien, no tuve ningún problema, por ahora... Espero que duren bastante.
El envío fue rápido y sin daños.
Se notó la diferencia en la laptop dónde las instalé, se ven de buena calidad, vamos a ver cuánto duras, no he tenido problema con ellas.
Hasta el momento todo ok, salieron muy bien

name: RackPath 6U Performance Wall Mount Server Cabinet Network Rack Enclosure, Quiet Cooling Fan, Locking Glass Door, Black
description:
• Dimensions: 21.65" Length x 17.72" Depth x 14.06" Height ; The wall mounting holes on the 6U cabinet are spaced 16 inches center to center for greater stability, matching standard construction framework
  • Fully adjustable mounting rails with square holes for easy equipment mounting; Total usable equipment mounting space of 14.6" (370mm) front to back
  • Removable top and bottom panels for cable management
  • Cooling Fan – One premium quiet cooling fan is included
  • Weight capacity:110 lbs; Sturdy welded frame structure (Easy Assembly Required)

reviews.review: Using this at my shop to house a UPS, network switch, and patch panel. The built in fan is nice and not too loud, the lock keeps people from fooling with it, and the glass front comes in handy for the non-techy people to be able to peer in and make sure the appropriate lights are on if there are issues. Assembly is not too difficult, just a little time consuming and the unit is overall pretty sturdy.
We used this to house an NVR and Monitor for a Security Camera install. Easy to put together and well built. A lot of bang for your buck.

This rack is mounted quickly on the wall in my server room. The assembly was simple and straightforward. My only issue is that the unit drops slightly when removing the side panels, making it difficult to insert the side panels after performing wire maintenance or upgrades. I would suggest installing a firmer support rail to hold the frame "Square" so that the equipment does not "Sag" the structure.

It turned out well (I first ordered a refurbished one that was missing a lot of pieces, do not recommend buying these things used - too many parts to lose). Building it was a bit of a pain, the instructions were not all that helpful. For what it is, it is ok.
Perfect for our outdoor karaoke equipment

name: ORICO 2.5" 3.5" RGB Hard Drive Docking Station Offline Clone USB 3.2 to SATA HDD SSD Hard Drive Dock Duplicator up to 36TB with UASP [Support Both USB-C and USB-A ] (8828C3-C)
description:
• 【Support Offline Clone Function】The docking station can operate offline cloning independently from a computer. Please backup files in the target hard drive before cloning. Any files in the target hard drive will be overwritten when offline cloning occurs. The target disk must be larger than the source disk.
  • 【14 kinds of RGB Effect】Phantom RGB lighting effects are specially set for game users to meet your ultimate experience of personalization and desktop aesthetics, many large games can be easily operated on this hard drive docking station, you won't be bothered by game stuttering anymore.
  • 【6Gbps with UASP Accelerated】Our hard drive docking station designed with USB 3.2 type-c to c interface, supports up to 6Gbps max transfer speed and UASP accelerated transmission protocol, 70% Faster than conventional USB 3.0, supports S.M.A.R.T and TRIM.
  • 【Support USB-C and USB-A Device】The SSD docking station come with a durable USB 3.2 G2 type C-C data cable that can support a wide range of USB-C and USB-A devices such as laptop, computers, tablets, desktops, routers, projectors, etc. 10Gbps cable to meet the safety and stability of large-capacity hard disk data transmission.【 USB-A Adapter included】
  • 【Fast Heat Dissipation】These HDD docking station is made of sturdy and durable ABS material with a vertical design, which is portable and provides high performance fast heat dissipation. Dustproof socket baffle always keeps the dock station clean and safe. Support Windows XP/Vista/7/ 8.1/ 8/10, Mac OS 10 or higher

reviews.review: Fast read/write speed, but the design isn’t flawless: even when annoying non-functional led lights are disabled, the ACTIVITY indicators are so small and they’re hardly visible. The SATA connectors a bit misaligned, so you have to be REALLY careful when inserting the disk not to damage the SATA connectors.

works as designed in mounting external drives.
RGB color scheme failed after a weeks time.

I'm keeping it for now since returning it is a pain, but will never buy again from vendor.

I have to say I was disappointed with this dock, I have an older Orico dock that is USB 3.0 and that is much heavier and substantial and has been wonderful. This one just feels light and cheap. So far it works just fine, but I was expecting it to be more like my older one.

I really wish they had spent money on making a better quality case than the fancy LED stuff that I really have no interest in. Yes you can turn off the LED or change it to a fixed color. By repeatedly long or short pressing the LED button you can cycle through various fade modes, fixed colors or off. The color selected is memorized if the drive is powered off.

The supplied USB cord plugs into the dock with the USB-C end and the other has a USB-C with an adapter to also fit USB-A which is very nice. Cable also seems to be of high quality.

Another difference from the older Orico dock I have is the drive bay flap. The dive accommodates 2.5" and 3.5" drives but the drive bay flap is just one solid flap. On my older dock there is a cutout for 2.5" drives such that the flap pops up around the smaller drive and stabilizes it (3.5" drive fills the slot and so is stable). In this dock the flap just stays pushed down into the hole and the 2.5" drive is more prone to wobbling on it's connector. Since I will be using 2.5" drives inserted all the time it makes me want to disassemble and modify the flap! I guess the one advantage of the solid flap is that if the dock sits empty it will keep the dust out.

In use the dock works well and seems to get high transfer speeds.

The manual pretty much just explains how to use offline drive copy if you have the two bay dock. I have the single bay one and there really isn't any compelling reason to read the manual. It doesn't explain how to change LED modes at all.

I needed a second dock for another machine and this one has a better USB 3.2 interface than the old which is USB 3.0. It will get the job done, but I'm left feeling it's a lower quality device than the older one. Even the power supply seems like a cheaper one. So this is why I knocked off one star, I can't really fault the way it operates though.

I got this mostly for older hard drives and when some of my hard my hard drives are not connecting to my PC anymore. The ones that I know work, work well and as well as expected. The ones that were problematic, are more an issue of the disc itself and so this does not always solve the problem. Overall this device is worth getting and will use it.

This is an excellent hot swap storage drive dock that not only looks great, but works without any hassle. The drive has a two part cover tray that can fit both a 2.5” or a standard 3.5” hard drive. Simply just take whatever hard drive you have on hand, and slot in as labeled depending on the size format. For somebody like me, who switched over to NVMe drives ages ago, I have a lot of spare internal drives that were collecting dust in my closet until now. With this, I am able to use those old drives and store recordings, music, games and more and label them accordingly. The RGB lighting is also a nice touch and looks good on my desk. It fits with my setup and doesn’t take away from the aesthetic. Overall, I love how simple and easy this is to use and I think it’ll be incredibly useful for those that need to store a lot of data or want to breathe new life into old HDDs. I highly recommend it.

name: KCMconmey 4 + 1 Bay DIY NAS Case, 4 x 2.5/3.5 Tray + 1 x 2.5 Internal Bay. Compatible ITX MB Flex PSU. with Front USB 3.0 8cm Chassis Fan Hot Swap Backplane. Network Attached Storage Enclosure.
description:
• [Support Mini ITX Motherboard] ITX Motherboard dimension 6.7*6.7in (17*17cm).
  • [Support Flex or 1U Power Supply Unit] Flex PSU dimension 3.21*1.59*5.91in (81.5*40.5*150mm). 1U PSU dimension 3.94*1.59in (100*40.5mm) maximum length 7.48in (190mm).
  • [Support 1 Single Slot Full Height PCI-e Expansion Card] To add video card or network card or more.
  • [Come With 2 Front USB 3.0] USB 3.0 for faster data transfer.
  • [Come With 1 8cm Replaceable Fan] Pre-installed 80*80*25mm chassis fan.

reviews.review: Lots of modding to get everything to fit but in the end it's a very quiet raid10 NAS using an old micro Alienware I had lying around (All fans replaced with Noctuas). There is only 1 cpu fan that actually fits in this case and since I didn't buy that one I decided to bend the frame of the case to get the motherboard in and lucky enough it had no issues closing the case when bent back. There is also no airflow into the case so I had to drill a hole for a 40x10 noctua as well as another hole for the light up Alienware head on the front (see pics).

It would be even better if it was 10% larger with better wire management.
I'd like 8, 10, 12, 16 disk versions as well please.
A version with a standard ATX power would be nice too :-)

I bought this case with the plan to start with 2 18TB 3.5" disks and move up to 4. I have a low power N5005 motherboard in here and everything worked reasonably well until I added the last 2 drives. Even at idle, the drives just start heating up with no end in sight - especially the middle two. The drive temps hit around 50C within a few minutes of being turned on (but idle) - I'd hate to see what a parity sync would do at this point!
I replaced the 80mm stock fan with a noctua and added a 40mm noctua to the front to improve ventilation, it had no impact at all. I've currently got the top off the case with a regular oscillating fan pointed at the drives to stop them from cooking while I wait for a better case to arrive.
Don't bother with this unless you're going to leave some of the drive trays empty (which defeats the purpose) or if you're planning on using 2.5" disks.
This case will cook your 3.5" disks on your first parity sync.

This is as far as I could find, the absolute smallest mITX NAS case with 4 external 3.5” hot swap bays currently available to buy anywhere. It does have some drawbacks and difficulty building but if you really need a tiny custom NAS over something like a QNAP/Synology then this is the best you will find assuming can’t use something bigger.

Building in this case is not easy and was very difficult due to the size so new PC builders should not start with this case in my opinion.

A simple but massive improvement to this case design as others have mentioned would be if the drive caddy could be removed by screws as it is currently riveted in. This would make the motherboard install way easier. Even with a CPU cooler that is within spec for height, it still did not want to go in without a fight, I had to bend the case slightly to get it in. Once it is in though, it does have clearance, but cause of that drive caddy actually does not fit natively.

Another improvement would be if they cut another air hole in the front panel and added mounts for a second 40 mm fan on the opposite of the one it already supports. This would help add a little bit more airflow and there is room for it, so why not?

Lots of cables need to be plugged in prior to installing the board as again the drive caddy is in the way. For my board, this required plugging all of the PSU cables to the board and the front panel connectors ahead of time.

The SATA cables needed to be plugged into the rear of the drive caddy first and not the board side as plugging into the back of the drive caddy was quite difficult for how tight it is with that sharp turn. Also be aware that the included SATA cables are shorter than standard which is good for the case since it does not have a lot of room for cable management but depending on where the SATA ports are on your board there could be a length issue, mine just barely reached.

I replaced the rear fan with a Noctua one as it’s a lot better than the stock fan however for me at least, I highly recommend removing the rear fan regardless to make the SATA connections easier. You can still squeeze the fan by the cables afterwards.

Regarding temperatures as others mentioned the cooling is not amazing here even with my replacement rear fan. One thing that helped for me was setting a custom fan curve and using the PCH as my temp target instead of the CPU as in my case the CPU will likely be a lower temperature than the PCH on average.

One last thing since it only supports Flex ATX PSUs, there are a lot of issues with those having very loud fans. If you can handle the steep price, the SilverStone Technology FX600 is the most efficient Flex ATX PSU on the market and if you truly use this system as a NAS, you will never hear it as your load will never be high enough for the PSU fan to need to ramp up. Full load my system is under 100 watts.

System Specs:
CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 R5 Pro 5650GE
CPU Cooler: Noctua NH-L9a-AM4
Ram: 2 x 16 GB DDR4 2400 ECC
SSD: Samsung 960 Pro 1 TB with EKWB EK-M.2 NVMe Heatsink, Black
SSD: 2 x 128 GB M.2 SATA SSDs in a 2 Port M.2 SSD to PCI-e x1 adapter B
HDD: 4 x 12 TB HGST WD Ultrastar DC HC520
Case: KCMconmey 4 + 1 Bay DIY NAS Case
PSU: SilverStone Technology FX600

余ったパーツでNASに仕立てようと購入したのですが、細々と追加出費を強いられています。

ケースの説明書が何もないため、付属の金具やプラパーツ、何に使うのかよくわかりません。+1 のHDDをどこかに取り付ける用なのかもしれない。

センターのドライブベイを収めている梁と、その下の空間が狭い。古い余りもののMini-ITXに薄型CPUファン(37mmのはず)を付けたマザーを収めようとしても、マザー裏のバックプレートやネジが、ケース下部パーツの側面、20mmほどの立ち上がっている部分に干渉して、かなり苦労してもマザーを傷付けずに収められない。ケース側面の立ち上がり部分全体をペンチでひん曲げてクリアランスを確保し、どうにか収めました(まだ戻してないので、ケースのフタは上手くはまらないまま)。収まったあと、ドライブベイの梁とCPUファンとの間の隙間は5mmもありません。かなり薄いファンか、ファンレスでないと、無茶せずに設置できなさそうです。実測でケース下から梁の下面まで55mm前後だったと記憶しているので、スタッドやら側面のシャーシの立ち上がり部分など考えると、マザーの厚みはトータルで45mm切るくらいじゃないときっついです。側面の立ち上がり部分、マザーをするっと通せるよう、いずれ切ってしまおうかと考えてます。

電源が付属していないので、SilverStone のFX350-Gを購入しましたが、これの電源スイッチが、ケースの電源取り付け部パネルの横に通っている梁と干渉するため、しっかり取り付けができません。結局金工ノコでパネルの梁を切り飛ばすはめとなりました。またこの電源、最初はそれほどでもないんですが、HDDやら回り出すとすごい音になります。保証切れ覚悟で、もっと静かな40mmのファンと交換する予定です。

HDDスロットには4本のSATAコネクタと4Pinのペリフェラル電源一つを繋ぐ口があります。なので+1のディスクを取り付けないのであれば、SATA用電源は必要ありません。SATAケーブルは、コネクタがまっすぐで細くて曲げ易いものを用意した方が良いかもしれません。角ケーブル取り回しも大変ですが、電源ユニットから出ている余ったケーブルをケース内に収めようとするとかなりぎちぎちにないます。あるなら不要な電源ケーブル外せるモジュラー式を使いたい所ですが、Flex-ATX とか 1U 用でそんなのはなかなか手に入らないですからね。

4つ分HDDトレイがあるケースとしては結構コンパクトだと思いますが、それなりには存在感のあるサイズ感です。丁度いい電源ユニット、CPUファン取り付けた状態でめっちゃ薄いMini-ITXマザー、狭い隙間でコネクタひねって付け外しできる細くて器用な指と根性、もろもろ揃ってるならチャレンジして良いかもしれません。もう少し大きくなっても良ければ、大きめのケース買った方が…(といってもあんまり選択肢がないですが)

まだ蓋を閉めてシステム安定稼動させるには至っていないので、運用始めてからの感想などはまだありません。組み立ててしまった後、とくに気になる問題は出ていません。

I haven’t yet completed my build, but I inadvertently put undue pressure on the front swinging door cover and it snapped right off. Not a huge deal for me as this is a compact build first, looks and locks don’t concern me. But be warned there are children’s toys with better hinges. If someone was forcibly removing the disks without a key all they have to do is give it a decent pull.

別にNAS用のケースを欲しかったのではなくMINI-ITX用のPCケースでHDDが4本収納できるコンパクトなケースを探していたところ本商品をたまたま出くわした。値段が少々高いとは思ったものの即決で注文。到着は予定日よりも2日遅くて多少やきもきした。
大きさは他社のMINI-ITX用PCケースより一回り小さく狙い通りだった。ただしその分マザーボードやCPUファン、電源の搭載や配線ケーブルの取り回しには一苦労した。何度も改造をしたい方には不向き。

Overall a decent NAS case that could be great with a couple tweaks. Biggest plus for me is the full height expansion slot which allowed me to add a 10gb SFP NIC. As others have mentioned, the case is a bit tight to work in, which is expected for this size. Making the drive cage removable would greatly improve the install process, as it stands - you may have to play component Tetris when installing. I would definitely recommend testing components first before installing. Also, due to the fact that the drive cage is right over the motherboard, you will most likely need a low profile cpu cooler. Another issue I ran into was that the included sata cables were too short to reach the sata ports on my motherboard, they were also too stiff and thick to manage. I ended up buying longer, thinner, more flexible cables (4 sata cables bundled into 1) which solved that issue. The 4 cables bundled together were able the thickness of 1 included sata cable.
Other than the expected install challenges, I haven’t had any issues. No sign of I/O errors when using the drive back panel, but then didn’t use the included sata cables which may have had wires broken when bent.

name: Internal 5 Port Non-Raid Sata III 6GB/S M.2 B+M Key Adapter Card for Desktop PC Support SSD and HDD. Jmb585 Chipset
description:
• Connect five SATA drives to a m.2 B+M key connection, providing up to 1700 MB/s speed
  • Plug and play supported, no additional software installation or setting required
  • Can support port multiplier that is not in a RAID configuration. Compatible with SATA hard drives & solid State drives and computer systems with SATA controllers
  • 2-Lane M.2 PCI-Express 3.0 interface (B & M key). complies with PCI Express base specification revision 3.1a
  • This card is only design for storage use only, can not boot any OS/ system drives. Backed by syba 3 Year hassle-free warranty and lifetime customer service

reviews.review:
This controller card tells you to not boot your OS on it. Well.. I was going to use it with Unraid like the others. The heatsink is a MUST. Occasionally my larger transfers would just drop to 0mb/s every minute, for 10 seconds before going back to 400mb/s, and they are terabyte transfers. (They're mechanical hdds). I used a raspberriy pi heatsink, which is about 25mm, even includes a fan ontop. It was that excessive.

As others have noted, they are not kidding about this thing being flimsy. The PCB is stupidly thinner than I would like. and you HAVE to plug the SATA cables BEFOREHAND, BEFORE you put the m.2 adapter into the motherboard.

DO NOT place the m.2 adapter INTO the motherboard BEFORE adding SATA cables. Also make sure your SATA cables are adequately long enough so they don't strain the port. Or else the m.2 adapter WILL FLEX IN WEIRD DISTURBING ANGLES.

Despite all the cons of this product. This is one of a kind, and if you are in the situation where you need 5 sata ports instead of one NVME port. It's THE product, and no other substitute.

I use this card on a nano-ITX server board, running Debian 11. Worked out of the box. Has good/decent read/write speeds with multiple disks (ZFS) attached and heavy data transfers. Good solution if you need more SATA ports and your only option is B/M Key PCIe.

Originally i could not get this device or connected drives to register under any modern linux distribution.

That said, i did get it to work eventually. You need to ensure the drives are plugged in the appropriate order (wtf....?) and avoid UEFI boot for the first boot.

Appears to work as advertised after that.
I ordered it months ago. Just getting around to installing it and I open the sealed box and get a bunch of glass beads/marbles...... jfc

Kept getting BSOD in Windows. Replaced it with ASMEDIA ASM1061 card and everything's good.
The card also tend to bend, so it would be nice if there was some kind of structural support included.

De momento funciona perfecto en una instalación de TrueNAS dentro de una caja Jonsbo N1.
Para mi Mobo en concreto hizo falta instalar un adaptador de m.2 2242 a 2280.
Por lo demas no noto diferencia alguna entre los discos que van directos a placa y los que pasan por este controlador.
Como digo, tiene un controlador sata de verdad, no es un splitter o divider multiplicador o como quieran llamarlo. No hace que dos bus sata compartan el mismo bus, crea otro bus diferente a través del nvme
Not much to say except that it worked. Added two sata drives and speeds are solid.

Once set up, it works great. Just be very careful handling it. The sata ports are incredibly stiff and the pcb incredibly flexible. In fact, probably the stiffest sata ports and most flexible pcb I think I've ever come across. Not really a good combination. But other than that works like a dream.

Mini-ITX mobos are notorious for having limited storage expandability due to their size, but they're a popular choice for NAS systems because of how compact they are. My board has a maximum of 4 SATA ports and I only needed a few more so this M.2 adapter was perfect for my needs as I wasn't using the M.2 slot already.
So far this expansion card has worked flawlessly and transparently; no drivers needed and my drives showed up as they should.
There were other reviews worrying about how hot the chipset gets and after running a 1 hour write test to both connected drives at the same time I only measured a peak temperature of about 125F. However for peace of mind I stuck a small Raspberry Pi heatsink to help with longevity.
Also, yeah, those activity LEDs are **BRIGHT** and they light up the inside of the case so I recommend doing something like putting a piece of electrical tape over them if they're an issue for you.

I'll update this review if anything arises, but so far everything is good (also as a note I bought this used).

It might be my imagination, but I feel like this thing was/is messing with my onboard ethernet. The first two boots after installing this, Windows wasn't detecting my ethernet as plugged in. May have just been coincidence, and it has since sorted itself out, but it was odd. And then it has an EXTREMELY bright blue LED on it for each of the two ports (I got the m2 with 2 ports). Which really messes up my whole build's look. I'm sure I can figure out a way to tape over it or whatever, but it is pretty wild how bright that thing is. Also wild that there's no software to be rid of it.

But, it seems to be working as it should overall. It was more or less plug and play. My latest mobo only had four SATA ports and I used those up quickly. I got my oldest HDD plugged into this thing right now, so speeds are a non issue in my situation. I'm not gonna be pushing any advertised speeds or anything with an older drive so I didn't even benchmark. I will definitely be leaning towards a dedicated NAS or reeling in some of my data hoarding (ha!) rather than use this thing long term though. It just feels a little finicky for my use on my daily machine. But it was the band aid I needed in the meantime. I got it open-box from Amazon Warehouse and it looked unused, so no complaints at all with the price I paid. Maybe a bit too steep at retail. I might find a use for it in another build, who knows! Really interesting bit of hardware that seems to do its job.

reviews.review: It's only now that I had installed it in my PC that I'm seeing that this is a bad PCI card. It's not detected by the system. It's not even detected after trying to install the drivers that came with it. Nothing. Only a green led is lighting up on it and that's kinda it. The system does not see any changes in hardware. If I plug any device in the USB ports I have no connectivity to said device. Nothing works. It is a bad product and unfortunatelly only now I can see it because only now I could actually test it. For anyone wanting to buy it, don't.
This is actually a 3.1 spec board. This is recognized as an ASMedia Technology Inc. ASM2142 USB 3.1 Host Controller. I'm using it in my old Dell Poweredge to give me some USB3 connectivity.

I bought this to give my Dell R710 a faster connection to transfer files from my external. I had it up and running fairly quickly and has given me the speed bump I needed for when I was moving files back and forth from my backup to my RAID array.
My Dell has a slot for this board

It does not automatically recognize usb devices plugged into it. You will need to install this device, then plug in your usb device, go to the device manager and scan for hardware changes. You will need to do this for each of your devices AND plug your device into each USB port on this card and go through the steps again.

reviews.review: Great can’t find this anywhere in a computer store

Only like 600-700 MB/s

Where the drive in the M2 slot on the mother board got 3000+

Still cheep solid storage if you have an older M2 drive kicking about that won't take away lanes from your Graphics card

Product works and does its job. It's an X1 connection so I didn't expect crazy speeds but it still gets about 800mb read and write with a Kingston NV1 drive. I put it on the very bottom X1 slot available in a b550 motherboard.

I'm probably buying another one since I have another X1 slot available above it. Very useful for multiple storage options in your desktop especially with prices of NVMe drives being so low now and sometimes cheaper than the 2.5 SATA ones.

Definitely a recommendable product.

L'image avec le score le plus haut est l'adaptateur avec un bon NVMe Samsung et la deuxième est avec un SSD simple qui semble correct (sachant que je l'utilise comme disque de stockage principal pour Windows). La qualité de ce produit est incroyable, moi qui croyais recevoir un produit de chine que la vitesse est semblable à une clé usb 1.0. J'ai fait les tests avec un Samsung 970 EVO Plus SSD NVMe 500GB et avec un Team L5 Lite SSD 240GB.

A pci-e 1x adapter for an m.2 NVME drive, what can I say it works. I just wish a weee bit faster, but I think it's because I installed it on the bottom 1x slot on my motherboard. The other vacant slot would choke my gpu.

The card is sturdy and feels high quality. If you're installing a full sized card, there is a standoff and screw preinstalled on the board for that. They do include another set of these if you are installing something smaller.

I have a Sabrent 1TB ssd rated for 3000ish mb/s and obviously I won't be getting that. I was hoping for something along the lines of 700 or 800, but oh well. Maybe I'll move it to a higher slot or get a better mobo with more m.2 slots. For now though, these speeds will do, it's almost 3 times faster than my standard HDD.
It works but there are better PCIEx1 to M.2 out there that are better quality and even a access light to boot. The one i tell of is cheaper and better.

the adfapter does,indeed let me use my M.2 terabyte drive in my Linux box, however, BIOS does not see it, probably limitations of my X58 mobo, but the OS finds it and I can ise it for storage. It's as easy to install as any other card since IDE... hard to mess that up, and is small enough to fit, even though there IS a lot of space. Recommend to have a fan nearby to cool the SSD

Workmanship is good, everything fits perfectly, but make sure you have a sufficiently new motherboard because older ones might not work with it reliably. I had it initially on an almost 10 years old motherboard, it worked, but "vanished" intermittently. I moved it on a 4-5 years old mother board and it works flawlessly since. None of these motherboards had a native M.2 socket, so I guess it is something in the design of the older motherboard that fails to maintain proper communication with the adapter. I didn't use it for boot, so I cannot say if it works or not, but I'm using it for the swap file and it did improve the speed of Windows 10. I'm happy with it.

I needed a 1/4 height PCI card to run an M2 in a CHENBRO ES34069-BK-180 case, and since that isn't a thing that exists, I bought this one and made a special mounting bracket.
Works great with my M2 (SAMSUNG 970 EVO Plus SSD 500GB) and can boot Linux from it on a picky motherboard (ASRock J5040-ITX) even.
Not the fastest of cards but it's a PCI x1 so I'm just happy it works at all with an M2 :)
Funcional y útil para hacer respaldos o emergencias, buen producto
Reasonably priced and works great!
Funciona bien, como describen

I had to go into Administrative Tools, Computer Managment, then Disk Managment to format the unallocated new drive. Asus M588 with a Crucial P3 M2. Yeah maybe a sata SSD would be easier. Still happy once I seen what's going on and everything worked out great!

reviews.review: Little expensive. Not hard to install. Plenty of spare screws. Good looking and sturdy for purposes.

As other comments mentioned its not exactly easy to build, I made a lot of mistake along the way and had to go backward but I enjoyed still. Fun challenge let's say. You can easily modify the frame along the way: I ended up doing a lay down build and using the other pieces for an eventual aio upward instead since my GPU was way too heavy.

For the price of most testbench out there or a simple open cases design that's not too big: it's a 10/10 for me.

Do mind that the handle in one of the picture showing the chassis is not included

I was looking for a case/frame that would allow me to fit my ATX computer into a cube of my Ikea shelf under my TV. Although the default setup would not fit, I was able to alter slightly the original design to make the whole thing fit snug in the cube.

Others mentioned and it's true it takes time to build. I had a hard time screwing the motherboard, had to fiddle to place the pieces so they are aligned properly with the MB holes. In spite of this it was very fun to build and I love the final result!

It wasn't the easiest case to setup (build) but it was worth the effort. Its very sturdy and the components are of good quality. Would be nice if it came completed to be honest. It is nice that its somewhat modular to some degree with parts being moveable in some situations; ex. moving the power switch to the top. They provide enough hardware to have spare hardware for some out of the box thinking. Overall its a nice little case and 1/3 the size of my previous case which is good for me. Using an ATX motherboard, there really isn't much room for fans behind the acrylic fan mount. The positioning of the main 24 pin lead from the power supply doesn't work well with the limited space in that front area. My only suggestion would be to increase the frame size, make the acrylic fan mount modular/moveable or provide a cheap power adapter that is thin and uniform.

Using this frame for a tfuel miner so its basic and I would buy this frame again for this type of use.

reviews.review: I needed to add some USB ports to a Dell Vostro. Speed wasn't a factor, but I wanted to add both USB-A and USB-C, because I only have 1 slot open. This card fit perfectly and I didn't need to install any drivers. I just installed the card into the open slot, turned it on, and my Vostro recognized the new PCIe card and USB ports. The USB ports only provide 5GBs transfer speed. But, that is all I really needed for my purpose. I really like that this card includes 4 USB-A ports and 3 USB-C ports, so I should have plenty for the future. So far, it has been working well and I haven't had any problems connecting to my devices (headphones, cell phone, flash drive). I feel the price is a little high, but I would certainly recommend this.

Well, this does what it claims to. It provides you with a bunch of extra USB ports on your PC! However, since it doesn't accept accessory power, and it has 7 total USB ports (including USB C), it definitely cannot power a bunch of higher power draw devices at once. A single USB C port itself can exceed the entire power draw limit of the PCIe slot this goes into.

If it did have accessory power (meaning, extra power provided over a cable from the power supply), it'd be a lot more versatile and charging support more devices. However, it does work well for things like flash drives, connecting phones, and powering more basic devices.

If you don't need to connect high power draw devices, this should work well enough!
Very convenient, perfect for adding a few more ports to a desktop. Easy to install and great value

I can recommend this card if you just need the extra ports and not in need of blazing speeds.

Installed easily and Windows set it up without needed a special driver. The ports work but from my experience it does not transfer at full USB 3 speeds and with a multiple devices seems to be really dividing bandwidth, so temper your expectations if you dream of having all ports in use and all ports transferring at top speed.

The ports all work, but to use the USB C ones I have to make sure I put it in just right. When installing it, I was unable to use the screws it came with as well as the hole didn't line up with the one in my desktop.

I was able to finagle it and wiggle it just enough so the ports would show though the opening so they could be used. When I first installed it, it was just covered and I couldn't use any of the ports. I had to hold the parts in place as I put the side on. If I need to open it again, I will need to finagle and make sure the ports line up again before fully putting on the side cover.

reviews.review: Cette carte fonctionne selon les spécification du fabricant. Par contre il vous faut un cable usb-c capable de transmettre les données à la vitesse spécifiée et non pas un câble bon marché ou un autre qui ne fait que charger. La charge rapide fonctionne très bien. N'installez surtout pas le pilote du fabricant fourni avec le cd. Laissez Windows 11 installer le sien qui est supérieur en terme de fonctionalités. Celui du fabricant ne supporte pas le transfert de données.
A great little gadget solves big problem. Works like a charm. Does what it supposed to do. Will recommand it.
The card work fine so far. Nothing bad to say. Did not test speed since its my son computer but it work.

The expansion card allowed me make the front panel type c port active in my PC case. Transfer speed is not blazing fast. It's advertised to be 5Gbps (Gigabits per second that is) which translates to around 500 megabytes per second. But with this i could not achive that transfer rate. My Samsung T7 can transfer at 900-1000 megabytes per second when connected to a dedicated usb 10gbps port, but on this it cannot go beyond 380-390 megabytes per second. So speed falls short about 20-25% compared to what's advertised. Not a big issue, but wish it used PCIe 3.0 x1 instead of PCIe2.0 x1 interface. Then it could have been a 10Gbps port.
PCに取付るだけ全く問題無く繋がりました。

There are two versions of this card PCI-E 2X and PCI-E 1X. I'm not sure what the difference in speed is but I'd recommend the 2X version if you have an available slot. It will work fine in a PCI-E 16X slot. My NZXT 510 case has a usb-c port on it but my motherboard didn't have built in connectivity for that. I used this board to enable my PC case port and it works great. It's at least as fast as the usb-c port on my motherboard's built in usb-c port. The product comes with a mini cd-rom that includes the driver. I did not need to us it as Windows 11 detected the card automatically. The card came with a standard plate installed but a smaller plate is also included if you need to install it in a small form factor PC. The card does not have any external usb-c ports so only buy this if you need to enable a port on your PC case.

Review for PCIe x1 type e + 19 pin.
I've only used it with the 19 pin connector and it seems to work fine at around the expected data throughput speed of 400MBps (3.2 Gbps) with a fast external drive. This is consistent with the claim of 5 Gbps USB3 gen 1 performance.
The caveats:
First, and most important, is that it has no power supply connexion beyond the relatively meagre supply from the PCIe bus; this means that it could have difficulty operating high power USB devices, especially if more than one is connected.
Second, the total data rate might be a problem if more than one fast USB device is attached, because the available PCIe x1 throughput will be exceeded. However, in normal use, diversity of bandwidth demand between devices would probably come to the rescue.
Third, it was a trifle expensive, but not excessively so.
Generally, though, I am well satisfied. At least it worked, which is more than can be said for a previously tried card from another manufacturer.

Small enough to fit in a HP envy case for my client. No issues.
Great product, definitely gained a faster system with the improvement in clock speed and is stable in overclock.
Très bon rapport qualité/prix. Très satisfait de mon achat.

It was good for a solid month, then would crash my system whenever I try to run cinebench, then the LED on the motherboard would just get stuck on DRAM and would not turn off even when forced (unless I flip the PSU power switch)

Maybe good for some motherboards.
But not working on Asrock and Aorus B550i motherboard. Returned once I tried.

Bought 2 sticks, 16gb each over a few weeks, was not sure so tested the first stick for a few weeks before buying a second. Running stock at 2600, non overclocked, on a Asus prime b450-a/csm, ryzen 5 2600. Using 2x16gb of these with 2x8 3200 corsair. All happy In mixed matched system. Dual boot Linux 23, Win 7, and win 11.
This is a great choice for any budget build. It looks good and performance as advertised
I wasn't familiar with the brand, but so far so good!
Bought because I had one stick, needed an extra 8gb. Worked perfectly.

Benutze die Ram Riegel auf einem NZXT z590 Board. Xmp liess sich problemlos aktivieren. System läuft stabil. Bisher (ca. 6 Monate in Nutzung) keine Abstürze oder Probleme. Hatte zuvor 2 andere, diese liefen aber nicht so gut. Bin daher sehr zufrieden. Optisch passen sie sehr gut in meinen Cleanen White Build. Klare Kaufempfehlung
As described and fast shipping.

I tried to use these rams at the velocity it says ( 3600mhz ), but it crashes above 3000

i bought 2x16 Ram DDR4 3600mhz, which i tried to use with my current hardware:

Aorus Elite B450
Nvidia RTX 3060Ti
Amd R7 5700x

These rams were working fine, but out of nowhere my pc crashed, it started to happen mostly when i was playing games, for example, Call of duty Warzone

PC diagnostic said it has no issue in the hardware, but here we are, after i switched to 3000Mhz, my pc hasbeen running without a problem, it hasnt crashed sicne then.
Great Price and Value!

This is an ENCLOSURE and ONLY an enclosure.
Completely Misrepresented in the title/description/pictures. Everywhere it claims to be a DVD-RW. Only in ONE bullet point does it indicate it MIGHT be an enclosure, but it never says that it is.

This is going BACK!

Dislike
This is just a case not a DVD drive like the discription and box states!!! This is not sold by Amazon, but Amazon needs to take this item down!!!

The title is VERY confusing. I bought this knowing that it's just an enclosure as I had an old laptop blueray drive I wanted to use in it. So far it works great. I'd give it five stars but the title needs rewritten because it's not clear at all that this is just an enclosure/adapter.

reviews.review:
This case was a beast to put together, but once together provides a nice 12U server case for home use (or portable use with the wheels). Overall I'd give this is good rating for anyone looking for a home server rack, and am definitely pleased with my purchase, but there were a few cons that makes it a 4, not a 5 star.

The big drawback:
The back is screwed in. Meaning if you need to get to back cables easily, you're out of luck. My rails block any side-access, and so getting to the back of a server's power or network cables is near impossible. A flaw if you need to actually work on anything, but not so bad if it's all meant to be left untouched.

Pros:
- Great Price
- Solid Rack
- Just does what it's supposed to do.
- Comes with some nice extras (power bar, fan, etc) so you don't have to hunt down those pieces.
- Fits full length servers (eg R610). I've also commented this in the cons as they're a very tight fit, but they fit! So it goes in both pro and con.

Cons:
- Instructions are difficult to follow
- Door is not easily reversible.
- Two sets of keys; one for side locks, one for front (Yeah, you don't think this is a big deal - but just wait)
- Screws are on the outside, meaning if you didn't have the keys, a simple Phillips would unlock it.
- The frame is not "square" until all the parts are screwed in. The back panel is what's keeping my rack level and lined up.
- Shipped with missing screws; had to contact seller. (or this could be a pro... seller responded quickly and sent me extra screws - was very pleased about that).
- While the inside is the advertised 35" depth, the maximum post distance is 33". Unfortunately cable and bezel room are needed so the maximum realistic post distance is 28-29". Measure your devices accordingly. This barely fit the length of an R610 due to power/network cables at the back and bezel at the front.
- "Free" rack is only 21.5" deep and requires posts to be set at that depth. The rack is useless if you require deeper post distance (such as with a Dell R610), so mine is in a parts pile somewhere.

Even with all these "Cons" I would highly recommend this product as I found nothing that matches the price-point for the nice simple 12U full-length rack you get. Honestly, even if they fixed some of the small things like the 2-sets of keys and maybe the free-rack being expandable, I'd have bumped this to a 5-star, but there's no 4 1/2 so that's life.
Excellent rack, easy to put together and conveniently designed. it is deep enough for any server. The price I think is low for the quality. You will not be sorry.

Cheapest server cabinet you will find. Wobbly, back panel without quick release clips so you have to unscrew to remove back panel to access cables etc. Not enough ventilation, I had one Dell R610 server and the fans were high pitched, open the glass door and fans return to normal. Had to drill more holes but still wobbly. Regret the purchase, would have paid more for one that would worked. New model has removable back panel better exhaust not sure how stable.
Arrive on n time.
"I was very impressed with the quality of the SYSRACKS server rack I purchased. It was easy to assemble and seems very sturdy. I would definitely recommend this product to others

Update2: The parts that were damaged in shipping were replaced by the manufacturer. Thanks so much for that! Now that I have undamaged panels, I can say this rackmount system is really nice. It looks great. It's very heavy duty and there's nothing wobbly. It's longer than I expected, it's a long rectangle - but that's fine. The instructions for assembling it are a little unclear, but you can find videos online.

Update: The manufacturer contacted me and they will send me replacement pieces for the damaged parts, and that the damage must have happened in shipping. Once I get those parts and install them, I will update my rating - I think this will be a great cabinet once I get parts that aren't damaged.

I am super disappointed in this purchase. I paid almost $500 and another &70 for shipping on top of that. The delivery box was in pretty good shape but once opened it was clear the unit that was delivered to me has been used before. It is damaged in multiple places. All of the small screws/bolts/nuts were not in bags, so they were all strewn about the inside of the box - I'm sure having all those small metal pieces rattling around inside the box through transit contributed to some of the issues with this unit. Take a look at the pictures. Both sides and the rear are badly bent so that they don't fit well. One of the mechanisms that holds one of the sides in place has been torn...It's plastic, seems like someone forced one of the sides to open without using the Open mechanism. The worst part - the top piece of this unit is badly damaged. It is ugly. I don't think I can use this unit. I'm not sure how possible it is to get a refund now, but if you're thinking about purchasing one please know that I regret this purchase.

This is actually a pretty decent rack. It took me over an hour to setup excluding taking out of the packaging. A few pieces are bent and dented (see photos) so FedEx really gave this thing a beating because it’s steel.

The instructions that come with this are terrible! For instance they say don’t tighten the bolts until step 6. But you need to tighten them before this step! So I had to assemble and disassemble a few parts here and there as I realized the instructions didn’t clearly convey the part needed. The one thing the instructions don’t mention are the 4 screws needed for the front and are apparently crucial to the structural integrity of the rack! I didn’t have them in and even with everything in place, the rack flexed a lot. As soon as I put the screws in, it was solid. I also struggled with assembling the front lock as it came apart trying to put the locking lever on. See photo of how this should go.

Speaking of screws, quality control failed and I came across some screws that still had the metal in the middle. See photo comparing the bad screws to good screws and you’ll see what I mean. Thankfully there are plenty of extra screws!

Finally this rack cuts down noise a lot. It’s not soundproof, but it made my office noticeably quieter. I have a Catalyst 3750-X, a HP Proliant DL360p G8, and a Supermicro all on and running. I couldn’t do this before.

The exhaust fan at the top also helps a lot and is the one reason I got this rack.

The only major complaints I have is that the rear panel is screwed on, not latched like the side panels. This makes working in the back difficult as that is where I put the PDU. The PDU is also pretty cheap feeling. I have plans to replace it. I wouldn’t use it long term.

Overall, great rack. I just knocked a star off because of the bad instructions.
comes with rack mount power managment and 2 shelfs as well

This is a great server rack and well-built, especially for the price.

Pros:
- Well-built and sturdy
- Casters, which allow for mobility and work/roll well
- Comes with fan, mountable power strip, and one mountable appliance shelf (maybe 12 inches?)
- Side panels are easily removable via their latches and each have a locking mechanism (although I wouldn't rely on it)
- Looks great, especially the glass clear front panel

Cons:
- The instructions could really use some work. It took much longer to put it together than needed, and for some items (e.g., installing locks, door latches, etc.) there were no instructions at all. Other areas the instructions were so vague I had to guess (still not sure parts are put together correctly...)
- Back panel is screwed in, which if you're working with anything over around 30" in depth, makes it challenging to work on from the side. That means you will either need to leave the back panel off or unscrew it each time. Recommend making the back panel work on a latch system similar to the sides, or at the very least, use thumb screws that can be easily removed.
- Front panel droops quite a bit when open. It is not a big deal, but may want to consider adding some thicker/more durable washers on the hinges.

All-in-all, very happy with the purchase and recommend it!
